Ordered all of the food we wanted to eat and boy when they brought out the dish I was blown away. Not only was it nicely presented but there was SOOO much food. The restaurant was seemingly clean, a lot cleaner than the ones im used to eating at. Overall I was very happy with this meal and have come back multiple times with different friends.Bonus is that its BYOB and they're open late. Let's just say I've come here after a hard night out and about.

22.description: As a group we decided to partake in a restaurant that was oriental and authentic as well as delicious our mistake was entering the restaurant sweet station. The food here was beyond what someone may call terrible. After eating here, and by eating I mean forcing ourselves to eat the smallest portions possible for as to not regurgitate any of it, a cause we attempted with no avail, we left the restaurant paying not for the food, but to leave. The service was on par with grabbing a soddering iron to your hand and cutting off each digit one by one, and the only thing worth it was the chime of exiting the restaurant.

15.description: In the past when I have gone here, the service was great and the food was tasty. This time, however, it was just ok.I took my friends here for dinner and I was glad that it wasn't packed. However, it took a very long time for a waiter to come to our table and it also took them a long time to deliver our food.This place is alright, but I definitely have had better chinese food. The portion sizes are well worth the money though

57.description: Out of the 3 entrees and wonton soup we ordered there were only 2 that was good. The entree that you get to choose 4 items with steamed white rice and steamed bok choy was so tasteless. as for the fish tempera covered with sweet and spicy sauce, it was mouth watery delicious (recommended by one of the waitresses). The fried rice was ok, something I or anyone can easily cook within 5 minutes. The waitresses was polite and took their time to do their job because there weren't many customers that morning (Valentine's day). Lastly the restaurant was a small cozy one, we missed the location the first time and had to make a u-turn back. ^_^ Overall it was ok.

20.description: Go to place for AYCE hotpot. They have a good variety and there's mussels!! They do have some side dishes, we usually get the fried mantou with condensed milk, the potstickers and sometimes the crab rangoon. They're service is pretty good; I've never had many complaints here. Sweet Station also brings back many college memories; we'd order delivery to campus all the time. Definitely recommend their BBQ Four Things if you're looking for delivery. So much food and it's pretty good.

36.description: Sure this place is cheap and it opens late.But, their food is extremely oily. I've definitely had a lot better for a few bucks more. We ordered the crab and fish maw soup, which tasted like water! We had to add salt and ground white pepper to make it edible. We also requested for a bowl of water or we used the soup to rinse off our fish from the spicy fish dish and you can see a large layer of oil that remains after dipping in the soup or water. We also ordered the egg gravy ho fun with shrimp. You can tell the shrimp were frozen and not fresh, but overall, the dish was alright. The pea sprouts were pretty good besides the fact that it drips oil everywhere.We wanted their shanghai soup dumplings but they don't serve it late night.Again, cheap Chinese food late night, but I mean you get what you pay for.

14.description: Go to place for AYCE hotpot. They have a good variety and there's mussels!! They do have some side dishes, we usually get the fried mantou with condensed milk, the potstickers and sometimes the crab rangoon. They're service is pretty good; I've never had many complaints here. Sweet Station also brings back many college memories; we'd order delivery to campus all the time. Definitely recommend their BBQ Four Things if you're looking for delivery. So much food and it's pretty good.

1.description: Attended a birthday party at No. 18 last night and it was truly a unique and equally fun experience! PROS:  Relatively swanky, albeit a little tacky. But hey, this is Chinatown karaoke!  The prviate party room was unlike anything I've experienced before.  Fairly dark ambiance with sectional faux-leather couches, black lights among other pretty cool lighting fixtures along with glowing walls of random neon designs - very trippy, but that's all part of the fun. Other reviews have noted the private room areas are not large enough for (advertised) parties of 30, and I would agree. Our group size was closer to 15-20 and that was the optimal number. I wouldn't want anymore heads than that.  The private rooms truly make it private though...as in I gather just about anything goes.  Interpret that comment as you wish. CONS: The place was a little confusing to initially navigate, restrooms included.  And make sure to remember your private party room number before thowing back too many drinks. On that note, the watered down drinks from the bar disappointed me. Actually, not even sure there was any vodka whatsoever in my drink. Oh well, thankfully I had leftover booze from our prior BYOB dinner which def came in handly.  The sound/audio equipment was sufficient and the flat screen TV worked fine, but I did feel the music selection was a little lacking - they need some newer, more relevant tunes in my opinion - not just the same 'ol usual suspects.  And unfortunately, similar to many other places in Chinatown, the random stinch of sewage seems to come around every so often - namely in the common areas.  These places really need to consider scented candles or glad plug-ins. Or better yet, just fix these ongoing sewage smell issues altogether - new pipes and better ventilation would likely work wonders. All & all though, our group had an absolute blast and think every Chicagoan needs to experience a night at No. 18 at least once.  Good times await!

9.description: Nice location and great cost performance!Very comfort furniture with nice audio system, definitely will come again :)

23.description: Awesome place! They have the bar and different sizes of karaoke rooms. It is so much fun to hang out with friends there! !!  Highly recommended!!

25.description: I love this place . It is so much nicer than the other karaoke I have been to in Chinatown. Their snacks and food are good. My friends and me went to this place and they gave us free 4 hours singing in a private karaoke room.

12.description: Beat Karaoke in Chicago!!!!! Totally worth it especially u r with ur real friends. Great venue for special parties and casual hang out . Come and see!! Definitely come back again!!!

21.description: No18 is an excellent place for karaoke! The rates are good and the people working here are really nice and helpful -- Jun in particular was great!

16.description: Went on Wednesday for Karaoke, and it was only $20/hr because of happy hour (All of Wednesday) special. The song list was great, and we found just about every song we looked for. The only downside about this place was that the waitress was a bit pushy in asking us to buy things. They should have a call button instead of checking in every 15 minutes since the vibe would drop whenever they would turn on the lights and stand in front of the TV.

17.description: The bartender was trying to give us free warm here in order to pay to get into the spot really not a good spot to go if you're trying to bring your lady or your friends I'm sorry but it's really bad favor and don't show up not worth it to try to hustle you and take your money from you

10.description: Decided to have my birthday celebration here! First time visit and I will be a regular. The bar and food is reasonably price. They have private rooms that are comfortable and pretty big. The staff took very good care of my friends and family......Super good customer service.

5.description: Went for a birthday party this weekend. Love: separate rooms. Don't have to sing in front of strangers. Good time. Good music choices. Lots of options.Did not love: the set up and disorganization. Have to go order drinks and have them brought to us. There was much confusion when ordering each time... My bill had several items I didn't order due to the disorder and lack of attention to details. We weren't treated special as a customer nor did they remember anything. Since they were able to adjust my bill and I had a good time and the bday girl had a good time, I only took off one star.

11.description: $45/hr for a room for 8 people. Not bad. The drinks weren't too overpriced. The place was not too crowded on a Sat night. After 10-15 minutes figuring out the machine, we were on a tear. At first thinking, one hour was plenty, we were literally carrying the mike and singing out the door when our two hours was up. We brought the kids, they had a blast. Plenty of pop songs from Pitbull, Ke$ha, Rhianna, Sam Smith, Beyonce, even Queen. Our group wished for more AC/DC and Bruce Springsteen, but come on!!  This is Chinatown!  The service was fine. Obviously, english is not the native tongue, but they were pleasant and nice. I would definitely come back. I think kids are allowed up until 10 p.m.

22.description: This is a great place to go for a drink or to sing karaoke or just to listen and enjoy the vibeI was in Chicago for the weekend and just l wanted some place in Chinatown to get a drink late at night. We found No 18 our first night and it was what were looking for and more. Good drinks, karaoke in the lounge or private studios (English, Chinese, Korean, etc...), tasty food, great atmosphere and friendly staff. We ended up going to No 18 ever night we were in townSpecial mention to a young Chinese woman with short blonde hair. I never got her name but she was there bar tending  and serving every night we were there and she great. Very friendly and really good service

0.description: Handsome staffs!! Especially the owners...very polite and friendly throughout the whole time I was there with few friends. Not just a karaoke place but also has a full bar area. Great spot for a weekends' night out.

20.description: Jun was incredibly patient explaining the pricing for karaoke rooms! We were pretty confused at first but he sat and answered all of our questions and explained how we could get the best deal.

19.description: I love this place . It is so much nicer than the other karaoke I have been to in Chinatown. Their snacks and food are good. My friends and me went to this place and they gave us free 4 hours singing in a private karaoke room.

2.description: Meh. Trashy. Sloppy. I'm sure any city inspector would shut them down.Elevator was out of service so we had to push through the line for the restaurant downstairs to find the hidden stairwell up to the club. With all the padding on the walls, electronics, and extension cords strewn across the dark stairs, the place would be a total death zone in the event of a fire.Rooms had good soundproofing but smelled like old nasty cheese. They need to change their mop water more often. The people before us had stolen the batteries out of the microphones. Only one out of 3 stalls in the ladies' room had TP. Entire place smelled of cigarette smoke.Our waitress Tina said we could use the call button to bring her back, but then never responded to it. We wound up going out front for drinks. They were out of bottled water, so I had to keep going back every 10 minutes for a refill. Each trip required extracting the bartender from the chick he was hitting on all night.English-language song selection was acceptable but not extensive. Song selection software and controls are buggy and unresponsive. The touchscreen song selection system is all very flashy but I'd be much happier with an old-fashioned analog system that actually works.

18.description: This is a great place to go for a drink or to sing karaoke or just to listen and enjoy the vibeI was in Chicago for the weekend and just l wanted some place in Chinatown to get a drink late at night. We found No 18 our first night and it was what were looking for and more. Good drinks, karaoke in the lounge or private studios (English, Chinese, Korean, etc...), tasty food, great atmosphere and friendly staff. We ended up going to No 18 ever night we were in townSpecial mention to a young Chinese woman with short blonde hair. I never got her name but she was there bar tending  and serving every night we were there and she great. Very friendly and really good service

13.description: THIS IS THE BEST KARAOKE PLACE IN CHINATOWN. I have been there twice and I left there happy after both visits. They are not very pushy about selling private room or drinks and they have been extremely nice. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!

4.description: Came here with a small group on a Saturday night and I have to say that I'm really impressed by this place. Having been to multiple karaoke places in the Northern suburbs and in Asia, I have to say this is the best karaoke place yet I've been in the Chicago-land area. The decor, rooms, and karaoke systems are all very updated and you almost feel like you're back in Asia.Service was also very good, which seems to be uncommon for Chinatown. We sang for 2 hours and it's $35/hour for a small room. The bill turned out to be $90, so we assumed that gratuity was automatically added.

24.description: Hahaha  this karaoke is fking awesome! It's beautiful place! I love here! I been this place a lot times, I will have another big party again!

6.description: I came here to celebrate my birthday earlier this month and had a great time-- but despite a great evening, I feel as if there were a lot of things that did not go smoothly. PROS: nicer set up than the Karaoke places on Western, CLEAN (which says a lot, it's in Chinatown)CONS: 1) Very confusing--- A) The entrance was closed-- had to go into a side door through a restaurant to get inside (but there were no clear signs explaining where to go, but we figured it out) B) they didn't explain how to work the karaoke machine C) my friends were billed for drinks they did not order (which if severely intoxicated, you wouldn't be able to spot)-- I couldn't tell if it was an honest mistake or if they were taking advantage of a drunken situation. 2) SLOW SERVICE.  We would order drinks at the bar, then the drinks would slowly roll into our room-- they were busy and it seems as if they didn't have enough staff to service. 3) OUR LARGE ROOM THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO FIT 30 PEOPLE, barely fit 20 comfortably, and for the record, my friends and I are not big people. 4) SONG SELECTIONS: WEAK

15.description: I believe it was $40 an hour here. You enter through the restaurant downstairs to get here, and head straight for the elevator. I think I counted about 12 rooms, and one common area next to the bar. Good place to get up to 8 friends together and sing for awhile. Came here with a friend, and we enjoyed it. I must say the touch interface was difficult to use, and took about 10 min to get the hang of it.

7.description: Very cool spot to celebrate a birthday or just a fun night out, wide selection of music and the private rooms are a nice touch.  Only issue is it smells like cigarette smoke in here other than that I enjoyed myself.

8.description: Snazzily designed venue and decent collection of English-language songs, but I was put off with the under-the-table attitude of some of the staff.A group of us (about 9 people) came in without a reservation around 8 pm and asked to sit in the main bar area to karaoke after learning that the private rooms would not be available until 11 pm. After being told we could freely sit and sing by the bar by one staff member, another one then told us the minimum cost would be $100 in cash for our group (mind you, they take credit card) and that all of us would have to buy drinks.Eventually we were able to bring it down to a more reasonable $30, thanks to my friends who could speak fluent Chinese. However, I still don't think we should've had to pay this much for using the main bar space. We also were first told we could stay for as long as we wanted, but after an hour, they told us our time was up.Overall, I had a great group of friends, and despite what happened, the staff were quite polite. Even so, I wasn't impressed by the drinks, and I didn't appreciate how inconsistent the staff were about their services and the one staff member's attempt to rip us off.

3.description: THIS IS THE BEST KARAOKE PLACE IN CHINATOWN. I have been there twice and I left there happy after both visits. They are not very pushy about selling private room or drinks and they have been extremely nice.

14.description: Surprisingly we had great experience! Good English song collection, nice employee, easy to talk on some last minute changes on reservation (we were lucky) overall very recommended for those who enjoys Asian karaoke lounge style.

3.description: Got five dishes for four people with complimentary rice bowls per person for less than $10 per person..what?! Also, this is the most authentic Chinese food I've had in Chicago, it's so good. They specialize in spicy food but I'd suggest getting at least one non spicy dish or tons of milk/yogurt to help you through it if you can't hold your spice. I highly suggest the spicy chieken and pig ears. This place and the whole food court is highly underrated.

1.description: Hidden little gem!My mom absolutely loves this place. They have traditional Chinese dishes that aren't found at many of the restaurants here in Chinatown. For example, spicy crawfish and pork blood dishes. The prices are great and the chef is very nice. I can't wait to go back and try more!

2.description: Yep. The reviews are accurate. I just tried it this afternoon because of the fine Yelp reviews, and it was as good as advertised. I had what they call the "fried" clams, but they were not the kind of breaded fried clams you would get at the beach in New England. They were fried in a wok in the shell. They came with some delicious black bean sauce and white rice. They were great, and only $6. The place is just one of many stands in the basement of a rundown food court. You would never think a place like this has such good food. It's a must try, however.

9.description: Chef: Very personable and passionate about the quality of his food. Quite talented given the number of dishes he excels in. Food: More szechaun/spicy style. They have a large selection of appetizers and main dishes given it is a tiny joint. Generous amount bowl of white rice comes with most stir frys. For novice, I would recommend spicy fried shrimps or  Korean Kimchi fried with pork. For the adventurer, I would recommend lamb brisket with dried bean or bean sprout with (pork) intestine. They also have (seasonal) chinese sweet soup desserts I would recommend japanese pumpkin with tapioca. Environment: moderately noisy (with about 6 TV sets) and laid back. Little kids running around sometimes. Students coming over to chill or study while able to snack on food. An environmental lady is there around the clock to keep the place tidy. Washroom facility was amazingly clean (being in Chinatown). You will need to ask for the key from one of the shops. It would be ideal to bring some tissues with you as needed. Reminders: Food court closes at 9 pm but some shops close earlier depends on business that day. Prices $1.95-11.95. Almost all of the shops in the food court are mom and pop shops. Help them avoid credit card fees by using cash. If you know you will be unable to finish the food ask to have the food comes in carry out containers. Elevator available.  There are also cantonese, philipino, japanese food worth the try.

10.description: Incredibly good and very inexpensive. I don't really have anything to add to the below links, just wanted to make sure they have a presence on Yelp.It is in a food court and served on a tray, so I'm assuming they may only be open during lunch/early dinner hours. Cash only.Laganma- absolutely delicious.I got a beef noodle bowl as did the Chinese patrons next to me- you get to choose the noodle type. Also got shrimp skewer, cauliflower and quail egg skewer (which I dumped into my noodle dish)chicagoreader.com/chicag…chicagoreader.com/Bleade…(the door to get in is shared with a Citibank- on the south side corner of the building- head downstairs to the far back corner of the underground food court/mini mall)will be trying the lamb and chicken stir fry dishes next time as it looked delicious in front of the other patrons that ordered it.

4.description: Hands down best restaurant in Chinatown... Found out the owner was a well known chef in Cheng Du...

6.description: The food here is spicy, delicious, and very reasonably priced! I greatly appreciate how my order of garlic stir-fried pea sprout leaves were not overcooked.  My favorite is the spicy pig ears. I have tried several other dishes and they were all very fresh and tasty except for the the seafood hot pot, which the shrimp and squid were a bit overcooked. Nonetheless, I will come back to try more dishes next time!

11.description: This place was really good, especially for the price! Their chicken was soo tender. When I saw their noodles in the soup, I thought to myself oh no, cheap noodles. But the noodles tasted good with the soup base!!! We got 4 dishes for $16 and they were very reasonably sized. My mom LOVES this place.

5.description: Chinatown's best kept secret...for now. You can walk in with $10 and literally to  filled to the brim after you're done. The basement also offers other dining options, but snack planet is the anchor IMO that holds this all together with their quality and selection. My friends and I come here at least once every other week.

7.description: Holy whack-a-mole!  This place beat out Joy Yee Noodles, and I love Joy Yee Noodles.  Fresh, authentic, and with plentiful servings at a nominal cost.  In fact, the servings are so big, I recommend sharing your meal and dessert if you're not going home right away.

8.description: OMG, so cheap and so good!! This entire food court down here is amazing! Reminds me of the motherland!TIP: while some vendors accept credit cards, I'd suggest bringing cash to be on the safe side.

0.description: I love this place! I've been here a few times and every dish I order I am never disappointed. The menu is simple - two sides pages of pictures of every dish. One of my favorite dishes is the potato noodle spicy soup, I am not a fan of spicy dishes but the soup is a blend of heat and vinegar which makes it very enjoyable. Honestly, every dish I've eaten here I have enjoyed and that keeps me coming back for more. The price point is reasonable for all the dishes. I guarantee you will make this place your favorite as I did.

1.description: I am a frequent visitor to the area and no stranger to the locale when it comes to options to fill your tum. I work weekends nearby and, as of late, have opted to try eating at Alps the last few times. Noteable favorites for me that stand out are the Aromatic Chicken Curry and the Mango Chili chicken crumb salad.For an upcharge of 2 dollars on the curry you can turn it in to a rice combo set at 10 dollars complete with drink and two fried shrimp on the side. I don't know enough about curry to articulate the intricacies of, but I have eaten my fill of food to know good from great and the not so much. The curry is green sauce based and made with coriander so it's high on flavor, but low on spice; curry comes with pepper and asparagus that is well cooked so it's tender; bring it together with the chicken, sauce and rice and it all works well together.The Crumb Chicken is my other favorite dish here if I am in the mood for salad. Lightly breaded chicken that's tender accompanied by mango slices and warm, crisp potatos that brings a twist on something traditional and simple. The dressing is Zingy and works well with the other flavors; biting in to a particularly juicy tomato slice is refreshing with it all.Saint Alps is high on presentation and quality of food and the staff are friendly and caring for services rendered. I've seen some not so pleasant reviews of the place based on food or staff, but often times they leave it at that initial visit not giving the place or it's staff another chance; they have been kind to me in all regards. I don't think you will be disappointed if you choose to eat here; a critique could be that it isn't a place for large parties or gatherings, but medium sized get togethers are more than able to be accomodated.Stay curiously hungry and may your tums ever be filled.

9.description: Awesome food! I went here with a couple friends on my first trip to Chinatown. The food was very authentic and vast. I ended up sticking with what I know and getting fried rice, while my friends were more adventurous. The food all came out at different times, which was a tad annoying. I was raised to wait for everyone to have their meals before I eat mine, so it was hard to do when we were waiting for everyone to have their meals. The worry of food getting cold crossed my mind. They also have really good drinks. I got a coffee drink, the name of which escapes me. It had little gel cubes in it, so it was very different but delicious. The drinks took quite awhile. I'd probably try somewhere new instead of this place, but the food was good.

12.description: Just stopped in for bubble tea. The place looked cute and inviting. It was a really cold day so I decided to try hot bubble tea again and it was pretty good. I remember the last time I had hot bubble tea it was too sweet so I asked for half sweet. The tea was great half sweet and the bubbles were the perfect texture, bouncy and chewy. A little disappointed the bubbles didn't have flavor though, I like them a little sweet.

21.description: So far so Good! This quaint spot just opened up. I tried the Chicken Chop with Teriyaki sauce; it was suprisingly very filling. $7.95 worth it. The service was also pretty swift. Easygoing atmosphere despite the crowd you'll see in there. I went on a weekday, so I was surprised.

16.description: Pros: The tea drinks are good and if you order food the portions are *enormous*, even if you get the medium size.Cons: The food is mediocre, and they haven't figured out how to use their new location.  Getting our check and paying took *forever* (upwards of 30 minutes after we'd completely finished everything, even with us flagging people down to speed the process along) and on our way out we realized that they only had two waiters covering an entire two-story building.  We think our original waiter may have just forgot we existed and went home.Probably won't come back, which is a shame.  The place has potential but needs to iron out a *lot* of kinks.

17.description: Fantastic ginger tea and matcha au lait. Must go place for the winter. Step in for some warm tea while you wait for your reservation!!

10.description: This place is going downhill ever since they have moved their location. I have been this location multiple times and every visit seems to get worse and worse. Their green tea with milk is starting to get really watered down to the point where it tastes like water. The food is decent, not the best food you can find in Chinatown. The only problem I had was that the food was a served a bit too cold. I feel like their manager or whoever runs this place needs to set better standards for their workers. During my last two visits, this worker, in his late 50's, had a hard time taking orders. I had to repeat myself five times in order to get it right. He was also very rude towards me and my friends. When we sat down and ordered drinks, he immediately slapped us with the check. Within 20 minutes of sitting down, he told us to leave. I would understand if it was busy, but there were multiple tables open and not that many people. Bottom line: the best thing was their bubble tea but it's going downhill, food was mediocre, horrid service.

5.description: Wide assortment of drinks, free wifi, and great staff.  I spent an afternoon here working and sampling milk teas.  Their jasmine green milk tea is very aromatic and tasty, and green agar and nata both go well in it.  If you are only looking for drinksk then maybe Joy Yee might be better, but the atmosphere at Saint Alps is more calming, less chaotic.

11.description: So far so Good! This quaint spot just opened up. I tried the Chicken Chop with Teriyaki sauce; it was suprisingly very filling. $7.95 worth it. The service was also pretty swift. Easygoing atmosphere despite the crowd you'll see in there. I went on a weekday, so I was surprised.

3.description: Went here for coffee after lunch at 3pm and service staff did not let me sit because tables are for "dining". It is ridiculous for a 'teahouse'. By the way the restaurant was empty too. Mocha tasted horrible as well.

0.description: New location! It's now right across from Chi Cafe in the new Chinese area district. I came here today after eating lunch at Chi Cafe for tea with my friend which is how it usually goes down.Atmosphere: very modern looking restaurant with touches of greeneryService: acceptableFood: This place is most known for their milk teas. I love their hot taro green tea with tapioca! I've had food here in the past and it was ok... but their teas are where it's at!Price: average $3.75 for a regular tea... a deal if you ask me especially when compared to the likes of Starbucks!

20.description: Still love their drinks there and food. More convenient with the new location. But the price has gone up quite a bit so there's the only take back on it.

19.description: What I can say about Saint Alps? I am a regular customer for their delicious black tea with milk or mango smoothie. I always get the Lunch Special Chicken Teriyaki Chop. The food is delicious and hot. The salt and pepper tofu is a must try absolutely delightful. As well as their smoothies a must try is watermelon and lychee.

2.description: Pretty decent. Good lunch combo special.The roti is not that good.Portion for the beef chow fun is huge.

18.description: I came here for what was intended to be a quick meal. However, the workers were so disorganized and my food and drink came out around 10 min after my bf received his instead of at the same time. When I brought it to the waitress's attention that my drink order was incorrect, she talked to the barista and he was loudly complaining in the background. They not only brought my food to the wrong table but also continuously messed up the orders for the table next to me. We also had to keep flagging down the waiter/waitress to get our check. The food is on par with the other restaurants in Chinatown. In my opinion, the drinks stand out the most at St. Alp's. I love their jasmine green milk tea. Overall, I probably won't be coming back to eat here as the service is terrible. Save yourself the trouble and eat elsewhere--there's a ton of other restaurants in Chinatown that will appreciate your patronage.

13.description: My friends recommended me to come over here. I came by myself, they had 2 tables but server abandon me, cut to another table that they just came. I had to let the dude at the tea bar know that there was no server pay attention to me at all.Very slow service (-2 stars), food was up to par + reasonable price and milk bubble tea was okay (pretty watered down comparing to kung fu)I wonder why they don't do self service instead of having terrible servers.

4.description: The atmosphere of this place is modern and clean, which was what drew me to this little eatery. HOWEVER, the service is subpar, and this place isn't the most vegetarian-friendly. My friend and I ordered stir-fried vegetables with garlic, and it came with two shrimp. Plus, when the server asked if I wanted milk and sugar in the tea that came with the meal, I said no milk and no sugar, but it came with milk and sugar. What the hell.

6.description: My girlfriend and I just came back from visiting family in the suburb, so we want to get something that is the best of our buck in Chinatown for a quick late night snack. We walked pass this place, and its decoration definitely stood out in my eyes. It was very nicely decorated with walls of greens with imitation plants hanging on the walls, making it pleasant to scan across. And so in we go.Base on the menu, I immediately had the hinge that this restaurant is a Taiwanese cuisine restaurant. Mainly because most of the items made me think back to my childhood..which, is to my delight.My girlfriend got the appetizer wings while I got the value meal bento box. I have to say, it really tastes like motherland. Not to say that it completely outdid the food I tasted in Taiwan, but it definitely has its resemblance. To further enhance the experience, the price is definitely cheap! Though this is coming from someone who does not frequent Chinatown as many of the locals. If I ever swing by the area, I would definitely come back~

15.description: I just don't get it.I'm Chinese and I grew up in the area.  And since I was young, friends have been wanting to meet up at Saint's Alp.  And for the last 15 years, I have always wondered why.  The food is not that great (average or slightly below for Chinatown).  The bubble teas are not as good as Joy Yees or Kung fu Tea.  I decided to give it another try a few weeks ago and I still don't understand why people like this place.

7.description: Total chaos and disorganization. Waited 35 min for no one to talk to me. Sat multiple parties that arrived after me.

8.description: Seems like their quality has changed since moving to their new location. While it's much updated, newer and in a prime location, it's totally not worth the trade off. My hot green milk tea now tastes bland and watered down. The prices are also higher than other tea places. Call me crazy, but could I get my cup filled to the top, please? Bring the old St. Alps back!

14.description: It was a cold Tuesday night. After watching the new star wars movie, which I highly recommend, a couple of friends and I wanted to have a cozy place to socialize and enjoy some drinks with each other's company. It was between Kung Fu Tea and Saint Alps. I have never had Saint Alps since it has moved its new location; therefore, my friends and I decided that it would be a fine choice.     Upon entering, I was filled with joy from the selections that were offered on their menu. From surprise drinks to sorbies and ordinary bubble tea. After receiving our drinks and settling in, our conversation was interrupted by the waiter slapping the check onto the table. I thought to myself that maybe since we just ordered drinks, they did not want to wait to calculate the check later. As a result, we paid the check and continued our conversation with the warmth of our drinks accompanying our wonderful conversation. However, the waiter returned to our table a moment after the check was paid. To our dismay, he was not there to assist us to see if we needed anything but told us in a stern tone that we had to leave because we were not eating food.      Now why would you pride yourself as a teahouse when a group of friends can not simply enjoy a few drinks inside the establishment without ordering food? We had paid for our drinks and had every right to stay inside. My friends and I did not want to argue and cause a scene. Consequently, our meet up ended early and we left to be greeted once again by the harsh December cold. To say the least, you can find me at Kung Fu Tea in the future.

12.description: Photo department refused to sell us photos we printed because they "looked too professional". I had enhanced the colors myself on picnik.com! Not sure how they expected us to get a "formal release" from a non-existent photographer. Won't be coming back here!

3.description: Worst pharmacy! Do not go here. Plan on waiting 20-30 minutes to even get to the front of the line, let alone get your prescriptions. I have come here over 10 times and each was ridiculous! Slowest service!

1.description: Skip this place if you need a Wellness Check.  They take online appointments, but don't fulfill them.  And their rude pharmacist and his team will grunt and moan about the system and then tell you to come back in a hour cause he is so busy.  Never mind they don't acknowledge you have been waiting 5 minutes to hear this great news.  Skip them.  Brining down Walgreens reputation one pissed off customer at a time.

2.description: Nobody's home here.  They forget to call when there's a problem with the prescription, then when you call them back you get put on hold for 10 minutes.  I was waiting for over a week for them to call to tell me when my prescription got in...when they said it would take 2 days.  I went there in person at first and they assured me the drug was covered by my insurance.  So I call a week later and ask about it, and wait on hold, and then they tell me it hasn't even been ordered yet because of some glitch with the insurance.  Well, maybe you should have called and told me about this instead of just letting it sit.  Now I have to straighten this out and probably wait another week just to get my medicine.All this "modern" technology, and nothing gets done.  Not here, at least.

9.description: I hate that they don't advertise what is on sale from the ads on the shelf. Pain in the ass!Cashiers are not friendly and they check your coupons closely here like you trying to rip them off.

10.description: Deceptive pharmacist. Came in to fill a prescription. They didn't have it but associate offered to call another Walgreens. While holding, the pharmacist stops the associate's search and, looking up from his computer, says he looked it up and sees that the other Walgreens has plenty. I drive straight there. Nope. None. Waste of time. He obviously didn't want his personnel wasting time helping a customer, even though there were no other customers. He was content to be of no help to someone trying to fill their prescription in the middle of the night. Walgreens must be scraping the bottom of the barrel when looking for pharmacists. Obviously, someone looking to fill a prescription late at night might be experiencing a problem.

4.description: The only bad thing about this walgreens is the check out line. It just gets very long at times. Especially pharmacy, I think they need to hire more employees to work at the pharmacy section. There are usually 2 people in front of me waiting to talk to a pharmacist or get my prescription, but the wait is usually 15 minutes or more. And the pharm interns or techs can be a little nicer and give better customer service. It's cool that they can speak Chinese (good if your English is bad and if you speak Chinese). They are pretty helpful if you ask nicely. Over all if you are not from the area then you should just go to another Walgreens (unless it's for some emergency).

6.description: Sale items get sold out pretty quick because Chinese residents are super frugal. My only bad experience was when they had the Facebook photo promo and they indicate on the bottom that I could get a maximum amount for free, but it turned out it was too good to be true. Wow, so misleading and they printed them all out without consulting me first. Nicely played photo lady, you had my contact information and instead of waiting for me to call back or anything, you printed everything I had out because you knew I would not be able to get out of paying for all of them. After that indicent, I stopped shopping here with my own pocket money. However, I will admit I gotten less mad at Walgreens because most of the current employees are not that bad.

15.description: This place is definitely open. I was here on Sunday 3/28 and people were alive and well whilst shopping. I have to say the employee's were not very friendly and a customer actually burped in my face. Yup. I almost puked on her but instead I paid quickly for my diet pepsi and crystal light and ran away. The cashier didn't even hand my bag to me after bagging my stuff, she ran to another register and directed the line to her. I would really love to say that it wasn't because I'm not Asian but it truly felt that way. No big deal, tho. I can smile and move on. G'day.

0.description: Your standard Walgreens.Besides the fact that almost all the employees and patrons seemed to be Chinese, there's nothing that makes his Walgreens stand out from the rest.I walked in to buy a couple CTA day-passes for when friends visit from out of town.

5.description: The pharmacy here don't have it together, a simple prescription for allergy meds turns into a circus, the lady who was taking care of the late night shift told me that my doctor had to call because SHE deleted my script, came back in the next afternoon , after my doctor called in the morning, still didn't have my meds together, Waited 30 more minutes for a simple allergy medication, I'd hate to see what happens if I needed serious medication.

13.description: It's a regular Walgreens.  I use it mainly to park when I need to pick up some quick takeout in New Chinatown.  There is a sense that they will tow so do your non-Walgreens business quickly.

11.description: Yes this place is definitely open!! I go here a lot because it's close to where I live, and it's convenient. They have a parking lot and a Redbox! Most of the employees are helpful and polite. Sometimes a part of the store can be a bit messy if they're restocking.

8.description: The walgreens employee doesn't have good communication working with customer service and poorly don't care too much.

14.description: Always takes them forever to ring anyone up. The older cashiers always stop to chat with people no matter what and there's always a line way around the corner. The fastest I've ever gotten rung up was by a new trainee that had no idea what he was doing. Also, they always seem unprepared and understocked . . . some of the displays can be crude and hard to shop . . .

7.description: I just saw an employee show a customer an item, and kept walking away as the customer was asking questions. This is why I don't shop at Walgreens and using them right now to charge my phone.I felt bad for the lady and went to go help her myself.

58.description: Strolling through Chinatown, you will probably notice this place because the line for the bubble tea and smoothies is hard to miss.  The list of flavors is immense.  Our party tried a coffee, a watermelon, and caramel.  All three were good, but all of us voted the watermelon the best.  It was just light and refreshing.  If you're taking in a meal, the menu has quite a lot of choices, too.  Two in my party went with noodle soups while I went with a combination meat platter and rice.  We shared some shrimp spring rolls, which just right!  The portions are generous.  I feel there is something here to appeal to almost any taste.  It's a bright, open eating space, and I thought they handled the crowd well.

56.description: I first came to know Joy Yee for their bubble tea. And boy, do they have a lot of flavors of bubble tea. In fact, it's not fair to call them a bubble tea place because they also have smoothies or "freezes" made with every fruit imaginable. I usually get the less common flavors, like durian and taro, because when will I ever go blend up a durian?? Btw, both flavors were pretty good and true to their taste. I also love that you can add things to your drink, like jelly, tapioca, or red beans...the list goes on. If you're not overly stuffed from a meal in Chinatown, then come to this place for a freeze or tea. Or it can be a meal in itself - the drinks are pretty filling. Their food menu is equally as extensive. If you want any variation of asian food you can probably find it here. I got the pineapple shrimp fried rice. Mainly because I thought it was SO COOL that it came in a pineapple. But sadly, it did not come in a pineapple....so warning: don't get the pineapple fried rice only because you want to eat out of a pineapple! Besides that disappointment, I thought the food was mediocre. The fried rice was a bit over-salted but their stone rice bowls were pretty good. I would come for the bubble tea over an actual meal, but the food is good enough and reasonably priced.

29.description: Went here over the weekend and service was excellent! Staff was attentive and food was delicious. It was a total of 5 of us and food portion was huge! Like I had food for days. I was so hungry that I didn't get a chance to snap our food. We ordered the salty fish chicken fried rice which is always delicious. Pho noodles come in huge bowl. We actually split it between the 5 of us as a soup side dish. Thai beef salad was just ok. I think it could be more sour. The fried crab shell spring rolls is one of the best things I had here so be sure to try it! Overall everything I've ordered never seem to disappoint. The prices are very reasonable. 100 bucks for a table of 5 with lolev6 dishes is a pretty awesome deal with the portion we got. I always looks forward to coming to Chicago to stop and eat here. Looking forward to making it back really soon!

42.description: I usually go to Hing kee but I wanted to try something new else. Joy Yee. I m very disappointed. We first ordered Steamed Szechwan Won Tons. The meet had absolutely no taste. Not it was spicy either. Then Kimchi beef stone hot plate. The meet was hard to find in the meal! Mostly onion! Whatever beef slices were found were super fat! Service was slow... I will definitely not come back here.

23.description: Like others have said their menu is huge. I settled on Tofu Pad Thai. It was delicious, and was served in a trough-like dish with generous portions of tofu and fair amount of vegetables.

47.description: We stumbled upon this over a year ago. We love absolutely everything on the menu! We make it a point to eat here as our traditional Sunday brunch. I highly recommend this place.

8.description: 5 stars alone for the durian freeze which brings lots of Joy to my tastebuds. Having grown up around an abundance of the King of Fruits, Joy Yee gets two thumbs up for their durian freeze. They use a generous amount of fruit which gives it that ultra rich taste. You know it's legit when my hapa gal wouldn't even touch it with a pole. She's usually a fan of durian flavored foods, but after one sniff of this concoction all her Asian roots flew out the window. She claimed it was way more pungent than what she was used to. I'm putting my money on the fact that Joy Yee imports their durian straight from the deepest reaches of the motherland.Oh, and their food ain't half bad either. It's priced higher than what most Chinese establishments charge but think of it as a BOGO deal as 90% of the portions are well enough for at least two people. There's also approximately 835 dishes to choose from. My personal favorite so far is the soft shell crab pasta!

31.description: I just ordered from here, last night too. Yesterday's meal went off without a hitch, but this time we got some kind of extra special surprise. A whole extra box containing a single deep-fried mass the size of two child's fists, which dripped fish juice when ripped open and contained shrimp tails, chunks of whitefish, browned old pieces of imitation crab, possibly a piece of paper, seemingly whatever was left over in the fryer, not seasoned. My disgusting boyfriend ate the whole thing before I could take a picture because he has no self-respect. Otherwise, I love this place and how many kinds of drinks they have, and the fruit cups! Gotta love a place with fruit cups.

34.description: Terrible food, bad attitude, crowed and noisy environment!!

16.description: This place is a nice restaurant. Nothing too spectacular. The food was ok. It was a bit greasy for my taste. But other than the grease, I liked all of the other flavors. I had the Beef Brisket Udon and a boba. The boba was great! I am definitely coming back for those. And I am happy to say that the portions are large (both the food and the boba). This is a great place to go if you are hungry. Overall, I liked this place, but I would not really rave about it to my friends or tourists. Unless they want boba. Then I would most certainly take them here.

13.description: Ordered Joyyee after reading reviews. I wasn't sure what to expect since I wasn't eating at the actual restaurant, and instead had the food delivered to my hotel. I was pleasantly surprised! Ordered the Chicken Pad Thai, crab rangoons, and a strawberry lychee. All were delicious and the food was still hot on arrival!

11.description: The dilemma with Joyee is they are without a doubt a great drink place. On that note they are 5 stars. But the food leaves so much to be desired. Terrible quality food with bad flavor and somehow they try to make up for it by giving you large portions. Eat somewhere else and pick up a drink from here on the way out.

39.description: First time exploring Chitown's Chinatown. Luckily we got there on a Tuesday evening. AKA it wasn't packed/busy like on a weekend. Was in the mood for a refreshing smoothie rather than a milk tea or cream based smoothie drink so I tried the passion fruit coconut with mango jelly (it was still cream based)- They said fresh fruit was in the mix but I didn't really taste any fresh fruit.. Maybe a hint! BUT it was still good though. Pretty good for sugar flavored fruit, & I typically don't favor artificially flavored drinks. My aunt ordered their avocado smoothie. Good, but I wish the avocado flavor was more apparent. If I lived here, I would definitely be back to try the others! The menu is super overwhelming but I appreciated how it provided different Asian foods (i.e. Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, Chinese, etc) for its restaurant guests! We shared the spring rolls, won ton soup with noodles, hot tofu soup, & beef jap chae! Jap Chae is one of my favorite Korean dishes & I was pleasantly surprised! It was pretty up there with some of the better jap chae's I've tried. I'd recommend it/this place for groups in search of fruity flavorful variety of Asian foods(;

37.description: Joy yee has some of the best bubble tea I've had. I ordered the honeydew jackfruit freeze, but also tried the taro and coconut; they were all were great! Food was also pretty good, and the manager was a nice guy. My only complaint would be the prices, but they aren't completely outrageous, just a little higher than I was expecting. But when it comes down to it, I think their prices reflect the quality of their food.

0.description: I usually stop by Joy Yee whenever I'm in Chinatown and it never disappoints.  The place is almost always packed so be prepared to wait a little bit.  The menu at Joy Yee has a variety of Asian dishes, so you'll definitely find something that will fulfill your taste buds.  We ordered 2 dishes and 1 appetizer.  I got the stir fry udon noodles with beef brisket.  It was super flavorful but a bit salty.  Lots of meat in the dish though.  The shabu shabu was good but a little bland.  After adding some chili sauce to make it spicy it tasted a lot better.  Plus there were a lot of other ingredients in the bowl that meshed together very well.  The Szechwan won tons were very good too.  Cooked just right so the delicate won ton didn't break at all.  They also have an extensive list of drinks, smoothies, and bubble teas.  There are hundreds of combinations due to the choices between tapioca bobas, popping bobas, jellys, mixed jellys, etc.  The drinks are pretty tasty so people do come here just to get a drink.  They have a section in the front and outside where people can order just drinks.  If you're ever in Chinatown or in Chicago, I would recommend that you stop by here to check out their food and drinks!

38.description: This place has been our go to place if we're craving some really good Asian food. I've been to their Chinatown, university village and Evanston location and all of them always have the best service. As for the food, they have a really big or should I say massive menu that you can pick from. You can get a bowl of pho to a spicy Mongolian beef. If you want some shabushabu that have that to. Price wise, very decent for a big chain of Asian restaurant. If calculated correctly then per person it should be around $15 to $25.

51.description: I remember my first time coming here 7 years ago when they were just the one store in Chinatown and they were already hustling and bustling with customers. What appealed to me then was seeing the huge bowl of noodles that they had on display along with their huge menu with the largest selection of food I've ever seen. All the food I've tried here has been great and what I love in particular about this place is the drinks. The drinks are almost to die for. I literally travelled from NYC to Chicago JUST for it, I love their mini tapioca and coconut drink. I'm a huge fan of asian food and being able to have the variety here and knowing that no matter what I choose it will still taste great. I've always been iffy about going to fusion places that serve more than 1 type of food since that usually means it's not great, but Joy Yee is really an exception! I love coming here every time I'm in Chicago. The only downside is that it can get really busy and the wait for your food sometimes can be long so when you're starving, you really have to fight it out.Can't wait for my next visit here!

27.description: Step on up and prepare to make some big decisions! Their list of bubble and jelly teas/freezes is extensive- something I don't mind getting used to. From taro, to honeydew and lots of flavors in between. I settled on rose with bubbles. Did not disappoint! I can't wIt to return to get jelly tea!  It was a bit crowded, though and the standing room was also in the enter/exit area, which was a bit of a traffic jam.

32.description: This place use to be really good...... Not sure what happen now. I ordered my usually beef cubes in tomato rice, which you usually can't go wrong with. This time both my orders were completely covered in black pepper making it taste like straight black pepper rice. The cool must have spilled the black pepper while cooking and said screw it and served the food instead of remaking the food..... Very upsetting part is I took the food Togo and drove 45minutes home before tasting the food and being disappointed with a upset stomach :(EDIT- upped my star rating because I let the restaurant know of the issue and the next day they replaced my food with properly made fresh batch. Apologized for the new cook they had in the kitchen. Still a hassle to drive back but I am happy to finally have my craving satisfied. Thanks!!!

54.description: I usually enjoy this place, but I went in on Monday and a waiter was rude to me. We decided to sit down, cause it was hot out and the place was fairly empty. We ordered two drinks (my stomach has been upset, so I couldn't eat moe) and the guy was like, "Oh, the tables are for food only." I was like "Ok, where can we sit?" He very noncommittally waved his arm over to a tiny, dirty table near a cramped area. Why exactly can't I sit and enjoy a smoothie?

48.description: Food: 3/5Service:2.5/5My first experience here wasnt very good. Food was ok, but there are much better restuarants in chinatown. There were following things that bothered us: 1) The floor of the restuarant all through was wet/ had shoemarks everywhere, which is a big safety issue. No Caution signs either.2) We asked for straws, and when they brought is straws, it had waterspots and dirt on them. When we asked about this, they replied "we keep straws near the sink and so it has water splashes. Unacceptable.I am not sure if I am going there again.

44.description: I ordered a watermelon lychee smoothie and my friend ordered a kiwi lychee smoothie.   Not as good as before.   They just put too much sugar in there.   It was so sweet it was unbearable.   The line wasn't too long.  The drinks are around $5 each so it's kind of expensive.

24.description: The restaurant covers Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, Chinese foods, and quite a variety of smoothies, and milk teas. It could take a while just to browse the menu and all the food items are fairly priced and the portion is pretty good for noodle stuffs.

7.description: I have been to joy yee in the past and thought the good here is average until yesterday. I came for lunch w/ a friend. He ordered the szechuan beef and I had the salted fish and chicken fried rice. We agree the soft shell crab roll as appetizer.I have to say that Joy Yee has grown quite a bit over the years. The decor has been upgraded and looks really hip. Couches instead of plastic chairs. Open bubble tea shop. Looks really nice. The soft shell crab roll comes with a sweet sauce that I did not try as it was tasty enough. The fried rice was tasty as well. What I like best is their menu. Lots of items to choose from and they included photos of each dish so you know what to expect. The prices seemed high but the portion is huge. One dish served two meals for me.

49.description: Disclaimer: Have not tried the food here and have only been here for the bubble tea. But you'd be hard pressed to find any place with a bubble tea menu as expansive as Joy Yee's. And it's actually pretty damn good to. I mean, they really try to avoid the powdered stuff and you can see before you all the fresh fruit they put in their regular teas and in their slushes. And as I'm not that big a fan of the sweet stuff, the tea here isn't actually that sugary so it strikes a satisfying medium for people like me. Yeah the line is long, but there are a lot of people working and it goes through fast. And also they have that outdoor pick-up window....pretty nice if you're in the area and want some great boba.

40.description: Been a patron of Joy Yee in Chinatown ever since they were in existence...and last night I received the worst/unethical service here. It was very disappointing as this is my favourite location. Last night me and my party of 3 arrived and we ordered our dishes, we ordered their signature wings, a stone rice bowl, a seafood noodle and a pho. When the food arrived we had the most shocked look, as we did not know we ordered the LARGEST PHO that they had, which serves 5-6, on accident.Now mind you we are only a party of 3 and this is way too much food to order. Good customer service would've been for the female server to give us a kind reminder that if we are sure we want that HUUUUGE bowl of pho even though already ordered 2 entrees and an order of wings. The second part I was disgusted at is when we commented amongst ourselves that "how are we going to finish all this pho"...another server said to us "oh there's 2 guys in your party so you guys will be ok". It was a very slow night and we left with the thinking in mind that, since it was slow, were they tying to hustled us. We don't mind paying for what we ordered but just think better customer service should be warranted...who wants to take home 3 tubs of pho and soup base?!?!? We take blame in order it on accident but could've used a reminder...to ensure we know what we ordered.

53.description: The drinks here are gross! At least what I ordered, peach green tea. The green tea tasted like black tea. The drink had a bitter taste, like black tea. I asked the person making the drink to confirm that it was not a mistake, and it wasnt. It just tastes very nasty. Drinking that peach green tea left an after taste in my mouth. Gross!

30.description: Bubble teas on point.  You can Always see Fresh fruit used as they make it.  The smoothies as far as mango goes is not overly sweet,  with a good ratio between sweet and a hint of sour.  The tapioca and jellies selection in each is a must try every time.

46.description: Best Mongolian beef I've tasted so far... The drinks are grreat surpasses your regular bubble tea or Jamba Juice locations... 5 stars!

1.description: Not as good as I remembered it.I really enjoyed it the last time I came in 2013.  We came because I wanted banh mi, but it was the one item they no longer carried on the menu.  The pho didn't come with the usual condiments.  The beef & string beans wasn't exceptional, even the rice was bad - cold and hard.You're in Chinatown, there's better options.

55.description: I always passed by this place because it seemed overrated, especially being "asian fusion" cuisine. But I had to try it because it was always crowded, now I see why!Their menu is huge, would probably take months to try everything on the menu. But everything I have tried is delicious! Their seafood kimchi fried rice is great. It mixes Korean and Chinese flavors, with abundance of fresh seafood inside.The serving sizes are huge at a good price. Bubble tea is good too!

9.description: I think that the incredibly large amount of items on the menu is more appealing/interesting than the actual food itself. The noodles, fried rice, bubble tea, smoothies, and soups that I've ordered from Joy Yee are alright/nothing spectacular, but I always want to come back and try another item on the menu. If you're in the Chinatown area and can't pinpoint the exact kind of Asian food you want (Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese, etc), then I recommend Joy Yee. I will say that the bubble tea drinks don't look anything like what's pictured on the menu, but they still taste good.

26.description: I'm a pretty frequent diner here at 4 of their locations. I usually get the same thing here, I typically would give this place a 4.5 stars, but today's experience resulted of this 3 star rating. The item I frequently get, Beef Cubes over Tomato Sauce. I get this probably one a week. The host over the phone told me that they switched chef's during the time I ordered and it must've been a different chef cooking. Then resulted to telling me that they changed the recipe of the dish a few days ago. And if this is the case, I will never be ordering this item ever again. What used to be a delicious, bold flavored tomato sauce rice, is now a very bland rice. The beef cubes were super wet, not enough charred flavor like it used to. And now they've included big chunks of onions. The chef definitely didn't care enough to cook the food because it only took 5 minutes to cook it. This was an absolute favorite of mine and it's disappointing the host told me they've changed the recipe because it wasn't announced anywhere on their menu nor was told over the phone. This meal today is an overall 2star. I have to pour soy sauce over it which we used to never had to. Please change it back to the original recipe or chef because this quote on quote "new" recipe is horrible. My to go order shouldn't have taken 5 minutes to make.

25.description: This place is one of my favorite places to go! Yes they have over 10,000 dishes and the menu is the size of a 3 year old but they provide pictures so be prepared to have a lot to choose from! This place is always packed but they seat you right away,  they are attentive so expect to see your server as soon as you put your menu down!!! The food comes out very quickly and it seems like they never make mistakes! !!!!! The atmosphere inside is very modern and almost futuristic looking, this place is great!!!! 5 Stars from me!!

12.description: Joy Yee seems to be really popular. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to dine here but only had their taro shake. The dining menu had every Asian dish on there except balut.  It was packed like they were giving away money. The Taro Shake was pretty good and wasn't too sweet as I anticipated.  You could really taste the taro and the jelly was a nice change from your typical Boba.  It was a perfect drink after a salty and spicy meal at Lao Sze Chuan.  The Taro Shake definitely soothed the burning sensations I was getting from Lao Sze Chuan.  Lastly, it's a good stop to grab a drink and walk around Chinatown skipping and whistling.

59.description: This place is honestly a HUGE disappointment... First off, I honestly have no idea as to why people find this place to be "amazing". The only thing that they serve here, that's actually surprisingly good, is their bubble tea! Other than that, their food is just extremely bland... Unless you want some really good bubble tea, go somewhere else...

21.description: I had the afternoon off yesterday and decided to explore Chinatown. It's been a while since I've visited and there were many new restaurants but I really wanted some noodles. I was about to walk right by Joy Yee and keep looking when I noticed a man inside with a giant bowl of noodles. I couldn't resist and immediately went in.Despite the lunch rush I was promptly seated and my order was quickly taken. There are many options on the menu with confusing names but most have big vivid pictures to help out. I knew exactly what I wanted when I saw the picture of the foochow egg noodle soup. It arrived in a giant steaming bowl. Just what I'd been craving on a cold afternoon. The seafood piled atop the noodles all tasted delicious and well made. I don't know what everything was but I ate it all. The noodles tasted very fresh and the broth was delicious. I could've just eaten a bowl of broth and been happy. With so many delicious options to choose from I'll definitely be back for more.

17.description: Go go go! No reason to debate choices, just do it! I'm so glad my friends knew about this place! We ended up spending $139, including tip and tax for 7 of us, around $20 each for lunch but it was worth it! We each got a fresh fruit bubble tea...it's really hard to find such an extensive fresh fruit menu but you can make up whatever  concoction you desire. There's only one size, large, but it's worth it. Every food dish that came out was sooo tasty, nothing was bad. I wish I lived closer so I could experience more of this place....alas, I'm 1,200 miles away.

10.description: Went here over the weekend and service was excellent! Staff was attentive and food was delicious. It was a total of 5 of us and food portion was huge! Like I had food for days. I was so hungry that I didn't get a chance to snap our food. We ordered the salty fish chicken fried rice which is always delicious. Pho noodles come in huge bowl. We actually split it between the 5 of us as a soup side dish. Thai beef salad was just ok. I think it could be more sour. The fried crab shell spring rolls is one of the best things I had here so be sure to try it! Overall everything I've ordered never seem to disappoint. The prices are very reasonable. 100 bucks for a table of 5 with lolev6 dishes is a pretty awesome deal with the portion we got. I always looks forward to coming to Chicago to stop and eat here. Looking forward to making it back really soon!

5.description: Step on up and prepare to make some big decisions! Their list of bubble and jelly teas/freezes is extensive- something I don't mind getting used to. From taro, to honeydew and lots of flavors in between. I settled on rose with bubbles. Did not disappoint! I can't wIt to return to get jelly tea!  It was a bit crowded, though and the standing room was also in the enter/exit area, which was a bit of a traffic jam.

3.description: Swung by here after grabbing a hair cut nearby. No wait  for Saturday around lunch time so we were seated right away.The first thing I noticed was how large the menu is. They serve a combination of Chinese, Korean, Japanese and Vietnamese food and they even have PICTURES of every single dish. The one thing that bothered me is that all the food prices were listed at the last page or two, so if you were curious how much a dish was that you saw in the middle of the menu you'd have to keep flipping back and forth. Anyways after looking over the extensive menu for a solid 10 min, I went for the lemon grass pork chop over tomato rice. Pretty generous portion served in a long bowl. Would've been much easier to eat off a large flat plate but I guess it's meant to be shared? The rice tasted more like a sweet fried rice than tomato rice and I would've preferred more of a fried crispy pork chop, but either way it was still quite tasty. Overall food was good and a good value, but would be hard to say I'd be back since there so many more restaurants near by that is be will to give a try as well.'Til next time, cheers!

35.description: I have been to joy yee in the past and thought the good here is average until yesterday. I came for lunch w/ a friend. He ordered the szechuan beef and I had the salted fish and chicken fried rice. We agree the soft shell crab roll as appetizer.I have to say that Joy Yee has grown quite a bit over the years. The decor has been upgraded and looks really hip. Couches instead of plastic chairs. Open bubble tea shop. Looks really nice. The soft shell crab roll comes with a sweet sauce that I did not try as it was tasty enough. The fried rice was tasty as well. What I like best is their menu. Lots of items to choose from and they included photos of each dish so you know what to expect. The prices seemed high but the portion is huge. One dish served two meals for me.

19.description: I loveeee their boba . Ive never had a bad experience with their milk teas :)!The food is pretty good , i dont think its super amazing but it also hasnt been terrible.Their beef cubes are amazing though!

28.description: Love the huge drink selection. I always come for my favorite taro pudding with mango freeze. Food is satisfactory. I ordered the teriyaki chicken stone bowl. It was pretty good . My boyfriend got the chicken pad thai which was lack luster. But ill definitely be coming back for the Amazing drinks!

45.description: I have been a loyal customer for a decade. A couple nights ago we arrived when the place was only about 20% full. A friend and I just ate at the other end of the mall and we stopped in for a couple smoothies. We sat in the window at a two person table told the waiter what we wanted. He started writing it down and then when he asked us what we want to eat we said we're just having drinks. He then told us we would have to go stand over in another window if we're just having drinks as if we were not allowed to stay inside if we're just having drinks. This would be understandable if the restaurant was busy it was 80% empty though. Also it's horrible customer service because there was no line at the drink window there's no reason he could not have gotten the are smoothies for us. There was no reason we couldn't have stayed and drank our drinks at the table. Will not be back until apology and change in policy.

33.description: What a terrible experience eating here!! When we came in, I couldn' imagine the waiter refused to let us sit in the place we wanted which was available though. And nobody took good care of us. We need to fetch someone to make the order. The management was in chaos. After 30 minutes, our food still in waiting. And what made me more surprised is that the waitress said she had no idea about when our food would come out with a terrible altitude. And the manager stood on her side and never even apologied from anyone of them!! I would never ever come here anymore!!

43.description: 5 stars alone for the durian freeze which brings lots of Joy to my tastebuds. Having grown up around an abundance of the King of Fruits, Joy Yee gets two thumbs up for their durian freeze. They use a generous amount of fruit which gives it that ultra rich taste. You know it's legit when my hapa gal wouldn't even touch it with a pole. She's usually a fan of durian flavored foods, but after one sniff of this concoction all her Asian roots flew out the window. She claimed it was way more pungent than what she was used to. I'm putting my money on the fact that Joy Yee imports their durian straight from the deepest reaches of the motherland.Oh, and their food ain't half bad either. It's priced higher than what most Chinese establishments charge but think of it as a BOGO deal as 90% of the portions are well enough for at least two people. There's also approximately 835 dishes to choose from. My personal favorite so far is the soft shell crab pasta!

2.description: ive been to the joy yee in evanston and i didnt think it was that spectacular, just a good solid option if you are in the mood for chinese food. I did like this location more, its cute looking with clean lines and bright. Service and seating was really quick for me, I went on a friday night and the place was pretty full. I got the bibimbap and the taro shake- I would have just got the taro pudding but the waiter recommended I didnt. I did really like both the dishes I got, and I would get them again if I go there. Service was quick and the menu is super long, so perhaps read it before you get there. The drink menu is long as well, but is worth it if you want something out of the way of a normal shake you could get elsewhere. Shoutouts to taro and lychee. Instead of the boba, they also offer red beans which are delicious, you can also get pudding and popping boba as add ins.

18.description: A place he recommended and it was actually good! This is rare because my standards are high and he's cool with anything; which is why we don't get along. I had the green tea red bean slush and he had the honey dew tapioca jelly. Both drinks were amazing for the hot weather and I loved that they used fresh fruits! You can see them chopping up the fruits! The lines are long but it's worth the wait. They have a wide range of options too.

41.description: Only thing good was that the devilry guy was well within time. Other than that food went uneaten.  Save  yourself, pass on this place. 1 Beef Cubes with Tomato Sauce Rice $11.75 - beef was well over cooked1 4 Vietnamese Fried Pork Egg Rolls $5.95 - dry as can be, maybe they were old/out dated1 10 Fried Shrimp Shumai $5.95 - Mushy, bad texture  1 Chinese Broccoli in Oyster Sauce $9.95 - was good, just over priced for broccoli.

52.description: I have always had optimistic expectations of Chinatown before I arrive, then, well.... when you get there you see mice, garbage, various unpleasant odors, people spitting on the sidewalk. ugh! the restaurant was just ok, looks so cool from the outside. The food looks great on the table. Then you get to tasting it and at best it's inconsistent. Beef pho was lacking in flavor and very greasy, the beef with green beans had a ton of green beans very little beef, the kung pao chicken was very tasty not enough chicken and the shrimp and chicken fried rice stole the show it was excellent. We originally were going to do dim sum, we should have stuck to the plan. We did have a nice stroll through the neighborhood and bought a huge piggy bank for my nephew.

50.description: I would give a 5 star for the best milk tea in China Town but they provided really really bad service for dine in. Manager sat me next to the windows and servers ignored that i was there. I complained to one of the servers that i've been waiting for someone to take my freaking order and he didn't seem care. He said "you wanna go back to the seat?" Stupid! Not anymore.

4.description: I had the afternoon off yesterday and decided to explore Chinatown. It's been a while since I've visited and there were many new restaurants but I really wanted some noodles. I was about to walk right by Joy Yee and keep looking when I noticed a man inside with a giant bowl of noodles. I couldn't resist and immediately went in.Despite the lunch rush I was promptly seated and my order was quickly taken. There are many options on the menu with confusing names but most have big vivid pictures to help out. I knew exactly what I wanted when I saw the picture of the foochow egg noodle soup. It arrived in a giant steaming bowl. Just what I'd been craving on a cold afternoon. The seafood piled atop the noodles all tasted delicious and well made. I don't know what everything was but I ate it all. The noodles tasted very fresh and the broth was delicious. I could've just eaten a bowl of broth and been happy. With so many delicious options to choose from I'll definitely be back for more.

6.description: This place had the most ridiculous menu I have ever seen. I was so overwhelmed by the amount of items on this menu and wasn't expecting the restaurant to have such a huge selection of menus. It was basically 5 restaurants fused into one with a boba shop too! The menu is arranged with all pictures in the first half of the menu and the lists of prices and items are all in the back half of the menu. This place seemed like there would be a wait, but my friends and I were fortunate enough to come here while there was no wait.After taking forever to decide due to the huge selection, I ended up ordering the the Beef Brisket Chow Udon. My friends ordered the Malaysian Seafood rice, Beef Cubes with tomato rice, and Eel and Beef cubes. It's really interesting that they have jumbo sizes that serve 2 as well. All of the dishes were really good!! My only complaint was that the beef brisket in the chow udon was a bit tough. I wish they had a Joy Yee Noodle in the Bay Area!

22.description: the fruit juice and milk tea are much better than the noodles!

15.description: I'm not sure if it's a Midwest tradition but portions are huge here compared to what I'm used to on the East coast. I noticed a few reviewers complain about the prices but I would argue that it's fair because I had leftovers for about 4 days! I had the Soft Shell Crab with Pasta, curry chicken and coconut baked rice along with a durian freeze and coconut with taro jelly. The food was served in these cute little wooden bowls/pots. The food wasn't the best I've had and I realized their real star of the show was the drinks. I was a bit disappointed with the curry chicken and coconut baked rice since the rice did not have any coconut flavor at all it actually tasted like fried rice just without the toppings.. The soft shell crab was meh, the crab was too briny for my taste, the noodles were alright though. I never really trust restaurants that offer multiple cuisines because that would mean all of their food is mediocre since they have not truly committed to one type of cuisine and executed it in a 100% manner, Joy Yee is one of those examples that prove me right. I do give them some props on their menu design. I liked that they show pictures of all their dishes so it's pretty much a no brainer when you order. However it was imagery stimulation overload, I felt pretty overwhelmed on what to order because there was too many choices. If it wasn't for the drinks I'd have given this place 3 stars.

57.description: AVOCADO FREEZE.I will say it again: AVOCADO FREEZE.I know, it sounds wierd, a smoothie drink made from avocado?? That was exactly my thought when I first ordered it that fateful day 4+ years ago when I first visited Chicago Chinatown. But it's really so creamy and pure, so cold and refreshing, so milky and comforting,  so perfectly 'just a touch' sweet, so...avocado-y. :)My hubby and I try to order other things, and they're mostly pretty good (except the Taro was not real taro and a bit powdery so not the best), but we always end up coming back to old faithful. We just smile, sip, and enjoy, sharing just one, and then planning our next trip back the next year. :) oh and the portions are HUGE.  Seriously crazily huge. Wooot! :)The food is actually pretty good too but you mostly get food to eat with your huge meal of a smoothie. :) they have a nice big variety of all kinds of Asian food not just Chinese.
