The woman who I had seen barehandedly tossing noodles in the kitchen had run out, sneezed into her hand, spit up outside, yelled at the cashier, and ran back into the kitchen.It was like Contagion.  Then the cashier started hacking.  Like a bronchial-infected, whooping-cough, influenza extravaganza.  Then a polite cough, cough from the table behind us.  One friend noted that her dish had noodles in it and we all locked eyes.  Struggling as hard as we could against our Minnesota-nice, incessantly polite roots, we picked up our plates, pretended we were taking them to go and dumped it outside around the corner.Three Crab Rangoon....$1.50One giant omlette....$4.25Not catching SARS.....priceless.

19.description: Oh Gourmet...what would I do without you and your deliciously cheap rice boxes?I'm so glad my friends introduced to me this place! I've recommended it to so many people looking for cheap eats. The restaurant itself is more of a take out place, but there are a few chairs and tables inside if you'd like to dine in, but it's kind of dirty and the ground is sometimes sticky. I usually prefer to order take out.On to the food...Gourmet is known for their ridiculously cheap rice boxes. They also sell xiao long bao, BBQ meats, etc. For just about $5, you are able to get a large box of food that usually lasts me two meals. They have all different types of rice boxes from chicken to pork to beef, but I usually get the minced beef with a fried egg on top - so good! They also have some of the best fried chicken wings I've had in Chinatown! These wings have to be battered in crack - that's how good they are! I've also tried the xiao long bao here, but the skins are too thick and there is rarely any soup inside, so avoid them at all costs. The douhua (tofu dessert) here is really good and super fresh - they make it fresh daily, and it's only a dollar something for a large container. Make sure you get here early for this because they sell out pretty fast.Because it's located in the old part of Chinatown, parking can be a bit tricky, but there is street parking - just watch out for all those people who think they're invincible that walk out in the middle of the streets or behind your car as you're parking!  Overall, it's a great joint to grab a quick lunch at rock-bottom prices.

28.description: Taste: 4.5/5Location: 3/5Cleanliness: 2/5Ambience: 1/5Value for Money: 5/5 (Price, given the Food Taste)Service: 2.5/5I give this place a high rating simply for one thing: great prices for great food.Where else can you get delicious food with prices ranging just from $4 to $6?One more thing, they have hundreds of dishes, so you'll always have options to choose from.Apart from the food, everything else is just alright or even below standard. The place is dirty, the cashier and servers can barely speak English (with the exception of one of them). I'd recommend you to get your food to go instead.

45.description: hmmm not sure where all the negative reviews are from, most rice box places in Chinatown are 3-4 stars and Gourmet is a 4 star on my list.  Note: I DO NOT cook so i need to have in constant rotation my go-to palces for dinner-after all it is less expensive to eat out at these prices! :)My go to dish here is the BBQ combination plate.  For $5 you can get your choice of roast pork, chicken, duck or BBQ pork  over rice with veggies. Add a $1 for soy milk  The meal is very tasty and the portions are generous, I usually have enough for lunch the next day.

33.description: I've been here countless times and their food never lets me down. Atmosphere: it's pretty quiet and it's pretty similar to a lunch room. They do feature a few tables and mostly booth so the noise level can raise as a result. They are warm an cozy during winter days. Their expansion during these recent years included AC in the summer, so it's not terribly unbearable for dine-ins. 3Decor: the place worked on improving (replacing seats) and also added a tv from the last time I dined in. They also have several chairs that are lined at the wall across from the counter. The seats are regular and mostly wooden, but comfy for the meal. 3Food: the food is pretty awesome. I definitely appreciate the fact that they heed my requests to "go easy on the oil" when I ask for my favorite beef with thick rice noodles. One of my favorites from here are the fried chicken wings. The wings are always big, fresh (not all the time, but I'm usually lucky to get fresh ones most of the time), and delicious. I can't find that taste anywhere else. 5Service: this place is similar to a lunchroom. You order and you pick up the food--- self serve! Like most restaurants in Chinatown you will be able to order to-go or dine-in. I find that I get a lot more food when I order for dine-in. You basically clean up after yourself after your dine-in meals. I mostly order on the phone for pick up and they rarely ask for last names... so I end up standing in line asking for pick up and have to remember every box that I ordered. 2Price: for the amount of food and taste, I think this place rocks. Your meal can be under $8 and you will be stuffed (rice-box plus other appetizers, of course). 5!Their place also features a Chinese bbq (not with charcoal) with a variety of meat to choose from. They have roasted pork, bbq pork, roasted ducks, and chickens! If you are a fan of flavor and crispiness, go for the roasted pork! The tastiness doesn't end there either, do try the roasted duck! For bland eaters, (not quite the case) try the salted empress chicken. They're absolutely tasty with the sauces (scallions, oil, and ginger)

43.description: I wish I hated the food here, but I don't.  It is awesome!  Pretty much anything you order over rice is fantastic.  The portions are generous and the prices are so cheap.  The shrimp dumplings in their soup are incredible.  You really can't order anything bad.  You know a Chinese restaurant is good when ppl who work at other Chinese restaurants eat there.The reason I wish I hated it, is the girl that works behind the counter (I think it's a girl.  It might be an old lady, I dunno).  This female never smiles.  She never says hello or good bye or thank you.  She once yelled at me b/c I waited 20 minutes for my food (I know, it doesn't make sense).  This is THAT person who hates doing their job while at work.  Order your food and get out.  Don't ask for extra silverware or napkins.  If you do, she will give you this nasty piercing look.  It's as if she'll remember you and make sure your food tastes "different" next time.  I wanna spit in her mouth every time I leave the place.    I would give this place 5 stars if it wasn't for her.  Is it wrong that I hope she gets fired or quits?...preferably fired.

2.description: I bought 1.5lb bbq pork from there this morning . When I come home I found that was from yesterday! The meat was cold and hard! They are unbeatable! !!!我打电话过去，那女的说是今天早上的。打死我也不信，简直是冰箱的温度，那肉象石头一样的硬。不是心疼那几块钱，是心疼孩子们今天没得吃！我还要返工呢！

18.description: I like to come here for their rice boxes (around 5 bucks) which are big portions and tasty. 3 rice boxes would be less than 20 dollars. I recommend any of their salt and pepper dishes as well as their tofu dessert!Make sure to bring cash.

41.description: i been eating here since i was a little kid. i love the food here because the flavor is just right and the portion is big... but i wouldnt eat there tho since the table and chairs isnt so clean

52.description: Seriously, Look at the dates of the previous reviews here. Gourmet USED to be good. Original owners made this place AWESOME, 2nd owners kept it up. Current owners screwed it up and made it crappy.I have been eating at Gourmet since it first opened over a decade ago, so I know how it's changed. This used to be my GOTO place and I would eat here more than twice a week...sometimes 4 or 5.The last time I ate here, I got food poisoning from here. I reported it to the Chicago Department of Health and they were shut down for a short time to clean or whatever to bring it back up to code.The current food is BLAND, undercooked or overcooked, and pricey compared to other places in Chinatown. Seriously, it doesn't TASTE good. If you are only used to Panda Express, then this place may be better...but it's not good.AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

50.description: 4.5 starsThis hole-in-the-wall diamond in the rough was and still in some ways amazing.  I remember back in the day you could get a can of pop, the soup of the day, and a rice box all for under $5.  But soon the extras kept on getting stripped.But who cares when you got great quality food for the price!  You will still be paying only $5 for your meal and you will leave full.  Recommendations:- What I love are the spicy salt chicken wings, they are juicy, spiced just right and tender.  Oh man trust me its fried chicken at its finest; just know you'll need to work out afterwards. - The spicy salt shrimp is the best here; I haven't liked other restaurants even though they sell it for much more.  - Pork Soup Bun.  don't let the name fool you.  These are similar to potstickers and dumplings but these are amazing.  They are steamed and have a soup inside that explodes in mouth but the juices are rich and delicious.  Trust me this is a great appetizer with your meal.  It comes with a rich vinegar with garlic, onion, and ginger pieces that enhances the taste of the bun.  - spare rib rice - just like dimsum, love it!- Singapore noodles, curry with noodles, can't beat it.- Beef Chow Fun (dry), fish with corn, sesame chicken, fried egg with shrimp, porkchop with mandarin sauce, porkchop with onions, curry chicken... everything is practically good.One note though this place ain't good for the body and not a good place for a date unless you are assured of her love for you.  This is the only reason to knock on this place but since I'm all about good food and less about the atmosphere.  Try it!

4.description: AVOID if you can, the lady that helped us acted like we owe her a thousand bucks, give us two set of cheap chopsticks when we came in as a group of 4 cuz she thinks the food we ordered wouldn't require chopstick, asked for napkins and she gave us 2 at a time, have to keep asking like 5 times. I mean how much is an extra set of chopsticks going to cost you. I asked her a question and she simply just ignored me. It was a really unpleasant experience overall. Also, the garbage is really close to where we eat, and the guy who were changing garbage bags just did it right at our face. Not to mention the food was below mediocre. We asked for fresh crispy doughs, and the lady told us they aren't making fresh ones anymore, well obviously they are lol for those of you who read Chinese: 油条比之前难吃好多

6.description: This may actually be the MOST dive-y place I have ever been to (and trust me, I've been to MANY jank establishments). This place takes dive-y so far, it's almost charming...like you walked on to a set of a Hong Kong fast food joint back in the 70s. Gourmet food is a super no frills and all-business type of establishment catered to the Chinatown locals. Food is rock solid and dirt cheap. I got the salt and pepper shrimp rice box, black pepper beef rice box, two rice balls, and two cups of freshly made soy milk to go for ~$18 (that's two meals for two people w/ left overs!). Absolutely incredible. They are clearly doing SOMETHING right if they are still bustling amidst the competition from Chinatown square and the main street of Wentworth. I was debating whether to give it 5 stars because I have no doubt that I will be back over and over and over again, and that's usually my gauge for how many stars to give a place. However, I recognize that the incredibly run-down interior and exterior and the rushed service may be off-putting for many. So accounting for that, 4 stars is probably more reasonable. But all that said, you should absolutely come here for the cheap and delicious Chinese foodstuffs. Soy milk was the bomb. I wish I could've also ordered the tofu dessert before they ran out, because that too was freshly made in house and sold like hot cakes while I was in line. If you can shrug off the decor, this place is REALLY REALLY REALLY worth your while.

22.description: Yes, it doesn't look great but it has lots of yummy food. I come here for their sweet tofu - tofu fa. Good texture and the syrup isn't too sweet.

15.description: mm.. This is my go-to restaurant when trying to find cheap delicious chinese food. When I was younger and lived in chinatown, I came here quite often for a 5 dollar rice box. Came here the other day with a friend to catch up and food is still like I remember. My favorites are the salt and pepper pork chops, the green onion oil chicken, and the minced beef with egg. They are fast and efficient and the closest thing I would say to a delicious hole-in-the-wall place in Chinatown.

57.description: This is your more than typical hole in the wall place in the heart of Chinatown.  You shouldn't dine in...  I have nothing good to say about the interior but definitely order take out.  The food is cheap, hot, and delicious.  It's a bit oily but sometimes I crave that grease.  I love the pan fried noodles with fish and chinese broccoli.  It's comfort food for me!

20.description: Disclaimer: my review is based on take out that was eaten about 30 min after we ordered it. The beau and I ordered some rice boxes to go since we were leaving Chicago and going on the road. I ordered the baked fried rice (seafood with vegetables and tomato sauce) and he ordered a pork and rice dish. It's a pretty good price for the amount of food - I was able to split mine up into 3 different meals and it cost $6.50 total.The tomato sauce ended up being pretty ketchup-y and sweet, making it delicious at first but hard to finish. The fried rice also wasn't too special - the seafood that was inside was shrimp. We also got some BBQ pork to go, and that was pretty good, but not the best we've had. Overall, good price but average food based on our one-tiem experience...

36.description: I'm only rating the deliciousness of my favorite dessert. It's the one and only place to get your dao fu fa or soy pudding. And it's oh-so delicious! It reminds me of Hong Kong..that's how good :) You van get it either hot or cold. I prefer it cold buy always order it hot and then frigerate it since it seems to be fresher. If you haven't tried it, you must! They add the sweet syrup on it for you, but diny hesitate to ask for more or on the side. It's my perfect light dessert. I can hardly wait to grab a spoon and eat it on my car ride home. :)

14.description: Fresh Chinese bbq meet, chicken and all sorts of intestines (fried or grilled). Sweet bean curb milk Cash only!

58.description: Been going here for over 25 years. Recently updated on the exterior and interior. I always order fried shrimps and if I feel like eating healthier than I order their cocktail shrimp, clams, and dinner rolls. And their hot sauce is the best that I have had. Absolutely love love this place.

56.description: HUGE fried shrimp- amazing sauce... MUST GO HERE!Place is always busy and they are always open- sometimes the crowd is a little sketchy (but partially my fault for getting Lawrence's cravings at all hours of the night ;-)Seriously, I think the fried shrimp were the size of my fist- breading has great flavor, not too much but just right.  You can tell they use fresh ingredients and fresh oil to fry everything- that makes a massive difference and keeps the quality high.  Staff is always happy and helpful, but the place could use a bit of an update (admittedly I haven't been here in awhile so maybe it's already happened?)  Big private parking lot and fortunately well lit at night.  ***The hot sauce here is ADDICTIVE!!! Like seriously! ***

29.description: Everything was very good! My only negative was the catfish  it tasted very muddy like it was caught in the river. Maybe it was? The place is great. Favorite thing to do on the river is tie off the boat and go eat some seafood and grab a brew!

42.description: Food is decent, sort of on the bland side. I'm trying it for the second time today. Fingers crossed because I've heard so many good things. And I want it to be Update- Just had the Shrimp Po Boy and it's worth the trip! My only complaint is that it was HUGE and I couldn't eat it all even though I wanted too :) I will be back to try more.

23.description: I have heard about this place for years and finally decided to try it. Nice clean place. But that's as far as it goes. I didn't like the  the fish or shrimp. I also didn't like the sides. I'm sorry I ever tried them.

47.description: This is my #3 go to shrimp place. Im bias....I only come for the shrimp so all Im rating is the shrimp. I love them. The shrimp is good but cant give 5stars becuz why do I have to pay for my hotsauce?? Also, the restaurant is NO BUENO. I come here for pickup orders ONLY. Even when I was like 6yrs in the 80s, I remember my parents taking this TO GO. Its always packed during the day when I go, but their shrimp is good.....anything else, I have no clue.

8.description: This place was highly recommended by a south suburbs friend. So after ministering at nearby PGM, instead of eating in Chinatown, we tried Lawrence's. I was a bit afraid that everything would be salty but was pleasantly surprised that the shrimp & fish weren't! Shrimp werePlump & juicy. And for once the cocktail sauce did not smell nor tasteLike acetone. Good stuff! Also, it is spacious and clean inside. Cool artwork on the walls. We'll be back, I'm sure.

31.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE! Placed an order for pickup and due to bad traffic I didn't make it till the restaurant until an hour later. My food was still not ready and had to wait an additional 40 minutes to receive my order. Entire staff had terrible attitudes. Considering the fact that my two meals totaled to almost $25, I should have been the only one upset. I will NEVER spend my money at this establishment ever again! I do not recommend anyone to go there!

34.description: Nice to see the place updated as I haven't been there in years. Ordered the half shrimp dinner and a drink and immediately had to spit out the cole slaw-awful. Shrimp with the hot sauce was OK, fries so-so, bread roll-days old.They're obviously content sticking with the same old formula, but $13 and change is a high price for average food.

16.description: Very underwhelming. Went in for a bite to eat with my husband on a Saturday afternoon. We ordered the Large Shrimp, Crunchy Cod and fries with two sides of cole slaw. The large shrimp was fresh, but I wouldn't exactly call it large. It had way to much breading on it. Maybe they do this to make them "appear larger" or something. I ended up peeling a ton of breading off so I could actually taste the shrimp. The crunchy cod was just ok. I've had much better. I expected more fish wise here being that it's a fishery and all. The fries were undercooked, under seasoned and mushy. Coleslaw wasn't my favorite. The only plus to this is place is they allow you unlimited sauces. Would I return? Probably not. I know much BETTER places to get actual JUMBO fried shrimp and cod for the same price.

13.description: This place has a wide selection of sea food, most of it is deep fried, which can be a good thing, but, for a fried fish to be excellent, the fish has to be FRESH, and with my first bite of the shrimp and then my first bite of the catfish, the first thing I noticed is that this sea food may not be so fresh.It's ok though, the amount of salt in the shrimp and catfish made it hard to notice the lack of freshness with all the subsequent bites. Just have to get over that first, mildly repulsive bite. And get water, you'll be thirsty after. Upside is, it's open 24 hours a day.

11.description: It was ok. Not impressed. The batter on the shrimp frog legs was too much. The chicken wings were really good.

39.description: Customer service is great! And the food was awesome I had Coconut Shrimp and it was really good. I would recommend Lawrence Fisheries for a fresh quick bite to eat!

37.description: If you are in the area this is a must try!  Casual dining experience - not at all pretentious.  Popcorn shrimp were awesome! Crab cake meal was also pretty good. They have a nice parking lot and a outside reading area, again very casual.  Good is served in Styrofoam or paper bags.  Loved it!

0.description: Been coming here for 15+yrs!  Highly recommended!!Great for late night snack, especially after 2am :)Always always call before showing up unless you have time to kill(always packed w/ customers)!  I always call to order, got there no waiting just pay and pick up order and leave :)Their spice sauce & cocktail sauce are awesome!

38.description: I have been here a few times since my last review. It is still very good. I think the service was a bit off possibly due to new people? Does not take away from the food though.

51.description: As a Chicagoan I must say the remodeling looks terrific and when I went in to order the customer service was outstanding. The shrimp, frog legs and jumbolya was beyond expectations and the service was quick and efficient. That's why this place is a staple in Chicago.

27.description: The coconut shrimp is fantastic. Catfish strips were a close second. They were out of the corn fritters so I'll have to make another trip back. What a pity.

32.description: My husband like to go here. The food is always fresh and hot. They are very busy every time we visit so we have to wait. The place to clean and they have nice outdoor seating. The breading is off putting. It is too thick. So, when we eat there we are pulling off thick breading. There hot sauce is sweet and not hot, which I do not like. The customer service is decent. My first visit here I used a Groupon which was cool. It is not terrible but not great. This place falls inbetween for me.

54.description: Was in the area recently and had wanted to try this place to see what they had to offer and had wanted to check a different place out for seafood.  It was crowded for a Lenten Friday night but it moved fast and it was shorter wait for my food than I expected.I got the fish chips upsized to a dinner (fries cole slaw and roll).  It was tasty and hot. Their mild sauce isn't too bad either.The place itself is decent sized with a lot of seating.Might be back here one day for some seafood if in the mood and in the area.

48.description: It was okay! Not fabulous... They messed up my order not once but twice. And it was over priced! I won't be back

44.description: Too expensive for my blood, went there the other night and ordered a pound of fish chips and a pound of shrimp. It cost me $27.51 and it wasn't all that great. Overly breaded fish and lack luster staff.

24.description: Unbelievable.  I paid and waited and the somehow lost my order.  Waited and waited.  Bullshit!

7.description: Totally unprofessional. Just tried to order food. Been waiting in line with everyone else. Man comes from the side asks one of the ladies behind the counter a question and immediately gets to jump in front of everyone! So I guess me standing in this super long line, waiting patiently, wasn't good enough. Not cool. How do you treat customers like this. I could see if there was no line or if there was more than one line open, maybe. But to BLATANTLY disregard everyone else in line, PATHETIC!

49.description: OMG !  The best, freshest,  delicious  fish.  I travel over 1 hr to this awesome find.   Keep up the great friendly  service.. the staff is awesome.

40.description: I used to be a die hard fan before the remodeling and I still am! My father used to work across the street and he used to come here for lunch for 30 plus years. I really admire the fact that they have been at the same location since the 1950's and have really kept the family tradition alive, all of their recipes, including their famous breaded shrimp recipe is still wonderfully the same so give this place a try. This is a hidden gem right in the heart of Chicago.

53.description: The best thing going on here is their Hot Sauce!!!  The shrimp is too heavily breaded and you cannot taste the flavor of the shrimp.  Fresh Gulf Shrimp has a distinct flavor like none other and those who know how to bread it AND fry it  [Haire's Gulf Shrimp @ 8112 S. Vincennes, Heinie's Shrimp @ 10359 S Torrence Ave, and Trojas's Chicken and Shrimp House @ 4151 W 26th Street] know that you don't over bread the shrimp just for it to weight more when you weigh it.  Those who care for quality will pay more.  I buy Lawrence's Hot Sauce to eat with my shrimp I buy from Haire's, Heinie's, and Trojas and you should too.  OBTW, don't even think that going a little North to Goose Island is better, their shrimp coating is thicker than the fur on a Polar Bear in January!!!

30.description: If you like paying $18.00 per lb. For jumbo breading & small shrimp so be it. It use to be a lot better . Why do things get worse over time should be the opposite for a staple like Lawrence's  doesn't come close to Frank's Chicago Shrimp.

46.description: Update Lawrence Seafood has restored my faith in fast fresh seafood. Again the staff are fast and my order was perfect. Fish smelled and tasted fresh and well cooked. Thanks Lawrence for many more great meals to come!!

1.description: I FEEL LIKE I WAS TOUCHED INAPPROPRIATELY, NOT IN A GOOD WAY EITHER!!!!I ordered a 1/2 lb of jumbo shrimp &1/2 order of wing zings. I know the order taker Clifton from my neighborhood (childhood friend) so of course service was pleasant. It took about 10-15 mins for my food to come and when it did Boy was I excited. That excitement quickly ended when I got to the car and saw it was only 5 shrimp in my damn bag! Smh it was about 6pc wing zings. My food was fresh atleast, but the shrimp were gone before I made it to the expressway. MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT. I enjoyed my food, but I don't know if I'll be returning because the portions on the shrimp are ridiculously small now. Prices have raised, portions have become significantly smaller. The restaurant is clean and spaceous. The bathroom is also clean.

55.description: Hubby likes it I never have.   Its a Chicago tradition but the food is not that great unless you like more breading than actual shrimp.   Most people flock here because its open 24 hours.

9.description: I'd really love to always have a great experience at Lawrence's but today was horrible. I attempted to call in a pick up order, I was placed on hold three times, hung up on twice and the final time I waited 6 minutes for an answer. Then a woman gets on the line and Is beyond rude that I just hang up. I went in to place my order instead hoping to not have to deal with this person again. My order was simple, one pound of jumbo shrimp and one order of jumbo wings. I know that the wings take somewhere near 12-15 minutes from past experience of always placing the same order either with more or less shrimp but always wings for my son. This time I placed my order at 7:29pm. I didn't walk out of there until 8:13pm. Now this is nearly 45 minutes later. I asked several times about my order and no one knew what was going on. I understand the fact that they were busy but by the time I left the sudden rush had been served and I was still waiting. I asked to speak to the manager at around 8:00'when the half hour mark hit, it took her over ten minutes to meet with me and that was after I had my bagged food in hand. The attitude was ridiculous and this was the same woman from the phone. Her voice is distinctive enough. She was rude and asked what I needed and what I ordered with such an ugly tone that I just looked at her and said "never mind I won't be back." This is aplace that I grew up having shrimp from. It's our go to quick takeout and of the 25+ years of going as a child and adult I can guarantee that this is the longest time I have ever waiting and that includes during Lent at their all time busy time. The managers behavior was unacceptable. A manager should never make a customer fee like their order doesn't matter, when your serving maybe a 1,000 people a night my order probably didn't matter at the end of the day but I shouldn't know that as a customer. This will be my last time here for a very long time

26.description: What can I say this place has been a staple of my life's late night shrimp cravings and as always the consistancy is amazing on what kind of flavor profile to expect.  This is one of Chicago's hidden gems; Lawrence's is certainly in my top ten and comes in at number 4 in my power ranking. Oh BTW way the new entrance is a new improvement from Death stairs that used to be there.

25.description: They have a nice ramp to the main entrance and it's spacious inside. They have a large private parking lot and wheelchair accessible restrooms. Cool art inside. The outdoor seating by the river doesn't look wheelchair accessible because there are stairs to get down and the ground is only gravel. Ordered a half pound of fried oysters, half pound of fried scallops, and gumbo. They were out of shrimp and grits. Everything was smaller than we thought.  Mini scallops look like popcorn shrimp and were a little rubbery at times. Oysters were bigger but fishy. I like the oysters better but my sister liked the scallops more. Both were crispy and not salty, which I like. Gumbo tasted like tomato soup and was a little salty. The farthest table has a nice view of the river.

12.description: I have heard about this place for years and finally decided to try it. Nice clean place. But that's as far as it goes. I didn't like the  the fish or shrimp. I also didn't like the sides. I'm sorry I ever tried them.

59.description: Stopped in here last weeend. I've been wanting to stop here for a while and I was disappointed. For one they ran out of okra -_-. That's an automatic fail!!! The price point wasn't terrible . For two half order shrimp dinners it was $21. We got shrimp, fries and a drink. I wish the breading had some sort of flavor to it. I think it would take this place to another level I'd they just addded a lil sumthin sumthin to the batter. Its really nice inside. I love the murals a over. I thought it was also pretty cool they were playing the Bulls game. That's a plus. Overall,  tho idk if I'd be back.

21.description: I've been here many times in the past before they got the parking lot now when it use to be just a pile of land with gravel laying around with no fence, even before they changed there suppliers for the oysters. I'm  saying this just because the old supplier they use to have was delicious. When I first bit into there fried oysters they use to ouzze with juices. Now a days they kind of do the same but not as much.. The half chicken dinner use to contain huge pieces of fried chicken as well now they are smaller piece of chicken. The palce is still convient place to go on the weekend or late nights hunger because they open 24/7.

17.description: Chicago's Captain D's. Too much batter on the deep fried menu. Shrimp were good other than that. Staff was not friendly.

10.description: I haven't even eaten the food yet but I had to review for the jerk calling out the numbers.... Give me a second to calm down........ ........I just ate and its not getting any better. Problem #1: I ordered the whole catfish and got the large catfish strips(which really are nuggets) the difference between those two are the bones and $4.50. In their favor of course. Problem #2: there's an old black guy (it's ok I can say it because I'm African American too) he got mad at me while giving me my order. The exchange went as follows:Him: "32!"Me: hey (handing over my receipt)Him: "what kind of Sauce you want tarter or cocktail"Me: do you have hotsauce if not I'll take tarter.Him: "I said which sauce do you want!?"Me: " I just said tarter."Problem #3There is something to the side labeled hotsauce. Beware it isn't. Don't come here. Unless you want rude service and can't make it down to Ed Debevics.**update**The manager reached out to me and offered to fix their error. I think that was a great gesture but this place is pretty out of the way for me. I'm adding a second star for Dan's timely response.

5.description: Been going here for years and nothing changes.  Sometimes that can be a good thing, sometimes it's a bad thing.  I'm not totally sure which category it falls in.  As most have pointed out, it's open 24 hours and it's a convenient location so that change isn't bad.  But the food has stayed the same and it's nothing to really rave about.If you are just trying to get something fast and fairly inexpensive, Lawrence's will do the trick.  I'm not a fan of their seasoning (or lack thereof) so I pretty much just load up my dishes with hot sauce or any other sauce they have.  My last dish here was a perch dinner that couldn't have tasted any blander if they tried.  But I was starving and I was passing here on my way home and with the right amount of salt, pepper and hot sauce it did the trick (mainly soak up the liquor I had consumed).

3.description: I'm totally not a fan of fried food so not exactly blown away my this place. Crab cakes were decent, fries needed more seasoning, and hot sauce seemed watered down. Great service though and reasonable prices. Oh and there open 24 hours!

35.description: After driving by this place for years, we finally stopped in for lunch. The shrimp and fish chips had way too much breading on them. The shrimp po-boy was essentially a shrimp and lettuce sandwich, lacking any authentic po-boy flavor. The fries were limp and greasy. The clam strips did have good flavor and weren't over-breaded like everything else, however the "strips" were short caterpillar-sized nuggets. We'll go back to driving past this place without stopping.

19.description: WESTCHESTER LOCATION:  Stay away for a few months until they work out the kinks.  The shrimp are significantly smaller and the haven't figured out the batter yet.  They were extremely over-fried and were not hot.  You could definitely tell they'd just been sitting.  The shrimp were so greasy.  They are NOTHING like the shrimp from the Canal Street location.  For a new location, they should have the faster workers on the register to move the customers out.  While the employees are very nice and courteous, the food leaves a lot to be desired.  Definitely not worth the $16.45/lb

28.description: Yep, it's good. If it's a chilly time of year and you're in the mood, try the gumbo.

45.description: THIS IS A MUST GO TO FISHERY!!I have been going here for the past 10 years and I come to this place after every single Sox or Bears game! I even drive here on random nights I crave fish (I live about 30-45 minutes away in the suburbs). It is a bit pricey but it is open 24 hours. They also renovated the interior and exterior over the past couples of years. It looks ALOT nicer. The cashiers are normally extremely friendly. I have had conversations with them for over 10 minutes when they weren't busy and they are normally very entertaining. Now to the food, it's is amazing. I have had everything from the fried shrimp (a must have), frog legs, cod, chicken, and the list goes on. I have friends say "I don't like fish" and 5 minutes later they're in love with the shrimp. If you have the chance or are in the neighborhood you NEED TO STOP HERE!

33.description: Due to parking lot renovations, the bus parking seems to be gone or severely limited at best. STILL, they have the best shrimp in the city. Period.

43.description: I haven't even eaten the food yet but I had to review for the jerk calling out the numbers.... Give me a second to calm down........ ........I just ate and its not getting any better. Problem #1: I ordered the whole catfish and got the large catfish strips(which really are nuggets) the difference between those two are the bones and $4.50. In their favor of course. Problem #2: there's an old black guy (it's ok I can say it because I'm African American too) he got mad at me while giving me my order. The exchange went as follows:Him: "32!"Me: hey (handing over my receipt)Him: "what kind of Sauce you want tarter or cocktail"Me: do you have hotsauce if not I'll take tarter.Him: "I said which sauce do you want!?"Me: " I just said tarter."Problem #3There is something to the side labeled hotsauce. Beware it isn't. Don't come here. Unless you want rude service and can't make it down to Ed Debevics.**update**The manager reached out to me and offered to fix their error. I think that was a great gesture but this place is pretty out of the way for me. I'm adding a second star for Dan's timely response.

2.description: Ordered food and my friend lost our receipt. We were talking to the same person who gave us the receipt and they lied saying our card never went through and refused to give us our food after we payed for it. Checked my account statement this morning... "12/19/2015  Pending Lawrence's Fisheries  $15.25"Going to make a chargeback on my card. SCAM

18.description: Wow! This place has absolutely DELICIOUS coconut shrimp.  The dipping sauce makes it even better.  We love Lawrence's shrimp - and are excited about the new Westchester location!

41.description: Amazing! Friendly staff, fast service! I will be back late at night for some munchies!!!

52.description: Very busy place customer service was very snappy and quick with the customers. Food was hot and good however our order was not correct and I guess if you don't bite into your food right then and there you are out of luck. Got stuffed mushrooms instead of corn fritters. Portion sizes are a little small for the price you pay but it makes up for it in the taste. Overall I would return for more.

50.description: Visited my Bff for her birthday in Chicago and this place is a tradition for us girls after we go out! Its open 24 hours a day and when ever I come we always order fried shrimp, boiled shrimp, fried scallops and lots of crackers and hot sauce!! Lawrence's hot sauce is the best . I also loved how its been remodeled and new Sign!

4.description: They have a nice ramp to the main entrance and it's spacious inside. They have a large private parking lot and wheelchair accessible restrooms. Cool art inside. The outdoor seating by the river doesn't look wheelchair accessible because there are stairs to get down and the ground is only gravel. Ordered a half pound of fried oysters, half pound of fried scallops, and gumbo. They were out of shrimp and grits. Everything was smaller than we thought.  Mini scallops look like popcorn shrimp and were a little rubbery at times. Oysters were bigger but fishy. I like the oysters better but my sister liked the scallops more. Both were crispy and not salty, which I like. Gumbo tasted like tomato soup and was a little salty. The farthest table has a nice view of the river.

6.description: Called in my order and I spoke with a rude ass person by the name of Angela, I was craving this so bad but the westchester location was closed early due to problems with a fryer. Not a big deal but one thing for certain Angela needs a customer service course because she lacks it..

22.description: This place has a wide selection of sea food, most of it is deep fried, which can be a good thing, but, for a fried fish to be excellent, the fish has to be FRESH, and with my first bite of the shrimp and then my first bite of the catfish, the first thing I noticed is that this sea food may not be so fresh.It's ok though, the amount of salt in the shrimp and catfish made it hard to notice the lack of freshness with all the subsequent bites. Just have to get over that first, mildly repulsive bite. And get water, you'll be thirsty after. Upside is, it's open 24 hours a day.

15.description: Forget the unprofessional women you give you the stink eye upon entry. Focus on the $9 wasted  for a hard fried flavorless cod nugget dinner. I was extremely disappointed. I really thought this place was going to be delicious! But even my fries were hard and tasted like they made them 20mins ago. They have this "hot sauce" but it's not hot and it doesn't even taste like Chicago style mild sauce. I would've even considered returning if my fries were good, just to try another type of their fish but it all sucked so bad. Even the coleslaw

57.description: The only reason I even consider eating here is because they're open 24/7 & they have good french fries and fried mushrooms.  The fried shrimp is extremely over battered. Literally, when you bite into the shrimp all you taste is breaking. I have to peel the bread coating off just to eat the shrimp.I really don't understand what all the hype is about. Go to DiCola's if you want great fried shrimp.

20.description: I tried this place for the first time, like other reviewers I agree that yes it is open 24 hours, it looks nice and clean, but the food is horrible. I ordered the fried shrimp, catfish, gumbo, it was all terrible. The food looked good like in the pictures, but when I tasted it like one guy said, it didn't taste so fresh, I felt like it was a waste of my money because I was really hungry when I went here, I went for the first time in my life, and I won't be back. Everything isn't for everybody.

36.description: Not the Lawrence's we grew up with. The fish is over breaded. With that being said. The flavor is the lick! You can't beat it for a late night stop. It is refreshing however to see that they have put the money back into the business.

14.description: I will probably give them a 4.5 star.  They recently had some remodeling.  There are ample parking spots in their private parking lot.  They feature the handicap ramp and a nice patio for dining in when weather permits.They are currently running a groupon deal: $13 for 20, and groupon offers an additional 15 percent of you want to use on this deal.  As the result, I paid a little more than $11.  We've got a half-order of scallops, a half-order of large shrimps, corn fritters, and two (2) fountain pops and paid an extra $2 for the balance.  The orders took some time to make, so we waited for approximately ten (10) minutes.  If you order the dinners, it will take a shorter time.  Thus, keep that in mind if you're in a hurry.  The breading was firm and not at all crumbly, which was a good sign.  The seafood was juicy and fresh.  They offer unlimited cocktail sauce at the condiment table, unlike some other places, which will charge you for sauces (like Hagen's in Portage Park).  The corn fritters were delicious.  I like them more than the typical hush puppies that are normally offered at a seafood fry place.  I couldn't give them a perfect score because of the bathroom condition.  They needed some improvements, enough said.  Otherwise, it's a great spot and opens 24/7 with friendly service.  There's an ATM on site, but I believe they do take credit cards.

28.description: Ohhhhhh, I get it now, this place's real name is "New China Town Chop Suey" As everyone said, its a late night joint. I usually go there with a group after a night of drinking and fun. This is an intimate place with one waiter (be patient). The service is good and they are fast an efficient. Chinatown is a beautiful place but New China isn't.... the restaurant gets to the REAL business at hand....the eats. I like it, its simple. The place only takes cash because "the credit merchant is out of order" and has been like that for as long as I have been going there (over 7 years). When you go there I suggest: 1. You don't go there after the club closes if you don't want to wait for a table because that place gets packed. It happens to my friends and I all the time. We go after a night of drinking, dancing, and fun then we head over to New China for some good cheap eats...then they are packed to the gills. It is so packed that you see people practically standing and eating. Then we end up getting frustrated and eating next door, Three happiness....HUGE mistake. Three Happiness doesn't satisfy as good as New China will. 2. Bring cash. To keep your cost down...try the "over rice dishes" on the menu. 3. Try all or any of these items: Salt and Pepper pork Chops Clams in oyster sauce shrimp and scrambled eggs Salt and pepper shrimp w/o the shell BBQ pork fried rice Crab Rangoon Hong Kong Steak (expensive but goooooood) Chinese broccoli Go out of your way and try this hidden treasure and you will be thanking me.

1.description: This restaurant has opened for more than a year now and we walked by there multiple times when we were heading to other restaurants in Chinatown and never for once thought of dropping by here. The reason is that the sign looked like those restaurant catered more to either people who do not know what authentic Chinese food is, and it does not look very modern and most of the young people would not think of taking their friends here.After being told by a friend that this is the only Fujian-style restaurant in Chicago, we decided to drop by. It is actually surprisingly good. It is very authentic, really recommend any of the dishes in the first section of the manuals, those are all authentic street eats in the Fujian region of China.The taro cake is well cooked, not too oily, with a lot of taro inside (instead of just heavily battered, but not much stuffing). the battered had a bit of those chinese pepper salt on it, compliments the taro inside quite well.The rice noodle with oyster in there is quite good too.Despite the look of the restaurant, all the food there are quite authentic. Worth a visit!

9.description: Avoid this place like the plague unless you like overpriced, over fried, über salty food accompanied with "steamed" veggies that would be more at place on a raw veggie platter. The tea and rice were the only palatable items and for $15 (for two people getting the lunch special) that's truly unacceptable. I think their lunch special is just refried leftovers from yesterday's dinner menu. There are SO many other restaurants to chose from in the area. So chose one of those instead.

29.description: new china town chop suey?  what the heck is this place?!?  ohhh you mean new chinatown restaurant...MMMM...when I was young and didn't know any better, we all went to Seven Treasures after the 18+ parties.  now that we're old and wiser, we go to New Chinatown when we want some chinese food after clubbing.  Ray is the tall lanky dork in the glasses and white dress shirt black pants that's always serving during late night - good guy.With all that being said, their chinese food here is REALLY good.  and really cheap.  The mongolian beef, the beef tofu over rice, the beef stew over rice, the beef fried rice (do i see a trend here?), the salt and pepper pork chop, the chicken wings, SPOT ON for everything I've had here thus far.  I thought for a moment that I might be favorable to their food because I'm almost always drunk and really hungry and it's 5:30 in the morning, but the times i was sober I do remember the food still being really good.Chinatown is pretty shady late at night so do arrive with crew and park on cermak in plain sight.  If New Chinatown is too packed, there's always 3 Happiness next door and Emerald across the street, but New Chinatown is my first pick.

23.description: Here's the deal. Whether it is 2 am or 2 pm, if I suddenly get a craving for Chinese food, this place instantly comes to mind. They have the best veggie egg rolls, best pot stickers, the best fried rice, the best cashew chicken, the best beef and broccoli, the best hong kong steak, hands down. I have never had anything that I didn't like from this place. But enough about me, if you scroll through the following reviews, it is plain to see that there has been less than a handful of bad reviews. That should speak for itself! It's right off the Chinatown red line stop and the Cermak exit from the highway so it's easy to get to whether you're on public transit or in a car. NOTE: They do not take credit cards so make sure you have cash in hand!

5.description: Before coming here, I had never visited chinatown. My friend eats here a lot and told me I needed to try it. On the day that we went, I honestly was in no mood for Chinese food. With that being said, I devoured everything that we ordered. We ordered the beef fried rice, beef and broccoli and the short rib sizzling plate. ALL of the dishes were great. I am not sure what made it different from the Chinese food that I'm used to, but it was not the same. The flavors were awesome and the food was cooked perfectly. I even enjoyed the little girl who watched me eat my entire meal. I will definitely be going back.

31.description: I'm surprised more people haven't reviewed this place. Probably because no one really knows the actual name of the restaurant and it's mainly just referred to as "New Chinatown" by late-night regulars. Weird. Anyway, it may be out of nostalgia and years of coming here that I love this place so much, but I earnestly believe the food is that good. In general, I am not a big fan of Chinese food. Rarely do I choose to eat Chinese-- and when I have no other choice, rarely will I enjoy it. But I love the food here. The wonton soup is far better than the majority, the salt and pepper porkchops alone are worth the trek here, the beef chow fun (extra crispy as my friend always requests it) is so very good, and the Hong Kong-style fried rice is like a party in your mouth. And those are just the tried-and-true favorites. There is a vast world that awaits us.

25.description: I came to Chinatown after going out on black Wednesday. My friends and I planned on going to 3 Happiness (which I LOVE) but the wait was ridiculous so we decided to try out the identical looking place next door. This unfortunately was New China Town Chop Suey.. The waiter was confused from the moment we stepped foot into the place. It's not like the place was that busy but it took us about 40 minutes to get him to take our order, and once after, a shocking 1 hour to receive our food! (Water was served long after the food, after asking for the umpteenth time) Now, I wouldn't normally freak out about a long wait, but this is CHINATOWN. Chinatown is known for fast service and faster food. This place was so unorganized with the orders and the waiter was a complete ding dong. He served us the wrong appetizer and it somehow still made it's way onto our tab. The first dish that came out, came 15 minutes before the rest.. Just unacceptable. Now the food was okay.. I give it that. But just OKAY. Why come here when you can go to the many other late night Chinatown eateries nearby that won't have you begging for food and water?? Never will I ever step foot in this place again!

12.description: IT'S LATE AT NIGHT AND YOU WANT CHINESE FOOD.C H I N A T O W N.NEW CHINA TOWN CHOP SUEY!!! OK so, the place next door looks a lot more presentable.Well don't be fooled.  New Chinatown Chop Suey has way better food.Drunk or not...you won't be disappointed with the following dishes:-Schezwan Eggplant.-Salt n' Pepper Squid-Salt n' Pepper Pork-Oxtail-Beef Chow Mein, extra crispy-Ask for a fried egg on the side!LARGE PORTIONS. CHEAP. EFFIN' GOOD!!!!The Salt n Peppa dishes are both deep fried...and sooo good. Be careful eating the Salt n Pepper Pork as well as the Oxtail because there are a lot of bones left inside..  Definitely worth the trouble.The Schezwan Eggplant COULD PASS for a meat dish...EVEN IF YOU DO NOT LIKE EGGPLANT....TRY THIS DISH...otherwise the Schezwan Chicken is pretty good too!If you get a fried egg or three...be sure to ask for them to bring it out first....otherwise it will come DEAD LAST....after you are done eating.Cash Only.  Help yourself to some pop in the fridge.Open until 5am! Better tasting food than next door!

21.description: Hands down THE BEST General Tsao's chicken in the world.  Portions are ridiculously huge. A small soup can feed 4 people easy.  Very generous portions and everything I've had here is amazing.  Chow fun, fried rice, egg rolls, etc.... My favorite chinese restaurant in Chicago.

16.description: Steer clear! Under new managementThe menu, cook, and restaurant has changed! Food is horrible. Salt and pepper porkchop, S&P squid, and beef chow fun does not look and taste the same. The appetizers section has been removed. Prices are now marked up. Server does not have the same spunk as old man and the tall guy with glasses. Such sad news.

17.description: Were you partying, drunk, going crazy, etc... til 4am?Yes.Feel like delicious Chinese Food?Yes.Don't give two shits about food presentation and the interior of the restaurant?No.Then.. Yay! I'm a fan.What did I order? Duck Fried Rice; one of the only places I'm aware of that serves this.

10.description: CLOSED - Heard the owner hurt his arm and it's not opening again! Boo!

11.description: My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant since we were 19 years old and after 12 years, it hurts me to say that we will not be returning to the "new" New Chinatown.The food isn't the same and the prices have changed. The food we ordered was just awful. My Kung pao chicken was oily, unseasoned, flavor less and had more vegetables than chicken! My husbands orange chicken was completely different from what it used to be. The "orange sauce" was served on the side and was flavor less and the chicken was dry. I will always have wonderful memories of the "old" New Chinatown.

26.description: This place really hits the spot when it comes to finding a place to eat late at night.  Forget Ihop people its all about this place if you are hungry and looking for a delectable bite.  When I went there we had the Salt n' Pepper Pork Chops, Spicy Egg Plant (AMAZING!), Pork Dumplings, Beef with Noodles (I forget which one), Fried and White Rice and finally the greatest thing ever, glasses of free water.  I went there with some great company and it was a lot of fun.  The place was packed with people, and there was only one waiter who was all over the place and was on point when it came to timing for water refills.  The appearance of the establishment is like most late night eating restaurants, grimmmmmmmeeeeeeeee, but still it was satisfying just to sit down, talk and eat.  I would recommend this place to anyone who would like a late night meal that will satisfy you till you are about to explode.  The food is right to the point, fill my stomach and make me full.-Filipino Fury

27.description: Had a craving for some bad Chinese food last night at 11 with the gf and walked around Chinatown before giving this place a try.First Impression: Very hole-in-the-wall type restaurant. Similar to what you may see in China. The cheap linoleum flooring to the chairs. As dirty as it looks, it fits the restaurant well! 1/1 starFood: I had the beef & tomato rice (with added Egg) and my gf had the black pepper beef chow mein. The rice was TASTY TASTY!~ The beef was tender and the sauce wasn't too sweet. The way I like it! The chow mein wasn't bad, but they put way too much black pepper in. After a while, all I really tasted was black pepper! I'm guessing that can be a hit or miss dish. 1/2 starsDrinks: Didn't have one here, as they only had canned soda, bottle water and Arizona ice tea. But I will give them the star anyway for carrying Brisk Iced Tea! That's BRISK BABY! 1/1 starService: Definitely pretty weak sauce here. I asked him to recommend some rice boxes and he didn't seem too sure. Working in a restaurant, I'd think he should know at least what's popular and not. *sigh* I'm glad he didn't recommend anything anyway...I liked my Beef Tomato and Egg Rice! 0/1 star All in all, New Chinatown Restaurant wasn't what I would say Awesome, but it surely wasn't bad! I may have to come back for my $4.25 rice box!

35.description: Ahhh, new chinatown restaurant... there's only one time of day that i ever visit this place, and that's usually at the wee hours of the early morning after a night of dancing/drinking, before we go home to our warm beds...the food is not bad at all, especially when you're starving... we always get the salt and pepper shrimp (which is laced with lots of salt and msg, good when you're in the mood for that), salt and pepper pork (which i must warm, probably is composed of more batter than pork, but it's an acquired taste), the hong kong fried rice (good), beef chow fun (beef very tender), and sauteed veggies in garlic or bean curd sauce...this isn't a place you go to for service, half the time your waitstaff doesn't speak english very well (menu comes in handy to communicate/translate)the food is very affordable, but you must have cash (no credit card machine... sign says it's broken, but i think they've never had one in the first place :)this place really hits the spot when you need it!

8.description: No way in hell this place deserves anything above one star. It is edible, granted. If you're looking for something to just die in your stomach either from the amount of grease it is cooked in, or your own ulcerous digestive juices from years of mistreating your body, then just disregard the rest of the warnings to avoid this outhouse.My food was appalling, but seeing as I'm the adventurous type and fit into the latter category, I ate what I could. The soup, supposedly mushrooms and spice, smelled of urine. I'm not kidding. If Coco Chanel were stuck on a deserted island with only her soiled Depends and this soup to make a new scent and returned a year later to civilization, you and I would be buying celebrity piss to adorn ourselves. It would be the new black, to borrow a cliché.Everything was either burnt, refried^2, or plain crap.Don't. Patronize.I'll be sending them my dry cleaning bill for the any potential sharding incidents.

0.description: Fuzhou style food. We're all so close, my mom knows the owner. My family occasionally flies back to fuzhou almost every summer and I almost always crave the simple cooking style. Love it. The food is so comforting to me and this restaurant is quick with its service and won't bother you while you scarf down its food. Highly recommend the fried taro cake lol. That stuff is my life.

20.description: Don't look for the name Chop Suey anywhere on the door.We went after seeing Rush on Monday night.  It wasn't too hard to find except the name isn't what is listed here.  We actually went because it was suggested here on yelp as a good place for late night food.It was okay.  The pot stickers were right on.  The chop suey, eh.  As typical for this kind of place, no fountain drinks on bottles in the cooler, but all at better than gas station prices.  The server/cashier was nice but I'm not sure he spoke english.There were other places open, and busier, perhaps that should've been a sign to us to go somewhere else.  Oh, and they definitely don't take credit cards, so make sure you have some cash.  We ate for well under 20 bucks though so you don't need a lot of cash.Be expected to be approached by panhandlers when you go in, we got hit on the way in and on the way out.

19.description: It was 4AM, and at first. I was a bit apprehensive about eating at New China Town Chop Suey. But once I tried the food, I changed my mind. The salt n pepper squid used to be my favorite, (once I had the courage to try it) but my new favorite is the beef chow mein, extra crispy. I don't really even need the beef... the chow mein noodles and the sauce are REALLY great by themselves! The sauce is flavorful and not overly salty as some Chinese food can be.The portions are more than generous, and one dish will easily be enough for 2-3 people.

33.description: I've been eating at this restaurant for over 6 years and I had no idea this place was called New Chinatown Chop Suey! I always thought it was simply new Chinatown.Whatever the name maybe, they have the best egg drop soup and veg egg rolls in Chinatown. I've rarely tried anything else besides the egg rolls, egg drop soup and vegetarian fried rice. This was our favorite place to go at 2 am when I was in college and remains a favorite place whenever I'm craving Chinese food.The look of the restaurant is pretty basic, nothing trendy, hell, doesn't even feel clean half the time. They have a TV that is probably as old as I am with an antenna that wouldn't catch a signal if it was being transmitted from New Chinatown's kitchen! Oh and don't be shocked if homeless people come in (usually late at night) asking for change or get a can of pop!The waiters don't really speak English, especially the older guy and everytime my order comes out, I'm shocked to see that it is what I had ordered !It really is a fun experience to eat here late at night.Their credit card machine has been 'out of order' for years! I have paid with a card before, but not in the past couple of years - so make sure you have cash.Next time you're in Chinatown late at night, try New Chinatown for a cheap, quick and good Egg drop soup and Egg rolls!

2.description: Maybe their strategy for the restaurant's name is that if you are looking for something "new," they'll be in that mix? The current lack of a knowledgeable English speaker among their wait staff may be a challenge for some.The proximity in taste to Cantonese food was what attracted us. Not at all very tasty or well executed. Our simplest dish was Chinese broccoli in oyster sauce. It was cooked just right, but preparation of the stalks of the gai lonn did not aid in eating them. Each stalk was sliced in such a way that thwarted picking it up with fork or chopsticks! Quite an accomplishment. The meat-filled fish balls (3 per bowl) were about the size of a large matzoh ball, but a lot denser, which made them difficult to eat or divide (especially in the soup bowl). Our stir-fried green beans could have been very good, with slivers of garlic, ginger, and fried bacon in the mix. But for some reason, it was all overcooked. Some of the beans had become almost paper-like. Finally, we chose the stir-fried jelly fish, expecting that the main ingredient would be sliced into bands as we had eaten in other restaurants, but NCR's come whole, making them much more difficult to chew.Their name and location (just east of Little Three Happiness) should ensure they thrive, but there are much better choices in Chinatown for a similar menu.

34.description: Best LATE NIGHT chinese restaurant in the city! I have not set foot in this place earlier than 2am, nor would i need to with the abundance of great restaurants in chinatown. But when your after-clubbing crave does not call for gyros or polishes, this is the spot!Must haves include: hong-kong steak, hot+sour soup, salt+pepper squidAlso very tasty: potstickers, beef in oyster sauce, tofu in bean curd, fried chicken, wonton soup, curry chicken, and some clam dish in a black bean sauce

32.description: What makes this place so awesome is that you can come here after a night of clubbing/partying with friends to get some good Chinese food.  But be prepared, if you do come here around 5 amish on Fri or Sat, you might not be able to find a seat because it's packed! Their salt and pepper anything is good but I think the squid is my personal favorite.  Their hong kong steak, hot & sour soup, curry chicken and potstickers are delicious as well.  I've never had a dish here that I haven't liked!

18.description: Stopped here for take out at the end of an incredibly stressful night, at an ungodly late hour. I was amused when the little Asian grandmother staggered out in her night coat to prepare my meal. This place is in no way fancy, the Chinese equivalent of a greasy spoon all nighter. What this place lacks in splendor, it makes up for in interesting menu choices and gritty charm. I was feeling a little funky that early am, so I ordered the stir fried blue crab , my first time ordering the dish. I was more than pleased with my entree and thought it was great. I ordered a side of beef fried rice, I've had this fried rice in a dozen places, pretty typical but still very good. I think I just found the front runner in my search for a favorite place in Chinatown.

13.description: Open late for me and my date! :)Hole in the wall restaurant that's open late AND has a plethora of Chinese food items on the menu. We ordered the small wonton soup which was enough for two persons. The dish was filled with bok choy, at least 10 wontons, chop suey (red pork) and an opaque pork broth, topped with diced scallions. Are you drooling yet???? All combined together to become an amazingly soothing and fulfilling dish after a long night of dancing and drinking on the town. Honestly, I could say it's probably ranked in the upper 90th percentile as to how good this wonton soup was compared to others that I have tried.The crowd is mixed. There were blacks, mexicans and asians all in one area. The dining area is mall but you can combine tables if you have a larger party (as the group behind us had done for their party of 8 persons).Service was pretty practical of an Asian establishment. Server says hi, give us menus and tea, walks around, takes our order, pay at counter, leave and he might or might not say thank you and bye.Prices were INEXPENSIVE. I was expecting a tiny bowl of wonton soup but out came this motherload of wontons floating in broth. Sooooo worth the visit if you're hungry and it's late and south of the loop isn't too bothersome for you. I'll have to try something else tonight if dim sum isn't available. :DHIT IT!!!!!

4.description: This restaurant is now called New Chinatown Restaurant and has Northern style Chinese food in addition to their regular menu. My parents are from Northern China so they are always on the hunt for new restaurants that advertise as 'Northern' style. When we got here on a Sunday afternoon, we had low expectations since the restaurant is pretty dingy and a surly Chinese teenager was our waitress. However, we found the menu to be pretty expansive and the food was pretty authentic/homey mom cooked feeling! Also, the prices are extremely reasonable along with portion size. Will definitely be back to try out some other dishes!

24.description: good late night spot. i like how the same guy is there all the time, and knows us by face.

6.description: I ordered for delivery and the lady had us waiting for a hour and I called to check up on the order and she canceled it  horrible.

22.description: Stopped here for take out at the end of an incredibly stressful night, at an ungodly late hour. I was amused when the little Asian grandmother staggered out in her night coat to prepare my meal. This place is in no way fancy, the Chinese equivalent of a greasy spoon all nighter. What this place lacks in splendor, it makes up for in interesting menu choices and gritty charm. I was feeling a little funky that early am, so I ordered the stir fried blue crab , my first time ordering the dish. I was more than pleased with my entree and thought it was great. I ordered a side of beef fried rice, I've had this fried rice in a dozen places, pretty typical but still very good. I think I just found the front runner in my search for a favorite place in Chinatown.

15.description: ((rating is base on any other 4-5AM restaurant in Chicago)-=Décor=-Yeah, drop off your bougy taste of your ideal elegant dining at the door... Keep in mind it's 5:34AM and this restaurant is a hole in the wall. Please keep in mind that this spot has DA BEST Salt 'n Pepper Pork chops chinatown! Watch out, it's filled with chopped up bones! Everything on the menu is super cheap. Credit card machine has been out of order since 2002. So bring cash!-=Service=-If you see a young, tall asian guy with glasses in the white shirt, black pants and black gym shoes? Yeah that's Ray. I have no complaints about him at all... I want to give him five stars in LIVE! If you want any beverage of any kind, just stand up and get it your self. Water will come after the first dish is out or maybe not at all. Food comes up randomly. Someone could finish their food before you even get yours. Fried eggs will be last, you can count on it! You will also need to request a spoon, if you really need one.-=Food=-Drunk or sober, the Chinese food served here is always slammin' good and extremely cheap! I've listed a few items below that my friends and I would always order. We always make sure we do family style dining (we share our food). Like I said before, food will randomly come out, not in any order and at times really slow. So share! You'll thank me later. Everything I've ordered was on point and I've never had a disappointment when it comes to their food.Starters-Crab Rangoon-Wonton Noodle soupThe Recommended Dishes -Egg Foo Young-mongolian beef-Beef Tofu over Rice-Beef Stew over Rice-Schezwan Eggplant-Salt n' Pepper Squid-Salt n' Pepper Pork-Beef Chow MeinIdeal modifiers -Ask for extra crispy on any cho mein-Ask for a fried egg on the side!Remember to say greet to RAY! He is their one and only server, young guy with glasses in the white shirt.5AM on any given night? Don't feel like fast food or deal with a chain restaurant? Drunk? Long Night? HUNGRY?If so!? NEW CHINA TOWN CHOP SUEY is for YOU!!!

7.description: Best place to go to after the clubs close at 5am.... this was my dinner/breakfast place.  Here I am with old friends in 2004...but I went here in 2002, 2003, 2004, and a few times in 2005, and 2006...haven't been there in such a long time but the memories are still there.... with Brother Lee as my friend Brandon used to say...ahhh  those were the good ol' days when there were no responsibilities.  Here I am with my friend Judy to my right and Ben to my left...long time friends, fast food, good conversation, a place to connect!  I used to get pot stickers, shrimp with lobster sauce, and orange Chicken...  expect a hole in the wall because it is.  Give some of your food to the homeless outside, but ask first if they are hungry.  Never assume someone is hungry.  ENJOY the food!

36.description: One of my favorite late nite grub destinations!They are open from 5 pm to 5 am, this place is always packed with people after last call at the bars/clubs.The food is better than most late night joints.  If you and your friends are either 1. too tired to really figure out what to order or 2. too drunk to care what you're eating, I would recommend just ordering one of the family style menus.  fair warning, always order for the amount below the actual number of people in your group, otherwise you'll have so much food you won't know what to do with it.There really isn't much too look at, it's your basic hole in the wall chinese restaurant: tables, chairs, cooler with bottled beverages.  Don't get me wrong, it's clean enough but there really isn't much of an ambiance.  It's your basic, I want food, feed me and let me out type of place.Service can be spotty, as there is usually only one person working the front even when the place is packed.  They try and are courteous, but there is only so much one person can do on their own.Bring cash, if I remember correctly, they no longer accept credit cards.

30.description: All I have to say really - THE BEST salt and pepper pork chops and crab rangoon in chinatown!!!  And super cheap too, except their credit card machine has been out of order for years (why can't they just say "we don't accept credit cards"?). You have to come here without expectations of a fancy place or super awesome service, if you have dined in chinatown before than you should know what's up. The same young guy with glasses in the white shirt always serves us.  I have no complaints about him at all, nice guy, does his job, calmly handles the bums that come in, and does his best on his own when it's busy late night on the weekends.:) :) :) :)

3.description: This is the only FuZhou style cooking restaurant in the whole Midwest. Dishes are different than northern style cooking and similar to Cantonese cooking but more heavy on taste. They specialize on stir-fried seafood, Fuzhou fish ball, rice noodles, and fried taro cake. Staffs doesn't speak English well, but friendly. I learn many different Fuzhou traditional dishes by talking to staffs and customer there. More pictures on their menu or posted on wall will be a big help for a person like me do know much about Fuzhou style cooking. Dishes came out quickly and steamy hot, which is I love. Taste is on the heavy side for stir-fried, but rice noodle is great. I love the fact I can actually choose different kind of meat and seafood to put in there. Makes it interesting every time I have it. Definitely a new experience. Their price are very reasonable, and also serve American Chinese food.

14.description: Ohhhhhh, I get it now, this place's real name is "New China Town Chop Suey" As everyone said, its a late night joint. I usually go there with a group after a night of drinking and fun. This is an intimate place with one waiter (be patient). The service is good and they are fast an efficient. Chinatown is a beautiful place but New China isn't.... the restaurant gets to the REAL business at hand....the eats. I like it, its simple. The place only takes cash because "the credit merchant is out of order" and has been like that for as long as I have been going there (over 7 years). When you go there I suggest: 1. You don't go there after the club closes if you don't want to wait for a table because that place gets packed. It happens to my friends and I all the time. We go after a night of drinking, dancing, and fun then we head over to New China for some good cheap eats...then they are packed to the gills. It is so packed that you see people practically standing and eating. Then we end up getting frustrated and eating next door, Three happiness....HUGE mistake. Three Happiness doesn't satisfy as good as New China will. 2. Bring cash. To keep your cost down...try the "over rice dishes" on the menu. 3. Try all or any of these items: Salt and Pepper pork Chops Clams in oyster sauce shrimp and scrambled eggs Salt and pepper shrimp w/o the shell BBQ pork fried rice Crab Rangoon Hong Kong Steak (expensive but goooooood) Chinese broccoli Go out of your way and try this hidden treasure and you will be thanking me.

1.description: This tiny little Chinese grocery has a nice selection of Chinese ingredients, and a helpful staff if you're trying to cook Chinese cuisine.  Good choice in noodles, sauces, vegetables, and spices. Don't judge by size, they've got a lot of stuff shoehorned into this little corner shop, and it's not especially pretty.  In exchange for not having the Whole Foods overhead (and attitude) the prices are very good, though some of the stuff for sale here just isn't available in corporate chain supermarkets so there is no direct comparison.  Worth a trip for specific ingredients, also definitely worth a stop in if you're in Chinatown to eat at a nearby restaurant.

2.description: This grocery store is very affordable. I was shocked at the high quality and low price of much of their produce. Also, if - like me - you're used to shopping at Jewel and whole foods, you'll find the prices on their tea, dried mushrooms, peanuts, and other staples to be insanely low. They also have some cool stuff like dried octopus (although I didn't buy it because I'm a vegetarian).  As can be expected of a store this affordable, they didn't invest in the interior decor of the place (so I'm deducting one star for cleanliness/lighting/appearance). However, this is definitely a place to go if you're looking for affordable and quality groceries.

0.description: I happen to come here often - Why - because my mom is on this root vegetable kick that I don't know the American name of.  She makes this soup with it and requests that I specifically buy it from here because they have the best prices on it.  I can't really argue with that since we did go to probably every grocery store down on Wentworth and Archer.  There was even an older man that must be related to the owners here that helped me dig amongst the shavings to look at the other optional sizes to pick the ones I liked best to buy and take home with me.  He helped clean off some of the shavings, too.  Maybe, I'm a sucker for old people and appreciate however they want to be recognized as useful or helpful.  I don't even get that kind of service at Asian restaurants!  Plus, most Asian store staff people seem busy or annoyed when you talk with them.  The store seems to have other well priced vegetables although it's not a large selection.  They do sell other items that might be an occasional stock item like blue crabs, and other random things.  I'm sure I'll be back buying more of these root vegetables for my mom, and look forward to the shop people telling me that "dis good one" plant to buy.

3.description: Oh snap, I just got gyped! I go in to look for a cute little souvenir and the owner/cashier is all over me trying to say "hi" in every single Asian language in the known universe. With all her yapping in my ear, I can't focus and pick up what I thought was a pair of Mashimaro  hair bands. Wrong. It's not a pair, it's one hair tie. Who the hell sells one little hair tie by itself?? Apparently these guys do. I come back to ask for the other one and the woman wasn't as happy as she was the day before and says, "No Refunds." Lousy waste of time.

1.description: Cool little place. The people there are very helpful, just point at what you want hanging from the ceiling or wall and they will find it, somewhere, somehow. Also, they gave me an extra gift, dont know why, but I bought more than 20 bucks of stuff....Maybe the reason.Ride the water taxi down, way more fun than the CTA.

2.description: I think this is my favorite gift shop in Chinatown.  I could spend hours here.  My mom finds her good luck gold hanging ornaments here.  We have also picked up some jade pendants and other fun items.  I was amazed that after the guy at the World Journal Book Store off Archer told me that my mom's horoscope book that she wanted was out of stock everywhere in the US, we found it at this store only a few hours later.  They can also make some custom clothes as well.  I saw this super cute outfit that I want to get my niece.  If my mom is taking a while grocery shopping, this is where I'm sneaking off to!

5.description: Gosh..I just LOVE this place!!!!  They have the prettiest purses for cheap $$ and a big selection of chinese dresses!!  I bought a purse there a while back and have been getting compliments every time I bring it out!  This is just a fantastic shop to get gifts for your friends if you are looking for something different and if you are buget conscious.

6.description: Pretty amazing array of art, clothing, vases, pictures, etc. Browse this and the Oriental Art Imports next door for some great window shopping.

7.description: This is one of the COOLEST shops I have ever stepped foot into! They  have these pretty Chinese handbags, clothes, shoes, etc... They have almost EVERYTHING u can possibly need and want! The people who work there smile a lot and they have great customer service! If you're looking for miniature figurines, halter tops, heels, Bruce Lee figurines or anything Asian...check this place out! I guess the name says it all huh? It is called Chinatown Bazaar!!! 5 stars from me!

0.description: I was on a quest to buy an assortment of little Buddha statues for a party, to give out as party favors. At the Chinatown Bazaar, I found exactly what I was looking for. I picked out 20 little charmers which turned out to be a big hit with my guests and hopefully good luck all round.The woman who waited on me, told me I came in on a very lucky day.
