31.description: I finally booked an appointment with Norris after many recommendations and I am glad that I did.  I went in for a balayage and am very satisfied with the result.We finished right when the salon closed.  I really appreciated the fact that Norris and his staff took their time and didn't make me feel rushed so close to closing time.Norris is professional and made sure to always let me know what was happening when he had to walk away or his assistants had to step in.  The staff are top notch and very professional.

34.description: Just moved to the area, did a bunch of research to find a new hair salon--this place had a bunch of good reviews and, at about $30 per haircut, was in the right price range (not outrageously expensive like a lot of West Loop places, but not questionably cheap like big chains). Everyone at HQ was very friendly, including my stylist Ricky, but I was ultimately pretty disappointed with my cut. I was already a little nervous when he decided to blow dry my hair BEFORE cutting it (a tactic typically used only for curly hair--mine is very fine and mostly straight, so while he was cutting it my hair was all wispy; it was weird). And though I'd asked for at least a few inches off, he barely trimmed it. It seemed like he didn't really know how to style fine hair. Typically, when I get home from a salon, my hair looks better than any other time of the year (stylists typically work their magic to build some body and shine into my fine hair, even if it only lasts a day or two), but when I got home I thought it looked slightly worse than when I went in. About the same length but frizzier and limper. Felt like I paid $32+tip for something that Great Clips could have done for $10. Other reviewers have raved about Norris, so maybe he is the guy to see if you go here. However, I think I will keep looking for a different place.

16.description: Wanted to try something new and my hair was feeling limp. After reading reviews on YELP I had to pick Headquarters and check out the hype on Norris- the Edward Scissorhands of Chinatown. Who is this man? Why are so many people raving about his passionate haircuts? I want a passionate haircut! Made a reservation and came here on a Saturday afternoon. Place was packed up the wazoo with guys and girls who had the most  edgy hair cuts and colors. The girl who led me to get my hair washed was named Sophie. She was really sweet but very quiet. After washing and combing out my hair- I met Norris. The Norris. Norris is such an ideal stylist because the takes the time to get to know you and has so much fun cutting the hair. He comments on the music and really gets into the haircut itself. He is incredibly precise with his cutting techniques. He is also very down-to-earth and hilarious. I've never had so much fun getting my hair cut! I am incredibly satisfied with how my hair turned out and he even curled it for me- so I could go out later that night. He is even meticulous when applying hair spray- it was carefully misted on specific sections. I think it's safe to say I found a new stylist in Chinatown. The hype is for real- this man has talent and I suggest you book an appointment ASAP!!

13.description: Recently moved to Chicago from Boston so I had to find a new hair stylists. I have long layered hair that was in need of a trim to fix the dead ends. Also have color treated hair that was brassy and uneven do to a previous bad color job. Luckily I found headquarters through yelp! They are open everyday and are open late enough to accommodate me after work hours.Had an appointment with Ricky. He is a sweet and goofy guy and tries really hard to understand your needs. He gave me beautiful layers and fixed my color. All of the other staff were also super accommodating. Even though they were quite busy, Ricky would make sure to check in to see if I was doing alright. Price is also very reasonable and affordable. I paid $122 for cut, wash, single process color & a blowdry. Glad that I've found a new hair salon in Chicago. Will be coming back!

11.description: So, Norris is absolutely amazing. I came into the salon (he managed to fit me in an hour after I called) immediately following a long work trip. Totally exhausted and pissed off because the stylist that I had gone to (in another city) completely fried my hair which resulted in me having to cut off about a foot of hair. Anyway, Norris brilliantly colored and cut my hair so it was no longer the ugly mess that I was when I came it. Not to mention, my hair color was basically black when I came in and he brought it to a gorgeous deep brown with amazing blonde highlights. I couldn't be happier with the way it turned out. Also, the girl who washed my hair had magic fingers. The entire experience from start to finish was fantastic--everyone was so nice! I can't wait to go back, especially since the entire experience (wash, cut, color and highlights) only ran me $160 including the tip while my previous stylist would've ran me $300+. Thanks, Norris!

39.description: I have extremely thick, coarse and wavy hair. I have gone all over town, spent hundreds of dollars at fancy salons and am never quite satisfied with the way my hair looks. I am very specific about what I want and what works best for my hair and most of the higher end salons listen to you and then do what they think is best anyway and make you pay for something you did not ask for. NOT at Headquarters! I am surprised by some of the negative reviews because I have been coming here for over a year now and walk out with an amazing haircut every single time. I mostly go to Samson, who does exactly what I ask for and is great. I have been to someone else and they also did a wonderful job. I am in and out very quickly, never have a problem making an appointment and the price is unbelievable! Great place!!!

37.description: Come back for an update. Perm is not there anymore after one week. I normally get perm twice a year. Last perm was done last Christmas, Norris wrote back damage of my hair is due to my last perm, i can say this is worst perm product I have ever experienced, and blame others is just mean. Besides needy perms,Whole haircut is horrible, I just went to my usual salon get rescue.

0.description: Took my girlfriend here to get her hair cut and I must say this place is fantastic. First off they were very accommodating. Her hair stylist that day was Norris and he was so professional, not to mention his skills with the scissors were no joke.After 45 minutes that included hair washing then cutting, my girlfriend couldn't have been more pleased. She is normally finicky about her hair, but Norris laid all of her worries to rest, and afterwards, she couldn't have been more ecstatic. To anyone reading this review, they do a great job and I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a haircut.

38.description: Thank you so much for a wonderful hair color and hair cut Norris!!! Everyone was so kind and made sure I was taken care of. My experience there was amazing! Definitely recommend!

51.description: I've been coming to Headquarter Salon for the past four years, but this is the first time I've left a review. (Just not much of a Yelp reviewer kinda person.) I've always had my hair cut and styled by Norris and just received another haircut yesterday.The salon overall is very modern looking, comfortable, and equipped with everything you'd expect. All the stylists seem very passionate and knowledgable about their job. Norris, the owner, is absolutely fantastic and will give you a great experience and look. I usually do the japanese straightening perm here and this time I just did a relaxer so that my hair wouldn't be as flat or damaged. Norris listened to my concerns and what I wanted and offers great solutions.Some of the support staff (shampooers, etc) can be a little rough around the edges. One girl who flat ironed my hair before pulled at it way too hard and also burned me once, and I've had some shampooers who scratch at my scalp and have gotten water down my back... But Norris works to improve every aspect of the experience at his salon. I had a lovely shampooer yesterday who recently started working and made me feel absolutely pampered. He was very considerate and gentle while shampooing and blowdrying my hair.I especially recommend this place to asians with unique hair textures (like mine) and to everyone in general for a great haircut at a great price.Thanks again, Norris! See you next time.

27.description: I had a barber named Samson and he was great. Cut my hair nicely and efficiently with no time wasted. He was patient and professional. Would def come here again.

32.description: So I went back to this salon to get a haircut and to get my hair dyed.Overall, it was great.  I think that the reason for my bad experience back in February was because of how busy it was.Now I love my hair and it looks so much healthier than before.

54.description: A no nonsense salon. I decided to try out Chinatown and I needed a cut to get the hair out of my face and rid those split ends I keep picking at. Booking an appointment was really easy for Sunday afternoon. I showed up 15 minutes early thinking I would use that time to peruse some magazines, but I immediately get whisked away to the shampoo station. There was some disturbing hair color splatters on the walls next to the sinks as the entire salon is bright white and a lot of traffic going through for the smoke break, idk. A bit odd, but I'll just focus on the music videos playing on the TV screen.Usually, a stylist would chat a bit on a hair cut, beforehand, but I guess they do things fast here. I didn't speak mandarin, so the guy asked me a few key questions and he got working away. In the end, I liked my cut. Styling and styling products were kept to a minimal which I was hoping they would do more because I suck at styling my own hair and that's the salon experience, but it gets the job done and they have outstanding prices.

48.description: I was extremely disappointed with my last visit. The hairstylist literally left me scarred. Please see the photo. Other than the terrible service and painful experience from the hairstylist, the remaining  staff were attentive and welcoming.

44.description: Norris, he is very good stylish. I went to this salon in morning he make my hair very beautiful . He is so amazing.

24.description: I wish I lived in Chicago so that Norris could style my hair all the time!  I was traveling and needed my hair trimmed prior to a big event. Based on Yelp reviews and the fact it was open Sunday, I decided to come here. Fortunately a time was available when I called a few days ahead.  This place is in the Chinatown Plaza, so the address got the taxi driver very confused. Take the L or get dropped off at Archer and Cermak!  Staff and clientele are overwhelmingly Asian, and a few staff didn't speak much English.Norris was very busy putting finishing touches on multiple clients at the same time, while various assistants washed, dried, and colored; nonetheless, I felt that he was always supervising their work.  He has an eye for detail and did a gorgeous job of trimming my layered hair and offered a quick color (45 min). The dark reddish brown was very subtle but   perfect, and then Norris was back for finishing touches, all the while complimenting the "great cut" which he'd just given me. Cut was $32, color was $70.  Love my 'do! I'll definitely return next time I'm in Chicago.

7.description: My husband and I still come here to get our haircut every month. I see Samson and my husband sees Ricky. You can't go wrong with any of the stylists. We always get compliments on our hair too and it's very affordable. You can even get dim sum afterwards with the money you've saved :)

49.description: Went in for a trim the other day. A woman was complaining about her hair color taking too long which distracted Norris while he cut my hair. He cut it quickly so he could tend to the woman. The cut was ok, but not nearly as good as last time.

40.description: Entering a Chinatown hair salon gives me the heebies jeebies equivalent of having that six-month dental check-up.Unlike the usual sterile-screeching-of-instruments I get from my dentist, the hair cut experience is slightly better when it's masked by upbeat K-pop. There's an unspoken gross factor from both parties. I, the client who pops in sans-appointment with grizzly long unkempt hair, full of split ends. Do I condition? Not really. When was your last cut? Uh, a year or more ago? Hair guy wields his instruments to tame the aforementioned monstrosity. Of course, from the wash to the quick blowout, there's the residual rag-like-sweat smells from the wet neck pad I laid on while they're shampooing to the collection of other people's loose hairs on the brushes, combs, etc. Albeit they seemed to be on an endless rotation of customers, but shouldn't they do a time-out to properly sanitize? I am no fuss when it comes to my hair, but for my yearly trim (as I plan to grow my hair out for donation)... I would much rather shell out a little bit more, for at least a cleaner place elsewhere.

53.description: My daughter has been getting her hair cut by Norris for some time and it always looks super cute, so I decided to give Headquarter as well after my usual stylist took off for parts unknown.  I'm middle-aged and not Asian, so I felt a bit awkward in the salon but my hair looks great.  Norris is very meticulous and willing to work with your own style.

30.description: So, Norris is absolutely amazing. I came into the salon (he managed to fit me in an hour after I called) immediately following a long work trip. Totally exhausted and pissed off because the stylist that I had gone to (in another city) completely fried my hair which resulted in me having to cut off about a foot of hair. Anyway, Norris brilliantly colored and cut my hair so it was no longer the ugly mess that I was when I came it. Not to mention, my hair color was basically black when I came in and he brought it to a gorgeous deep brown with amazing blonde highlights. I couldn't be happier with the way it turned out. Also, the girl who washed my hair had magic fingers. The entire experience from start to finish was fantastic--everyone was so nice! I can't wait to go back, especially since the entire experience (wash, cut, color and highlights) only ran me $160 including the tip while my previous stylist would've ran me $300+. Thanks, Norris!

46.description: I went there got a excellent service from Norris i got exactly what I wanted the color came out amazing  and he was very friendly and patient I would highly recommend this place

1.description: No frills salon. Great, affordable haircuts.I've been going here every 2-3 months for almost three years. I've gotten a cut from almost everyone that works there - never a bad cut, just some that I like more than others. There can be a bit of a language barrier sometimes, but if you bring a picture, it's no big deal. My personal favorites are Ricky and Norris.My hair is extremely slick and straight, and over the years I've learned that cheap Chinatown haircuts work best for me because they get Asian hair. They're great with non-Asian hair as well!

55.description: I just got my hair done there and I must say they are the best place to get ombre done at. I am Caucasian and originally walked in and thought that I was going to get a bad coloring ... And I must say this is the best hair coloring I have ever got in my whole life and I get my hair done in Los Angeles and New York very often. BEST PLACE EVER

9.description: One word, "Margie"I've been going to HQ for about 5 months now & have been getting my hair cut by different stylist each visit. However, up until yesterday, Margie cut & styled my hair according to a picture I brought in. Hands down, the best cut I have ever experienced.Guys, If you want a quick, smooth, effortless cut, Ask for Margie!!!!Over all, the staff is friendly & super accommodating.

26.description: I've had two disappointing appointments with Norris (I know, surprising) so sadly I probably won't be going back for a third. While Norris is really nice and very willing to accommodate you, in my experience I was just never happy with the outcome of his work.First time I went: I asked for a dark brown hair color and my hair turned out a reddish black. It got lighter eventually over the course of a few months but it never was the color like in the picture I had asked for. Second experience: I asked for an ombré and a layered haircut. My ombré was done very unevenly and sloppily and it's not even a proper ombré. There are areas where the bleach touched separately from the ombré'd part so it looks striped. The color does not gradually change at all, there's just a harsh change from blonde to dark brown. As for my haircut I asked for a trim and extra layers but it was just a mediocre haircut. I've had neater/more thorough haircuts.I made the second appointment giving HeadQuarters a second chance and expecting a better outcome since the reviews were so great but unfortunately I was still as dissatisfied the second time as the first time around, especially for the huge amount of money I had to spend. I thought I would save myself from the risks involved with coloring my hair myself but in the end I would rather have done it myself anyway.

25.description: LADIES, LOCK UP YOUR LOVERS, YOUR BOYFRIENDS, AND HUSBANDS BECAUSE WHEN YOUR GIRL FRIEND WALKS OUT OF THIS SALON. YOU BETTER WATCH OUT. SHE GON TURN HEADS. Hahaha.WELL, I actually literally did, after walking out with my new haircut, guys were literally turning their heads and I got holla's and pickup lines.Ladies, watch out.Maybe the salon should have an ADVISORY WARNING.like a "WARNING, DO NOT PROCEED WITH HAIRCUT UNLESS YOUR READY FOR LOTS OF ATTENTION AND TO BE STARED AT"it's funny you think im be joking, but i'm notNorris cut my hair. That's probably why. I've heard he works like MAGIC. He's been cutting hair for ten years if I remember correctly. He knows what he's doing. He said he could do it with his eyes closed (jokingly of course). I challenged him, haha. But really, he is probably my go to hairdresser now. I don't typically get haircuts that often. I did three months ago, but I just wanted a change recently. Anyways, I love my new hair!Might I add that Norris is super sweet and funny!I realize that it might be harder to book him if there are positive reviewsbut, hey, i think he's already gotten plenty of rave reviews. And, I just have to share anyway!

12.description: Unfortunately after I got home and washed/dried my newly cut hair I realized that it was cut in a very layered style, which did not show the U shape I was looking for with a Blunt style. I only wear my hair straight (which it is naturally) and not in curls so this layered look looks messy unless I curl my hair- there is absolutely no shape to the hair. If I go back to recut though I will lose length in my hair. Otherwise Norris did a great job styling my hair at the end- I showed a photo of my previous haircut for maybe 15 seconds and in the end he got it pretty close! He curled my hair and spent time listening to me- I only spoke English so it is possible that there was a language barrier. I He was pretty fully booked and I asked for the appt the night before and got a lunchtime spot :)

59.description: Norris knows what he is doing! I trust him 100%! I always had a long hair and since spring is coming up, I wanted to cut my hair really short. I was afraid of changing my hair but man... Norris did an awesome job! I seriously loved my hair cut and color. I just showed him couple pictures and he did better than the picture. All of my friends loved what he did and I cannot wait to go back next time! Thank you Norris.

21.description: Incredible experience - I will definitely come back to Headquarters for all things hair-related. My hair came out exactly as I imagined; all I had to do was show Norris the picture I brought with me. Not only did Norris give me a beautiful natural balayage and flattering trim for half the price many other places charge ($125 for cut, Colorado , wash, and styling), the customer service was wonderful. Although I originally made an appointment for only a women's cut, Norris was nice enough to fit me in for color as well. He took his time and was attentive, friendly, and sincere with every guest I saw him work on. The rest of the staff was wonderful as well. 5 stars!

17.description: this is my first time and also it's my last time get hari cut in this place,i just moved from nyc to chicago with my wife couple weeks ago ,me and my wife looking some place to get a hair cut,i searched online that saw some good comments for this salon that's why i went to there,im going to try this place first and i can give some comments for my wife before she doing her japanese straight.hairstylist is called leo,he looks not that professional with his job,he suggest me dying my color when i told him i dont like to do that he looks not really happy,he used around 15 mins to finished my hair cut it seems like he just perfunctory wtih his job .i know it depends which hairstylist you get in most of hair salons ,but the quality is really different in here ,any way it's a terrible experience for me,i think i still need looking more place .hope you guys lucky

10.description: Norris is amazing and I go to him for all my hair problems  prices are reasonable and you don't pressured to buy unnecessary products or services that you didn't ask for -- I drive half an hour just to get coloring and cuts from him, totally worth every visit!!

5.description: I love this place!  Norris is a genius and always ensures that my hair is at its best.

3.description: This was my first time dyeing (bleaching) my hair.  They did a fantastic job - it looks great, and I'm getting tons of compliments.  Even though they had to bleach it five times to get it as light as I wanted, my hair is still soft, and reasonably undamaged.  A few major complaints, though:When I called ahead, I very clearly explained what I wanted, and I was given an estimate of 3 hours and $100.  It ended up taking 5 hours, and when I got there and had sat down, they told me it would probably cost $250.  Once they had finished bleaching it, they told me I should really do a treatment to minimize the damage - which would cost another $75.  When I declined, I was given a discount, and ended up paying $300 in the end.  They also bleached twice as much hair as I indicated. Again, it looks great, and they did a fantastic job.  If you have time and money, I would highly recommend them, though you should be careful about your requests being followed.--Anne

35.description: Samson did magic on my butchered haircut that I didn't think was fixable. Props to him and this salon. Don't get scared by the language barrier, the man knows what he is doing!

19.description: Entering a Chinatown hair salon gives me the heebies jeebies equivalent of having that six-month dental check-up.Unlike the usual sterile-screeching-of-instruments I get from my dentist, the hair cut experience is slightly better when it's masked by upbeat K-pop. There's an unspoken gross factor from both parties. I, the client who pops in sans-appointment with grizzly long unkempt hair, full of split ends. Do I condition? Not really. When was your last cut? Uh, a year or more ago? Hair guy wields his instruments to tame the aforementioned monstrosity. Of course, from the wash to the quick blowout, there's the residual rag-like-sweat smells from the wet neck pad I laid on while they're shampooing to the collection of other people's loose hairs on the brushes, combs, etc. Albeit they seemed to be on an endless rotation of customers, but shouldn't they do a time-out to properly sanitize? I am no fuss when it comes to my hair, but for my yearly trim (as I plan to grow my hair out for donation)... I would much rather shell out a little bit more, for at least a cleaner place elsewhere.

28.description: Let me just start off by saying that I live in St. Louis and I still get my haircuts here. I first decided to try out this place last fall while visiting a friend in Chicago after reading good reviews on Yelp. I booked an appointment with Norris since he seems to be highly recommended, and he did not disappoint. I vaguely explained to him what kind of haircut I wanted (to be honest I wasn't even sure, but this man is magic). Just watching him cut, you can just tell that he's experienced and confident in his work. He was focused and there was no hesitancy or doubt with every cut. Now I see Norris every time I'm in Chicago, which is about every 3 months or so (coincidence? I think not). I practically base my trips based on when I'm due for a haircut because I can no longer let anyone else in St. Louis touch my hair. I may have to move here eventually if this becomes unsustainable. You also get shampoo'ed first and the people who do that are great as well. I've been to some salons where they rush through the shampoo or are really rough with your hair/scalp, but I've had a really good experience with the people here. $32 w/o tip (you can tip on your card!), which is more than reasonable given the quality.

45.description: Norris always give me a great look.  What else is there to say? Best Salon in Chinatown.

33.description: Definitely the best haircut I've had in Chicago! I have been to many barbers here, but nobody compares to Norris. He's very detailed, has remarkable artistic vision, and he explains different aspects of your haircut very clearly. And he's super funny! Check him and the other stylists at Headquarters out!

43.description: Oops, I meant I LOVE (not hate)  focus on hair, not idle chit chat.  Regardless, 5 stars!

2.description: This used to be my favorite hair salon. Not anymore. The quality of the haircut you get is really inconsistent and largely depends on which hairstylist you get. Last night my boyfriend and I  stopped by after dinner to get our haircut, and both of us had a terrible experience.I'm trying to grow my hair out but really needed a good trimming to get better layers, shape, and volume. The hairstylist spent a total of maybe ~5 min cutting my hair and the proceeded to spend the next 30 min blowdrying my hair (and burning my scalp on several occasions). The end result was impressive, how can it not when the mass majority of time was spent styling my hair rather than cutting it? But unless you have time to give yourself a blow dry every morning, your hair will look disastrous. Because of the way she layered my hair (short on the outside and long inside), it would naturally flip out (a big NO-NO for me). I'm a low maintenance girl, and this was unacceptable and disappointing. I payed for a haircut, not for styling.My boyfriend's haircut was worse. He wanted to get his hair cut short, but leaving at least 2 inches (and this was communicated to his hairstylist). The hairstylist proceed to basically give him a buzzcut, leaving him only maybe 0.5-1 inch of hair. This is the kind of haircut you get at a $5 greatclips. He went to get a professional haircut, not to come out looking like he's about to sign up for the army!I think it's time for me to look for a better hair salon that can give more consistent results. Meanwhile, my advice to those that want to try this salon, ask for Norris (he's the best), and stay away from the other hairstylists!

18.description: I don't want to write this review b/c it is already very difficult to schedule an appointment with Norris! This is a hair salon in Chinatown and I've had pretty good luck with all of the stylists here. The reason I love Norris so much is primarily b/c he speaks English and he listens to feedback. Again, I think i've had 3 other people cut my hair there too and though they spoke limited English, they did a good job as well! Prices are very reasonable at $32.

41.description: I came into HeadQuarters last Friday at 6pm. I came here because it was one if not the only salons that stays open late and had great reviews. They took me in right away. I wasn't expecting to be attended my the lovely Norris since it was a last minute appointment, but I was! I initially came in to redo my highlights but Norris changed my mind and we went with a balayage. I absolutely loved my experience at HeadQuarters. I got a hair cut, root retouch and balayage which only took about 2 and a half hours. i was out by 8:30pm ready to enjoy my weekend. My other stylist took 4 hours on simple highlights.  Norris was so friendly and had great work ethic. he did most of the process but his assistant who are equally friendly and kind washed my hair and blow-dried it.  He is modest but knows he is good and makes you feel very comfortable in his chair. I would have trusted him with any hair style. I am looking forward to going back in a few months.

52.description: I went to HeadQuarter Salon for the first time to get a Japanese straight perm. Ricky did a great hair cut and he was very nice. However, the assistant needs to improve her shampoo & customer service skills. She shampooed my hair with her finger nails, not with the tip of her fingers (which was very uncomfortable) , and all the splashing made my face and back wet. If she was more friendly, it would have been easier to overlook   at least. As well, the bathroom was very dirty. It's too bad since the salon is so nice and clean...

50.description: I've heard only good things about this salon so I was looking forward to coming in and fixing my mediocre attempt at cutting my own hair. The place looks very nice and the people are friendly, but the haircut was really subpar. There was a chunk of unevenness on the right temple, a huge chunk of hair that just doesn't blend well, and pieces of hair sticking out. The entire top is slanted and the whole thing looks pretty choppy. The cut itself was really fast and I was in and out in less than 20 minutes, which would have been a plus had the cut been nicer.

4.description: Not going to lie, I had serious doubts about this place. Mainly because it could be cleaner (hair is all over the floor and just about everywhere here). But I came in with a picture and explained to Vincent how I wanted it cut since I don't part my hair in the center, and Vincent did a great job. I couldn't be happier with the cut its exactly what I wanted, I was in there for less than an hour and it came out to $32 for shampoo, cut, and blow dry.

6.description: Thank you, Norris, and your staff for being hospitable and making me feel welcomed today. I absolutely admired the blonde you styled for me! However, I feel that the two colors did not blend well, especially when I requested balayage. I was not lying when I said that I loved what you did for me, but when I came home and the curls you did for me faded a bit, I can clearly see how the two colors did not blend well. I am fond of the blonde you did for me and would definitely come back for touch-ups. Update: Thank you for being super patient with me and trying to perfect my hair!

22.description: This place is perfect for me. I usually don't know what I want to do with my hair. Johnny did a great job giving me a cut with little direction. I will definitely be going back.

15.description: Went here with my boyfriend so he can get a haircut when we first came there. the people seem like you don't belong there.  They give off this vibe like they don't want you there.  It's hard sometimes to find a good salon that cuts Asian hair properly so we thought why not because Chinatown is not that far from downtown Chicago near the loop so we thought hey let's give it a try. just didn't know that the people there were not friendly

57.description: I am sad. I really wanted to like my hair. Norris is so nice, so welcoming, and attentive, but my hair color is not what I wanted. I tried to convince myself to like the hints of orange but I just couldn't. It's been 2 weeks and I have not been able to tell myself that I am satisfied. I even had a friend ask why I bleached my hair orange. :(. Norris bleached my dark hair over two sessions, but it still came out with more hints of orange than the ash blonde that I came in to get. Sigh. I really wanted to like this place and my hair.  Norris still nice though. That counts for stars!

20.description: Made an appointment the day of with Norris, which was exciting! I'd heard a lot of great things about his hair-styling, and wanted to see for myself what the hype was about.Came in for an appointment at 4:30pm on a Friday, and Norris was incredibly sweet when starting on my hair. I made clear that I wanted my hair cut incredibly short, and I think this might have been a little nerve-wracking for Norris because he'd never cut my hair before. However, he was very patient with me. The appointment was supposed to take ~45 minutes, and I definitely went over. At one point, he was working on another person's haircut while also finishing mine, and I was impressed by how well he was managing everything. Norris himself was super sweet! He was very considerate, and didn't make me feel uncomfortable at any point, always checking in with me along the way.In the end, the quality of the haircut suffered a little, if only because a) Norris was rushed, b) as mentioned, he'd never done my hair before and c) I'd come in with long hair and wanted an incredibly short style by the end, which is already really difficult.The haircut itself was a little uneven in the end, upon further examination, and the length of the top is still too long and uneven. It doesn't look like a good hairstyle unless there's a lot of product in, and I'm not a fan of putting too much gel in my hair on a daily basis.Overall, it was a great experience, and I really loved my time there! Would definitely recommend and come back.

36.description: Recently moved to Chicago from Boston so I had to find a new hair stylists. I have long layered hair that was in need of a trim to fix the dead ends. Also have color treated hair that was brassy and uneven do to a previous bad color job. Luckily I found headquarters through yelp! They are open everyday and are open late enough to accommodate me after work hours.Had an appointment with Ricky. He is a sweet and goofy guy and tries really hard to understand your needs. He gave me beautiful layers and fixed my color. All of the other staff were also super accommodating. Even though they were quite busy, Ricky would make sure to check in to see if I was doing alright. Price is also very reasonable and affordable. I paid $122 for cut, wash, single process color & a blowdry. Glad that I've found a new hair salon in Chicago. Will be coming back!

14.description: I finally booked an appointment with Norris after many recommendations and I am glad that I did.  I went in for a balayage and am very satisfied with the result.We finished right when the salon closed.  I really appreciated the fact that Norris and his staff took their time and didn't make me feel rushed so close to closing time.Norris is professional and made sure to always let me know what was happening when he had to walk away or his assistants had to step in.  The staff are top notch and very professional.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: With all the options available for bubble tea in Chinatown, you'd think Kung Fu Tea would try and take an edge over any of them. Unfortunately, they don't and here's why:-Cash only!-Tastes about the same as anywhere elseOne redeeming quality is the boba - great consistency and flavor. I've only been here once, but if it's consistently good quality, it may be a good stop if I'm feeling non-fruity (boba freezes with fruits will always be best at Joy Yee's)

56.description: Being KFT lovers, travel-mates and I were ecstatic when our eyes laid upon a Kung Fu Tea here in Chicago. Atlanta KFT spoiled us with free wifi and credit card usage. Only con here? It's CASH only. Keep your ones for this establishment. No free wifi either. It's located on the second floor to the right of Chinatown Square. Like the location in Atlanta, drinks are customizable. You may choose your sugar level, ice or no ice, toppings, etc. I ordered a taro slush, less sweet, with no toppings. After a full meal at Lao Shanghai, I didn't want anything too heavy because we had dinner reservations later in the day. The taro slush was refreshing on a very hot summer day in Chicago. Service was fine. Plenty of seating options. Dessert cups and water bottles available for purchase.

29.description: Been here a few times and they gotten a little better from when they first opened, but still could use some work. The drinks still taste better from the New York Chinatown location.Got the coffee milk tea with less ice and got less drink. Customers that know what's up don't want to spend money on ice, but also don't want their drink shorted.Cash only is always suspicious. Overall, I would still go here once and a while, but there is more competition popping up in this plaza for real authentic bubble tea.

42.description: Been here too many times to NOT write a review.This is my go-to boba spot when I'm in the Chicago area. Although it is a chain, I still prefer Kung Fu Tea over it's neighbor, Joy Yee's. Nothing against Joy Yee's drinks, but Kung Fu Tea seems to be lighter and more tea-based, which I prefer. I also like that they have varying sizes in case I have the craving, but not the stomach room. You can customize your drink with whatever "topping" you want (boba, grass jelly, etc.), sugar level, and ice level. Their boba is nice and chewy with subtle sweetness, definitely meeting my standards. Some of my favorites are the kung fu milk tea (which is basically earl grey milk tea), kung fu green milk tea, and peach oolong tea (with actual peach pieces). The oreo milk tea is also pretty good and definitely different. The prices are reasonable, but keep in mind that it is a CASH ONLY establishment. They have food now too! I haven't tried the food but I need to eventually try their takoyaki and onigiri. It's a popular hangout spot for Asians and can get quite busy since they're open late, but the service tends to be fairly quick. Only downside might be their bathroom.

23.description: Inside looks nice and "hip". There are games you can play with your friends while sitting in the place. It has a decent size variety of drink. You can customize your drinks in terms of sweetness too. BUT I am disappointed with the service and wait time. Depending who you get, the cashier can be friendly or not so friendly. I usually wait 10-15 mins to get the order. You would think it would be faster with 3-4 people making drinks behind the counter. The drinks taste fine...the portion is a bit smaller compared to its competition in the area. I am not impressed. Will probably not visit this place on my own again unless I get dragged there by my friends.

47.description: Overall: average bubble tea that's worth getting if you're in the area but not worth a trip for. Also, cash only.Food: original milk tea. I ordered 50% and it was more sugary than I liked.King Fu Tea is decent. Not bad but not outstanding. I'm not a fan of super sugary drinks and found the milk tea to be slightly more sugary than I preferred, even at 50%. It'll satisfy cravings and lighten your wallet. Literally, they only accept cash. Not my favorite place but decent enough for bubble tea cravings.

8.description: This place reminded me of homeeee (aka Taiwan)! I am so glad that they can cater to the preferred sugar and ice levels! Taro milk green tea is amazing! Must try!

31.description: This is located conveniently in the middle of Chinatown in Chicago. I got some dimsum and then naturally was craving some boba after the fact. There are multiple boba locations in the plaza but this looked the most modern and promising. You have to climb up these spiral stairs and the shop will be right in front of the stairs. There were plenty of seating in the shop and you always know it's a legit place when they're playing jay chou. That's what's up. I got an early grey milk tea with pearls. I thought it was a perfect level of sweetness and the pearls were very chewy. I really enjoyed my drink. i wouldn't say it's the best boba I've ever had but it's definitely decent!

34.description: This is my go-to place for milk tea! While I can't speak on their other drinks because I've only had the milk tea, I love the customization they have here, especially how you can choose your own ice level. This is definitely the best place for milk tea in Chinatown.

16.description: It is a good addition to Chinatown/Chicago and a nice place to chill and talk since it open late until 12a.m. The people are quick and it gives you can choose sugar and ice levels. However, I am always a big fan of taro milk  tea and their isn't so great, it is too sweet. Also, I don't like how they only accept cash.

13.description: I heard from a friend that this was the place to go for good boba/milk tea. Being from so cal where there are a plethora of delicious boba joints, I didn't expect much from this place. I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered their Kung Fu Honey Tea. Since I got a hot drink, I decided to leave out the boba. The drink was heavenly (perfect for the 20 degree weather outside). It wasn't too sweet and was pretty different from what I'm used to in so cal. If you're a tourist and need a quick boba/tea fix, this is the place to go.

11.description: Hard pressed to find a similar spot like this (well, of course, uness you're in chinatown.)I love that this spot features TEA. Honey tea. Green tea. Oolong tea. And even other odds and ends drinks that usually aren't featured in other spots, like yogurt drinks. It's a cool, colorful, and vibrant vibe in the interior, along with modern seats.  They've got little lounging couches and jenga on a table. Erego, it attracts a younger crowd. The workers are young.  Clientele is young.  This place is open late, so I'm not surprised non-alcoholic wayfarers use this spot as a friday night option to safely spend time with some friends.but really. the cups? they're amazing.  They are so super secure and sturdy. I wish all spots were like this. I like that they also typically have a hot vs. cold option on nearly all their drinks. But here's my gripe.  Cash only.  Womp womb

39.description: I went there this weekend on Labor Day Monday with my girlfriend during our trip to Chicago for Labor Day weekend. On one of our previous trips, we went to Joy-Yee, which is another bubble tea place in chinatown, so we wanted to try a different place. We went there around 1 PM on a Monday and when we got there there was a long line out the door (probably because it was Labor Day). It took a while to make it to the front of the line. When we finally did we were told that they were out of bubbles (boba). This wasn't a big deal because I ordered the Mango Green tea which had mango jelly in it and my girlfriend ordered the regular milk tea and she didn't mind that it didn't have boba in it. I was still a little disappointing however because I did wanted to try out their boba and I wish they had told everyone in line that they were out before they got to the front.Although the wait for them to make our bubble tea took a while, we were able to sit down and wait. There are also board games to play like Jenga if you want to. The tea itself was good, and in my opinion one of the best in Chicago. There are a few things that are important to note when going here. First, they only take cash, so come prepared. Secondly, when making your choices on ice level and sugar level, make sure you are not going to change your mind because if you do, they won't be able to change your order, understandably. They forgot to put "less ice" on my girlfriend's tea, but since we noticed it right away and it was their mistake, they just wrote it in on the label and were able to make it the correct way. Last thing, they have really nice and clean bathrooms. It almost seems too nice given that it's just a bubble tea place, but clean bathrooms are always nice. Although you shouldn't just go here because of the clean bathroom, if you are looking for a bathroom in Chinatown, then you might as well come here and enjoy a bubble tea along the way.

37.description: I love coming to this place every time I'm in the area. My favorite drink is the Oolong milk tea with boba. This place is crowded most of the time but the line moves pretty fast.Their drinks cost about $4-5. They only accept cash so make sure you have enough cash before you go there.

0.description: Whenever I'm in Chinatown, I always try to drop by Kung Fu Tea for boba! It's a pretty open space with a good number of tables here for sitting and chatting. There are board games provided if you want to pass the time too (I've played a couple of rounds of connect four with friends here while waiting for drinks!). Kung Fu Tea also lets you customize the ice and sweetness levels of your drink, which is a huge plus.My favorite drink is the taro milk tea with boba, which ends up costing me $5.25. The coconut milk tea is also good, although slightly too rich/ creamy for my taste. The boba here are amazing- chewy and soft. If you are a little less adventurous, you can't go wrong with original milk tea. Also note that this place is cash only!

38.description: Line was out the door but moved pretty quickly. When we got to the register we were told they were out of boba. Kind of wish they had a sign or let people know so they won't have to wait until they order to find out. I've been to the locations in Evanston, New York, and Atlanta (I swear I'm not obsessed with this place) and the quality is pretty consistent but the other places take credit card above a certain $ while this location was cash only. We got the regular milk tea and mango green tea and both were pretty good as expected. I like that they ask you if you want less ice or sugar in your drink because at a lot of other bubble tea places it's not apparent that you can customize your drink. There's seating and tables inside and I can see it being a nice hang-out spot when it's not crazy busy. Also, their bathrooms are SO NICE, like much nicer than my bathroom at home. I was shocked since my standards for a nice public bathroom is no urine on the seat or unflushed business, but this place blew me away. Clean, new, and well-decorated. I know most people probably won't care about the quality of a place's bathroom, but it was a nice surprise after being in chinatown for half a day.

51.description: I had a positive experience at Kungfu tea. Their teas are on the pricey side, but then again, it is bubble tea. It's worth a try. They have tons of different choices including blended drinks, less sugar, less ice, etcetera. I would go again. I had the coconut milk tea with little sugar (30%), tapioca, and herbal jelly!

27.description: There bubble tea was really good. The texture was soft and chewy like they are suppose to be. I have been to some places and the texture just isn't right. There drinks are good and not as sweet as some places that I have been too. I always have to get some tapioca after hot pot. It was so yummy and filling.

32.description: Went here during the mid autumn festival celebrationThe line was out the door but my friends really wanted bubble tea so we stayed. Surprisingly it moved pretty quicklyThere is a lot of variety with food and drinksthere is also a handful of board games to play and just hang out.

54.description: We came here after some bad dim sum hoping to wash away the bad taste but it didn't.Observations:-this look like its a chain. everything is professionally listed. the cup has a sticker of your order.-the boba was little more cooked than other places which I liked. -cash only (I don't get by as this is a chain)the Good:- as it seemed like a chain, they have posters on what's their top 10. - they have the option to have less sugar in your drink.the Bad:- not sure if my drink actually had less sugar. it was honey flavored for a coconut milk tea. my order sticker on the cup said I wanted less sugar. - some items I would usually like at other places wasn't on the list (I didn't see thai milk tea or lychee flavored smoothie or popping boba options)

48.description: Love the variety of options! Order:KF green milk tea with red beansThe tea is on point. Service is fast. My favorite is the green milk tea with either regular boba or red bean. Most of the times I get it half sugar or less to feel a little bit more healthy. Other times I'm just craving sugar. The only downfall is that they only accept cash which can be a little inconvenient.

44.description: This one is not as good as the one in Philly. The bubbles are too soft....

24.description: Totally living for Kung Fun Tea! Such a chill spot after a long walk around Chinatown. If I lived closer to Chinatown this would be the spot where I would do my assignments. The customers are all typically Asian, which I love because it makes me feel like I have escaped Chicago for a few hours. I love the modern decor and the stylish people. Only downside is they only accept cash. However the teas are AMAZING! chilling, refreshing, sweet. They have some truly unique flavors as well. If you're looking for a bubble tea joint in Chicago, KFT is the place to be.

7.description: Went here during the mid autumn festival celebrationThe line was out the door but my friends really wanted bubble tea so we stayed. Surprisingly it moved pretty quicklyThere is a lot of variety with food and drinksthere is also a handful of board games to play and just hang out.

49.description: Stopped by after having some dim sum at a nearby Chinese restaurant. The oolong milk tea is reasonably good with a distinct flavor of oolong. Quite refreshing.The place is a little bit noisy, typically the Chinese chatting style. The music they play is soft and soothing. A good place to hang out and relax though.

40.description: Love me a classic milk tea and some solid pearls.

53.description: This is the first time I went here and boy was I impressed! You get to choose toppings, SUGAR LEVEL, and the list goes on. The biggest difference from this boba tea place vs. other is that you could choose how sweet you want it. The place is located upstairs of Chinatown. Decor is cute! Great place to hang out with your friends or rest your feet after a long day in Chinatown.

30.description: Surprisingly the banner advertisement of the place caught my eye, and so I thought I would go upstairs and check this place out. It's a pretty contemporary looking bubble tea shop. It doesn't necessarily beckon comfort to me, but more of a technology hot spot. There are quite a few options on the menu, and I decided on the hot coffee milk tea. I was disappointed that the hot option only comes in the large size so you also pay that size price which really sucks and felt wasteful for someone who just wanted to try it and just couldn't consume that much. It was ok, and I think I expected more coffee flavor. I think there are better options around.

46.description: Hard pressed to find a similar spot like this (well, of course, uness you're in chinatown.)I love that this spot features TEA. Honey tea. Green tea. Oolong tea. And even other odds and ends drinks that usually aren't featured in other spots, like yogurt drinks. It's a cool, colorful, and vibrant vibe in the interior, along with modern seats.  They've got little lounging couches and jenga on a table. Erego, it attracts a younger crowd. The workers are young.  Clientele is young.  This place is open late, so I'm not surprised non-alcoholic wayfarers use this spot as a friday night option to safely spend time with some friends.but really. the cups? they're amazing.  They are so super secure and sturdy. I wish all spots were like this. I like that they also typically have a hot vs. cold option on nearly all their drinks. But here's my gripe.  Cash only.  Womp womb

1.description: On days when the cravings for Boba hits, I am especially thankful for kung-fu tea. Their classic milk tea with Boba is great but I also enjoy their taro green tea. I am pretty impressed with the texture and taste of the boba in their drinks, they were just the right combo of soft and chewy. They are sweetened so my strategy is to go half sugar on the drink and get the sweetness of the boba to balance the drink out. I am also excited that they are rolling out Taiwanese food items. I cannot vouch for any of them since I've never tried them. This place is cash only so make sure you're prepared!

55.description: This place is located on the 2nd floor in Chinatown Square. I've had Kung Fu tea in New York which I enjoyed, but this place was really disappointing. I had the oolong peach tea which wasn't bad, but nothing special. My friend got the orange green tea and it honestly tasted like cold orange juice. I really think they don't put much effort into their product and rely on their name to bring them business. Just for some tips, there is seating in the shop and it seemed like a good place for people to sit and talk. Maybe their milk tea is better, but I won't know because I won't be coming back here for a second time.

9.description: Drinks are a bit too expensive. Went after the Chinese Lunar New Year parade so the place was pretty packed. Seats were all taken but we were able to grab a table after a group left. When I went to use the bathroom the horrible stench hit me pretty quickly. After someone came out from the women's bathroom she said that the toilet was not flushing which makes sense why it smelled so bad but still does not make it acceptable.

26.description: I came here after eating hot pot across the street. Stuffed, bloated, full of sodium, I was looking for something sweet. I had better expectations because it was pretty packed in here. I asked the cashier what the most popular drink was because the menu is a bit overwhelming. I decided to order the normal iced milk tea with bubbles. It was pretty good but nothing to rave about. I would give this place a second shot but I was a bit unimpressed with their 'best' drink.  Perhaps their sweeter milkshake like drinks are the way to go.

25.description: I was craving boba tea so hard during my trip in Chicago. There weren't many boba places in the city so my group lyfted here for some authentic boba. I don't know if it's because I was so deprived of boba but this place was really good. I got the milk tea with less sugar and it was just perfect. But then when I tried my husband's milk tea with regular sugar, I thought that was good too. So I ended up just sipping back and forth trying to decide which one I liked better, and lo and behold, I just ended up finishing both drinks!Of course I was not able to sleep that night... But totally worth it!

12.description: I was craving boba tea so hard during my trip in Chicago. There weren't many boba places in the city so my group lyfted here for some authentic boba. I don't know if it's because I was so deprived of boba but this place was really good. I got the milk tea with less sugar and it was just perfect. But then when I tried my husband's milk tea with regular sugar, I thought that was good too. So I ended up just sipping back and forth trying to decide which one I liked better, and lo and behold, I just ended up finishing both drinks!Of course I was not able to sleep that night... But totally worth it!

59.description: I basically get boba wherever and whenever. This is hands down the best boba shop in Chicago!Chicago Chinatown used to mainly specialize in smoothie bubble teas, so I am happy to see some new places with standard milk teas in their repertoire.  The menu is truly authentic with a wide selection of flavors ranging from original milk tea, to taro, to coffee milk. I have been very impressed by the quality of all their flavors. My favorite is the coffee milk tea, which is a blend of coffee and tea. Sounds gross, but is absolutely delicious. The boba pearls have a hint of honey sweetness to them and they are always fresh and chewy. My only qualm is it is CASH ONLY. WTF?!?! This is Chicago!! What place doesn't allow credit cards. Seriously annoyed that they have still been too cheap to get a credit card processor.

21.description: The opening of this Kung Fu tea was a true blessing to Chinatown! It is so good and a nice little atmosphere, there are usually people just hanging out or playing games here. The milk teas are so good - my personal favorite being the milk green tea with bubbles. The bubbles are the best bubbles I've ever had, because apparently they're infused with honey or something that makes them taste good in their own right. I know a lot of people also ask for half sugar or something, but I like it as is. Have never had to wait too long for it either which just adds to the glory. I usually want to order a second one to go even because I finish them so quickly.

17.description: If you love boba. Come here. Stay away from the fruit stuff since they use powder instead of fresh fruits. IE: strawberry. Lots of fobs and students come here in the evening so the general demographic is quite diverse. Service is so so but not a deal breaker - make sure you pay cash as they don't accept card.

10.description: Being KFT lovers, travel-mates and I were ecstatic when our eyes laid upon a Kung Fu Tea here in Chicago. Atlanta KFT spoiled us with free wifi and credit card usage. Only con here? It's CASH only. Keep your ones for this establishment. No free wifi either. It's located on the second floor to the right of Chinatown Square. Like the location in Atlanta, drinks are customizable. You may choose your sugar level, ice or no ice, toppings, etc. I ordered a taro slush, less sweet, with no toppings. After a full meal at Lao Shanghai, I didn't want anything too heavy because we had dinner reservations later in the day. The taro slush was refreshing on a very hot summer day in Chicago. Service was fine. Plenty of seating options. Dessert cups and water bottles available for purchase.

5.description: I've had the KungFu Tea chain in Philadelphia before. Without many options in Chicago, I would say this is the best boba place for milk tea options and they have egg pudding. My favorite drink is the honey oolong milk tea with boba and egg pudding.

3.description: I really love this place. Nice place to chill at and play games with friends. They have games for you guys to play such as Jenna and uno. There's also wifi here. Staff people are nice. I love the variety of their drinks. My sister and I got cookies n cream boba and green tea hot latte. They were both soo good!! My cousins had different drinks but I forgot what they got, they were good either way. Definitely want to try all the flavors here.Sometimes they do Instagram contests, you have a chance winning a drink or something. It's different every time.

35.description: A very small boba shop in the middle of Chinatown. $2 an hour to park on the street. Got a passion tea with lychee jelly and a milk tea. Passion tea tasted good, but the lychee wasn't sweet. Milk tea was okay. Tea was served within 3 min, which was nice. When we arrived, there was no popcorn chicken. Would have loved to try it.

19.description: This is a popular place despite it is on the second floor close the Zodiac square and cash-only. Really?I was referred to this place as "they have the real tea". I ignored my kids request to get the smoothies from Joy Yee and got them here to have the Strawberry milk smoothie. There was a line in front of me and almost all tables were occupied. One thing I really liked that they have options for size, amount of ice, and how much suger you want in your drink Clearly listed. So I quickly asked for a Taro milk tea (little suger and less ice) with red bean topping. And quitely asked only half suger for my kids's smoothies. I liked my drink as it not overly sugery and I could really taste the tea flavor. Guess I have another nice stop after my dinner at Chinatown.

28.description: This is definitely my only place to go for milk tea in Chicago area. I love KF Oolong milk tea w/ herbal jelly

45.description: I had a smooth and quick experience. Ordered an almond milk tea (which truly held to its name, and was delicious!) and Takoyaki (yes, they've got Street food!) around 1pm, which had the lines to the door. I got my order surprisingly fast when I expected to wait at least 10 minutes. The options Kung Fu Tea offers are plentiful from shakes to milk teas with additional customisable options to ice levels, sugar levels, and toppings. I've had bad experiences from KFT in Minneapolis of chalky drinks and sub par flavours, but have since enjoyed the KFT brand after a second chance. Definitely try them out compared to Joy Yee's!

33.description: I only visited on a Thursday night at 7:30pm and there was no line. The variety in "tea" based bubble teas were impressive. Don't come here if you're strictly looking for "fresh fruit" bubble tea/smoothies. The place is cash only and the many signs inside remind you of that.

43.description: After celebrating my parents' anniversary with a dim sum lunch, my family was looking for a place to grab some coffee and enjoy a beautiful sunny day in Chicago.  My cousin pointed us in the direction of Kung Fu Tea.  It sounds like they should have coffee, but they are more of a bubble tea place.  It took about half an hour (or longer - I lost track of time) to get 5 cups of coffee.  Needless to say, I was getting antsy.  Luckily, my family has sense of humor so there were no tantrums thrown.I haven't tested out how long it takes to get a bubble tea.  If I'm in the area, I might be willing to give them another chance.  We shall see...

2.description: Until more Taiwanese people see Chicago as a tech hub and bring with them their tasty trends and standards for said tastiness, we're stuck with Kung Fu tea which is probably the best of a mediocre lot in Chicago. I keep coming back for the roasted oolong milk tea which you really can't find anywhere else in the city. Often served cold but best warm with the boba on a frigid Chicago day.

18.description: I only visited on a Thursday night at 7:30pm and there was no line. The variety in "tea" based bubble teas were impressive. Don't come here if you're strictly looking for "fresh fruit" bubble tea/smoothies. The place is cash only and the many signs inside remind you of that.

41.description: The service here is extremely awful. I've never been to a restaurant that asked the customers to clear the table with  rather rude attitude and jeer. One star is even overvalued.

52.description: This is a popular place despite it is on the second floor close the Zodiac square and cash-only. Really?I was referred to this place as "they have the real tea". I ignored my kids request to get the smoothies from Joy Yee and got them here to have the Strawberry milk smoothie. There was a line in front of me and almost all tables were occupied. One thing I really liked that they have options for size, amount of ice, and how much suger you want in your drink Clearly listed. So I quickly asked for a Taro milk tea (little suger and less ice) with red bean topping. And quitely asked only half suger for my kids's smoothies. I liked my drink as it not overly sugery and I could really taste the tea flavor. Guess I have another nice stop after my dinner at Chinatown.

50.description: We love Kung Fu Tea! I haven't tried their locations in NYC but we always get the Kung Fu Bubble Milk Tea, with Green Tea. It's the perfect amount of sweetness and is always very refreshing! Last week, I was feeling adventurous so I got their Green Tea Yogurt, which is made from those little Asian yogurt drinks that I loved growing up, so this was perfect!!!! The Green Tea was very light but that just meant more yogurt drink taste! Next time, I think I will try the Orange Juice Yogurt. We love watching the machines vigorously shake our milk tea. Cash only so make sure you have some!

4.description: Totally living for Kung Fun Tea! Such a chill spot after a long walk around Chinatown. If I lived closer to Chinatown this would be the spot where I would do my assignments. The customers are all typically Asian, which I love because it makes me feel like I have escaped Chicago for a few hours. I love the modern decor and the stylish people. Only downside is they only accept cash. However the teas are AMAZING! chilling, refreshing, sweet. They have some truly unique flavors as well. If you're looking for a bubble tea joint in Chicago, KFT is the place to be.

6.description: Great space, great tea. An automatic stop when making your way for 22nd and Archer doings.

22.description: This cafe is located on the second floor of Chinatown square. Strengths: It's brightly lit and has comfortable seating to have a tea with friends . They also provide board games to pass the time . The Menu has a lot of good options like adjusting your sweetness and ice level. They also have a few appetizers (mostly fried). The tea drink options are good and the boba has a nice fresh  consistency. Areas of improvement :The place needs a better cleaning crew. I have tried this place three times and each time I have struggled to find a clean table . Service is not great, and you might have to wait 15-20 minutes for your drink.  The place needs more of a artsy touch, looks very much like a franchise. Although their tea options are good they don't have different options for boba.  Don't get the coffee ! It has a sludgy bitter / burnt taste and they won't steam your milk. They also don't have espressos. Don't get the chai tea milk it is not a traditional spicy chai it's more of a oolong tasting tea. Overall: It has a lot of potential for improvement but if you're craving bubble tea it's an okay place. If you're looking for coffee, Chinatown has better options.

15.description: I've come here a couple of times with friends and find that the bubble tea doesn't quite live up to the hype. Perhaps we have been spoiled too long by Joy yees bubble teas. Anyway, the best part about this place is really the ability to customize your drink and adjust the level of sugar, ice etc. This is really great for anyone watching sugar consumption. I usually order a jasmine green milk tea or honey green tea and the strength of the tea is off- I can't quite put my finger on it but it could be better.

57.description: This place is a good alternative to joy yee if you would like to get bubble tea. The selection is not as wide as joy yee as their main specialty is bubble tea. I tried both the taro milk tea and coconut milk tea. Both were added with bubbles for $0.50. Many other toppings, such as herbal jelly, nata jelly, mung beans, and red beans, are also available for the same price as well. You can also customize your drinks by choosing how much ice and level of sweet to suit your taste. The coconut milk tea was rich and tasted like coconut milk coming out of a can. I cannot say that I enjoy this beverage very much. The taro milk tea had a good taro flavor but it was a little too sweet for me to finish the entire drink. I might go for 70% sweetness next time. One downside to this store is that they only take cash.

20.description: Literally waiting 10 mins for bubble tea when it's not even busy. Are you kidding me? You've got to be kidding me.

36.description: I got golden oolong milk tea with bubbles and half sugar, but the drink wasn't sweet at all. The bubbles werent sweet either. Definitely not as good as the kung fu tea in Evanston. Very disappointed in this.

14.description: Stopped by after having some dim sum at a nearby Chinese restaurant. The oolong milk tea is reasonably good with a distinct flavor of oolong. Quite refreshing.The place is a little bit noisy, typically the Chinese chatting style. The music they play is soft and soothing. A good place to hang out and relax though.

58.description: Food was great but the service was disappointing. Waitress kept forgetting parts of our order and was very slow in attending to us.

56.description: My family and I enjoyed Connies, the Buffalo chicken is amazing with the house salad, the sampler was extraordinary! The wait staff is very polite. I'm going to keep coming in once a week IM IN LOVE!

29.description: Connies used to be really great. Something has happened to the staff or management because things have really changed....and not for the better. I have eaten here 3 times in the last 6 months. The food was bad every time. I really wanted to give them a chance which is why I kept coming back. The menu has changed, eggplant parm was served lukewarm. It almost tasted frozen, thawed and cooked. Last night I had their chicken marsala and it was covered in oil. I am not sure it was even olive oil. I used my napkin to dab the linguine, chicken and mushrooms to try to get rid of some of it. The oil was dripping off my fork all over everything. Honestly, it was disgusting. I told the manager, who is a fixture of the place, and to his credit he asked me if I wanted another meal - but by that point, it was too late, I was sick to my stomach. He said he told the kitchen to lay off the oil. Maybe they should just hang up the menu items and just serve pizza.

42.description: Went there to have deep dish pizza in a group of 8 with one of my friend from Hong Kong. The service from our waitress, Yolanda, was horrible. Liquid dripping from the ceiling and we ask for reseat. She told us she knew it was driping and took them half an hour to move us. Three of us ordered a cup of lemonade, coke, and dr. pepper. She brought us a jar of each kind without explaining and charge us 20+ dollars for the soda when only three of us order&want a "cup" of soda at the beginning. Keep arguing with us how it make sense with her pop philosophy rudely. Won'T go back there again with such customer service.

23.description: It's been over 6 months since I ordered a pizza from Connies. So I decided to give them another try. The last 3 I've ordered hasn't been the order I place. I should have checked before I left the restaurant. I called to tell them and they didn't seem to care. So all I can tell you is, go somewhere else.

47.description: There was a $15.00 special which included a large pizza, wings and a 2 liter pop. The pizza was fine. The wings another story. I never tried their wings before so this was the first time. I asked for an order of spicy wings but received plain wings. They were dry and chewy and hard to eat. I didn't know if it was supposed to have sauce or if it was dry rub. Granted that the special was a pretty good deal. But it was so busy that the lines were crazy. But if they're going to have the special offerings they should learn how to serve their customers. I don't know if I can give a good rating for the wings. Since I don't think they were good for the first time. Better go to Buffalo Wild Wings for real wings!

8.description: I loved the pizza. But all good things must come to an end. They ripped me off by giving me a coupon that looks free, but it really in small print said ONLY SEVEN DOLLARS.  I could take back my orders. They should care about students, not tip them off.

31.description: Great atmosphere. I am not a fan of Chicago thick crust. Thy have some thinner alternatives which are still the fluffy dough. I recommend the Sicilian rectangle margarita pizza.

34.description: I came here with my boyfriend for a date. It was very casual to fancy. The food was really delicious and I was really pleased. Every since, we have been coming here. This is one of our favorite Bridgeport's spots. I have never been disappointed though I have been here over a dozen times. Occasionally we would get a waitress that does not care at all but never a really rude one but what restaurant has waitresses who are sweet 100% of the time?Only thing I did not like is their menu did not have a huge selection but I always found something new I liked.

16.description: ive eaten food from connie's pizza for so many years.. either from company parties, friend gatherings, potlucks, and the list goes on..never understood the hype about this place.. i feel like they use way too much dough on their pizza and it is quite bland in taste.. the pastas and few other food items ive tried was just eh.. mind you the food here is also pretty pricey...there are just far too many more other places around the area that has better pizza and food for the fraction of their price..

13.description: My family took my parent's here for my father's 70th birthday. We could have went any where but Connie's has not great food service .I would recommend this restaurant to everyone and I drive from Joliet to come here! Lot's of great memories after Sox game's or dinner date with my wife Connie's is great and thank you for making my father Juan F Cepeda  feel secial on his day !

11.description: A solid Chicago staple. Their best food isn't their pizza, but it's the other items they have on the menu. Decent service, okay food, nice portions. You're not tasting the city's best, but you're not paying for it either.

39.description: This review would have been better if it wasn't for our server. We were a party of 14 and the server refused to separate the bill for the three family's; but finally by the end she separated it in at least two. When she started taking my order; I asked for a clean glass since mine had something floating in it, she just rolled her eyes away and took the next person's order. No acknowledgement to my request but more of an attitude towards me; why? I don't know. The others in my party noticed it, too. Someone else had to ask for a clean cup for me; later she brought two: one clean and one with stuck on dough (why didn't she check?)Because of her attitude; I asked the hostess at the front if they do mandatory tip on larger parties; her response was: "State of IL law does not require mandatory gratuity". I thought good: I personally didn't want to give her one for myself only. Just after that, the manager came by and asked if everything was ok, chatted with us and was very pleasant. The food was good; but again; the server was slow to serve; check on us, follow up and present our bill. Here's the kicker; she put mandatory gratuity on there. That honestly upset me. If everyone in my party wanted to put in for that; that's fine; but I personally don't think she deserved it just because there were so many of us there. I would like to reward good service and not feel forced to give just because a large family came in.

37.description: They should just stick w pizza. Sandwiches and pastas not so good. Happy to see it is always busy.

0.description: Great place to bring your family. My family and I have Been coming here since I was a little girl. I Absolutely love this place.We have had birthday party, My parents Anniversary, My Brothers rehearsal dinner. We have always received excellent service. And Great food. There's was either a male or female manager there. They are always so friendly and very helpfully planning your event and making sure everythingGoes well.

38.description: We have been going to this Connies since they opened.  We've been there when they are really busy and when they are slower and in the past they have always been a great place for our family to get together.  However the last few times we've gone there, the service has been absolutely TERRIBLE.  Normally I would direct the complaint to the server and just write it to off to the server having a bad day, but now its just becoming a consistent issue.  The last time we were there, we simply decided that this would be our last time. Sunday July 13th at 5:30 was the last time we will go this restaurant.  At 3:00pm I called to preorder our pizza to be ready at 5:30.  We like their pizza and really don't want to wait a half hour or so for the pizza to be ready.  We do this almost every time we come, so its not like its not an accepted process.  We arrived at 5:18, there were ample tables available, they didn't seem particularly busy -- we were early.  We sat at our table until 5:40 before the server even greeted us.  Needless to say the pizza was not ready -- it didn't arrive until after 6:00pm.  From the time we arrived (5:18) until 6:30 the server saw us twice.  We tried to get the attention of the other servers in the dining room, but could not get ANYONE to help us.  Finally a bus boy came and offered to get our server.  The server eventually came -- we asked her for a refill on our drinks, a box for the remaining pizza and the check.  She apologized for being busy -- which frankly did not seem to be the case, she was taking care of 3 tables max.  All of us at the table at one time or another have waited tables in the past -- 3 tables is NOT busy.  We were hoping that she would bring everything we asked for with her next stop so that we could get out of there quickly, and needless to say that did NOT happen.  We waited ANOTHER 30 minutes.  Then after receiving what we considered to be horrible service, the server came up to us one more time and said their POS system was slow and she was not able to print up a bill for us, we would have to wait even longer....  The experience could not have been worse.  The staff was well aware of how awful the service was, nothing was done to even try to make the experience better.  Normally I would simply chalk this up to the server having a bad day -- all of us at the table have at one point or another been servers and understand the challenges of that kind of job -- there was something way more than a bad day going on here.  And given that our experience over the last few visits have also been equally poor, it must be a restaurant issue and NOT a server issue.  We've loved coming to this restaurant for many many years and it saddens us that it has become what it has.  We will not be going there again.

51.description: This place was wonderful! I got here at 2 pm after the lunch crowd and before the dinner crowd so naturally we were sat right away with excellent waiter attention.  I had the lasagna- OMG! It was absolutely wonderful! It was huge and piled high with mozzarella and ricotta cheese. I have a very large appetite and had not eaten since six that morning so I was famished when I walked in. I could not finish it all! Honestly- the best lasagna I have ever eaten and I was raised in an Italian household with grandparents right from Italy. The sauce was unbelievable! The salad was a true Italian salad- with peppers, olives cheese and a variety of greens and other vegetables! The bread was warm and fresh. I can not say enough good things about this dining experience. I live in south Florida and I am always frustrated with the Italian food there- I can not understand why the Olive Garden is always so busy in my town (I guess old people love bland food). I was overjoyed to finally find a lasagna that I can call "SUPERB"! It is just a shame I had to go all the way to Chicago to find it. Connies Pizza has become my go to place whenever I am in town.

27.description: Wow, what a great space.  Who knew, I drove by this place so many times.  I enjoyed the deep dish pepperoni, it had great texture, crispy on the inside, enough sauce and chewy on the inside.  No wait on a friday night.  I prefer Giordano's but for the convenience and atmosphere, I like this place for a large group, especially if you're rolling 30 deep.
