32.description: ive eaten food from connie's pizza for so many years.. either from company parties, friend gatherings, potlucks, and the list goes on..never understood the hype about this place.. i feel like they use way too much dough on their pizza and it is quite bland in taste.. the pastas and few other food items ive tried was just eh.. mind you the food here is also pretty pricey...there are just far too many more other places around the area that has better pizza and food for the fraction of their price..

54.description: I been coming to Connie"s pizza over 25 years.   It used to have an excellent bar tender named ti I back In the day.  My mom loves it here because it bring her back memories of my father and sister.  When we come here we always order the minestrone soup French fries with house ranch.  Btw this is the best dressing I had ever tasted.  We also always order the fried calamari and of course the thick crust pizza half mushroom and half sauce.   Oh yeah who would forget desert we had this huge fired crust filled with ice cream bananas, strawberries chi lite dressing and whip cream of course we do not finish it not after eating all of this food.  Delicious

48.description: The Mussels were amazing.   The sauce can not be beat. Marco an exceptional server, spot on and very attentive.

44.description: We ate there for the white Sox game shuttle and had amazing pizza and fries as always. The awesome part is their driver Ken. We had an amazing ride home. He was nice, and polite, and is a great driver. Totally made up for the guy who drove us to the game. We will be asking for Ken next time!

24.description: Connie's has great pizza. But my recent experience with them was horrible. I literally live 13 minutes from the location, 2.6 miles to be exact but they would not deliver to me. Said I wasn't in their area, I just didn't understand it. Hopefully they expand their delivery area soon.

7.description: I ordered delivery. They said it would be an hour. It was just shy of an hour and a half. We got a small thin crust cheese pizza with ricotta and a Special deep dish. The thin crust cheese pizza was ok. Frozen dough? Almost no sauce. Bland and cardboard-y. The deep dish was good. Lots of cheesy goodness and the crust was soft and crisp at the same time. Sausage chunks were very large but veggie balance made that ok. The cannoli wasn't filled all the way - empty in the center. The green powder on the ends with chunks of shell make it look like there are a lot more pistachios than there are. I'd skip them. Cheap and not worth the calories. Go for the deep dish but leave the rest.

49.description: Been in town a week now and have had some great pie.   This was not one of them.  If anything I'd call this place basic. Had the pizza combo with a slice of special the the day.  Deep dish with pepperoni, sausage, and cheese.  Came with a side salad that was super tiny and a drink.  Pizza was just bland. Not gross or anything but not anything you'd crave. Pepperoni was very mild so maybe that's a plus? Sausage really was just salty and out of a bag  I'd guess.   Side salad was funny as the packet for the Ceasar dressing was enough to dress four salads of this size.  So in a pinch sure it's food and it won't gross you out.  But for my stars it's got to be more.

40.description: This was my first visit to the actual restaurant. I have had the frozen pizza and thought it was great but the hot, out the oven pizza was outstanding. My sister and I ordered two small so that we could sample a couple of them. I ordered the spicy sausage and cheese in the original crust. The crust was tender and buttery, the cheese was piled high and the spicy sausage was divine. My sister had the original crust with cheese, pepperoni and veggies and it was delish! Connie's Pizza makes Giordano's look like White Castle in comparison. Loved it and will be back!!!

53.description: So good!  Got some of this at the taste of Chicago!  Yum.

30.description: The best of mediocore pizza. If you're looking for a Chicago gem, i'd go elsewhere. They skimp out on the toppings, be sure to ask for double.They've been serving pizza for 50 years and their crust taste like its been out for that long too.

46.description: Chad was awesome! Took great care of us. Will definitely ask for him next time I come.

1.description: It's hit or miss. I recommend dining in, it's obvious that food for delivery/carry out is not prepared as well as what's being served in the restaurant. Tonight I ordered a large pan crust with spinach and a house salad for pick up. The pizza was undercooked. And spinach shouldn't even be a topping option if that's the way they serve it...Inedible. I wish I would have taken a photo because the amount of stringy, brown crap on that thing was ridiculous. Ended up throwing most of it away. The salad was just sad. Extremely minimal toppings...basically paid 8 bucks for a container of romaine. Step it up, Connie's! Whoever's managing needs to keep an eye on what they're sending out. Though I've had good experiences dining in, what I paid for tonight was unacceptable and I won't be back. Too many other consistent pizza spots in the area to chance it anymore.

55.description: I think I need to stop ordering from this place.  Seriously.  I love their chicken strips, but at $9.95 an order, that is just too pricey to have something go wrong with them.  Last time they left the garnish and ranch dressing part of the order out (something which they have done several times now), so they were nice enough to comp me two new orders of the chicken strips when I called and complained.  Thought that was very nice of them... however having taken advantage of that comp order tonight, I am sitting here looking at one half of one whole order left that is completely inedible.  Dried up, overcooked and with a burnt taste.  I don't care if it's free because they screwed up the order last time -- that is just not right.  I gave up on ordering the burgers years ago after time and time and time again having them arrive not cooked well as ordered.  Then I discovered the chicken strips and that became my go-to order.  But I'm pretty done with all of that now.  I hate to have to keep calling because they leave out the garnish and ranch -- and so I have not bothered to call several times and just dealt with it -- but it's part of the dish and part of what I'm paying for... and it's just food, NOT rocket science, for crying out loud.  I'd rather pay for food done right and delivered as ordered than have to keep calling and complaining and ending up with free food.  Comping a customer who was done wrong and is unhappy is great... but useless when the comped food is wrong as well.

9.description: Visiting Chicago again and wanted to try the style Connie's offers. Connie's offers thicker, fluffy crust vs. the thinner, buttery style with more "stuff". It was so different and confusing that I forgot my wallet there--but more on that later. Our big salad to share looked good and even had delicious artichoke hearts in it, but was pretty drowned in the dressing. Sorry for those who had to eat that bottom third. Ordered two "legendary" deep dish pizzas. Despite all the sausage and pepperoni we had on our pizzas, I didn't find the pizzas to be too salty. I hate when sausage is so salty that it just overtakes the other toppings. Dough is chewy and soft. I thoroughly enjoyed my pie, really, although I think I truly craaaave the thin, buttery crust style more.As with any deep dish pie, be prepared to fork over that guap to try this novelty. Also, I saw the server plate and serve slices at every table but ours. Hmph!Oh, and about my wallet, it was never recovered. Pretty sure the shady-looking bussing staff made off with it. I should have checked the dumpster out back.

26.description: The pizza was great. Our server was also wonderful, her name was Anareli. The manager's name was Edgar and he gave us a hard time about removing a 3 dollar charge for jalapeños off our order. I found that despicable and that is why I took a star off. We had a super pizza it was delicious. The calamari  was a bit salty. Their Mango sangria is great.

25.description: Had such an amazing time with family and friends here tonight I gotta make sure to come back everytime I'm I'm town. Service was great, food was excellent, and the manager was a great guy came up to you and made sure you were having a great time. Love everything about this place

12.description: I am a big fan of thin crust pizza. Connie's thin crust pizza isn't thin at all. It's like a pan pizza.

59.description: I ordered delivery. They said it would be an hour. It was just shy of an hour and a half. We got a small thin crust cheese pizza with ricotta and a Special deep dish. The thin crust cheese pizza was ok. Frozen dough? Almost no sauce. Bland and cardboard-y. The deep dish was good. Lots of cheesy goodness and the crust was soft and crisp at the same time. Sausage chunks were very large but veggie balance made that ok. The cannoli wasn't filled all the way - empty in the center. The green powder on the ends with chunks of shell make it look like there are a lot more pistachios than there are. I'd skip them. Cheap and not worth the calories. Go for the deep dish but leave the rest.

21.description: Horrible, horrible service. The waitress had a frown the whole time, was absent more than necessary, brought us the wrong pizza and didn't apologize for making us wait, then snapped the credit card out of my hand with a grimace and without my permission. The food was over-priced and not fresh. With the price we paid we should've had much more and much fresher ingredients. Never going back.

17.description: First off the atmosphere was great second service was good and food was okay !!it really bather me  the we were seated by and ice Machine it was so noisey we can even conversate they really should take table out of their!!!!!!!!!!! I will not coming to this restaurant anytime soon

10.description: Had a delivery of deep dish. Arrived warm and was well made. The crust on this style of deep dish is my favorite. I actually prefer this pizza left over the next day out of the toaster oven!A great choice for good ol' pizza

5.description: I just dined here. I ordered the rigatoni in marinara sauce for my entrée and it was really good. The salad that came with it was fantastic. It comes with tasty crouton strips. The bread is always fresh and delicious as well. Our waitress Grace was friendly and did a great job. The manager always stops by to say hello and makes you feel like a regular.

3.description: Really good Italian food at reasonable prices. Only bad thing is that they are pretty busy in the evenings on the weekends, so you will wait about 20 - 30 minutes without a reservation for a table. The interior is really trendy and authentic and you'll see different sections of seating, but all areas are great. Noise level is pretty high most times, especially when they are really busy. But the entrées are really delicious and you'll most likely bring home part of your order. They have a big parking lot so you won't have trouble finding a spot, but you most likely not get a good spot close to the doors since there is only one exit/entrance. A link to their site: conniespizza.com

35.description: Food is decent, went here for lunch with my dad during the week and sat outside. They have a nice large out door seating area that was covered so we weren't too hot. Ordered pizza, salad and some wings. Wings were just ok, but the pizza was good! Service was also good.

19.description: I came here with my boyfriend for a date. It was very casual to fancy. The food was really delicious and I was really pleased. Every since, we have been coming here. This is one of our favorite Bridgeport's spots. I have never been disappointed though I have been here over a dozen times. Occasionally we would get a waitress that does not care at all but never a really rude one but what restaurant has waitresses who are sweet 100% of the time?Only thing I did not like is their menu did not have a huge selection but I always found something new I liked.

28.description: So, I guess that we are unable to order pizza to be delivered to our address after 9pm. I ordered and fifteen minutes later they called back to let me know that they don't deliver.The pizza is still by far the best in Chicago (we actually love the thin crust).  We visit their Archer Ave location when we want to go out for pizza.

45.description: FYI make sure to check in on YELP when you arrive .  I made the error of paying for my  carry out order and then checking in.  By then it was too late to use the coupon code. My only complaint would be that I was told 30 minutes and the order was closer to 45-50 minutes.  But as always the food was excellent!! Had the cheese and sausage middleweight with an antipasto salad with house dressing.

33.description: Hanging with the family on the porch waiting for the pizza. Once arrived we dove in with love and love. The buffalo sause went perfect with the fresh veges the chicken the pizza. The buffalo ssuse is buttery with the perfect mix with heat. If you want the perfect mix of oohiegooie delish pizza and all the extras. Call now! You won't be disappointed.

43.description: I am rating this a 3 star because of an employee names Mariel (not sure if I'm spelling it right). Her zero enthusiasm and zero knowledge of the menu made it very difficult for me to place a order via phone or to try something new. Food was great though like usual!!

2.description: Something has changed since I last reviewed in 2009. Their pizza sans cheese actually has flavor now. I get the vegetarian one on thin crust. It is one of the special pizzas.I go about once a month with some coworkers. The other vegan usually gets a salad because he is healthy. You could also get pasta here if you are vegan.They have $5 glasses of wine on Wednesday, which I like as well! Makes up for the limited vegan choices.I prefer Kitchen 17 and dimos for vegan pizza, but if your friends from out of town want Connie's, you have a few choices.

18.description: We come to Connies often, usually the service is great but today we had the worst service. Our waitresses name was Cindy, I'm assuming she's new. Upon arriving we were sat right away, which was good. But when we got to our table our waitresses came and said she would be right with us and we didn't see her again for almost 10 minutes. We got our waters and she took our order. Our salad and soup came out first, and then our entrees came about 5 minutes later.Before our appetizers, the food was delicious as always. But the service sucked!

41.description: We sat outside because the weather was excellent. However, the interior is very serene and next time I go back, is where I am going to sit and dine. Ordered the deep dish pizza with spicy sausage, bacon, spinach and roasted red peppers. It was delicious! The calamari was ok, a bit too rubbery of a texture. The ceasar salad was excellent and what can I say about the dessert! It was a sundae which was composed of vanilla ice cream with chunks of chocolate brownies and bananas and cut up strawberries supported by a delicious, crunchy churro. Enjoy!

52.description: Worst customer service ever!!! This was my first time and will never go again. I heard a lot of people saying how good their pizza/food taste so I want to give it a try to take my family there for a birthday celebration. I know it's weekend so I called ahead to try to make reservation. Unfortunately they said they don't take any more reservation but they accept walk in. So I got there around 6ish the hostess told us will be about 1 hour 30 mins to 2 hours wait. Inside waiting area was completely pack so we step outside waiting area with chairs where we can wait for our tables. Once in a while I see the staff come outside to call names. 1 hour pass still didn't hear our name call yet so I went inside to check how much longer. I mean I asked them very nicely and the answer I got is "we called your name few times and you're not here" I said we never hear our name call and we've been waiting outside in the waiting area for an hour. One of your staff came outside and call for a party but that's not our  name and now you gave our tables away. And we have to wait again. Manager came out and argue with me that they call us but no answer. I said we were waiting outside where most of the people waits and you claim no one is outside. What kind of bullshit is this. They don't even apologize for anything so I left without even get a table. My first experience and will be my last experience with them. Bottle line if you don't know anyone working there as manager or anything don't bother. Because they don't give a sh1t about you.

50.description: Visiting Chicago again and wanted to try the style Connie's offers. Connie's offers thicker, fluffy crust vs. the thinner, buttery style with more "stuff". It was so different and confusing that I forgot my wallet there--but more on that later. Our big salad to share looked good and even had delicious artichoke hearts in it, but was pretty drowned in the dressing. Sorry for those who had to eat that bottom third. Ordered two "legendary" deep dish pizzas. Despite all the sausage and pepperoni we had on our pizzas, I didn't find the pizzas to be too salty. I hate when sausage is so salty that it just overtakes the other toppings. Dough is chewy and soft. I thoroughly enjoyed my pie, really, although I think I truly craaaave the thin, buttery crust style more.As with any deep dish pie, be prepared to fork over that guap to try this novelty. Also, I saw the server plate and serve slices at every table but ours. Hmph!Oh, and about my wallet, it was never recovered. Pretty sure the shady-looking bussing staff made off with it. I should have checked the dumpster out back.

4.description: The pizza was great and so was the service. Made reservations and as soon as we got there we were seated with no wait. Highly recommend there cheese fries as an appetizer.

6.description: We had not been here in a long time and I am so glad we finally made it back. Connie's was a staple in my younger days. I am so glad it has not changed a bit. Service was friendly. Prices are fair, pizza and appetizers are so very good. Wine is reasonably priced as are draft beers. Plus they still have the "Connie's bread". I think it is a sourdough bread from Turano Bakery in Berwyn and it might be one of the best breads ever.Family friendly. There are a few outdoor tables in season.Free parking in lot.

22.description: There delivery sucks!!!! They made me drive to a different location to get my food, like wtf is that all about! After I gave them directions, the guys were giving me attitude. They are really unprofessional and I am never ordering from them again!! They suck!

15.description: I placed an order online to be delivered and 15 minutes after I placed my order they call me to tell me they can't deliver because it's not in their zone. My question is why can't they let me know that once I placed my order or when I put in my address. Horrible customer service!

57.description: Overrated pizza. The delivery drivers blow through Bridgeport blowing stop signs and red lights like they are in a Fire Truck. I have eaten here about 20 times and never had a great experience. I never actually met Connie either. Domestic Beers $4.50 plus tax. So basically 5 dollars for a 12 oz Domestic Beer. Outrageous!

20.description: We come to Connies often, usually the service is great but today we had the worst service. Our waitresses name was Cindy, I'm assuming she's new. Upon arriving we were sat right away, which was good. But when we got to our table our waitresses came and said she would be right with us and we didn't see her again for almost 10 minutes. We got our waters and she took our order. Our salad and soup came out first, and then our entrees came about 5 minutes later.Before our appetizers, the food was delicious as always. But the service sucked!

36.description: Coming to Chicago each time, I always plan a visit. And why wouldn't i?!  They have amazing pizza, very interesting building, and just a fun environment. The $5.00 off $20.00 deal I think is a ripoff. They mark up the menu item things and put a higher price on your food, then take $5.00 off.  I'm not 100% sure that is what they do, but when I got my bill, that seemed to be the case. I was in a hurry and really enjoyed the pizza. Otherwise I may have argued.

14.description: Been in town a week now and have had some great pie.   This was not one of them.  If anything I'd call this place basic. Had the pizza combo with a slice of special the the day.  Deep dish with pepperoni, sausage, and cheese.  Came with a side salad that was super tiny and a drink.  Pizza was just bland. Not gross or anything but not anything you'd crave. Pepperoni was very mild so maybe that's a plus? Sausage really was just salty and out of a bag  I'd guess.   Side salad was funny as the packet for the Ceasar dressing was enough to dress four salads of this size.  So in a pinch sure it's food and it won't gross you out.  But for my stars it's got to be more.

58.description: Average food at average prices. Not a bad place to stop by if other restaurants in Chinatown Square get too full but if you go through the trouble of trying to find parking in this area, there are better choices available. If this wasn't located in Chinatown Square, I might bump it up .5 or maybe even 1-star but the quality of food in this area has gotten better and to remain competitive it's necessary to offer both delicious and wonderfully presented food.Drinks (teas, smoothies, etc.) - Similar to non-specialty places (like Joy Yee's) in Chinatown.Ong choy - Vegetables are fresh but the dish could have been more flavorfulChef special combination ramen - Pretty good ramen with nice noodles.Lemongrass chicken wings - nice large wings and crispy but the flavor didn't stand outBaked pork chop over Portuguese sauce - I wasn't a fan of the flavor but it wasn't done poorly either. I prefer the Chi Cafe version more.Fish fillet with chinese vegetables - Didn't like this dish -- wasn't a fan of the flavor choices.Walnut shrimp - Good size shrimp with a nice texture.Chef Special Pork Neck Meat - One of the better pork neck dishes I've had in the midwest. Good texture and flavor with a good amount of meat. This is the only dish that stood out in my mind.This restaurant has a very good location since it sits in one of the entrance/exit spots in the square but the lack of consistency in quality among dishes prevents it from being rated any higher. It would probably be better to offer fewer choices but consistently provide quality at 4, 4, 4 instead of 4, 3, 5 for the dishes.

56.description: It was cold last Saturday and with me being pregnant,  I was craving for some hot pot.I usually make it by myself,  but hey, I was freaking tired that day. So I asked hubby to go out and eat hot pot. The regular place (where we always go) was 40 minutes wait, so hubby decided to try my place instead. The sign was promising, $16 something for all you can eat hotpot, and I was okay, bring it on!! (Being pregnant makes you eat like a pig)BUT!!!!!!!! This place is certainly not a good place to get hotpot. The broth tasted blah. We got half spicy and half not spicy. The spicy broth looked promising,  I meant it looked spicy because it has chili and all that spicy thing, but it didnt taste spicy at all. The not spicy broth tasted like water, literally taste bland. Yes they did give us some condiments sauce, but it didn't help at all. As most chef say, a little salt and pepper makes food taste much better.Then come to the ordering the hotpot stuff. They gave you paper and you check which food you want to have (tofu, beef, lettuce, pork blood, etc). We ordered shrimp, fatty beef, tofu,  fish tofu, lettuce, mushroom, clam and scallop (extra $3 for clam and scallop).When the stuff came, my husband definitely knew that it wasn't what we ordered. So we asked the waitress. She explained it in mandarin (I think), luckily we went out with a friend who speaks mandarin. Blah blah blah, basically we got the wrong order, but since its all you can eat, she said we can have it. But we decided not to, because there's pork blood and we don't eat that kinda stuff. We filed out the paper again and waited for like 15 minutes for the food to come. And I was so disappointed,  because it was missing a couple stuff, like mushroom, fish tofu and I forgot what.But with us being hungry, we decided to eat and order again. And it took another 15 minutes for the other order to come. All in all, its supposed to be all you can eat, but after waiting for sometime, we got tired and just basically give up. We paid around $97 for 4 people,  but seriously,  we didn't eat a lot. And yes, we're still hungry so for that amount of money we paid, it wasn't worth it. If I go to the other place, I would probably be full. Plus, the service was not good. We often heard the servers talked sooo loud and sometimes screaming among themselves. Its just not professional. Plus they almost charged my kids eventhough my kids didn't eat AT ALL, they were just sitting and playing. Conclusion, I will not go back here again. Its just not worth it

29.description: This is an OK place for a casual no-frills cafe style Chinese dinner.  They don't have family dinner offerings so you are limited to picking entrees ala carte.  Pricing wise, and by Chinatown standards, that puts one in the moderate price range.  We had a dinner for 6 people and the bill pre-tax was $85.70.  Entrees were all decent and comprised of:- stir fried double lobster- clams with black bean sauce- oxtail casserole pot- chicken and vegetable rice casserole pot- fried smelt- peapod leaf tipsThey are also now offering hot pot dinners (you do the cooking), and have an AYCE 2-hour deal for $16.88.

42.description: I love this place... The food is so good and they open very late. I get off work at 10:00pm and I don't have time to cook and this place open late and I love going there to get my favorite dishes and drinks. I've been going there for 2 years and love it... I don't think I would go anywhere else to eat. Love it !!!!

23.description: DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS RESTAURANT via SEAMLESS\GRUBHUB! - My Place will confirm the order via Seamless and not process the order. I have ordered from this restaurant 3 times and all 3 times they confirmed the order within minutes. I waited over an hour and to my surprise when I call. I get the story sorry we didn't get the order there was an issue with our machine would you like us to prepare your food. If I had the option to give this place 0 stars I would.

47.description: Quality of food really changes in here from 12 months ago. My friend and I ate there for 5 times lately and has been pretty consistence. Prices are reasonable, dishes are coming out hot, and beers are cold. Definitely a great place for late night snack.

8.description: Pros:* Good deals on eats from 2-6 pm*open late all week*Traditional cooked vegetables and greens.*their seafood 2 lobsters for $26.95Cons:N/AFinal Verdict:Highly recommend. Also BYOB ^__^

31.description: Some people like, some people dislike. I like there because there is a good service, fresh food, and clean dishes.

34.description: Oh late nights in Chinatown... There is something both magical and sad about late night cravings, especially if it accompanied by a long wait at a time all you want to do is get your guilty gluttonous eating in prior to crawling into your bed after a long night out. MyPlace (outside from it's confusing name, which is the butt of many of jokes between me and MyFriends) is always a welcoming place to eat past 12am. There usually isn't too bad of a wait during late night, and it provides relatively good service for Chinatown along with standard to above average food (in reality all the restaurants tastes the same in Chinatown after awhile). I haven't really sampled all the drinks at MyPlace, but the friends I typically bring here for smoothies all give them a strong endorsement. I typically stick to the traditional HK milk tea and half and half (half milk tea and half milk coffee) and they are relatively good. The food is pretty standard for a HK style cafe. Everything is relatively good, but I typically get either the Portuguese baked rice with chicken or salt and pepper pork chops. I also frequently get the congee because it's the lightest thing on the menu for late night eating. MyPlace also offers some fantastic value eats for breakfast, lunch, and snack time. These deals typically run from $3.50-$5.00 and come with a hot drink. Really hard to beat a full meal and drink for under $5 (even in Chinatown). Overall, is the food amazing? No. Is it above average? Sure. But the main appeal for me is the fact that I never feel rushed at MyPlace. They serve decent tea, decent drinks, and have pretty good service for Chinatown. They also feature two huge big screen TVs in the middle and frequently play whatever game is on at request. There have been many of nights where I've caught a basketball game while eating some standard Chinese food. They also stay open pretty late with a little to no wait time.

16.description: We were hungry at 1am and figured we'd give this place a shot. We weren't blown away but it was fine. The walnut shrimp were tasty. The mushroom and beef over rice in a clay/stone bowl was kind of disappointing. It was mostly rice with only a little meat. We also go the salt and pepper assorted seafood and that was very meh. The salt and pepper squid is much better at Golden Bull. Anyway, if you're really hungry and need a late night snack, this place is probably fine, but Chi café and other places are open as well so you don't have to come here.

13.description: We came here for a family dinner last week. Although the staff was accommodating to our large party group, the food was not that great. It needed better/more seasoning. I liked that they had unique dishes like split shrimp on vermicelli noodles and clams in a clay pot. But I just wish they had a lazy susan for all the dishes that we ordered. Kind of a pain.

11.description: No soy sauce, spicy mustard, or sweet & sour sauce in our takeout bag. Never in my life has this happened. Spicy Beef and Mongolian Chicken was NOT spicy. But we did get 6 plastic forks and 6 sets of chopsticks, so there's that...

39.description: Let's start off w/ this. I'm an ABC, grew up on the northside, but come down to Chinatown every weekend & birthday for food. That being said, this location has changed owners a handful of times over the past few years since I've started noticing this location. It used to be out of the way, especially before Tang Dynasty opened across the walkway. But... the food here is pretty good & reasonably priced. The $20 FOR TWO LOBSTERS can't be beat!! That being said, they very often run out. Out of the last 4-5x I've stopped by in the last 2 months, they had it 3x. Once in the afternoon, 2x at night. Once when we stopped by at night, before we were seated, we asked & were told they had lobsters. After we placed our order, the waiter told us they ran out. We weren't going to leave as it was. Was it miscommunication? Or a ploy for us to stay & eat? We stayed nonetheless, but there was also an incredibly long wait for the food that night; a table of Chinese northerners seated at the same time as us were served first and were almost done eating by the time our food started coming out (AFTER we complained to the waiter). We received a discount, which was better.

37.description: We got talked into coming here by a historian who specializes in modern indigenous Mexico so I didn't really trust his credentials for sniffing out authentic Chinese, but the delicious smells hitting us on entry coupled with the observation that on a Saturday night we were absolutely the only party that wasn't speaking Han -- this gave me newfound respect.  He's enough of a regular that he knew the best parking (2$ in the scary looking lot under the expressway), bring your ticket in for validation.  The lobster deal is unbeatable. There was only a short wait, the place is open late and during the time we were there, no tables were empty for longer than 20 seconds or so, this place is popular among those who know. The three of us knocked down four entrees and two appetizers as fast as they brought them out, service is efficient and competent, not overly friendly but typical for Chinatown. Prices are a little lower than similar places in Chinatown.  The decor isn't going to win any awards, this is a no frills place, but it's clean and even when busy it doesn't feel cramped.  Unlike a lot of Chinese restaurants, you can see what's going on in the kitchen, it's clean and the seafood is prepared fresh.  Big plus is that it's open late, I so with it was located near where I actually live.

0.description: came here for the dinner with a large group.  (which usually takes some planning as they do not take reservations).  Brings back memories of a place i wwnrt to several times in a residential neighborhood of Kowloon, Hong Kong as they just produce favorites with good skill, and friendly staff.  My Place is quite popular and is usually busy for dinner.  They also are fairly decent for either dim sum or lunch. Every table is filled by 6:30pm on a Sunday.  We ordered over 11 dishes and were completely stuffed afterward.  MSG sensitive folks beware as alot of sauces are already prepared with some msg.  Portions though decent, may be disappointing compared to some portion sizes of other dishes they have, so you'd need to find the right balance.  The shrimp dishes looked somewhat sparse, but were good.We had three cold app's:  pig ear, jelly fish, Hainan chicken.  Beef chow fun, salty fish chicken fried rice, honey walnut shrimp, salt n pepper shrimp, lemon grass pork, black pepper beef tenderloin, string beans, salt and pepper tofu.  all comes out to about $12/person.  Larger groups would probably have to wait a while for one of their 3-4 larger tables.  otherwise a group of four should be manageable.

38.description: Cheap and great Chinese Togo and sitdown restaurant. &23.95 for 2 lobsters all day long. And the delivery always fast

51.description: My Place is my kind of place. I've visited on numerous occasions, from breakfast to late night. My loyalty is evidently displayed by my number of check-ins and picture posts. What are my favorites?1) The lunch specials from 11am to 2pm consist of unbeatable offers with generous and tasty entrée portions and a drink. Price ranges from $3.25 to $5 per order and you have over 30 selections from noodles to rice. Since it begins at 11am, I would also make use of that as a late breakfast. I've tried the spam and egg ramen noodles, mixed beefs parts with egg noodle, wonton noodles, Portuguese chicken with rice, satay beef with egg noodles, beef with string beans and rice, etc. 2) For dinner, my usual order consists of the shredded beef with mushrooms. The English name sounds too general for it to stand out but I am absolutely addicted! It's a simple stir-fried dish with wild mushrooms or tea-leaf mushrooms for the direct translation and it does wonders. In addition, I've also tried eggplant and salty fish, clams in black bean sauce, peapod tips with mushroom, sweet and sour pork, sizzling beef tenderloin, etc. 3) For late night, I've always succumbed to the fattest and unhealthiest dish: fried pork cutlet with egg noodles in broth and milk tea. There are carbs, grease, caffeine, and sugar in the mix. Sounds like the perfect combination for a hungry belly...even at a late hour. With that said, I've tried a good portion of the menu and I still have yet to find something unpleasing. My Place isn't as popular as its rivals down the street, but I would choose MP anytime over the rest. Service is quick and efficient without ever making a mistake. Food prices are lower than competitors but the portions remain generous and quality is in no way downplayed.

27.description: Good place if you're looking for a cheap and decent lunch. Servers will only really come if you wave them down so don't waste time and wait around for them to come to you!

32.description: If the food weren't better here than Chi-Cafe and Sweet Station, this would be 2 stars. Service is just plain sucky which I doubt the management cares because they have decent business. There are always a lot of waiter/nesses floating around but if you ever need anything, have fun trying to get their attention. **Dine in or pick up, be sure to have patience waiting for your food.**Just today I had to rush the waiter after waiting for 35 minutes, but none of our four orders came. I absolutely hate to rush them on the orders because I know the waiters are not the ones cooking the food. However, the waiter quickly replied that "it's coming, it's coming" (which is mostly a lie) just to get us off his back and just told me to wait because the table behind us is also doing the same which makes no sense - they came in 20-25 minutes after us.My mom suggested that maybe they work on carry-on orders before dine-in ones, but I don't think so because the food is coming out of the kitchen once in a while, not as frequently as other surrounding Chinese restaurants. We concluded that they probably only a have a 2-3 cooks in the kitchen. The wait for your food is painful if you're hungry...

54.description: this place is very good.

48.description: I've only ordered delivery from this place via GrubHub but I find myself ordering from them often. Typically I enjoy two dishes:  Honey Walnut Shrimp and Salt & Pepper Pork Chop. The shrimp hits the spot every time. The flavor is just right without any added surprises (variable recipes). The portions are generous even though they are not prawns by any means. The pork chop I just love love love. Simple recipe that provides an excellent taste. It also includes some minced garlic and some chives, enhancing the flavors. The great part: no MSG.

44.description: Gross...just not good tasting at all.  I kept it simple with chicken fried rice and SS chicken.  The rice had no flavor whatsoever - just tinted brown.  The batter on the SS chicken had an indistinguishable flavor that was just weird.They give you a pretty good-sized portion of food...but that was not good in my case.Decided to give this place one more try after two previous attempts - i'm now completely done with it.  Won't be ordering here again.

24.description: Awesome. My family and I have frequented Chinatown for a long time (we're Chinese). We used to stick to one restaurant, but as their quality had gone down, we decided to branch out. MyPlace is amazing! Their prices are really great and their portions are pretty decent. Service is standard Chinatown service--efficient, but not super friendly. The atmosphere is whatever, not fancy, but you're not coming here for the atmosphere. Onto the food, which is what makes this place so great. Every dish we've had so far has been super tasty, flavorful, and cooked well. We usually get fish filet with ginger and onion, clams in black bean and garlic sauce, beef tenderloin with black pepper (my favorite! It comes out sizzling on a black cast iron plate), and garlic pea tips. I would recommend all of these dishes. I've also had the all you can eat hot pot here. It's all right and very filling; they don't skimp with the portions. The broths could use some work though. Otherwise, you can't really go wrong with this place.

7.description: This is an OK place for a casual no-frills cafe style Chinese dinner.  They don't have family dinner offerings so you are limited to picking entrees ala carte.  Pricing wise, and by Chinatown standards, that puts one in the moderate price range.  We had a dinner for 6 people and the bill pre-tax was $85.70.  Entrees were all decent and comprised of:- stir fried double lobster- clams with black bean sauce- oxtail casserole pot- chicken and vegetable rice casserole pot- fried smelt- peapod leaf tipsThey are also now offering hot pot dinners (you do the cooking), and have an AYCE 2-hour deal for $16.88.

49.description: let's go to "My Place! the restaurant! not my house..." when nobody's cooking delicious Chinese food at home, my first go to place is My Place! of all the restaurants in Chinatown and Chinatown square, I love My Place the most. It's chill and relaxing in there and they have great food! I've never been disappointed there -- unlike some other places... I love their fish fillet and tofu hot pot and their sesame chicken (their lunch special for it with chicken fried rice and egg roll (i substituted for crab rangoons) makes it a great deal too!) their sesame chicken isn't soggy and it's not all just flour -- you'll actually be chewing on chicken! all the servers are very nice too!give them a try :] try their drinks too or even the mixed fruit sundae mmm

40.description: Just ordered delivery and it took them 2 hrs to deliver Chinese food. The food was cold and not what I ordered. The delivery guy charged me a different price than what they told me when I ordered and the dumb f*ck didn't give me a receipt. So of course I called back to speak to the manager and now they want me to wait for the delivery guy to finish delivering the rest of the cold shitty food in his car to bring me my money back. Keep in mind they close in a hour.UPDATE: They just brought me my money back and said I can keep the food because they were late. He also apologized. I can go for that but it's now 1:36 a.m and I'm still hungry...

53.description: I really like this place. Very nice and friendly service. The food is good and the price is reasonable. The congre is good, I highly recommend. Its not too salty or full of msg and its a nice thick kind, not watery. The hot pot is a good deal if u like to drink beer cause they have a deal thats hot pot buffet and all u can drink beer for $25.

30.description: Afternoon tea (I think it's everyday from 3-6pm): for $4-5 a person you get 1 dish (more than enough for myself but my bf can probably eat 1.5 dishes), hot tea, and a drink (milk tea, coffee/milk tea melange, soda, etc.)!  The food is solid and cheap, albeit a bit oily at times but that's expected for Chinatown.  We come here at least once a week!

46.description: My mom loves this places.Great specials and inexpensive. Go in the afternoon!I usually get either the beef brisket or shrimp dumplings noodle soup with an included drink... and I usually get coffee milk tea. For less than $5. Yup.

1.description: My Place, the restaurant (not my actual home), is a notch above divey, and hits the sweet spot between value, quantity, and quality. The lunch specials in Chinatown Square are always a great deal, and My Place is no exception.I've had the wonton mein, Portuguese chicken over rice, spaghetti stir fry, and other dishes, and they all hit the mark for me. I see many customers go for the lobster special (2 for $26.95), which I've had as well, and it's ok. If you love lobster, then I'm sure you can't go wrong there.This is not really a place I'd bring someone for atmosphere, but for something casual, this is par for the course in Chinatown Square, which is okay.

55.description: Cheap food,  good service.  The hot pot deal is pretty good $16.88 per person all u can eat and $24.88 per person if u want beer and its all the beer u can drink (Nice! ) and the noodle rolls there are pretty good too.

9.description: OK, 5 stars for 1) the price, which is cheaper then I cook. 2) For the choices, so many diffident varieties, eg lobster, steam oyster and...quail!!! And all different kind of rice rolls. 3) for the always smiling and happy waitress. 4)  for the taste which I don't think they have MSG. 5) for the hong Kong style coffee which is not sour and, they have o-wa-tin!! 6) for the nice decoration and clean environment.Oh wait....they even have AYCE hot pot... Who else in Chinatown can beat them?!

26.description: My friend brought me here last week because I never been here. The one dish I loved the most was the bean curd ox tail casserole, to die for. Pros: Decent prices for tasty food, the 2 lobster special , I prefer salt pepper style,ox tail casserole, decent service. Cons: Gets crowded fast, small dishes, parking is hard and need to pay the meter. There is a parking lot across the street which is a better deal.

25.description: This would be the Go-TO Chinese place for my lunch and/or dinner. They have a special lunch set and late afternoon tea menu set that is very reasonable priced. It also comes with a hot beverage and extra 75cent for cold. During the weekend, they open until 4am? Plus they validate for the chinatown parking lot! My usual favorite:-milk tea/coffee mix beverage-stir fried lobster over e-fu noodle (sometimes they have 2 lobsters for ~$22 and extra $5 for noodles)-The short rib stonepot with rice (egg fried rice) - it's flaming!-shrimp walnut -fish filet with fried tofu over rice -Squab (special) -Hot pot is okay, but the ingredients is really fresh and quality of beef is pretty good compared to other AYCE- spicy pig's ear-scallop with egg white fried rice (so simple and delicious)

12.description: This was an unpleasant experience. First, the order was not even taken correctly. Then, people who came after us got their food first. We ordered 4 dishes and the last 2 came after I asked about the order. The dishes were rushed and oJf poor quality. Disappointing.

59.description: Our favorite chinese delivery.  Your standard take out and delivery chinese food.  We have tried so many in Chicago but this is now our go-to place.  Sesame chicken, orange beef, and fried rices are all excellent!

21.description: We came here for a family dinner last week. Although the staff was accommodating to our large party group, the food was not that great. It needed better/more seasoning. I liked that they had unique dishes like split shrimp on vermicelli noodles and clams in a clay pot. But I just wish they had a lazy susan for all the dishes that we ordered. Kind of a pain.

17.description: HOLY COW. SO CHEAP!My boyfriend ordered some kind of Portuguese rice with a white sauce and I ordered the wonton noodles for lunch. Both came with a warm beverage for around $4 each! Whut whut?! I know, insane. Flavors of the dishes weren't earth shattering, but pretty good. I will definitely be back to try other things. How can I say no to $4 meals?! We also couldn't stop laughing at the name. "Let's go to My Place!" "Your place?" "NO. My Place."

10.description: This place for the price is decent. It's small and the wait can be a bit of a wait. Not much room to wait. You may be up against a table. Not good for those sitting at the table. There's plenty of staff for the small place. They are friendly if you speak the language. But they try their best and treats everyone  well. The food was ok. Nothing spectacular but it was good. They used to have "happy hour" prices from 2-5 but not sure if they still do.

5.description: This would be the Go-TO Chinese place for my lunch and/or dinner. They have a special lunch set and late afternoon tea menu set that is very reasonable priced. It also comes with a hot beverage and extra 75cent for cold. During the weekend, they open until 4am? Plus they validate for the chinatown parking lot! My usual favorite:-milk tea/coffee mix beverage-stir fried lobster over e-fu noodle (sometimes they have 2 lobsters for ~$22 and extra $5 for noodles)-The short rib stonepot with rice (egg fried rice) - it's flaming!-shrimp walnut -fish filet with fried tofu over rice -Squab (special) -Hot pot is okay, but the ingredients is really fresh and quality of beef is pretty good compared to other AYCE- spicy pig's ear-scallop with egg white fried rice (so simple and delicious)

3.description: Can't beat 2 lobsters for about $26 here. The food is pretty good but it is a small place. Can't have a table over 8 people because they really don't have a table big enough. I've been here several times. Breakfast/lunch is good with the congee, they have a few different styles to choose from. Most time we have come for dinner and of course order the lobster. I recommend the lobster with ginger and green onion. Seems to be my favorite style. The sizzling plates are pretty good also.

35.description: This is the first restaurant we visited at Chinatown.  The serving size for foods is "huge" lol... foods they serve is FRESH & TASTY! Price is reasonable too. We will definitely come back again for different dishes :)

19.description: Disappointed...Came in on a weeknight and the place was hopping, which seemed like a good sign. But the food was bland and nothing a Chinese household can't easily make at home.

28.description: We didn't get any food but we stopped by to grab smoothies and it was better than I expected. Honestly this wasn't the first place we tried to go but it was the only place without a 30 min line. We got the pineapple and papaya smoothies and they used all fresh ingredients. She used an entire cup of both pineapple and papaya. The boba was wicked fresh too. It's always nice to have a good smoothie on a nice day in Chicago.

45.description: They have this lobster deal where you get 2 for only $22! You can't find this anywhere else in chinatown! I've also tried their fried pigeons, shredded chicken and I think everything was pretty good at a good price! I'd come back again especially for the lobster deal!

33.description: HOLY COW. SO CHEAP!My boyfriend ordered some kind of Portuguese rice with a white sauce and I ordered the wonton noodles for lunch. Both came with a warm beverage for around $4 each! Whut whut?! I know, insane. Flavors of the dishes weren't earth shattering, but pretty good. I will definitely be back to try other things. How can I say no to $4 meals?! We also couldn't stop laughing at the name. "Let's go to My Place!" "Your place?" "NO. My Place."

43.description: Crazy insane specials pretty much at all times of day. Came here on a weekday for lunch and this place was banging! The portions is amazing and the taste is not bad at all. Two of us each ordered off the lunch specials which comes with a drink for 4.95 then we saw a popular dish go by and couldn't resist ordering a third... OOPS. Coming back next time and bring peeps!

2.description: I came here for lunch yesterday with my sister and her friend who invited us.  The restaurant was packed.  We seemed to beat the lunch rush because shortly after we were seated there was a line at the door of people waiting to be seated.  Our waitress & the staff at this restaurant were outstanding.  She took our order and in a very short period she was bringing the food to the table.  I think the reason we were invited was to try the E-fu noodles which we have never seen before at other Chinese restaurants.  Throughout the meal the staff was one of the best refilling our water glasses, bringing us fresh tea, removing empty dishes, bringing plates for the shells from the clams, lobsters and shrimp.  They not only brought the plates, but emptied them several times and brought clean new dishes for the shells.We ordered 4 dishes.  1) The E-fu noodles with 2 lobsters.  The E-fu noodles were seasoned with green onions, & garlic and perfectly seasoned.  The E-fu noodles reminded me of ramen noodles.  The lobsters were cooked to perfection and broken into pieces that made it easier to pick out the lobster meat. 2) Whole Shrimp battered and pan fried and seasoned with salt, pepper, jalapeños & green onions.  I eat the shrimp whole head, legs and shells.  3) Clams cooked w/black bean sauce, jalapeños & garlic & pork.  4) Green beans w/pork, garlic, onions, & dried hot peppers.My Place also has some very unique desert dishes for a Chinese restaurant.  We ordered French toast.  That's right French toast.  It was delicious.  It was very rich in flavor like it was cooked with butter and instead of shrub they brought a container with sweetened condensed milk.  AwesomeOverall I would give their food a 4 and the service a 5 plus

18.description: Our new go-to spot in Chinatown for eats. Madd chill. Great food. Recommend the Pork Chop cutlet. Get 2 orders if you're rollin with a crew. We also get the yang chow fried rice, salt & pepper squid, and stir-fried string beans. You won't be disappointed.We keep coming back for "late night" eats.

41.description: Just look at how many check-ins I have here. I think its self explanatory lol. Anyways, plenty of lunch, high tea, and dinner specials. Feel free to be adventurous and try anything on the menu. You won't be disappointed!

52.description: I really wanted to like this place because a friend of mine kept raving about it. Sadly, I don't think it'll be on my top 10 places to go eat. First things first, the location is fun. It's right in the heart of Chinatown, and I love how authentic that feels as you walk into the area. In terms of service, they were great in adjusting to the group of 13 we had walking in. No problem or issues getting that together. However, moving forward, the service wasn't the best. They were great about bringing more broth to fill the hot pots, my water was always full, but they were terrible about asking me if I wanted another beer (had the all you can eat and drink option). I constantly felt as if I had to ask about getting new plates, additional silverware, and extra napkins. Moving onto the food, the meat didn't seem fresh. It wasn't by any means terrible, but definitely not the best quality. I guess you can't expect too much when you're buying an all you can eat option. The saving grace for this place were the potstickers. Seriously, those potstickers were probably some of the best ones I've ever had. If anything, when you go, make sure you get an order or two!Overall, not a bad place to try out, but definitely not in my top favorite places to go.

50.description: I have only hot pot here, so my review is based strictly on that. The hot pot was pretty good overall and the price is about the same as the other ayce hot pot places in CT. The broth selection is pretty small, I think you can only get 2 or 3 to choose from. They have a pretty average hot pot menu selection, but some stuff is additional. The service is better than other places in CT for hot pot, so that is probably one of the biggest reason that I will come back here for hot pot in the future.

4.description: Always a favorite. I'm usually the only gyelow at the table. Matter of fact90% of the customers are Chinese. Lunch specials are inexpensive and come with coffee. They validate up to 3 hrs parking at lot under Red line.

6.description: They have a break, lunch set til about 2:00 p.m. and after 2:00 p.m. deals! They have a 2 lobster over E-Fu Noodles for $26.95, rounding up that is about $30 for two lobsters with E-Ful Noodles. I didn't try that dish. I had a simple  baked Portuguese  chicken over rice dish that came with lemon ice tea! It was delicious!I would like to return there to check out that lobster E-ful Noodle dish next time. The prices are very affordable and I like their food, I was told it is close to what Hong Kong food is like.

22.description: This is my favorite place in Chinatown chicago. The food is always good, service above average compared to other Chinatown places. And of we get the waitress with long hair she's always really friendly to us. The place is nothing fancy, more of a casual environment than say minghin or cai. It gets quite busy sometimes, so I'd avoid going during weekend rush hours. Onto the food: the prices are very good, IMHO. The owners spent less of their focus on decor so the food prices can be as competitive as they are. They have an afternoon tea priced from like $3.95-5.95 or something ridiculously cheap. Some of my go to dishes I order everything basically are: lobster yi-mein, pea teas w/garlic, japanese style Eggplant with beef, golden soft shell crab. It's always excellent. Love this place! Definitely recommend it.

15.description: It was good, had sizzling beef with terayaki sauce and egg rolls. Egg rolls were a little bit plain but I finished everything ;-)!

57.description: This review is for the bubble tea only.The bubble tea here is as good as it gets and puts Joy yee's and Saint alps to shame. I've picked it up about 10 times now and the quality is always consistent - perfectly chewy boba, brewed tea and condensed milk.Not sure I would eat here, but the bubble tea is definitely top notch

20.description: Food is good -if the waiters who don't speak English get your order right.  Can't believe I waited for chicken wings for an hour and a half.  Pretty obvious, someone dropped the ball.  The place had only two tables at that time.  Mine and the one across us.  They 're not rude at all but extremely inefficient.  Don't think I'll go back.  There s tons of choices in Chinatown.  Besides, who has that luxury of time to sit around for over an hour waiting for nothing?

36.description: First Impression- False advertisement/ dishonor coupon:First time order from this place because we never try this place and coincidently a friend got a free fried rice coupon with over $30 purchase.  So we call in for a pick up and we mention we got a coupon for a free fried rice ( for the toddler) for our order over $50, the lady on the phone said to show them the coupon at the time of pick up. At the time of pick up, I show them the coupon and they won't honor it because it was copied, they only honor those that they have in their restaurant which they told me are all out. So what is the point of creating coupons to attract new customers and yet they don't have enough to give out and won't honor those that are copied? This might be the first restaurant I have been to that closes their doors on their customers. In the receipt they still show there's a free fried rice, thinking they had put it in regardless, but when we opened the package, we were so disappointed. If we have known the receipt inaccurately listed item that ARE NOT included, we would have ordered an extra fried rice. Now the kiddo is so disappointed.  Thanks ALOT!The Actual food:The taste is just so so, nothing special compared to other places in chinatown. The beef was marinated with way too much flour, there's no beef taste to it. Some of the dishes is way too salty. Conclusion:Don't bothered to get advantage of their advertised coupons as if they are not the originals ( which you won't find any since they are all out), they won't honor it. They don't value their customers at all as they didn't even have it prepared to give it to you in the first place. For so so dishes, i can get it elsewhere for less. This is my first and will be my last time here. Good luck to their business

14.description: First impressions count and my first impression is pretty bad. My partner convinced me to order from them after reading the reviews instead of ordering from our usual place. I placed an order at 12:27pm. At 2pm I finally called them to ask where our food was, coincidentally at the same moment that the front desk called to tell me the food was here.What we got was cold, dry food. If there had been sauce on my General Tso's, I couldn't tell. If there has been sauce on my partner's orange chicken, he couldn't tell. Despite ordering my General Tso's not spicy, it arrived with a lot of hot chili peppers dumped on top. Needless to say, one and a half hours of waiting for cold, dry food that isn't even prepared as asked has left me not interested in ordering from them again.

58.description: One of my top 5 favorite restaurants in Chinatown.  I have been coming here for over 10 years.   Good Cantonese style food and decent service.  I prefer a couple places over this one in Chinatown, but if they are too crowded or to switch it up once in a while, I have no problems going here.I always get authentic Chinese dishes from here so I can't speak for the Americanized version of the menu.

56.description: Eating out in Chinatown is one of my favorite things - authentic food made to order, jasmine tea served to my table, and the great half-English-half-Chinese din of a busy restaurant - I really love it.  Sometimes though, nothing beats the Sunday holy trinity; my sofa, a movie and Chinese take-out.  House of Fortune has completed my weekend trifecta with their Singapore Noodles.  At just $7, this huge portion is socked full of little shrimp and BBQ pork.  The green peppers were a little much, but the great flavor and just enough spice kept me awake through the movie's lulls.  The vegetable spring rolls, however, were only just good.  Although, I did manage to eat them both.  Delivery was a bit slow at over an hour, but understandable with the sleet/hail/snow.  Overall, I give it four stars and will definitely add House of Fortune to my Chinatown night-out rotation!

29.description: This was by far my favorite Chinese rest. in Chinatown until recently. Recently  my wife and I stopped by for a carryout, when we got home there was a huge black bug in the container with the rice. Of course, we returned the food and received a full refund. It  appeared that they were aware of the bus issue and were apologetic. Suufice to say, we have not returned.

42.description: One day we went to china town and didnt know where to eat.  I approached a family walking down the street and asked them "where's the best place to eat in China Town" and they said "House of Fortune".  We promptly walked to this restaurant and was very very happy!  The food was excellent.  Meat and veggie quality was great...and im pretty picky about where I eat meat from.  The service was good and fast.  The prices are reasonable.  The ladies room needs a little work with there being only one stall but its clean.  We have been back a few times and the food is consistent.

23.description: DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!! Ordered pot stickers and they tasted like pure oil. The scallion pancakes were more like tortilla chips and saturated in oil. The sesame chicken had no chicken and the governors chicken was awful. With delivery it cost $40! Will never order from here again!  Terrible food!! Only giving it 1 star because I had to rate it. Otherwise I'd give it zero stars.

47.description: One of my favorites in Chinatown. Everything I have ordered for Dine In and Carryout has been great. I have also had delivery (South Loop) a few times as well. I always order orange chicken and crab rangoon. Other than that I mix it up. I've only been mildly disappointed once when it seemed as though the quality of the chicken was going downhill. They seem to have corrected this problem though. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because I am most often the only person in the restaurant every time I Dine in. It's very awkward!

8.description: We placed an order with the expected delivery of 45 minutes; however, we did not receive our food 2 hours later.  Unbelievable because I only live within a mile of the restaurant.  I called the restaurant to inform them of the poor delivery time and was told that 'everyone ordered at one time'.   Really?!  Though the food may be good at the restaurant, when we received our food, the presentation and taste quality was subpar at best.  My recommendation is to either improve your delivery service or don't offer delivery!

31.description: We took our kids there and had a terrific meal.  We ordered the Family Meal for 4 and it was very tasty.  The egg rolls were a big hit at the table.  The wait staff was very friendly, parking was easy, and the bill reasonable.  We will make it back there for sure!

34.description: I feel very fortunate to have had dinner here tonight. Get it? House of fortune...fortunate? Ha ha ha. The restaurant was clean and nice, service was too. They treated us like kings and family; we got lots of attention and were able to order 1/2 orders of apps. Egg rolls were tasty, homemade mustard was spicey, crab Rangoon was great, meat filled dumplings were also great. We also had combo fried rice and the generals chicken which was our servers favorite dish. It was all scrumptious!! I give it 5 stars! Great experience, great service an great food! My friend, Jimmy, gets delivery from here a lot and says it always shows up fast and hot, just like my women...

16.description: Went back a second time and it was better. Still ok, not great!Sizzling Soup - This was good. Tons of veggies, shrimp, chicken and other stuff. I felt like there was barely any "soup" in this with all the stuff.Fried Won Tons with Meat - This was ok, but I would probably not order it again.Shredded Chicken - This was a bit salty and definitely nothing like the one Hong Min makes (no one makes it better than them.)Service was still good and attentive.

13.description: Came in on a random cold day to eat with my family and I had to say the place was quite empty so we were reserved about our decision. The food came out and we ate like hungry fiends. Food was alright, though a bit greasy in our opinion. The staff was attentive and tried to offer some signature dishes, but we still got our way since we knew what we wanted.

11.description: My food took an hour and a half to get to my place.  Then sesame chicken was bland and soggy, but that my have been because it was sitting in the back seat of a car for so long.  I live in the south loop on the 11th floor, I can see chinatown if I lean out my window.  The driver must have either walked it over or intentionally drove right past my house to deliver to everyone else first.I also got the ribs appetizer and it was literally a mixed bag, they were all different sizes, they could have come from a whole family of pigs.  There's this place in Naperville called House of Emperor.  They do a ribs appetizer that looks on the surface like a carry out container filled 3/4 with this delicious spicy boiling hot barbecue sauce.  Half a dozen of the tenderest ribs you'll ever eat are floating in it and as you lift one out of the container the meat literally disintegrates off the bone, splashing into that red sea.  Cut to 5 minutes later when you're trying to fish the last delicious morsels that have sunk to the bottom with a pair of chopsticks like a crack addict.  I only bring this up because that's the whole reason I order ribs from Chinese restaurants, House of Fortune is no House of Emperor.The most important thing is that this is the first Chinese delivery I've gotten all year that actually gives you fortune cookies.  Lao Tze Chuan will make you better food faster, but they won't give you a fortune cookie.

39.description: Very good Cantonese style food.  We come here on occasion for family events.  Some of my favs are the jellyfish platter with an assortment of pork and beef cuts.  We've had pretty much everything here.  Just like Tim H., we tend to order mostly authentic dishes and they're all very good.  Definitely hits the spot for me when I'm craving Chinese food.

37.description: There has to be better eating in Chinatown. Not a very busy spot considering the excellent reviews. The entrees are large and the service is friendly. However, food is greasy and ingredients such as vegetables do not taste as crisp and fresh as we would have liked. Good pot of freshly brewed tea is gratis.

0.description: Thanks so much !!!!!really great attention, food and place .....in Chinatown this is only place where we go to eat......

38.description: Went back a second time and it was better. Still ok, not great!Sizzling Soup - This was good. Tons of veggies, shrimp, chicken and other stuff. I felt like there was barely any "soup" in this with all the stuff.Fried Won Tons with Meat - This was ok, but I would probably not order it again.Shredded Chicken - This was a bit salty and definitely nothing like the one Hong Min makes (no one makes it better than them.)Service was still good and attentive.

51.description: This review is on food and delivery only. I have never visited the restaurant, and probably never will. Kind of more expensive than the other Chinese places int he area that I have ordered delivery from. However, the serving sizes are pretty large. A plus. The food was delivered warm (even though I live only a few blocks away). But I can't take bland and luke warm food together. One or the other, I can deal. Kung Pao chicken, I have had more than I care to share, was not spicy in the least, and tasteless. Pieces looked large, really there was very little chicken in the piece. Mostly skin and fat. I don't need any help in that department, thank you. There are many other places in the area with alot tastier food and lower prices.

27.description: Great lunch specials! We were here for a friends birthday dinner and we were a party of about 30 people. Service was fine but the lunch specials make up for it! Our table of 8 had a bill of about $35 when it was all done. Can't. Beat. That! The food is all delicious. I can definitely recommend the bbq pork fried rice, chicken fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, generals chicken (i think that's it), fried pan noodles, and beef with broccoli. The egg drop soup is a little thick for my liking but that could just be the texture of regular egg drop soup...highly recommended for a lunch spot in Chinatown!

32.description: We were in Chicago for the weekend and knew we would go to Chinatown for a meal at some point. We wound up going at an unexpected time, so didn't have much chance to check around for recommendations about where to eat. Once we got there we stopped in a gift shop and asked a sales clerk, who suggested House of Fortune. The local recommendation served us well -- were in for one of the best Chinese restaurant meals we've ever had.Resisting our efforts to nudge him off the beaten path, our 8-year-old insisted on orange chicken. As it turns out, House of Fortune's orange chicken actually is off the beaten path. The chicken was fresh and the breading light and crispy. Now about the sauce, this dish is typically spicy (it's one of those with a little pepper next to it in the margin of the menu) but they offered to make it non-spicy for our son. I thought that would amount to dumbing-down the orange sauce and making it bland. The sauce they served, though not spicy, was complex and flavorful. It was definitely orange chicken, but unlike any other - and better than any other - we've had. My wife and I split a seafood sampler served in a Phoenix nest. The Phoenix nest consists of taro root shredded into long pieces, then deep fried into the shape of a nest, surrounded by crunchy, lightly-cooked broccoli. The seafood included large, juicy shrimp, squid, and scallops with a light sauce accented with slivers of fresh ginger root. Absolutely delicious.The service was excellent. Without ever hovering over use, the wait staff was always sort of in orbit and responded at a glance. They were polite and casual, and took the time to dote on our son.We also sampled the crab rangoon, which was outstanding, and the hot-and-sour soup. Only two things could make the soup better: a dash of soy sauce (it needed to be just a bit saltier than as-served) and a head cold. There is nothing better than hot-and-sour soup when you're under the weather. None of us were sick, but the soup hit the spot nonetheless.Before you go, be aware that the stretch of Wentworth where you'll find House of Fortune is a bit the worse for wear. The avenue is lined with gift shops a mixture of very nice gifts and kitchy trinkets -- some of the shops err more on the kitchy trinket side. The buildings are not in great shape. Some of the other restaurants we passed were loud and dingy. Don't let that throw you. When we reached House of Fortune we were greeted like family and ushered to table. The decor of the restaurant is nothing to write home about (see the picture) but it is simple, clean, comfortable and quiet.We loved House of Fortune, and we'll be back next time we're in the Windy City.

54.description: My friends and I were on the prowl for some good peking duck. I've been to Sun Wah BBQ (yum-absolutely love the 3 course meal), but we wanted peking duck on crepes instead of bao buns. According to yelpers, House of Fortune was the place to go.Ordering Peking Duck can sometimes feel like gambling. It's an expensive dish, and you never know how it's going to turn out. I'm happy to say that HOF delivered. The duck meat was juicy without tasting fatty and the crepes were quite good. The servers were also very friendly.Please note that duck soup is not included in the price of the Peking Duck dish. They will charge you an extra $8. I should have known based on previous reviews, but I thought they had changed it up. We were also charged $12.95 for pea shoots/pea pod leaves (not on the American menu, but I think usually on the secret menu). I thought it was a little too pricey considering it didn't come with any meat. In fact, it was more expensive than our shrimp dish.I'd definitely go back for the Peking Duck, but would order different entrees next time.

48.description: As close to SF Chinatown food as I've had in Chicago to date. Our ordering could've used a little help, but overall we had a great meal at a good price. Our server was extremely helpful and nice and told us we really didn't want to order the pork and salted fish dish (mainly because of the smell and also because we were caucasions). However, our friend persisted and the interesting dish came out to not much fanfare. The pork was basically like sausage that you'd find on a deep dish pizza (one large thin circular piece) with the salted fish scattered on top. Salted is putting it lightly, this fish was bathed/drenched/immersed in salt for probably weeks until it was served to us that afternoon. The smell was pretty rank and it tasted just as bad. As for the good, our appetizers were amazing: BBQ Pork, Soup Dumplings and some of the best Sizzling Rice Soup I've ever had. The rest of our entrees consisted of Seafood in Phoenix Nest, Vegetables with Three Delicacies, Crispy Chicken (probably the best I've ever had) and Jellyfish. I'll definitely be back, but be a little more careful next time when letting my friend do all of the ordering...

44.description: House of Fortune has good Chinese food if you want the more traditional Chinese dishes.  Fresh fish, duck, tofu, Chinese veggies, they are all good.The last time we went, I took a bunch of coworkers to try to show them a more traditional sit down Chinese restaurant with good Chinese food and the service was great.  The wait staff was helpful and attentive to our larger table and we had the more private room in the corner.

24.description: First time there... we go there before the rush so YAY us :)Old school decor.. doesn't look like much has changed in ages.. table clothes, but casual.Pleasant host and server that were eager to get water tea and whatever else we ordered.Started with eggrolls.. basic and good, but nothing specialSweet N Sour chicken was a tad too sweet for my taste, but crunchy and full of fresh bell peppers so YAYMongolian beef was average.. sauce needed a little extra punch, but I added that myself. Meat was tasty and lots of onions.I saw someone eating soup and that looked awesome.. so I may be back for thatThey also offer no MSG on request and that is always a good thing

7.description: I don't know how the food is because they never delivered.  We placed an order and were told the delivery would be over an hour.  After waiting more than an hour they called to say that they had made an error and our order hadn't even begun and it would be more than 40 minutes more for the food.  We had to cancel.  They didn't care that they had ruined our meal and left us without food.  They made no effort to improve the situation after they admitted to making the error.

49.description: House of Fortune is the best! The menu is large, so finding the style of dishes that suits your palette might take a few trips. It's so worth it. Many of the dishes don't translate well to take out. They're best eaten fresh from the kitchen. I think the fried foods are the best here like shrimp with spicy salt no shell (ask for red vinegar to sprinkle them with), 5 spice chicken, and general tso's chicken. Peking duck and the noodle dishes are pretty great, too. Also try #111 pan fried won ton with meat. They are the best dumpling appetizer. Oh, the drinks are strong. Charlie, who runs the place, is very a friendly and laid back guy. The waitstaff are very nice and fast. We often have special requests (like easy ginger or american broccoli not chinese) or make up our own dishes which they don't mind to accommodate at all. My mom likes beef with bitter melon. It's on the menu, but they don't always keep bitter melon in the kitchen because of lack of popularity. When she orders it, someone runs next door to the grocery to get it for the dish. How's that for service? We also go for more casual family parties. There's a nice sized party room and a couple large tables in the main dining room. We often celebrate birthdays there, and bring cake which they don't mind cutting and serving. They do not mind kids at all. In fact, the staff kind of gravitates around the tables where kids are to help out. On a side note, House of Fortune is popular with travelling dignitaries and other hot shots. It is closed for private parties every once in a while for symphonies and even the Premier of China when he was in town a few years ago. The previous owner hosted Jackie Chan about 15 years ago and there used to be a huge blown up picture of her with Jackie Chan by the front door.

40.description: We had dinner here today.  I can only gove two stars to this place.  The dishes were average, and too salty.  The seafood was not fresh, and the rice were too hard to chew.

53.description: As I recently have moved to the Chicago suburbs for the month, I was craving good Cantonese food. Cantonese food is hard to find- I've scoured all overf the country, from Nor/Socal to the east coast.. and nothing beats Toronto, thus far.However, I was hungry, so with my Tai San (rare dialect of Canto) speaking father, we went to House of Fortune, in the old part of Chinatown.It was pretty good- I've had better, but if I had to rate it, I would give it between 3 to 4 stars. We started out with "quo tip", or fried wontons, which were very meaty, but the skins was a bit too thick and it was a little greasy. Next, we got the "siu long bao". The skin, was once again thick.. and there was no juice- the main staple of siu long bao! We also got:- Crispy chicken- good, not too much fat, and the skin was the right amount of crispy-ness- Sweet and sour porkchops?- I'm not sure what exactly it translates to english, but the sauce was a tad too red.. but the meat itself was tender.- A hot pot of fish, cha siu, and tofu- that was good. It even had abalone in it.- Fish mixed with pea pods dish- that was alright. This restaurant cooked with more oil than I would have liked.. but it still tasted good.Overall, the food was slightly above average. However, I liked the cleanliness of the restaurant- the dishes and tea cups didn't have the normal grime that most Canto restaurants have. Additionally, the wait staff was FAST, and the food all came out fast as well- on a busy Sunday afternoon.Would I go back here again? Eh.
