I'm certain we will revisit but I also believe Pop's quality will decline in a few months since this is still their opening month. Better make use of it now before that happens!

4.description: Came here last night with a group of friends and the night was super fun until we saw the bill. BEWARE.. CORONAS ARE $5 EACH. Without knowing this, my friends and I ordered 12 bottles and were shocked at how much our bill came out to be. On top of that, our bill only included a 2 hour session, but then all of a sudden they charged us for an extra 30 minutes. It almost felt like they were trying to take advantage of the fact we were drunk and charged us for extra time. Of course we went back and compared the time of when the receipt was printed and the current time and complained to the register. We were refunded the extra charge, but it could have easily been missed. Another factor that I didn't like was how the karaoke machine was run in Chinese. Thankfully we had a friend who was fluent, but I can only imagine how confusing it would be for someone who wasn't Chinese. Although they had some major faults, the rooms were clean and they even had lights to set up the mood.

14.description: I really liked the atmosphere they gave!   The song choice was very nice because all songs are chosen from a screen instead of a karaoke book.  The room had drinking games too!  It was just me and two other girls.  We were trying to kill sometime before leaving Chicago so we randomly came.  We had to use a large room at $50 an hour because there was no more open rooms.  They have English Japanese Chinese and Korean song choices.  What I liked about the karaoke is that all songs played the actual music videos instead of the random scenic backgrounds that a lot of karaoke a use.  The selection was pretty nice.  A little of everything.  The screen to select is in Chinese but I am pretty sure they will show you how to navigate to the English selection side.  Overall a very fun way to pass the time we needed in between taking our train back home!  I will come back for sure next time!

6.description: I've only been here once on a Saturday night and all the small and medium rooms were booked so we resorted to sitting down in the lounge area.I was really reminded of hong kong lounge bars. Beers are standard price (4-5$) and mixed drinks are pricier for pilsen  ($10-12) and the music is overly loud (trance, top 40, hip hop and the like) There was a very active smoke machine to add to the ambiance. The very attractive dude bartender made my 3 friends an Irish car bomb on my request. Great.PS: Bring a good ID; you get carded twice. Once at the door and the next time at the bar.Further details:The smoke machine smelled like flowery toilet sanitizer and the lounger area was around 15 decibels too loud for meaningful chatter so you can only resort to drinking shots and lychee martinis. That's fine if you want a cheesy shi shi night like going to a tiki bar with good friends but I don't recommend it if you're on a date.

1.description: Bought a nice bamboo plant, some insense, and chopstick rests. Also some nice flat chinese soup spoons here. The woman at the counter was very nice and friendly. We discussed making egg drop soup! They had alot of stuff at fair prices. Next time i visit chinatown, i will stop by for sure.

2.description: LOVE this store, it is a good souvenir and gift place. There's sooooo much inside and you can always find something fun - traditional Chinese items like gowns, slippers, Hello Kitty, chopsticks, plates and teapots, little figurines to my favorite items - jewelry! Real jade bracelets, necklaces and rings. There are many items for under $10 and even surprise boxes for $1. The staff is always friendly and check out the fun signs that rhyme around the store - don't break anything!

0.description: went here before dinner @ -big- three's happiness to shop for decor for my chinese new year party. i'm not chinese, but my roommate is half, so it was an excellent excuse for a celebration.after wandering in a few different gift shops in the area, we bought all our items here because the prices were right, and the service was super friendly! they translated all the signs we got, helped us find great garments to wear to our party (i got the cutest shirt for $15!), and gave us a bunch of freebie treats once we completed our order.these shops tend to all look alike after visiting more than one, so my advice is to keep this as your last stop and purchase all those things you've been eyeing here!

58.description: I really like the decor and the food is decent but the service is terrible. It took a good 10 minutes for someone to take our order and it wasn't like it was busy. I had a question about the menu but my waiter didn't know the answer and did not bother to even try. Instead he seemed annoyed that I would ask a question. Although the food came at a fast pace the plate that my spring roll came on had gunk on it's edges. It was almost like they didn't wash the plate well every time it was used. Now I was born and raised here, when someone feeds me or hands me anything I'd say thank you because I genuinely mean it. I didn't understand why my girlfriend and I were ignored when thanking someone while trying to make eye contact. It seemed like they just plopped our food on the table and left. I'm not making this up but this must be the worst experience ever because a large party came and the staff moved us mid meal. At this point all I did was laugh and comply, but I personally would never move patrons mid meal and if I had to I'd offer something for their inconvenience. Nevertheless the food was decent but I would not come back if I have to pay out of my own pocket. If a friend wanted to buy me a meal and they are dying to have Pho then sure thanks for the free noodles.

56.description: I was so excited to find a Thai delivery to my neighborhood.  The food was delivered in the time specified, and like a lot of other reviewers said was piping hot.  I ordered the Pad See Ewe - my go-to to compare the restaurant.  I was very satisfied with that dish and will DEFINITELY order it again.I also ordered the chicken Pad Thai.  The chicken was dry, but otherwise the flavors were spot on.The amount of food you get for one order could feed you in two sittings if you are not starving.  I think the value was good - considering they do NOT skimp on the meat.I will stop in another time to try the sandwiches so I get more familiar with their menu.

29.description: This place use to be good, the pho completely change. There soup taste like shit and the service sucks. I ask for a #15 large with extra meatball and 2 Vietnamese spring roll. They gave me the pho without the extra meatball and forgot my Vietnamese spring roll. I been going to this restaurant for plenty of years and gave them so many chance. I don't think I will ever go back again. Even Joy Yee have better pho than this place. Sorry to say, you guys lost a customer.

42.description: On a cold Monday, we decided to order something different. We decided to try this place out.  I ordered the Bangkok Chicken which was supposed to be hot and spicy was anything but. My fiancé ordered a couple different things. One dish in particular was the roast duck curry. As she was eating we found a bug in it. Completely fucking disgusting   Pictures attached

23.description: Stumbled upon this place because cafe hoang is closed early on Thursdays and I can say it's definitely not as good.  I ordered the chicken vermicelli to go they gave me pork instead and the lettuce in both my dish and spring rolls did not seem very fresh.   Kind of a big disappointment as I was really craving good Vietnamese food.

47.description: i believe that the restaurant has changed ownership at least two times suce my first review. i frequent the place as usual when i am in chicago. recently, they remodeled the place and it looks alot better and cleaner. the portion, howver, seem to shrink, but they have maintained the taste well.

8.description: Pretty chill place. I would go back again if I'm in the area.

31.description: Had a Bahn MI and spicy basil rice, with sesame wings delivered. The wings were soggy and tasted old, the sandwich tasted ok, very skimpy on ingredients. There were no descriptions on the menu. The rice is what got me the most. I've had basil rice before and it's not a carton of stir fried meat and vegetables with a side of white rice. I wouldn't have ordered it if there had been a description. I'll go somewhere else for Vietnamese next time.

34.description: The soup base for the pho lacked flavor and the spring rolls seemed like they didn't have enough substance. The peanut sauce was good though. Overall, a solid meh in my books.

16.description: I've been here several times before and after the interior remodeling. I've come to the conclusion that service is poor and I'll begin looking for other restaurants that serve pho in the Chinatown area. Positives: pho is cheap and plentiful.Service is extremely poor. Customers seat themselves so it's good that we can pick our own tables. The place was practically empty, yet there were dirty tables and plenty of staff (or people who seemed to work there) who could have cleaned the tables but didn't. What were they waiting for? There were only 2 tables there, and it took 5 minutes before the server came to our table to take our order. We weren't given any cups of water on our last visit on a Friday night. We tried to make eye contact with the server several times but she looked down and continued to do whatever personal thing she was doing behind the counter. Pho is okay if you have a craving for it and can't think of anywhere else to go nearby. I usually get the small pho with steak and brisket. The beef brisket is quite fatty and there isn't much meat in the bowl (maybe about 5 thin slices of meat). However, the bean sprouts are crunchy and jalapeno peppers are fresh and spicy. Mint leaves are washed and fresh. Lime is juicy.Portions are big. A small will fill you up quite well. A large is too much and can be shared between 2 people for healthy portions. The soup is hot. The Sriracha and Hoisin sauce on the table seemed to be old as the top was crusted and sticky from the sauce. I'm glad the sauces were offered. The tables are also well-stocked with chopsticks, spoons, and napkins.

13.description: I went here two days straight and for both days the customer service was horrible. On day 1 the waitress talked to me like I was slow and on day two all the waitresses gave me and my friends an attitude. The waitress even gave my friend the wrong order of food after waiting for such a long period for all our foods to come. And not only that we paid for our food and they didn't even give us change back until we asked for it; they just assumed that they could keep it. When asked for the change they gave us an attitude again, like why would you expect tip when you gave us an attitude for two days straight? They even talked about us in front of our faces because they thought we couldn't understand Chinese since we ordered in English.

11.description: We ate here a few nights ago. We had the shrimp egg fu young, shrimp fried rice and sliced chicken noodle soup with cabbage. The food was just okay. It was fine for a late night dinner. I gave it 2 stars because an hour after leaving the restaurant I started vomiting intensely. I was dizzy as well. It lasted for about 15 hours. Ugg. It was awful! No need to visit again.Even still, their service was really good :)

39.description: Probably the worst service in Chinatown or any Pho place ever. You need to flag someone down to get the menu, order food, get the check and pay. It's not like the place is big, you can see people waiting and staring at the servers from across the room.When you go in, I guarantee there will be dirty tables because nobody has cleaned them off. I seriously can't wait until a real Pho place opens and puts these people out of business.

37.description: Extremely disappointed. The only thing keeping it a one star is -- I can't get it even lower && the waitress kept our water filled.Bun Bo Hue - Too sweet and needs more flavor. Noodles were okay but had black stuff in it. Thought it was black pepper but turned out to be burnt things probably from the pot it was cooked in. Wtf?!? Pho - Flavorless. The worst pho I have experienced. I have been to countless places and is Vietnamese myself. This is not good. The noodles were even crap. The hoisin sauce is soooo thick, why? Fresh Spring Rolls - Very Americanized. Peanut sauce was okay. But wayyyy to pricey.Service - Not - so - friendly type of people plus was not Vietnamese ( usually it's a plus to ensure Authentic) was seated way and had to connect two tables for our 6. Was to close to other group on people literally not even 5 inches apart from them. Did not get water for everyone but did manage to keep out cups filled.

0.description: I moved to Chicago from Texas, where the Vietnamese food is plentiful and I can eat pho once a week without feeling guilty. For some reason, that's not the same here in Chicago but nonetheless, I have finally found a pho place that I can keep on coming back to.You'll find The Noodle tucked along the street of Wentworth Ave (beyond the Chinatown gate/statue thing). I ordered the beef pho noodle w/ steak meat & brisket. The pho soup was great and I enjoyed it a lot. If you're looking for a "decent" pho place, just come here. This might be the best pho you'll get in Chicago to be honest... There are several other non-Vietnamese food options on the menu. I haven't tried them yet but possibly in the near future because they also deliver in the area. Service for our table was pretty attentive. If you don't seem to be getting the service you need/want, just give one of the waitresses a stare down and they'll come to your table eventually! They just need to be notified.

38.description: One of my friends and I were craving bunbohue (Spicy Pork Noodle Soup, #22 on the menu) for lunch while working in downtown and this place is the closest to us vs. the restaurants in Argyle. We've always been to Café Hoang by Cermak but they were closed temporarily on Thursdays so we decided to give this place a try. I thought their bunbohue was okay and just average.. When I normally go to a viet restaurant, they would include cabbages for their bunbohue. For this place in particular, they gave us bean sprouts (same as if I were to order a pho) instead of the raw cabbages. I'm not Viet so I don't know if it matters or not but I've always had my bunbohue with cabbages. They only included one small piece of pork bone and 2 tiny pieces of pig's bloods. The broth wasn't bad but I had better. I've read on yelp that their pho is good so maybe it really depends on what you order from here. I knocked a star off for the little meat they put in my bunbohue. Our server did not know any English when my friend told her to not include any beef in her noodle soup. She demanded us to just speak Chinese to her instead which we did but still, what if you were to encounter a non-Chinese customer someday? What are you going to do then? I knocked out another a star for their poor customer service. Overall, this place isn't bad if you are in the downtown area and want something quick on your lunch break.

51.description: Nice looking place.  Their pho is pretty decent - I'm Vietnamese and have eaten pho from all over the world hehe.  The pho could use a little more stuff in it, but it tastes fine.  My friend ordered Bun Bo Hue, which was real bad.  I guess if you order aviary food, just stick with pho?  The service was a bit slow too; you really need to flag them for attention.  I haven't been super impressed with Viet food in Chinatown in General; Argyle is much better.

27.description: I love the decor and the service here. The decor is really new and fresh compared to the other restaurants in the area, which are very outdated. The servers were quick and brought our food and check as soon as we were ready.Despite those winning qualities, I thought the food was mediocre. Keep in mind that I have eaten a lot of Vietnamese dishes, so I can be very critical. I ordered shrimp spring rolls and I thought there was too much lettuce and barely any noodles. They could be considered healthier though. Also, I did not like the dipping sauce. Personally, I don't like hoisin sauce. Other places mix the sauce with peanut butter, which hides the flavor for me. This sauce was just plain hoisin. I also thought the crab rangoon wasn't that flavorful. It was lacking salt and I didn't see any green onions. The wrapper was a lot harder than what I'm used to. Usually they have bubbles when they're fried so it's very light and flaky. I also think the rangoon was not stuffed as full as it could have been.For the main course, I ordered seafood pho. I think the broth was pretty good. I feel like they skimped on the seafood, lime and vegetables though. I like to dump vegetables in mine because it makes me feel healthy. You could tell the seafood came from a frozen bag. It was not fresh, which I should expect because I'm in the Midwest. However, the shrimp should have been fresh and deveined. The last thing I ordered was a mango fruit smoothie. It was tasty but I could tell that it wasn't fresh because the fibers weren't present. Either they used a can or a powder mix. Also, it was was sugary because I could feel the sugar grains when I slurped up the drink. It wasn't the best but I'm okay with the drink.Overall, the environment is great. Remember, I'm pretty critical when it comes to Vietnamese cuisine. However, this place was packed and with a lot of different types of people. That is definitely a good indicator that people like the food here.

32.description: This is was first time here.. It won't be the last time. In fact I'm going tomorrow.  It was a great experience.  Great food and loved the environment.   I decided to come this restaurant because I wanted to step outside the box. Try something new.  I was impressed with the customer services. The waitress was so kind to me.  She recommended a entrée that's considered a sampler of different types.  I was surprised by the cost of the bill.. $18.44 one person.   I had gotten a lot.. Large bowl noddles with shrimps and crabs, green tea and sampler of dumpling, batter shrimps, wrapped shrimp with spinach glad chicken.. Dipping sauce Carmel peanut butter. & etc many more.. Check out the pictures

54.description: I've only done pick-up and delivery from this place. So my experience with them (and rating) is base on those two areas. Love the Pho from here. Always great and for the price you get more than you bargain for. Although when I do pick up I feel like the dine in portion are bigger, which makes me want to dine in. They recently remodeled as well and it's definitely more welcoming. Overall when it comes to Pho, it's the place to come. I haven't tried the rest of the menu but I can't wait for my first dine in experience.

48.description: We went on Columbus Day for an early dinner around 4:30 and the restaurant was almost full except for a couple tables. We thought this was a good sign that they were busy. Since we were a large group we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. They placed us in a table too small for 3 adults and 4 kids. Luckily the table next to us left and we took over the table for 2. We waited another 10 minutes for glasses of water. Then we waited some more for someone to take our order but no one stopped at our table so we had to stop a waitress to ask if someone can take our order. I don't know how a waitress can ignore a table with 4 tired and hungry kids, but maybe that's why no one stopped at our table (?). I had to say something to another waitress about us waiting for service and she said they were busy. True, but I can also see a staff of 4 other women walking around the restaurant. The food was good. We had pho, ban xeo, egg rolls, spring rolls and shrimp rolls. The ban xeo had a little more thicker batter than I care for. I prefer them to be light and crisp. The pho was good unfortunately, at the end of enjoying her bowl of pho, my friend discovered a long piece of hair. We showed a waitress and she didn't apologize to it but took the cost of it off our bill. Ugh. Watch out for the floors too! They wet and felt greasy. Granted it had rained that day and the last couple previous days, but it was dangerously slippery. I nearly slipped 3 times while there. I will never ever go back again!

44.description: I've been here several times before and after the interior remodeling. I've come to the conclusion that service is poor and I'll begin looking for other restaurants that serve pho in the Chinatown area. Positives: pho is cheap and plentiful.Service is extremely poor. Customers seat themselves so it's good that we can pick our own tables. The place was practically empty, yet there were dirty tables and plenty of staff (or people who seemed to work there) who could have cleaned the tables but didn't. What were they waiting for? There were only 2 tables there, and it took 5 minutes before the server came to our table to take our order. We weren't given any cups of water on our last visit on a Friday night. We tried to make eye contact with the server several times but she looked down and continued to do whatever personal thing she was doing behind the counter. Pho is okay if you have a craving for it and can't think of anywhere else to go nearby. I usually get the small pho with steak and brisket. The beef brisket is quite fatty and there isn't much meat in the bowl (maybe about 5 thin slices of meat). However, the bean sprouts are crunchy and jalapeno peppers are fresh and spicy. Mint leaves are washed and fresh. Lime is juicy.Portions are big. A small will fill you up quite well. A large is too much and can be shared between 2 people for healthy portions. The soup is hot. The Sriracha and Hoisin sauce on the table seemed to be old as the top was crusted and sticky from the sauce. I'm glad the sauces were offered. The tables are also well-stocked with chopsticks, spoons, and napkins.

24.description: I went here for late lunch/dinner yesterday with a friend. My friend ordered an meatball pho and for me I ordered a bowl of pho with every type of meat. Beef tripe is my favorite, so of course I had to take that as my first bite. As I bit it I noticed the texture of the tripe was really mushy and it didn't taste right. But I was hungry so I continued with my bowl of pho. After a few hours I started to have stomach pain and fever. This continued till the next day (today). And yes, I believe I've got food poisoning. This bowl of pho is what I ate the whole day, so I can't blame anything else. This place is not sanitary, nor the food is fresh either. I will not come back. If you guys want some "real" pho, just drive a little further to argyle.

7.description: I love the decor and the service here. The decor is really new and fresh compared to the other restaurants in the area, which are very outdated. The servers were quick and brought our food and check as soon as we were ready.Despite those winning qualities, I thought the food was mediocre. Keep in mind that I have eaten a lot of Vietnamese dishes, so I can be very critical. I ordered shrimp spring rolls and I thought there was too much lettuce and barely any noodles. This sauce was just plain hoisin. I also thought the crab rangoon wasn't that flavorful. It was lacking salt and I didn't see any green onions. The wrapper was a lot harder than what I'm used to. Usually they have bubbles when they're fried so it's very light and flaky. I also think the rangoon was not stuffed as full as it could have been.For the main course, I ordered seafood pho. You could tell the seafood came from a frozen bag. It was not fresh, which I should expect because I'm in the Midwest. However, the shrimp should have been fresh and deveined. The last thing I ordered was a mango fruit smoothie. It was tasty but I could tell that it wasn't fresh because the fibers weren't present. Either they used a can or a powder mix. Also, it was was sugary because I could feel the sugar grains when I slurped up the drink. It wasn't the best but I'm okay with the drink.Overall, the environment is great. Remember, I'm pretty critical when it comes to Vietnamese cuisine. However, this place was packed and with a lot of different types of people. That is definitely a good indicator that people like the food here.

49.description: Ordered food for the first time and everything is delicious!!  Delivery was fast and Pho soup came in piping hot.  I love the use of aromatic herbs , make food taste so fresh.  We also ordered Pad thai and lemon grass chicken on rice, both are tasty.  Price is good deal  too for the portion and quality..  Can't comment on service since I never dine-in but this will be my go-to delivery for sure.

40.description: My friend and I went there once for dinner and only ate pho. It gave both me and my friend diarrhea, making the both of us feel uncomfortable for the rest of the night.  I told my uncle about that place and he said he went once and said it also made him shit crazy. The noodles, meat and the broth were pretty dark as if they were days old. This place is unsanitary and it's nothing compared to Le's Pho in Argyle. Le's Pho is good and it doesn't give me diarrhea. Oh well, never going there again. If you want some real, authentic Vietnamese noodles, go to Argyle and not some Chinese restaurant that sells Vietnamese noodles because they obviously don't know what they're doing.

53.description: New decor but same crappy service.  Only decent pho place in Chinatown so they have a nice monopoly on it.  The place is small and they cramp too many tables in there.  Service sooooooo bad.

30.description: This place needs to get their delivery shit in order. We ordered through GrubHub and the estimated time came and passed. Still nothing. We called the restaurant direct since GrubHub was experiencing a high volume of calls. The lady at the restaurant who answered the phone asked what was our address. She then said in Cantonese, which I can understand the language, in the background to someone else "They said that their food is not there yet." She then comes back on the phone and said "Your food is still here" implying that our food was ready, and just not sent out for delivery. Um what the hell and why. It had been an hour since we ordered. Was our food just sitting there? That was what it sounded like. NOT cool. Then she puts us on hold again and I hear her asking the person in the background, "How long does it take from here to their address?" Umm was she talking to the delivery guy, and was the delivery guy just sitting at the restaurant not doing his job. Then she comes back on the phone and to tell us that it will take another 25 mins. All in all, it took 1 hr 40 mins for the food to get here from the time we placed our order.Of course when the pho arrived, the soup was room temperature and the noodle was cold and hence stuck together. Don't even bother with the spring roll. It is filled with lettuce and just a few strings of vermicelli.

46.description: A not-so-friendly spot in the Windy City with just average food.The pho was middling.  Their nem ra, referred to as "meat egg rolls" on the menu, were sub par.  The cucumber salad was awful.  The crab rangoon (not a Vietnamese creation) however was pretty good. The menu is not dominated by Vietnamese dishes, which I thought would be the case as it bills itself as a Vietnamese restaurant.  The Noodle's offerings are weighted towards Thai cooking actually.It's not the cleanest place.  Dirty dishes sat on table tops way longer than I was comfortable with.Another Yelper wrote it is a chain restaurant but I believe that is inaccurate.Located in the heart of Chinatown, it has decent pricing but bad vibes.

1.description: Probably the closest place for pho in my neighborhood is I checked this place out. It's in the heart of Chinatown which can sometimes be terrible for parking.I looked at the menu and the thing I really appreciated were the prices. It's pretty cheap! Pho normally isn't expensive in general, but thumbs up for keeping things more than reasonable.I got the pho is it was pretty decent. The toppings were good, the noodles were good. The only thing holding it back is the broth. It's more salt that a full pho broth. I had to drink a lot of water with my bowl. I was left pretty full though.This place is decent for pho with good prices. Worth a try.

55.description: I've seen this place for several years and never sure if I should give it a try. Even looked it up on YELP for pho and it wasn't listed?!? It's a Pho house and it's pretty nicely decorated and clean for an Asian place. It's a small cafe that seats about 30-35 people and I came strictly for the pho and was pleasantly surprised to find good traditional pho with all the fixin's: fresh basil and beansprouts, lime and jalapeno peppers. I was very disappointed with the spring rolls and noticed around the restaurant while waiting for the slow service to take my order that many people ordered what looked like onion rings so I'll have to figure that one out the nice time I go in, but the spring rolls have lettuce instead of other veggies and only 1 piece of shrimp and 1 small piece of pork so very unimpressive except for the sauce which was good. I will be back to test out the service again, but the food was served quickly.

9.description: We went as a group of 8. Not too accommodating for groups with kids, especially since it's smaller place. Nevertheless, we had a great dining experience with the beef and tripe pho, as well as the chicken pad see eiw. It was a great broth, with as much bean sprout and basil you can have! Although the place doesn't really seem to roll out the welcome mat proactively, this is a great place for pho for the family!

26.description: Its good. I would say its just as good as tank pho in uptown. Im from cali i know pho.

25.description: If In Chinatown this place is a must!!   Always friendly and welcoming.. food is fresh and light, never heavy or greasy. I have been coming here for over 8 years and love this place. Everyone seems to order "pho" soups in a variety of flavors. I love the #71 (temp hot) pork and shrimp over (temp cold) rice noodle and veggie dish. Needs a little saracha hot sauce and hoysen sauce.  Oooh my goodness delightful.

12.description: Food presentation was good and the food taste wonderful. The quality had been the same each time I came here and I would definitely come back for some pho.

59.description: My first choice for eating while in Chinatown are always MinHin or Ken Kee, but someone wanted noodles so here we ate. The place was packed during lunch on Monday and we came in when there was one open table. But it was yet to be cleaned. As a way of greeting, she waved us to the table as she walked to clean it. I didn't know what the process was for getting food. Do I go up to the cashier station to order? Do they bring us menus? I was able to flag down a server when she brought our neighbor's check. She looked annoyed. Looked through the menu and checked out the decor while we waited to have our waiter come by. The place is beautiful. Unlike other Chinatown joint. It's very modern and unchinese. Gorgeous wallpaper. And panel accented wall. Made me feel like I was in someone's living room on the beach. Theme was carry out into the bathroom, which was CLEAN. Stop the male waiter to take our order and he looked annoyed when I changed my pho from a small to a large. Asked for milk tea in to go cup and Vietnamese pancake. Food came out fast, but our drinks were in glass cups and our pancakes were burnt. Pho was huge and looked great, unfortunately I thought the tendons tasted funny. Broth was okay. I weight heavily on service. The staff was inattentive, slow, and borderline rude. There was absolutely no sense of urgency! As we waited for our check I saw a customer yell, "Can I get a F*****g menu!" She was hangry.

21.description: Food was really good, I enjoyed the pho and my fiancé loved the phad Thai. Service wasn't the best though they could improve on that.

17.description: A not-so-friendly spot in the Windy City with just average food.The pho was middling.  Their nem ra, referred to as "meat egg rolls" on the menu, were sub par.  The cucumber salad was awful.  The crab rangoon (not a Vietnamese creation) however was pretty good. The menu is not dominated by Vietnamese dishes, which I thought would be the case as it bills itself as a Vietnamese restaurant.  The Noodle's offerings are weighted towards Thai cooking actually.It's not the cleanest place.  Dirty dishes sat on table tops way longer than I was comfortable with.Another Yelper wrote it is a chain restaurant but I believe that is inaccurate.Located in the heart of Chinatown, it has decent pricing but bad vibes.

10.description: If In Chinatown this place is a must!!   Always friendly and welcoming.. food is fresh and light, never heavy or greasy. I have been coming here for over 8 years and love this place. Everyone seems to order "pho" soups in a variety of flavors. I love the #71 (temp hot) pork and shrimp over (temp cold) rice noodle and veggie dish. Needs a little saracha hot sauce and hoysen sauce.  Oooh my goodness delightful.

5.description: This place suffices for a pho craving. Only $6.39 for a small and $7.69 for a large. Good selection. Good price. Decent pho and soup.But for the love of god, do not get the shaved ice dessert. It is literally crushed ice (not even fully crushed, I had chunks of ice I had to break myself) with the toppings you specified. I wanted vanilla ice cream and they said they were out. It is basically bingsoo, but they can't imagine to get it right.

3.description: Delicious pho. We went here on a night that it was raining and there wasn't much for parking in the street. That's typical for Chicago anyway. The food was very good and served quickly. There's a lot of similar restaurants in that particular area and this one seemed to be serving the most people.

35.description: Poor customer service. Only thing we got was water! Employees were just standing around too. Worst part was customers who came in after us got their orders taken right away and was treated like how customers are suppose to be treated. Very disappointing experience!

19.description: This place needs to get their delivery shit in order. We ordered through GrubHub and the estimated time came and passed. Still nothing. We called the restaurant direct since GrubHub was experiencing a high volume of calls. The lady at the restaurant who answered the phone asked what was our address. She then said in Cantonese, which I can understand the language, in the background to someone else "They said that their food is not there yet." She then comes back on the phone and said "Your food is still here" implying that our food was ready, and just not sent out for delivery. Um what the hell and why. It had been an hour since we ordered. Was our food just sitting there? That was what it sounded like. NOT cool. Then she puts us on hold again and I hear her asking the person in the background, "How long does it take from here to their address?" Umm was she talking to the delivery guy, and was the delivery guy just sitting at the restaurant not doing his job. Then she comes back on the phone and to tell us that it will take another 25 mins. All in all, it took 1 hr 40 mins for the food to get here from the time we placed our order.Of course when the pho arrived, the soup was room temperature and the noodle was cold and hence stuck together. Don't even bother with the spring roll. It is filled with lettuce and just a few strings of vermicelli.

28.description: Got delivery from Grub Hub. Thank you for filling the void when i'm craving true authentic Vietnamese comfort food. You guys rock! Sping rolls 2 ways were fantastic. The adventurous soup was phenomenal. Panang curry, spot. One of the best Tom Yum Soup. Only miss was the pad thai. Other than that will be ordering from here again.

45.description: This place is teetering on the line of average and below average. My friend and I came here for lunch. The place was not packed, so I had trouble figuring out why we were being ignored while we stood in the entry waiting to be seated. After a few minutes, I decided we were going to sit ourselves. We found a table towards the back that was filthy, yet, less filthy than the other empty tables. Someone came to give us menus and did not even offer to clean up the table (water, food crumbs, and pieces of straw wrappings) so I took one of their nice napkins and wiped everything off and onto the floor.From the moment we got our menus to the moment someone took our order was around 15 minutes. I ordered the Thai iced tea and the lad lar. Both were bland, but the helpings were huge. After a while, the place got super busy (I can't imagine why) and we were ignored even more. However, when it was time for us to pay the bill, they moved fast and were on top of their sh*t. The employees were uninviting, rude, grouchy, and unfriendly. I'll never come here again.

33.description: I came here with my friend for lunch since we were pretty hungry and wanted something cheap and quick. Parking in this area is a bit difficult to find, but after driving around for 10 min, we were able to find metered parking right in front of the restaurant. Chinese restaurants generally have low standards for service, but this one truly set the bar!  I wasn't even greeted or taken to a table when I walked in, the waitresses were just standing around not doing anything ,I was really shocked. I just seated myself and asked for a vietnamese iced coffee, which I assumed they would have since it is a vietnamese restaurant, but when they brought it out it was so obvious it was just instant coffee.  It wasn't even iced ..I ordered the banh xeo, pho, and my friend ordered the pork chop fried rice and beef skewers.  The banh xeo was surprisingly tasty for the price only $6!!!, and it was huge! It was stuffed with bean sprouts and pork pieces.  They gave me a large size pho, even though I asked for a small, and since you can't take pho to go, I ended up wasting all the noodles which I felt horrible about. My friends pork chop rice was huge for the price, but since the pork chop was so fatty there wasn't that much actual meat he could eat. The beef skewers were pretty tasty, but not worth the $6 appetizer price. I probably wouldn't come here again, the vietnamese "iced" coffee was disgusting, and the service was cringeworthy, especially since they screwed up on so many items.

43.description: Best Pho shop in town. Interior is very clean, modern, and comfy, definitely above any other pho shops I've been to in Chicago.

2.description: So as I mentioned in my last review, I have a lot of mixed emotions of this place. The past three times I've been here I have ordered pho. Two of them being the spicy beef noodle soup (bun bo hue). The bun bo hue is way too salty and I feel like I could and want to down a bottle of water each time I am done eating here. What bothers me the most is that they never bring enough beansprouts for my noodles. I like a lot of beansprouts in my pho and bun bo hue. Whenever I ask for more they look at me like that is an outrageous request. Even when they do bring more, it is still not enough for me and my party. I am hesitant to ask for even more because they will probably think I am crazy at that point. Point is, look lady, I need my sprouts!

18.description: I tried for couple times for delivery,once i called around 9:15 they said delivery guy already left,I understand I'm too late,and second time after I repeat my address over 4times they call me back they don't come here。（even if not 5min away to the shop) I like the noodles there,  but the services was soooo bad

41.description: A while back, I had a pho craving, and I was downtown, so this was the closest place to go. However, when we got there, the doors were still open, but the kitchen was closed. But that few seconds inside the restaurant gave me a whiff of the amazing aroma of the pho, and I said I would come back one day.  I finally got a chance, and I didn't regret it at all. The broth is pretty amazing, and the meat was delicious and the veggies were fresh. I order the small bowl which was the perfect side.   I was excited to see soda, lime and egg yolk drink on the menu. It's a very Vietnamese thing and you won't see it anywhere else, and it is usually very good! But I can tell they used a flat and/or inferior brand of soda, and this drink left me disappointed.  If I'm ever in this area again, and want pho, I would not hesitate to come back.

52.description: Very nice decor in old chinatown. The food is great, especially the pho. they sort of went panasian though (you can find pho, chinese and thai food) which probably decreases the quality. the service isnt the greatest, but the waitresses were friendly. I will be back

50.description: 2 Stars only...decided to give this place another run since it got a bit updated and I must say still the same awful service as before.

4.description: The beef brisket noodle was flame and so was the Oreo shake !!! Came here looking for pho because it was the closest place to where we stay (Everything is up north).but the prices are cheap the pho is good, me and my gf came in and we smaaaashed lol. Anyone who likes pho or noodles or food even should definitely come eat here.

6.description: I came here with my friend for lunch since we were pretty hungry and wanted something cheap and quick. Parking in this area is a bit difficult to find, but after driving around for 10 min, we were able to find metered parking right in front of the restaurant. Chinese restaurants generally have low standards for service, but this one truly set the bar!  I wasn't even greeted or taken to a table when I walked in, the waitresses were just standing around not doing anything ,I was really shocked. I just seated myself and asked for a vietnamese iced coffee, which I assumed they would have since it is a vietnamese restaurant, but when they brought it out it was so obvious it was just instant coffee.  It wasn't even iced ..I ordered the banh xeo, pho, and my friend ordered the pork chop fried rice and beef skewers.  The banh xeo was surprisingly tasty for the price only $6!!!, and it was huge! It was stuffed with bean sprouts and pork pieces.  They gave me a large size pho, even though I asked for a small, and since you can't take pho to go, I ended up wasting all the noodles which I felt horrible about. My friends pork chop rice was huge for the price, but since the pork chop was so fatty there wasn't that much actual meat he could eat. The beef skewers were pretty tasty, but not worth the $6 appetizer price. I probably wouldn't come here again, the vietnamese "iced" coffee was disgusting, and the service was cringeworthy, especially since they screwed up on so many items.

22.description: To begin with, My friends and I chose The Noodle because of its appearance in cleanliness, however little did we know we were in for a very rude awakening. The wait staff came off somewhat polite at first and when my friends orders came out first before mine (they ordered each the pho bowls while I had the beef Vietnamese sandwich) it took a bit longer than expected to arrive. When I asked about my order, it was taken to a different table and the waitress had the audacity to ask me if I still wanted it.      First, no way was I going to take it since I had no knowledge whether the person touched it or not, & even if he didn't I still wouldn't have taken it. It's gross and I took it offense to be honest. Who asks that and more importantly, I understand mistakes happen but the waitress knew my order. It's not that bad to remember.     Second, the waitress rolled her eyes and agreed to make a new one yet, it came out less than five minutes afterwards. I wouldn't had been shocked if it was the same sandwich but my friends convinced me to give the benefit of the doubt. The sandwich still was cold and didn't  taste well at all.    Thirdly, the other waitresses were just as rude and we're giving us death stares that gave me a very unwelcome feeling. Even speaking in their native language I perfectly understood they were talking about my friends and I.      And fourthly, our waitress never even bothered to ask us about refills on our drinks ( even before the sandwich incident took place) or check up on us if we needed anything else the entire time we were there. Never again shall I go to this restaurant nor I do recommend it at all. The prices are fairly nice but upon reading the other reviews on its roach issues and it's horrible staff, I would suggest somewhere else and avoid this place at all times. I definitely am from now.

15.description: I love this place. My favorite place to get pho, better than argyle and closer to my home. I always pho number 44, and it's delicious. I always get their Thai tea and wow it's just creamy and so good. I love to one with friends here and we all love it. I haven't eat the other dishes only the pho, but one day I will lol. The service is good the ladies are nice and very fast. Love this place.

57.description: A lovely little place in Chinatown. A bit hard to find parking, as always is the case when Chinatown is busy. It has Thai and Vietnamese food and both are high quality. They recently remodeled, so the place looks nicer than before. I entered in to be nicely greeted with a glass of water and a menu. A few minutes later, they came to me to take my order. My favorite in Pho is the #17; it never fails to taste good. What also is nice is that they understand English, so non-Chinese speakers have a nice time eating. The waiters/waitresses all are very nice people. The food came out quickly even with my specific requests and additions. I have been here multiple times and always treat myself to this place if I get the chance.

20.description: Great food.., rode the bikes through Chicago all afternoon, needed a good meal. Busy place with locals. Nice friendly service.

36.description: The banh mi are incredibly disappointing especially with how marked up they are! Even Subways could probably make a better sandwich. The bread seemed stale and hard - not the toasty kind, it was just like a crumbly rock. The toppings are very basic and even then, they're soooo skimpy. I believe I opened a sandwich and just found three paper thin cucumber slices and a sprinkle of carrots. There was a squirt of mayo here and there but ultimately, the few bits of beef is what pushed me over the egg.The pho is pretty good though, and that's usually what I order. It's not even close to Tank Pho, but for the price and size they give you along with a heaping helpful of toppings, I'd say it's decent.The ladies at the counter seem really sweet and they answer questions if you speak in Cantonese, but otherwise, I think they're a bit unhelpful due to the language barrier. The interior is very pretty since they redecorated, but I always order to go since it seems hard to find a seat.

14.description: This place is teetering on the line of average and below average. My friend and I came here for lunch. The place was not packed, so I had trouble figuring out why we were being ignored while we stood in the entry waiting to be seated. After a few minutes, I decided we were going to sit ourselves. We found a table towards the back that was filthy, yet, less filthy than the other empty tables. Someone came to give us menus and did not even offer to clean up the table (water, food crumbs, and pieces of straw wrappings) so I took one of their nice napkins and wiped everything off and onto the floor.From the moment we got our menus to the moment someone took our order was around 15 minutes. I ordered the Thai iced tea and the lad lar. Both were bland, but the helpings were huge. After a while, the place got super busy (I can't imagine why) and we were ignored even more. However, when it was time for us to pay the bill, they moved fast and were on top of their sh*t. The employees were uninviting, rude, grouchy, and unfriendly. I'll never come here again.

29.description: i am Chinese,best Chinese restaurant in Chicago i got so far.

42.description: Went here for dinner after the Chinatown Fair on Sunday and I thought it'd be a great experience. But boyyyy am I wrong.When we went inside, there was only one family eating so it was not busy at all. We were seated promptly and given menus. But that's when everything went down hill with the service.  We ordered the cold spicy chicken appetizer which was okay. We also had the dry chili chicken which was HORRIBLE because they cheaped out and gave us mostly fried bread crumbs. Their Mapo tofu was also inedible because it had too much white powder and it left a disgusting after taste. The spicy fish filet soup and the bok choy was okay. We also ordered some spicy ribs as recommended by out waitress, and when the dish came out, it was so small!! There was barely any meat on the ribs! I have posted a picture of it so you can check it out.After our food came out, all the staff members started to eat dinner and that's when the service stopped. No one came to refill our water, tea, or checked to see if we needed anything else. They were too busy eating to realize that we were waving  at them to get the check. After finally receiving our check, no one came back to our table to pick it up so we had to walk up there to pay, and they made it seem like it was our fault for disturbing their dinner for trying to pay. This place needs to get their act together. Not a great impression if they are trying to attract customers.  I'd rather eat the the original Lao Szechuan restaurant in Chinatown square. Better food and WAYYYY better service.

23.description: Food here just isn't very good, at least it wasn't on my visit.I ordered the cold szechuan noodles for an appetizer, expecting a typical dan-dan noodles dish. The sauce had the barest hint of sesame oil or peanut flavor and had an unsettling gritty or pasty consistency (hard to describe, really). An order of double-cooked pork had so much salt that it was inedible, not to mention that the pork belly strips were tough and did not seem very fresh, and the dish was otherwise lacking in any other flavorings. Lamb sauteed Xin Jiang style was very dry and overwhelmed by the amount of cumin (and I usually like lamb with cumin). The only dish I liked was the wood ears fungus, but that was not enough to save the meal.

47.description: Yet another Szechuan venue in good ole Chinatown...My friend and I finally gave it a try. We ordered the Szechuan dumplings in red spicy oil, husband and wife's lung-side beef, and Szechuan noodles with brisket. Believe me, none of those dishes are as frightening as their mouthful, lack-of-English-sense, names. The dumplings were actually swimming in a bowl of hot and oily sauce but they were tasty. The dumpling wrap was thin and they were filled with pork. The lung-side beef slices were topped with an overly-generous portion of cilantro. If you like it, great. If not, have fun picking them out. I enjoyed them but my dinner mate wouldn't have any of it. The Szechuan noodles are NOT house-made. Don't expect any of those elastic and light tasting textures. The portion was generous but I doubt I will order it again. Parking was easy considering how it was a weekday around 9pm. Service was quick and polite. And the interior is a huge upgrade from the previous establishment! Note: All three of those dishes were spicy and oily. They didn't sit too well...

8.description: We were visiting from Houston and wanted to go to Chinatown for dinner. Our cab driver was Chinese and he asked if we liked spicy food and if we wanted authentic Chinese food. He highly recommended this restaurant. Inside is clean, the staff was very friendly. The food was beyond amazing!!! Between the three of us we had Tea Leaf Smoked Duck, Fried Lamb in Cumin and Pork Ribs. Again, I can't tell you just how amazing the food is. Thanks Zhimin!!!

31.description: Recently, A Chinese student of mine recommended this restaurant. He said it was the most authentic Chinese food he's eaten since coming to the United States. I have to say this is probably the best Chinese food I've ever had. The storefront is really unremarkable and you could easily walk by without a second thought. However, once you're inside the restaurant opens up into a large modern staircase and an elegant dining room decorated with modern Chinese decor. I was really surprised when I walked in.I tried all of the dishes my student recommended. I might be forgetting something but I think I tried the following: frog legs, tree fungus, pork skin, cold steamed chicken, crab and tofu soup, ma po tofu, eggplant in garlic sauce, whole steamed fish, pork ribs, and these potatoes that were sliced thin like noodles. I can't recall the name of that last dish but it was delicious. I've never had anything like that. You slurp up some noodles but it's like eating a baked potato. The tree fungus was probably my favorite. It was like a Chinese salad made with mushrooms and herbs. It was a great way to start the feast. The eggplant was really popular with my group. Everyone ate a lot of it. I even took some home. Also, the pork ribs were especially noteworthy. The meat was so tender!The frog legs and pork skin weren't my favorite. I'm adventurous so I'll try anything. However, the season on the pork skin was very unusual and I didn't care for it. I'd order almost everything else again.This place is great for groups because everyone can sample a lot of different dishes without paying too much. I can't wait to go back and try some more amazing Chinese food!

34.description: I was lucky enough to go here with food industry friend who cooks similar cuisine, and has been multiple times to this restaurant. We let him handle the ordering (around 8 or 10 shared plates for the table), and he stressed to the waitress that we wanted everything that should be spicy to be very málà.Everything was excellent, and the spicy stuff was properly spicy and numbing. The two dishes that really stood out to me against the sea of málà were the tea smoked duck, and the crab curd. This is not to say that the rest wasn't equally as delicious, just that you remember the outliers.The other reviews make this place sound a bit hit or miss, but this was probably the best meal I've had anywhere in Chinatown. I did have the luxury of dining with an expert though.

16.description: My only favourite sze chuan restaurant in Chicago! Their food can't be more decent and authentic.

13.description: Best Sze Chuan Cuisine In Chicago. Very authentic and very fresh. However, I can't handle all the heat. Some dishes I have to request to have it tuned down a notch. They are very good about accommodating such requests. The servers are very friendly too, but I think they are a little short on staff.

11.description: I am native from Chengdu and this is one of the best Sichuan style chinese resturant I have been to in US. And I have been to a lot.It is good for dating, friends get together and family meals. The decor is very modern and very nicely done. The menu is very authentic and l wish I could order everything. Everything we ordered turns out to be exceptional. The service is very attentive and friendly. Price is quite reasonable.We got the shui zhu yu, moyu and duck, silk squash with tofu, ginger chicken, pickled chicken and huiguo rou. Honestly, best dishes I have had, very flavorful and nicely presented in reasonable portion. I just wish we have one near DC.

39.description: I am just going to power point this.Food: Pot Stickers - mediocre at bestKung Pao Chicken - not bad nor was it goodDuck Casserole - is a bowl full of spicy oil, with a very few (and i do mean few) chop of duck meat, some vegetables, and a hand full of dry red pepper. avoid  this and be warn, this is not a soup. if you like sucking on oil, be my guess. Price at about $20, so ridiculous... smh... Garlic Chinese broccoli - passable, probably the best dish from this order.  Service:Was okay, came late about closing time so I am not going to blame them for their slow service. they are nice tho, that is all. Overall: ... meh...

37.description: I was born and raised in Chengdu, the capital city of Sichuan, so I think I have a say what's real authentic Sichuan food.  Unlike any "Lao" series restaurants, targeting Americans, Sze Chuan cuisine is a real Sichuan restaurant, serving the dishes we actually have in Sichuan. The food here reminds me of home.  If you want to experience the real Sichuan food I highly recommend you go there.  I would give it a 5 star if the price is more reasonable - a Sichuan chili whole fish with tofu costed $27, it tastes great but I think it's a little bit pricy.

0.description: Looking for some authentic Chinese with a kick? Look no further, this place will Bruce Lee you right in the gut. It was just my wife and I so we ordered about 5 things. This meant we were able to bring some home for some more heat the next day. Here is what we got in order from best to least favorite:Special Heavens Grilled Ribs (fall right off the bone)Hot and Spicy Diced Chicken Chongqing Style (very good, but light on the chicken)Dumplings in red oil (great tasting and full of flavor)Edible Tree Fungus Villa Style (love it, but not spicy enough for me)Sautéed String Beans (very large portion)Egg Roll (they are free if you check in on Yelp, and not worth getting)Service was typical for a Chinatown spot, which means it was average. It's at the end of one of the main streets in Chinatown, so stretch your legs and do some walking afterwards.

38.description: My favorite Chinatown restaurant!I've been going there for three times and called for delivery once.If you are expecting americanized Chinese food, don't ever go there. They don't even offer fortune cookies (which is totally normal in China).This place has the most authentic Szechuan dishes and would only appeal to the ones who love Szechuan cuisine. I have friends from other parts of China also having trouble adapting to the spice level. I recommend the pig feet, and the fish fillet with preserved pickles.PS. I grew up in Szechuan, so, five stars!

51.description: beautiful interior with friendly service. we orderedshredded chicken with soy saucespecial heaven's grilled ribscrab curd with soy bean flowerfried lamb with cumineverything was cooked authentically and very flavorful! will come back for more!

27.description: I am native from Chengdu and this is one of the best Sichuan style chinese resturant I have been to in US. And I have been to a lot.It is good for dating, friends get together and family meals. The decor is very modern and very nicely done. The menu is very authentic and l wish I could order everything. Everything we ordered turns out to be exceptional. The service is very attentive and friendly. Price is quite reasonable.We got the shui zhu yu, moyu and duck, silk squash with tofu, ginger chicken, pickled chicken and huiguo rou. Honestly, best dishes I have had, very flavorful and nicely presented in reasonable portion. I just wish we have one near DC.

32.description: This restaurant will make you crave for their dishes. No kidding.A little surprised to see so many bad reviews during the past. The waitress told me they changed the chef last year so I guess that's why the food quality went up so pleasantly.A few things we tried and fall in love:Spicy Pork Kidney (Kidney? Isn't it gross. Dare to have a try? You may like the silky and strong flavor)Chinese boiled dumplingsSze-Chuan noodle with spicy sourceSauteed white cabbageFish fillet with pickled cabbageI know the food is outstandingly good but don't know if it is authentic or not. Who will trust a girl from Canton province (zero spicy cuisine most of the time) on authentic Sze-Chuan styled spicy cuisine? But my friend from Sze Chuan province loves it, so here is my bet.

54.description: Great food, great atmosphere. The servers were very friendly. We were seated on the second floor and it was a great experience.I enjoyed most of the dishes except when I bit into a szechuan pepper, it's definitely a unique taste to me.

48.description: I love love this place! is the best! If you have a group if friends, it is the best place to go! Price is very good too.

44.description: The waiters there are very nice.All the dishes are very very delicious!Highly recommended!

24.description: Tree ear mushrooms, yummm. Great food with very affordable lunch specials. I split a bowl of dan dan noodles, grilled green beans, and "edible tree fungus" (ear mushrooms with peppers in sesame oil) with a friend. We loved it all, and got out for about $20. The dining room is beautiful, too.

7.description: I like their authentic Chengdu spicy food. If you want try the real spicy, definitely go there. They use the special and good quality chili peppers to make their dishes spicy and hot! Some people may think it's too much. But that's why I like it! Spicy food is not for everybody. :-) Recommended!!

49.description: Very poor service. They declare to use cash you can get 15% off. Somehow when we ready to check out, they said there is no discount since we are sitting in the private area. We try to argue with them but they refuse to talk. If you don't take cash at private room, then mention before we sit in there. Very bad experience. Definitely wont go back.

40.description: This summarizes my dinner... Tried this place just to try a new restaurant my friends and I have never tried before but we are not returning...When you walk in the interior design and decorations may impress you but do not be fooled. This is probably the best that they could offer. We ordered an appetizer, veggie dish, and 2 different entrées. Appetizer - pot stickers- the pan fried outer skin slides off as you eat it. It does not stay intact. The flavor is just ok. Tastes like something you would buy from the supermarket. I would give it 4/10. Kung pao chicken- there were too many spices that were not well blended together . Pretty big ginger slices and hot pepper in the dish. Nice peanuts roasted along with the chicken dish but again like the appetizer. Less than mediocre. Give it a 4/10. Tasted like fast food Chinese. Edible but would I eat it again? No. Duck casserole- beware !!! Do not order this because it is first of all overpriced, hardly any meat, lots of bones, and be sure to have some heartburn/ acid reducer with you. This dish is very very spicy in a will make you sweat and cause heart burn kind of a way. The most amount of peppers I have seen in a dish! Basically looking at a soup dish that is all red in color with some meat inside. Total waste of money...Lastly ordered the garlic Chinese broccoli. This was the best thing that we ordered of the night. Texture crispy, not overcooked. May have been a little too salty but it was the best dish of the night and that is sad. Overall, would not go back to eat at this restaurant it was just someplace we went to fill our stomachs but way overpriced for food that was not satisfying to our taste buds.

53.description: I'm Chinese and my hometown is in Sichuan Province. I went there everyday for purchase a launch box. The food is exactly like what  I eat in China.It's great.

30.description: It is not fair for me to review the food, I did not order Sez Chuan style dishes.  So let's just say the standard "cantonese" dishes are ok.However, the service is horrid, the dinnerware dirty, there was a hair on one of our plates, the teapot appeared not to be washed and when we left as we were walking out the windows were just plain dirty.  This coupled with the hostess ignoring us for 10 minutes as we entered (it was 4:45 and there was a table with 8 customers and NO ONE ELSE), makes me very sure I will not be back.

46.description: Monday is usually family dinner day, so as a family we decided to chose one of the more new restaurants in Chinatown. We stumbled up Sze Chuan Cuisine. My past experience at Sze Chuan Cuisine was somewhat .... interesting and disgusting.As we entered the restaurant I noticed how nicely designed the restaurant was. The design was more modern than most of the restaurants in Chinatown and there were many tables. The restaurant was empty, and a waiter seated us immediately. As my whole family was looking at the menu, in less than 4 minutes the waiter asked to take our order. We kindly asked for a few more minutes. The menu had a wide variety of spicy foods, a menu with noodles and a menu with spicy pork and steak caught my eyes. Again, within 2 minutes the waiter asked to take our order. Now realize this is our first time in the restaurant, as I assume for most folks also because this is a fairly new restaurant (less than 2 months.) We kindly asked for a few more minutes. Our orders were finally taken, and within 5 minutes our appetizers came out, I was amazed at the speed our food came out, probably because it was a cold dish. Within another 10 minutes, the remaining of our dishes arrived. Fast food is always a plus. Now this is the part that ruined my experience. We ordered 3 bowls of noodles, and 2 appetizers, along with a dish of greens. The 3 bowls of noodles were amazing along with the 2 appetizers. As my Mom was eating from the plate of greens she stopped and closely looked at her plate. She then pushed it aside. I asked whats wrong and she said there was a bug in the greens. I quickly analyzed the dish and realized there was a maggot-like bug on top of the greens. I'm not the type of person to make a huge fuss out of unclean food, so I calmly waived the waiter over. The waiter had a shocked look and took the plate into the kitchen. Another worker then came BACK with the plate and explained why bugs were in the greens. The explanation was bugs are common in greens, and these bugs are completely EDIBLE. I'm not exaggerating what she said, I'm quoting. She said the bugs were common and EDIBLE. I don't know how many customers enjoy the view of bugs on their food and eating the bugs; but I don't think I'd ever voluntarily ask for bugs and eat bugs. Our family dinner ended right then and there, we asked for a check. And surprisingly they gave us our check, with no type of apology or compensation. A simple apology would have been better, but not one was given. They didn't offer to cook up another dish or ask if we wanted to order another dish either, so that is why a 1 star was given.Overall experience - Restaurant design/layout very nice- Food was good other than the bug in the greens- Felt rushed while looking at our menu, we were the only table within the restaurant.  That experience would be my first and last experience at Sze Chuan Restaurant.

1.description: This place does not even deserve a 1 star rating, wanted to give them a negative star for being clueless in managing an even small place. Been here couple times before, never had any experience that is better than mediocre each time, the only reason that we ended up at this place tonight was that we were seeking Szechuan food in Chinatown and didn't want to patron Lao's arrogant crap. Never bothered to write them reviews for negative experience during the prior visits, but this time I ended up with serious upset stomach immediately afterward, and the service from the staff here this time was simply brain dead, absolutely horrible. You could get more interactive and friendlier service at a restaurant that is fully staffed with robots than you would get at this place. Not a joke!Let me summarize a few points: (1) as we walked in there were a half a dozen ppl waiting for table, the host seem annoyed by our entrance, no greets from the host standing there like a robot, no communication of any available table or wait time. Didn't see why she's worth her pay. (2) after we sat down I clearly asked the waiter for iced water, waiter had no response, as he walked away I assumed he was going to get water, nope, standing there chatting and laughing with sleepy co-workers was a priority for him. Later he came back with no water, I had to ask again. (3) I asked for a fork, then few minutes later the sleepy waiter came back with a plastic fork, so fancy! For a moment I thought I was at Panda Express, maybe all of our dishes were going to be served on paper plates as well. I had to ask again for a real fork. (4) we asked for a Coke, a different waiter came back with a can of Coke and dropped it at the corner edge of the table and rushed away as if the place was on fire. (5) food quality: I got serious upset stomach immediately afterward, need I say more?There are plenty of restaurants in Chinatown with decent food, but most of them are just lacking the effort to focus more on the service quality. Not training the waitstaff to the standard or not disciplining sleepy waiters are primarily the faults of the management. Tolerating horrible management to consistently exist reflect business owner's lack of appreciation of your patron. Why pay for crap???

55.description: I love the food so much, because this's the very new style of Szechuan cuisine that I feel fresh with. But don't brother the servers, slow and not very helpful with the menu. I mean yea, it's Chinatown right !?Green pepper pork kidney is one of the must-try dishes. I will take to go or delivery next time.

9.description: Not my cup of tea and I almost feel bad writing this review. While I appreciate the szechuan cuisine, I just don't care for dishes where it's so numbing, I could be eating glass or garlic and not know the difference flavor-wise.Anyways when I could taste the food, the flavors were good. The ambience is nice, wait staff attentive and happy to make suggestions. The restaurant was clean and seemed appropriate/intimate enough for dates but also welcoming to families. Parking was easy.

26.description: Best Sichuan restaurant in Chicago! If you like spicy food, you have to come here and enjoy the amazing food!

25.description: My boyfriend and I went late on a Friday night and there were about four tables total.   The menu took some time to go through but we picked out crab cakes,  steamed cabbage, spicy short ribs, and tofu with eggplant. The decor is nice and everything appeared clean.   The food came fast and tasted very good.  However,  the low rating came from the service.   Shortly after we arrived, the other tables filtered out and at one point we were the only people in the restaurant.   Both of our waters never got refilled and the server never came back during our meal to see if we needed anything.   It took them 20 minutes to clean and clear the table next to us after they left.   All servers sat in the back and were loudly talking and laughing and yelled a few f bombs in the conversation.   We both felt very uncomfortable and tried to get their attention to get the check and that took forever.  We felt like we were bothering them.   I'm definitely never going back unless I get take out.

12.description: Yet another Szechuan venue in good ole Chinatown...My friend and I finally gave it a try. We ordered the Szechuan dumplings in red spicy oil, husband and wife's lung-side beef, and Szechuan noodles with brisket. Believe me, none of those dishes are as frightening as their mouthful, lack-of-English-sense, names. The dumplings were actually swimming in a bowl of hot and oily sauce but they were tasty. The dumpling wrap was thin and they were filled with pork. The lung-side beef slices were topped with an overly-generous portion of cilantro. If you like it, great. If not, have fun picking them out. I enjoyed them but my dinner mate wouldn't have any of it. The Szechuan noodles are NOT house-made. Don't expect any of those elastic and light tasting textures. The portion was generous but I doubt I will order it again. Parking was easy considering how it was a weekday around 9pm. Service was quick and polite. And the interior is a huge upgrade from the previous establishment! Note: All three of those dishes were spicy and oily. They didn't sit too well...

21.description: This is currently one of the best restaurants in Chinatown for southwest Chinese style cuisine.  Focus is the food of the city of Chengdu.  Spicy and strong flavors overall but the kitchen doesn't have the heavy hand of some other well-known places by the celebrity chef of Chinatown.  Nice comfortable environment and attractive visual design round it out.  Well worth the trip down Wentworth.

17.description: This summarizes my dinner... Tried this place just to try a new restaurant my friends and I have never tried before but we are not returning...When you walk in the interior design and decorations may impress you but do not be fooled. This is probably the best that they could offer. We ordered an appetizer, veggie dish, and 2 different entrées. Appetizer - pot stickers- the pan fried outer skin slides off as you eat it. It does not stay intact. The flavor is just ok. Tastes like something you would buy from the supermarket. I would give it 4/10. Kung pao chicken- there were too many spices that were not well blended together . Pretty big ginger slices and hot pepper in the dish. Nice peanuts roasted along with the chicken dish but again like the appetizer. Less than mediocre. Give it a 4/10. Tasted like fast food Chinese. Edible but would I eat it again? No. Duck casserole- beware !!! Do not order this because it is first of all overpriced, hardly any meat, lots of bones, and be sure to have some heartburn/ acid reducer with you. This dish is very very spicy in a will make you sweat and cause heart burn kind of a way. The most amount of peppers I have seen in a dish! Basically looking at a soup dish that is all red in color with some meat inside. Total waste of money...Lastly ordered the garlic Chinese broccoli. This was the best thing that we ordered of the night. Texture crispy, not overcooked. May have been a little too salty but it was the best dish of the night and that is sad. Overall, would not go back to eat at this restaurant it was just someplace we went to fill our stomachs but way overpriced for food that was not satisfying to our taste buds.

10.description: They were not doing very well at my favorite Szechuan dish - boiling fish. Quite pricy but the probably the smallest size I have ever had in a Szechuan restaurant. The vegetables was just so so. Double cooked pork was a great surprise! Thin slice and authentic flavor! Mapo tofu was also not bad.

5.description: To give a little background, I was first introduced to this restaurant by my cousin who is a Sichuan native and he ranks this as one of the top Sichuan restaurants that he's had in the midwest, so you know its at least somewhat authentic. FOOD: I always give this word of warning about Sichuan food - it is often drowned in chili oil and has a very unique heat - "ma la" or "numbing spice". For those who are unfamilar with this spice, or if you'd like to limit your oil intake, you may not love this place. The dishes here are a hit or...just okay. One dish served here in particular that has impressed me is the "Twice Cooked Pork" (hui guo rou) - a fatty, slightly spicy, aromatic dish sautéed with leeks. The pork has a similar texture and taste as a thick slab of medium cooked bacon. Another popular Sichuan dish done fairly well here is the "Hot and Spicy Diced Chicken Chong Qing Style". Yes, it may look intimidating with all the red peppers, but its not as bad as it looks. The chicken is fried, so think Asian style spicy KFC...but infinitely better and in smaller pieces.My favorite dish that blew me away is something not on the menu, and definitely falls under the category of "adventure dining" - I'll leave my comments out, but ask the server about dishes not their menu if you're interested. The only dishes that disappointed me so far was the "Sichuan Cold Noodles" (Liang Fen) because the sauce was overly salted instead of spicy and the portion was fairly small, and the free spring rolls for checking in - but hey, can't complain too much about free food.PRICE: Very fair. It's always been less than $20/person (including tip). Pay in cash if you can!SERVICE: You're at a Chinese restaurant - what do you expect? No one will be checking on you every few minutes, but the second you wave someone will becon your call. ATMOSPHERE: Impressive decor inside with the attempt to look upscale. Agree with other reviewers though -  bathrooms could be better maintained.What I love most about this place though is that the menu is very expansive, covering all of Sichuan's most popular authentic dishes. I'll definitely be back to try out more whenever I'm back in Chicago.

3.description: First brought here by a friend, the food is so good that I come to Chinatown again next week just to come to this restaurant. Price is cheap if you order a few dishes and share among friends. My favorite is boiled fish fillet. The Kung Pao chicken is also good.

35.description: I always went there before when it was just opened. The food at that time was outstanding! But now, it was not as good as before. The appetizer was cold and the dishes were too salty. I hope it will be better again.

19.description: Just by chance we stopped for lunch and was rewarded by some of the BEST! food ever. Prices was fair, service was good and the food, oh the food. Flavor and aroma! what can we say but " we'll be back!!

28.description: Best Sze Chuan Cuisine In Chicago. Very authentic and very fresh. However, I can't handle all the heat. Some dishes I have to request to have it tuned down a notch. They are very good about accommodating such requests. The servers are very friendly too, but I think they are a little short on staff.

45.description: great resturant with great szechuan style food. especially the cheif special and lunch special is really cheap

33.description: Orderd beef fillets in spicy sauceString beansKungPao chickenHot and sour soup-- All for delivery1) Delivery man wouldn't even make an effort to pull up to my house. I had to walk out onto the main street to pick up my order.2) The hot and sour soup AS WELL AS the beef fillets tasted like somebody dumped 4 cups of salt into them- completely inedible. My tongue got super numb after having a taste.3) BC our order was more than 20 minutes later then the expected delivery time, we didn't even bother calling to have them resend us those dishes

43.description: Walked in. Sat down. Waited.... Waited... Waited... No water, no tea. It seems other tables had trouble getting attention also. Got up and walked out.

2.description: Solid Chinese food! It's always nice to find restaurants like these where you know you'll get good Chinese family-style dishes. I pretty much order pork belly whenever it's around/available on a menu and can vouch for the pork belly here. So flavorful that we got 2 orders of it! All the other dishes we ordered were delicious too (spicy whole fish, water spinach, sauteed lamb, pork with green pepper). We ordered 6 dishes between 9 people and the total came up to about $12/person. Super satisfied.

18.description: Went here for dinner after the Chinatown Fair on Sunday and I thought it'd be a great experience. But boyyyy am I wrong.When we went inside, there was only one family eating so it was not busy at all. We were seated promptly and given menus.
