21.description: Food was fabulous.  We had  the shrimp rolls, the won ton soup, the broccoli beef and the sweet and sour pork.  It was better than any oriental food we have eaten.

17.description: Three of us picked up takeout from here. I don't even remember what we ate, because everything was so tasteless it didn't even register. Really wanted to like this place, but out of 3 entrees, an appetizer, and soup, all I can say is that the food was ready on time and the people were pleasant when we picked up our order.

10.description: Very good place!..good food for a Very good price and very friendly service!!..only could use a bit more room for the dinning area..other than that, Great place!!

5.description: The food here is really good and the seating is decent as well. I even strayed away from my "go-tos" and was not disappointed. They actually have a drink menu for those of you that care about that. The service here is suprisingly awesome as well.

3.description: Best I've ever had.  Spicy salt and pepper chicken was out of this world!  Lightly breaded crispy perfect.

35.description: I have only ordered delivery from here so not very accurate as for their service or other menu items. However, their food was not as good as I was hoping. The sweet and sour shrimp was essentially fried shrimp with too much breaking and the sauce (came on the side) was no sweet and sour shrimp I've ever had before and had chunks of tomatoes and green peppers that were haphazardly thrown in. Do not reccomend.Their calamari was chewy and also over breaded. Asked for mild spicy flavor and got no spicy ness. Their vegetable dumplings were the only thing I liked but was mediocre.

19.description: Solid delivery option at the Hyatt Regency at McCormick Place.  Both Wonton Soup and Eggrolls were above average and the Salt and Pepper Shrimp was quite nice.

28.description: I have been craving delicious Chinese food now for a couple weeks; other than Panda Express. I went down to Chinatown and chose this place! It was delicious alright! The Spicy Salt and Pepper shrimp was amazing! The taste was so unique; starts off sort of sweet and then a salty spice! It is lightly breaded, though it doesn't make you feel like you are eating something fried.  Can't wait to go back!

45.description: Uh-may-Zing!!!! The food here is simply the best Chinese food I've ever had. Very fresh & the good tasted like it had not been sitting under a heat lamp all day ether That is not fast food. So, of you're looking for that, there always Panda Express. The food takes it's time because they're making it on the spot. Can't beat that!Great service too. Very family friendly.

33.description: Delicious meal! For starters the seaweed soup with pork set the stage for an amazing meal! The Chinese broccoli with shrimp was excellent and paired nicely with the Crispy Chilean Sea Bass. Service was very pleasant and very efficient . Overall experience super fantastic

43.description: In all honestly, if half-stars were an option, this one would be a 3.5. However, due the beautiful interior and consistent attention-to-detail, I'm bumping them to 4. Unlike most of their counterparts in Chinatown, Emperor's Choice keeps their establishment meticulously clean and their wares up to date. This is by far the most aesthetically pleasing of the restaurants I've been to in Chinatown, except maybe Kai, but much cleaner. I don't know if they've recently updated their decor, as this was my first time dining here, but they did a great job. Tables are pristine, bathrooms spic and span, and the bar when you walk in didn't have a crumb on it. Definitely a welcoming place! Food was good! We tried the hot and sour soup, which was among the best I've ever had. For entrees, we ate the Hunan Beef, which features some of the freshest veggies I've ever tasted. The fresh bamboo was my favorite, as I had only had this in chute form, previously. Beef was extremely lean, which is always great. The seafood dish was not as good, but still tasty. It had shrimp, squid, scallops, jalapeno peppers, and snow peas. Scallops are my favorite, and I wish there were more than three or four of them in the dish. Server was routinely checking up on us, but not in an overbearing, creepy way like some servers in Chinatown. While this isn't my favorite in Chinatown, I'll add it to my list of options every time I go back. Disclaimer: I go back quite often and refuse to eat Chinese in Chicago outside of Chinatown.

2.description: I've gotta guess that the Salt & Pepper shrimp is the house specialty. That's the only thing I ordered and it was one of the best things I've ever eaten. Can't speak to anything else, though.Lightly breaded shrimp. Shrimp that are big, juicy, and firm pink flesh. Mixed in with an assortment of sliced peppers. Not served in a fishy tasting broth. Just tasted like really fresh ingredients. Loved it. I am always SO disappointed by shrimp at Chinese restaurants; usually they are small, few, and slightly discolored. But these... make up for every nasty shrimp I've ever eaten. Real talk. I called my boyfriend after I ate it and raved about them for like 20 minutes to the point where he was just like... shut up. BUT I KNOW HE WOULD LOVE THEM, TOO! AND SO WILL YOU!

18.description: Excellent food, small space, but food is very well prepared! (vegetables aren't mushy) Service is friendly. Get your parking stub validated, and parking was only $2.00.We shopped afterwards, at Chinatown Bazaar- fun afternoon!

41.description: When it comes to great American Chinese delivery in the South Loop, Emperor's Choice takes the cake. Whoever picks up the phone and takes my order is always pleasant and helpful. Delivery is always much faster than the estimate they give you. And even the delivery guy is always very friendly. But most important of all - the food has been consistently delicious. I love their sesame chicken. The crab rangoons are excellent. They even went out of their way to prepare a dish I love that's not even on their menu, Chow Fun with Beef in Black Bean sauce - and it was the best I've ever had!

52.description: Haven't been there for a while and I'm happy to see they newly remodeled the whole restaurant. New menu, new plates, new bathroom. This is definitely a fresh experience to me. I love the Peking Duck, spicy eggplant, and lemon grass pork. Fried rice is good too. I'll try their lobster next time when I go with friends.

50.description: The food was delicious! Starting with the seaweed salad and crispy green beans, which came out quickly. Both dishes were very tasty and set the tone for our entrees..... broiled whitefish with black bean sauce and vegetable egg foo young with brown rice.... Both were well seasoned and fresh... My sister and I definitely enjoyed our dinner...Only complaint is that the restaurant is kind of small and the tables are extremely close together.... it's not conducive for private conversations or even a quiet dinner.

4.description: Huge portions. Fresh ingredients. Great service. Typical American-Chinese, though they did have some specialties I'd never heard of. Insanely busy, but the staff handled it well. Very impressed. Funny waitress who took care of business. The only thing I wish I had thought of was telling them to up the spice level. My dishes said they were spicy on the menu, but I wanted a little more sweat with my lunch.Ma Po Tofu -- First time trying this dish, and I'm grateful I tried it here instead of someplace else. Good! Came with peas, which was a great surprise. Big slices of jalapeno for just the right level of spice. Friends had chicken dishes. Both delicious, but my favorite was the "dry" noodle dish. The noodles got caramelized and a little crunchy! Salt and pepper green beans -- Whoa, really salty. But addictive. Super light crunchy breading. If you're very sensitive to salt, then avoid.Decent shrimp fried rice. Enough to feed us for another two days. : D

6.description: Great food and nice service. The eggrolls were delicious. We ended up ordering another order to go. The hunan chicken was great, not fatty or overcooked as is the usual.

22.description: Four of us stopped by for an early dinner and were thoroughly pleased. Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty. Service was great. We had Lo Mein with Shrimp, Sweet & Sour Pork, Beef & Broccoli, Won Ton Soup, Vegetable Soup, & Shrimp Rolls. Highly recommend.

15.description: My current go to for Chinese delivery.  Ordering online through yelp is easy and delivery is always fast and hot.  The food is tasty.

57.description: I've been at EC probably 30 times over the years and always viewed it as a reliable and sometimes excellent place.  But I was there 7/27/14 and it was mediocre.  The food was dumbed down to satisfy bland palates.  (This is not a matter of spice, but of taste.)  Service was fine -- brough chopsticks but you had to ask.  I'll probably give it another try for old times sake but am really distressed.

20.description: I went to the Emperors Garden and ordered the Mongolian beef and was disappointed.  The dish had no green onions and was over salted instead of being sweet and salted as it is supposed to be.  I had to ask for hoisin sauce on the side in an attempt to balance the horrible saltiness of this dish but it did not help.  I will have to try better places than this because this is the worst Mongolian beef I have ever tasted.

36.description: Me and the family ended up here because the original place we were supposed to go was closed for renovations. Turned out to be a blessing in disguise. We had dinner here on mothers day which we expected to be packed but we were immediately seated. To start off we had some long island iced teas and they were not shy with the liquor which is how I like my drinks. For the apps we had egg rolls, bbq pork, and wonton soup. Egg rolls were nice and crispy and flavorful. Bbq pork was tender and the sauce was delicious. The wonton soup was good and not watered down like a lot of places make it. For our entrees we had combination fried rice, mongolian beef, sweet and sour chicken. All of the food was excellent as well as the customer service . I do not have one negative comment about this place and I cant wait to go back and have it again.

14.description: Very goodWe had the shrimp and lobster sauce and the emperor's chow funGreat service too

1.description: Pretty nice staff... a little unattentive though. I walked in and a man was on the phone and the man next to him just looked up and didn't say anything. I clearly wanted something from behind the counter... I don't want to judge, maybe he didn't speak English so.... They carry slim quick which was what I was looking for. Great selection of teas. Just a store nothing much to talk about.

2.description: Good variety of Chinese and Japanese teas, all sorts of variations of ginseng candies, etc.

0.description: I highly recommend this store very friendly and knowledgable family owned staff   They know there customers which is a big plus for me.  Great selection of teas!!!!

1.description: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. This is a family owned business. This product is very high quality and well worth the cost. I have been using their products for months now and have noticed a difference in my memory as well as overall physical health. They now have a cosmetic line that one of the owners uses and all I can say is that it works.

0.description: Perfect gift for family. they have Korean cosmetics for sale as well. I believe this is the only place you can get real red Ginseng in Chicago.

28.description: As a lover of Asian food, I was excited to see this open. I know that Xi'an cuisine is not very well known in the US and not that easy to get. Hell, a few people from China told me that it's not even well known in some of the largest cities in China.I had the lamb hand-stretched noodles in soup and the cold sliced marinated lamb. The noodles in the soup were nice as was the broth. I think it could have used some more flavor, but then again I've heard from natives that it's supposed to be like that. I thought the cold sliced marinated lamb was really strong though. Really, really good stuff. Service was fine - not amazing or anything but not completely absent either.I'll be back to try more (the menu is not that large anyway).

1.description: This place gives you a sneak peak to the cuisine of northwest China - different combinations of broth, noodles and buns and other things made with flour, and seasoned meat. Not particularly genuine but close enough for me to pay visits.

9.description: The flatbread is delicious. The veggie flatbread had seaweed, Tofu noodles and hot peppers. My mom had the beef flatbread it was good but the beef is cold.We also try the beef potstickers. They were good but they were small. They only had beef and lamb options for both the flatbreads and the noodle soup.We also tried The pulled noodle beef soup. It's different the noodles are fresh but it's not something I was used to. I may have to try again.If I go back again I would definitely have another flatbread.

29.description: My husband and I decided to give this place a shot. We saw the pictures on yelp and thought the interior looked really nice so we were kind of shocked when we walked into the restaurant and it was completely different than the picture on yelp. We aren't big on ambiance anyway, but don't come here thinking it will be some fancy place with a nice wooden interior like the photo on the yelp profile. It's pretty bare bones but that's fine with me.We had the celery and wooden ear cold dish to start. We also had a pork sandwich and  a lamb sandwich. The lamb sandwich was better than the pork sandwich but the seasoning still needs a little work.  I had the lamb with handpulled noodle soup and the noodles were a really nice texture, but I found the soup itself to be a bit bland. Once I added some chile oil it was a bit better. My husband had the lamb intestine soup and he seemed to enjoy it. We also had an order of the xi'an cold noodles. I actually really liked the cold noodles and thought they were refreshing and light. Everything we ate was fine, but we have been to Xi'An Famous Foods in NYC and this pales in comparison to that. However, for Chicago, this is a welcome addition and is pretty good. I am sure it will improve with time as well. The prices are very reasonable. Make sure to bring cash if you don't plan on ordering much, because they only let you use credit card if it is over $25.

23.description: Beef soup noodle and lamb soup bread are really bland. Cumin lamb flat bread is good.

5.description: If you are in the area and need a snack, the flatbreads at Xi'an are pretty tasty.  I had the cumin lamb and the pork: the lamb was better (had a little hint of spice) but they were both good.Just make sure to bring cash if you're eating less than $20 worth of food; there's a minor charge if you're under $20.  Not a big deal, but I like to avoid unnecessary expenses :-)

31.description: We went to Chinatown on a Sunday afternoon looking to try something new.  We passed this place and thought it looked interesting.  My wife talked to the waiter in Mandarin and ordered 5 dishes for the three of us from a small menu of mostly inexpensive items.  I had  a flatbread sandwich stuffed with cumin spiced lamb.  This just may be the best three dollar food item I've ever had.  I ordered another to share with my wife and then a third to eat all by myself.  The lamb was pretty spicy and stir fried with lots of peppers.  I can't wait to go back for more.  My son had a similar flatbread sandwich with pork which was not spicy.  Great for a kid and he devoured it.  The other items we ordered weren't as pleasing to my American tastebuds but it didn't matter as nothing was going to come close to the lamb.  Our server was very nice and the place is clean, comfortable and newly remodeled.  Xian food is something most people probably haven't tried, so i recommend trying it once and make sure you try the flatbread sandwich with lamb.

25.description: So excited there's finally xi'an cuisine in Chicago! Service was great however the food was not authentic:( not at all comparable to the xi'an restaurants in ny, la or sf. Please consider hiring a chef from shaanxi/Xi'an!!

12.description: The lamb hand-stretched noodles here reminded me of Katy's Dumplings' lamb noodles. The noodle soup was enormous for $8, which easily satisfies both Kenny and me. The texture was spot on and chewy. I like it just a tad more than Katy's, too. The lamb was delicious. And we can season the broth to our liking with the chili sauce on the table. The last time we went, we also ordered the lamb flatbread. It isn't what I typically think of a flatbread... It was more like a hot pocket, but so much better. The cumin seasoning was delicious, and I"d definitely order this again.

21.description: Xi'an (two words, also the capital of Shaanxi province in the heart of China) Cuisine is a cash-only hole-in-the-wall establishment that serves up huge bowls of rich broth, among others. Just show up--making reservations over the phone is next-to-impossible unless you speak Mandarin, and you probably won't need to anyway (see last paragraph).Its menu is, well, finite. But you won't be disappointed--for what it lacks in variety (I counted maybe one vegetable total), it makes up for in lamb! A friend and I split a hearty bowl of lamb intestine soup (yang za tang), lamb hand-stretched noodles in soup (yang rou hui mian), lamb with cumin powder in flat bread, and a cold dish of spicy sliced marinated lamb. Don't tell Mary.The service/turnover is fast--we were in and out in 30 minutes on a Sunday. Business is good. The decor leaves much room for improvement...but who's attention is wandering outside the circumference of his/her bowl, anyway?

16.description: I'm from Xi'an and I can say this place is AUTHENTIC!! I tried Xi'an famous food in New York, which I think it's really authentic considering this is the America. But this place blows my mind! The lamp flat bread, the hand-stretched noodles, the cold noodles, etc everything is so authentic and flavorful! They reminded me of my favourite restaurants in the neighborhood where I grew up. I am so dedicated to this place that I decide to come here every week! I'm so happy Chicago finally has Xi'an food now and it is so freaking good!

17.description: As far as I know this is the only restaurant in Chicago that serves the food of Xi'an / Shaangxi province. The food is excellent, authentic and very, very cheap. Slightly too oily perhaps, but I guess that's part of the reason why it tastes good.

10.description: Been back twice since I've discovered it. Small no frills place. Not much ambience but the food more than makes up for it. Get the hand pulled noodles and cold noodles, and of course the flatbreads, I especially liked the cumin lamb. Wish they'd put more cilantro in the flatbreads to give it a touch of freshness and contrasting texture. Nonetheless, love it and will become a regular.

11.description: While the dishes were tasty, the staff lacked courtesy and respect for its LGBT clientele during the Chicago Pride Parade Sunday. Two of the staff made disparaging remarks about two gay gentlemen who finished dining and departed the restaurant. A couple of ladies overheard their remarks and expressed their displeasure. The staff replied by saying it wasn't about you two ladies; gay only refers to guys. After the ladies departed, they began to rant about them and their dislike of homosexuals and marriage of two men. Serving up hate is not palatable to us. We won't be returning.

26.description: I'm always looking for some new Chinese place to take my parents, so it was only natural that we come here after they have been open for a few months. I've actually been to Xi'an and was reminded of warmer days there. It was my sunny escape from frigid cold days in Beijing. I was looking forward to trying the place out. Getting inside, I was surprised to see how small the menu was especially when most Chinese restaurants have booklets with so many different options that you can be overwhelmed. Even with the limited options I did have some trouble on deciding what to order and the waitress was very helpful in giving her recommendations with which we went with. We got the lamb and pork flatbread, which was really tasty - go for the jalapenos and cilantro. We also got the lamb hand-stretched noodle soup, the beef hand-stretched noodle soup, and the pan-fried noodles. Everything was really tasty and enjoyable. The 3 of us ate everything.

27.description: The food quality is quite good especially considering the price. Most of the food is great. I had a very good time dining there.

0.description: On a chilly, snowy night, nothing soothes the soul more than a hot bowl of comfort food. In this case, my fiance, my friend, and I decided to get piping hot noodles and flatbread made with authentic Xi'an cuisine. Xi'an Cuisine is a small restaurant, but we were quickly seated and given menus. The waiter explained that their food is made authentically and therefore may tak a while to come be served. We understood the predicament and placed orders for some of their hand-stretched noodles, pork and lamb flatbreads while catching up over tea and water. Given that my fiance came back from visiting Xi'an province to see the Terracotta Army in person, her feedback was of utmost importance. She was not as impressed with the noodles because they had a chewy consistency. She explained that most hand-pulled noodles made in house are usually very soft and "easily slurpable." It was evident that the noodles were hand-pulled though because the noodles were of varying length. Maybe they were over or understreched? Anyhow, the flavors were there. The noodles were glistening with hot oil and served with generous amounts of crisp vegetables and soft, tender meat. But what impressed us the most was the lamb flatbread--seasoned to perfection with ground lamb sandwiched between oiled, pan-fried flatbread. If you ever come to Xi'an Cuisine, the lamb flatbread is a must!

20.description: When entering this place, it resembles a hole in the wall type of atmosphere in which I honestly prefer. I ordered the beef hand stretched noodles and also the beef flatbread. The beef noodles were just amazing. The beef was so tender that it will literally melt in your mouth. Most importantly tho, the soup base is just quietly amazing. Tho it does not have the type of flavor that will PUNCH you right in the face, it has this really subtle flavor that just keeps you wanting more. In alot of chinese restaurants I would always need a beverage to help clean my mouth to wash out the strong flavor but the noodles did not leave me wanting to do that which is great. As for the beef flatbread, the beef is alright I wouldve preferred it if it had some kind of sauce inside but the flatbread itself was killer. The inside was soft and the outside layer was crispy. That itself is enough said. Definitely will be back

19.description: Service is terrible. Forgot to make our food and waiter lied to our face about it.  Had to leave. Horrible attitude. One dish we did get was potatoes drenched in vinegar. inedible.

33.description: I've heard this quite a bit and finally tried their food today. As a big fan of the Xi'an Famous Food in New York, I guess this one is stealing the original name since it used the same Chinese name. Name aside,  the food is what I care the most. Well, I ordered 陕西凉皮（Shannxi cold noodles),  白吉馍（pork with flat bread), and 羊杂汤（lamb intestine soup). Wow, they impressed me, probably 'cause I didn't expect much. But, still, it's far from what you can get at Xi'an Famous Food in NYC. (I think I need a disclaimer: they don't pay me anything to advertise for them.)  The cold noodles came very quick, but the pork with flat bread was slow-- it didn't came until we were almost finished. OK, bottom line is, it's good and worth a try. What's more, it's not expensive. A good meal for only or so, gee! PS. Several friends had 羊肉泡馍( lamp soup with bread) and liked it. Will try it next time.

2.description: Stopped by to pick up some late lunch and I was not at all disappointed. For $20 I got a TON of food. The hand pulled noodles were perfect amount of spicy. The lamb tongue was tender and delicious and for what was billed as a small plate it was a ton of meat. Had to go a little off the beaten path and at least try the lamb testicles. They were perfectly grilled and had nice heat on them.Overall, quick service, great quality, and great value!!! Will definitely be back.

34.description: Jennie T. and I tried Xi'an Cuisine its first week of opening, and we're already adding it to our regular rotation of restaurants in Chinatown. We both ordered the Lamb Hand-Stretched Noodles in Soup. (I think we also placed an order for a Lamb Flat Bread, but it never came). The soups came out quickly after about 5 minutes of ordering. The first thing that struck us was how large the portions were. For $8, you get a bowl the size of your head. The second thing we noticed was how opaque and milky the broth was! It's definitely not what I was picturing a Lamb Noodle in my head.The first taste of the broth coated our mouth with a rich and meaty film. The sensation lingers for several seconds after sipping a spoonful. The lamb was actually a tad disappointing since there was no hint of gaminess, making the chunks taste a lot more like beef. The hand-pulled noodles that day were the best I've had in Chicago (including the now-reconceptualized Sing's Noodles): perfect chew, subdued flavor, and just the perfect size. The whole bowl was delicious enough by itself, but I felt that adding some chili oil helped increase the warmth of the dish, which was welcome this cold Chicago autumn. Overall, this ended up being one of the best soups I've tasted, even with the un-lamby lamb. All in all this place is slowly getting more and more new patrons, and it's well-deserved. It's a cheap eat and Xi'an food is something that didn't already exist in Chinatown.Note: cash-only.

32.description: Having been to Xi'An Famous Foods in NYC, I was very excited to see a Xi An style restaurant in Chicago finally. The restaurant menu is modeled off of Xi An street food, so limited to cold dishes, noodles, and Xi-an hamburgers/pitas. The atmosphere was pretty typical Chinatown, We tried a variety of items and my favorites were the cumin/jalapeno lamb hamburger, the lamb soup with dough pieces, and the cold spicy potato strings. Although not as good as the NYC Xi'An restaurant, I still enjoyed the food and you should definitely check it out if you are a lamb lover.

18.description: The service at this restaurant is unacceptable. They forgot to put in my orders so I did not get food served after 40 min when the restaurant was almost empty, wait and they lied about it saying they were making the food and needed five more min. They had a very bad attitude when we became unhappy wait i ng for too long. Ate here once before and they forgot to put any seasoning or sause in my cold rice noodles - no flavor at all! When I decided to give it another try, they forgot to put in orders and lied about it. Worst experience eating in a restaurant!

13.description: Jennie T. and I tried Xi'an Cuisine its first week of opening, and we're already adding it to our regular rotation of restaurants in Chinatown. We both ordered the Lamb Hand-Stretched Noodles in Soup. (I think we also placed an order for a Lamb Flat Bread, but it never came). The soups came out quickly after about 5 minutes of ordering. The first thing that struck us was how large the portions were. For $8, you get a bowl the size of your head. The second thing we noticed was how opaque and milky the broth was! It's definitely not what I was picturing a Lamb Noodle in my head.The first taste of the broth coated our mouth with a rich and meaty film. The sensation lingers for several seconds after sipping a spoonful. The lamb was actually a tad disappointing since there was no hint of gaminess, making the chunks taste a lot more like beef. The hand-pulled noodles that day were the best I've had in Chicago (including the now-reconceptualized Sing's Noodles): perfect chew, subdued flavor, and just the perfect size. The whole bowl was delicious enough by itself, but I felt that adding some chili oil helped increase the warmth of the dish, which was welcome this cold Chicago autumn. Overall, this ended up being one of the best soups I've tasted, even with the un-lamby lamb. All in all this place is slowly getting more and more new patrons, and it's well-deserved. It's a cheap eat and Xi'an food is something that didn't already exist in Chinatown.Note: cash-only.

4.description: I came here with a group of friends and the food was soooo tasty for really great prices!!! And the service was amazing too.Our table got a lot of appetizers to share, and all of them were solid (lotus root, pig ear, peanut dish), and we got the lamb bing and hand stretched noodles too. In my experience, you just can't go wrong with anything you order here.

24.description: The lamb hand-stretched noodles here reminded me of Katy's Dumplings' lamb noodles. The noodle soup was enormous for $8, which easily satisfies both Kenny and me. The texture was spot on and chewy. I like it just a tad more than Katy's, too. The lamb was delicious. And we can season the broth to our liking with the chili sauce on the table. The last time we went, we also ordered the lamb flatbread. It isn't what I typically think of a flatbread... It was more like a hot pocket, but so much better. The cumin seasoning was delicious, and I"d definitely order this again.

6.description: Having been to Xi'An Famous Foods in NYC, I was very excited to see a Xi An style restaurant in Chicago finally. The restaurant menu is modeled off of Xi An street food, so limited to cold dishes, noodles, and Xi-an hamburgers/pitas. The atmosphere was pretty typical Chinatown, We tried a variety of items and my favorites were the cumin/jalapeno lamb hamburger, the lamb soup with dough pieces, and the cold spicy potato strings. Although not as good as the NYC Xi'An restaurant, I still enjoyed the food and you should definitely check it out if you are a lamb lover.

22.description: 4 stars is only for the lamb noodle soup and cumin lamb flatbread!  Everything else is NOT that good (i.e. pork flatbread, cold spicy noodles, etc.) which I would give 2 stars.Also, this is a typical hole in the wall chinatown restaurant.  Try to bring cash- otherwise they charge $1 extra if the bill is under $25 for cc.

15.description: 4 stars is only for the lamb noodle soup and cumin lamb flatbread!  Everything else is NOT that good (i.e. pork flatbread, cold spicy noodles, etc.) which I would give 2 stars.Also, this is a typical hole in the wall chinatown restaurant.  Try to bring cash- otherwise they charge $1 extra if the bill is under $25 for cc.

7.description: For cheap eats how can you beat this place.  The flatbreads here are crazy affordable as well as delicious.  I tried the lamb with cumin and it was deliciously spiced.  Nice and crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.   It's like perfect street food and that is the only downside I'd have to say.  If they were selling these off a food cart somewhere they'd be selling them by the boxful.  However, you can expect a 15 minute or so wait that garuantees the quality of said flatbreads.The pork one was also good but it was just ok.  Not as interesting as the lamb.  Still for $3.50 each how can you argue with such a bargain.  This place is a definite win to get a bite while parusing through Chinatown.

8.description: ABC7 Hungry Hound dug up this authentic Xi'an place and that's why we came. Saturday morning half an hour after opening, we had three kinds of flavored Flat Bread, one noodle soup, by the time people getting busy.For the Flat Bread, juicy inside with crispy layer. The pork one was fine but you gonna try the Lamb/beef w. cumin powder one. Noodles were delicious and lamb was tender, put some white pepper or spicy sauce in it would be more tasty.Credit Card friendly, but have to pay extra $1 for cc if you're not over $20.

30.description: Very delicious! Authentic Chinese (not sure if authentic Xi'an since I'm not from there) food! Everything is awesome!

3.description: This is not typically Xi'an's taste. The noodles is too sour. While Paomo is tasteless.

14.description: As a lover of Asian food, I was excited to see this open. I know that Xi'an cuisine is not very well known in the US and not that easy to get. Hell, a few people from China told me that it's not even well known in some of the largest cities in China.I had the lamb hand-stretched noodles in soup and the cold sliced marinated lamb. The noodles in the soup were nice as was the broth. I think it could have used some more flavor, but then again I've heard from natives that it's supposed to be like that. I thought the cold sliced marinated lamb was really strong though. Really, really good stuff. Service was fine - not amazing or anything but not completely absent either.I'll be back to try more (the menu is not that large anyway).

58.description: Good meat. Beef, Beef tongue and lamp are very thin and fresh. Mongolian regular and spicy Soup broth was just ok.

56.description: Not the best hotpot I've had but met my expectation. Food is tasteful and fresh. Will visit again.

29.description: This place is a gem that we stumbled upon. It was so good and the food was on point because it was chilly outside. The spicy is really really spicy. I thought I could handle some heat, but it was really spicy. It was too spicy for me. It was good over all. They had these fish ball with roe that were so good. Can't find a place in Houston that has them that were just as good. Love this place.

42.description: What a fun place. We have never been to a place like this before. Once we understood the basics, we were off and ready to cook! The idea is to boil your veggies, noodles and meat in the hot bot of broth that sits over the burner on your table. Everything comes ala carte so you can have exactly what you want. Try this at least once. It would be a fun group activity. Right off the red line, one stop before US Cellular Field in Chinatown.

23.description: The service at Little Lamb was exceptional. The waitress checked in periodically throughout the meal to offer napkins, water, and tea. I ordered a vegetable plate and mala broth, and found it to be more than enough food. It tasted just as it should, with the perfect amount of spice. The place is slightly pricey, but beyond that, I was impressed.

47.description: Was quite impressed with this hot pot place. The meat we ordered was very well marbled and nicely prepared. Broths were just spicy and tasty enough to make the experience great (too spicy and things go south!)Highly recommend the grilled lamb rack. Huge but balanced cumin flavor that was delicious. Ordered 1 for a group of 4...not enough! Get 2

8.description: Hot pot galore, pretty much a staple in my culinary appetite as I usually enjoy this at my friends and family outings. This is my first time going to a restaurant for hot pot. They give you a very extensive menu to choose every item, there is no pictures which is hard for me since I see what I like to eat rather than the word describing the item. Took me a while but I ordered all the items I can remember. I got the not-so-spicy broth (there are more than 5  different broths) and over twenty little dishes came to the table Once the broth boils up and you can start to add cold items into the broth and wait and take it out in these wire mesh baskets to serve to your bowl. I was here for three hours to finish all my dishes. I would definitely come back again. There are plenty of parking and BYOB. The good thing about this is you don't have to do any dishes when you are done.

31.description: it was ok

34.description: Rather traditional hot pot. Everything is a la carte.  I wasn't used too picking out vegetables separately. ..i have only been to the ones where they provide a pre portioned bowl of noodles, veggies, and tofu. We got the herbal broth and the spicy herbal broth. Both were good. Though I was slightly disgusted with oil in the spicy broth....i kept spooning out the oil whenever I could.  Overall it was good. Just be ready that you are going to smell like hot pot after!

16.description: My friend and I came on a Saturday afternoon and I am not from Chicago.  I was greeted right away by the hostess and seated right away.  The waitress was really good in explaining the menu and answering any questions.  Overall, the service was excellent.  The broth we ordered was the House special spicy Mala and the mushroom.  The special spicy mala broth was overloaded with garlic and greasy oil.  The mushroom broth was good.  We ordered the vegetable platter, seafood platter, beef and shrimp dumpling.  There's a sauce bar where you can make your own dipping sauce as well.  Overall, the hot pot food and/or experience was okay.  The most frustrating part about this experience was we got these tiny plates to use which cause the table to get very messy.  Maybe if I try something else besides the hot pot, it may change my review of the place.  Hot pot restaurants are difficult to rate or review.  You either love it or hate it.  I probably won't go back.

13.description: Food quality is solid every time. Make sure to go Tuesday for free soup base or Thursday for 99cents veggies specials! The service kinda sucks because they either have no experience or they can't understand English well. Just not good wait staffs all around.

11.description: Rather traditional hot pot. Everything is a la carte.  I wasn't used too picking out vegetables separately. ..i have only been to the ones where they provide a pre portioned bowl of noodles, veggies, and tofu. We got the herbal broth and the spicy herbal broth. Both were good. Though I was slightly disgusted with oil in the spicy broth....i kept spooning out the oil whenever I could.  Overall it was good. Just be ready that you are going to smell like hot pot after!

39.description: Little lamb is an amzing place to get some amazing chinese food with great atmosphere and service! We had fun and our waitress Lingjia was very helpful for our first time.

37.description: Always come here with friends for hot pot. It is our favorite spot in Chinatown . The food is good here but service is just fine. Will come here again because we just love hot pot.

0.description: This Ain't Mary's Little LambFINALLY experienced the world of HOT POT! It was just what I expected it to be and more. The entire experience at Little Lamb was fabulous. From the moment we walked through the door to the moment before we received our check, just fabulous. On a super cold winter evening, hot pot hit the spot.Location - Little Lamb is strategically placed right on the corner of Wentworth. Right below a karaoke bar. You really would not realize this is a hotpot spot unless you decided to be a huge creeper and took a peek through the window. Even so, I love that this is not so intuitive as to turn into a tourist trap! Decor - modern glam serving ancient Chinese realness! I LOVE this decor! Easily the sleekest design in all of Chinatown! I love all of the black reflective glass on the tables, the red and white accents, and the huge paintong on the wall. I also LOVE the chandeliers. I felt so fancy eating here. Even the chopsticks are fancy! The booth seating are super comfy. I love the circular ones at the front!Service - Service here was decent. When the host sat us with our menus, it was like 5 minutes before our waiter came to see what we wanted to order. Slow down! I had no idea what was going on because It was my first hotpot experience but thankfully my good Asian friend was a seasoned hp diner, so we just let her take control of what we ordered. Our waiter was very nice. But we received no refills on our water. And we were not followed up with during our dinner. I was not too pressed about this because I dislike when wait staff hover, but not having water refilled whilst eating SPICY broth is not okay.Drinks - We all got wine. YES! For once I ordered a drink! BEWARE! The "Chinese Wine" is NOT wine!! It is 56% alcohol shot. The fragrance itself of the shot gave my friend a headache that she literally sent it back because she didn't want to be drunkboots-legsintheair drunk at Little Lamb. Food - Hotpot reminds me so much of Pho except you make the food fresh here at the table. You also have complete control over what you put into the pot. I like that you could control the temperature settings at the table. This is just a neat dining experience! All of the ingredients here are fresh! The chicken and pork slices were so thin. I would have loved them to be in chunks or dices (the chicken at least) but chicken is chicken. I also tried tripe for the first time and I was SO pleasantly surprised! Very rubbery, but the taste was quite nice. The potatoes were AMAZING once cooked in the broth! I accidentally mistook one for a big chunk of ginger. My friends thought my reaction to that bite was hilarious. I literally yelled "ewwwwwwwwwwww" and they were like, thats ginger. I felt so dumb but it was so funny afterwards. I also loved the beef balls in the broth. And the fried dough. Do yourself a favor and also add noodles! Everything was great.*Mongolian Meat Pie - basically like a potsticker excpet flat! It was beef not chicken. this was DELICIOUS! Definitely order these!Price - Okay. Because I let my friend take complete control over what we ordered, I was not keeping an eye on how much everything was. I had NO idea that this bill would have amounted to so much. We all paid close to thirty dollars per person. I literally choked when we got the check. What really licked my wound was that checking into Yelp got us all free, delicious ice cream! I will return for special occasions.

38.description: You never want go back there, you can even make this kind food at home, taste no good at all! If this place open in China it will be close after few days. 这个价位吃这样的火锅就真心不推荐了 味道很一般很一般 自己在家随便弄一下就是这个味道了 一点特色也没有 点的羊肉串80%都是肥肉 可能有人喜欢吃肥肉吧 反正我是接受不了的

51.description: Best hot pot in Chinatown! Worth the visit! Although a little bit more pricier compared to all the other cheap Chinatown restaurants, they offer quality meats with handmade noodles. Their wide variety of soup base is what made this restaurant so compelling!

27.description: Great hot pot with variety and even though it's a la cattle it's not too spicy. There were two of us and we enjoyed the food so much we over ate. The fatty beef was delicious as was the sweet corn. The restaurant and bathroom were clean and the food was fresh.Service was actually fine and while not five star a definite place to go to eat hot pot!

32.description: We didn't know what we were doing and our waitress, even though she barely knew English, did a great job in explaining to us what to do at every step of the meal. They give you a hot pot of broth and the Fixins and you cook it yourself so it is actually quite fun. Reasonably priced for the great amount of food you get. Highly recommend.

54.description: First off.  Excellent service!  Never was ignored or felt pressure to order.  So helpful with the menu as well!  The food itself was fresh.  I'll be back for sure!

48.description: Heard comments about how expensive it is because of the a la carte nature, so never visited until recently. While their prices are higher than all you can eat hotpot places in Chinatown, the meat quality is definitely worth it. I like how they have a wide assortment of condiments and even cheatsheets on how to make your own sauce. The cold noodles are a must. Spicy house broth was excellent. The regular house broth was a tad bland. Service was quite attentive for Chinatown standards, and our server handled our demanding large group quite efficiently.

44.description: Little spendy ($15-20 per person before tip) but if you can afford that, you've got to go here. I lived over in Taiwan for half a year and this place reminded me of one of my favorite restaurants over there. The food and ambiance are great and the service is pretty standard for an Asian food establishment. Worth a stop when you're in the area.

24.description: My friends are visiting Chicago from Thanksgiving, and I planned to take them to "the best hotpot place" in the area. It turned out the exactly opposite.The waiters are ninjas that they disappear too often that we couldn't find them when we needed them, and most importantly, when our food was not delivered on time. When the food arrived, it arrived in a very small portion that barely matches its cost, and the waiter who delivered the food would disappear and never be found again in the next twenty minutes, just like a ninja.My friends and I never had the rice bowls on our table until two hours later. (Probably the rice bowl is the real ninja)Another point is the food is really overpriced. $20-30 per person is probably common in the U.S., but for a Taiwanese who grows up eating hot pot, I don't get the point even the vegetable plate and sauces are priced. The people in America would probably never know what the real hot pot is like until they try one in a better and more original hot pot restaurant, and this one is definitely not the one.

7.description: Great place for hot pot. They have a sauce station where you can make your own dipping sauce, which I like a lot. Their meat and vegetable selection is varied and generally pretty fresh and seasoned well. I found the broths ok, not great but they'll do. It's byob so it's great to come here with a group of friends who are ready to throw down some serious eating. I don't like it as much as Flaming Pot (which unfortunately has closed down) but it does the trick when you want to satisfy that hot pot craving in Chicago!

49.description: This is THE place to go for hot pot! Great variety of items to add into the hot pot! Plus you could choose two flavors for the broth. We went on a Wednesday when they had 50% off lamb ribs which were absolutely scrumptious! They also had good deals on all the other days. Minus one star because the server neglected us towards the end of our meal and forgot to bring our ice cream out after reminding him twice.

40.description: We had a wonderful time! The hot pot was excellent and the server was very friendly and helpful. We'll definitely come back!

53.description: This was probably the best hot pot I've ever had.  I ordered the Mongolian spicy herbal broth, and my boyfriend orders the house special broth.  Both of which were excellent!  The Mongolian broth wasn't too spicy and works beautifully with the ingredients. The house broth tastes amazing when you drink it.  The sauces were unique and there is a nice variety.  I've never seen my boyfriend drink so much soup!  Highly recommend it!

30.description: I had spicy herbal soup (the second one on the menu). It looks really spicy, but taste not that spicy. The herbs gave combinations of smell, which is not bad at all,  but I'm not used to it. There are varieties of ingredients, which you can used to make cups of sauce yourself. Lack of service a little, but overall is a very good place to eat with friends!

46.description: Good food with horrible service.  The food deserves 3-4 stars, but our waiter was so bad that we dropped the rating down to two stars (we contemplated giving it one star).Once we were seated by the friendly hostess, our service pretty much ended.  We ordered two beers and some sake.  The waiter returned about ten minutes later with bottled beer and sake in a can.  He left before I could ask for glasses for the beer or sake.The waiter returned quickly enough to pick up our order (you write on the menu with a marker) without a word being said and we just assumed he didn't speak English.  He returned a few minutes later and told us that 2 items on our order were sold out, dispelling our prior assumption.Our food was brought out and this was pretty much the last time that we saw our server.  During the meal, our table-top "stove" became so hot that our broths started to boil over.  We had to adjust the temperature ourselves to keep the broth from evaporating.After finishing our meal, we waited for our bill.  We noticed the two tables around us were waiting too.  All three of us eventually went up to the front to pick-up and pay our bills.  One of the other patrons made the comment, "You must need to be a young girl in a skimpy dress to get service here!" because our waiter was extremely attentive to the table at the front of the restaurant with four young girls seated there.The final insult was that our bill included a charge for two dipping sauces.  I guess they charge extra for the self-service bar that has dipping sauces in it (something that we've never seen at other Hot Pot restaurants).  This was particularly aggravating because my wife only picked up a small container of green onion and the other bowls were for eating.  Our server never brought us plates or bowls, so I went to the bar to get some bowls to put our food in.  Instead of arguing, I deducted the extra charge from the tip (my wife didn't even want to tip our server, but I compromised with 10% minus $2).

1.description: Alright. I first came here a few weeks ago, and the experience was great. The spicy Mongolian herbal broth was delicious, and we really liked the lamb slices, mushrooms, seafood platter, and vegetables. The dipping sauces were great! Service was also good.However, just yesterday, my boyfriend and I tried to get lunch here. We arrived around 11:45 and were quickly seated and greeted by a waitress. However, we did not get our order taken, or even waters. We tried to flag her down a few times, and after over 40 minutes of waiting to get our order card taken, we just left. We watched several tables that were seated before us get service first. We got up and walked to another restaurant in Chinatown.I cannot believe that we couldn't even order food in the time that we were here.  I really enjoyed this place the first time, but there are so many other places to get hot pot where we'll actually get served... so I definitely won't be back here.

55.description: Love that there are vegetarian options for the broth. Our waitress was very kind, and explained the entire hot pot process for us newbies.Overall the food and service was good.Also the restaurant is located directly across the street from the Cermak-China Town stop on the Red line. Very easy to get to!

9.description: Good food with horrible service.  The food deserves 3-4 stars, but our waiter was so bad that we dropped the rating down to two stars (we contemplated giving it one star).Once we were seated by the friendly hostess, our service pretty much ended.  We ordered two beers and some sake.  The waiter returned about ten minutes later with bottled beer and sake in a can.  He left before I could ask for glasses for the beer or sake.The waiter returned quickly enough to pick up our order (you write on the menu with a marker) without a word being said and we just assumed he didn't speak English.  He returned a few minutes later and told us that 2 items on our order were sold out, dispelling our prior assumption.Our food was brought out and this was pretty much the last time that we saw our server.  During the meal, our table-top "stove" became so hot that our broths started to boil over.  We had to adjust the temperature ourselves to keep the broth from evaporating.After finishing our meal, we waited for our bill.  We noticed the two tables around us were waiting too.  All three of us eventually went up to the front to pick-up and pay our bills.  One of the other patrons made the comment, "You must need to be a young girl in a skimpy dress to get service here!" because our waiter was extremely attentive to the table at the front of the restaurant with four young girls seated there.The final insult was that our bill included a charge for two dipping sauces.  I guess they charge extra for the self-service bar that has dipping sauces in it (something that we've never seen at other Hot Pot restaurants).  This was particularly aggravating because my wife only picked up a small container of green onion and the other bowls were for eating.  Our server never brought us plates or bowls, so I went to the bar to get some bowls to put our food in.  Instead of arguing, I deducted the extra charge from the tip (my wife didn't even want to tip our server, but I compromised with 10% minus $2).

26.description: Ordering is self explanatory; order broth, order meat or seafood, and order any additional stuff with your hot pot. Since it was my first time here, our server pointed out that the selection of dipping sauce in the back. I chose, peanut, satay and sesame. All of them were great. Great attentive service; I showed them the yelp - free ice cream deal, they say they didn't have any ice cream. It was fine, great experience to try out Chicago hot pot.

25.description: It was busy so the service was pretty bad, even compared to other Chinese restaurants. It took forever for us to get our orders and we rarely saw him. Also the floor was so dirty and oily people skates across the floors.However the bathrooms were clean!And the food was freakin good. The meat was thinly sliced and fresh. The veggies were good and the frozen tofu was very good. The house made noodles were not great. There was no chewiness in it. But overall I feel great food trumps bad service so I approve of this place

12.description: Great hot pot with variety and even though it's a la cattle it's not too spicy. There were two of us and we enjoyed the food so much we over ate. The fatty beef was delicious as was the sweet corn. The restaurant and bathroom were clean and the food was fresh.Service was actually fine and while not five star a definite place to go to eat hot pot!

59.description: Little Lamb? Little Scam is more fitting. The other 1 star reviewers were dead on. Service was terrible.  I couldn't try to serve someone worse. The food is mediocre at best. The servers were busy texting and talking to each other. My group was drinking, and the server must have decided we shouldn't drink anymore bc he never came back to get us more beer. Sorry for wanting to make my tab higher so you'll get more of a tip. I guess being in high school makes you too cool to work for your money. Now to the scam part of the review. Dipping sauces...look carefully at the menu. Every time you hit that bland dipping sauce cart you better prepare yourself to pay $1. The extra charge isn't listed on front of the cart, so prepare to be nickel and dimed. They're also a new restaurant, so they were having promotions. They have a board in front of the restaurant saying you get a bonus meat, but when you go pay, it magically disappears. The table before us was complaining about not honoring their promotion. Well too bad, the management is gangsta like that and won't honor their promotion. tl:dr: Pat yourself on the back after you go to the all you can eat places across the street instead of getting  "Little Scammed."

21.description: I really like this place. Sometimes I think the communication barrier frustrated the wait staff which can be a little difficult. The food here is everything and affordable. I love the plum juice also. This is great for people who want a romantic date night or want to hang out with friends. I love the fact I can eat different toppings whenever I come.

17.description: What a fun place. We have never been to a place like this before. Once we understood the basics, we were off and ready to cook! The idea is to boil your veggies, noodles and meat in the hot bot of broth that sits over the burner on your table. Everything comes ala carte so you can have exactly what you want. Try this at least once. It would be a fun group activity. Right off the red line, one stop before US Cellular Field in Chinatown.

10.description: Love that there are vegetarian options for the broth. Our waitress was very kind, and explained the entire hot pot process for us newbies.Overall the food and service was good.Also the restaurant is located directly across the street from the Cermak-China Town stop on the Red line. Very easy to get to!

5.description: Pretty good hot pot for Chicago.  Pros:- sauce station. hiyah!!- pretty wide selection of veggies, meats, seafood- good service. they actually bring you the things you request (ahem, sweet station)- different broth selections- byob. no corking feeCons: - NOT ayce. boooo.- broths could be better.

3.description: This little gem in Chinatown is good, but definitely caters to the local clientele.  4 things I don't like: 1) we had a difficult time understanding our waitress and getting things explained. 2) they don't offer any preset combos, almost everything has to be ordered separately and if you want a large variety of veggies, it adds up quickly. The few combos that are offered don't list exactly what come in them (ex: veggie platter does not say it has bok choy, napa cabbage, carrots, radishes) 3) the spicy broths have whole peppercorns in them, and when you bite into them it takes your flavorful, spicy dish to unbearably hot. 4) they charge you $1 for every sauce you get from the bar but don't have taste spoons...so unless you are a regular to this type of cuisine, you don't know if you like the sauce or not.Now that the negative is out of the way, I really did like this place.  For $40 we got a huge amount of food.  We ate until full while there, and had two takeout containers that we ate for breakfast the next day.  Had we known how much food would come out, we would have ordered less, but made the most of the abundance. The staff was attentive and patient with us being a little indecisive and needing more explanations.  I have only done Hot Pot onec before in Beijing and ordered a combo with preset veggies and I only had to choose my meat making the process easy. We visited on a Friday night and the place was bustling, but not overly crowded.  We walked to a nearby bakery for dessert and were pleased with our trip.  My BF is now a Hot Pot lover.  Thanks Little Lamb.

35.description: Food is good but service need improvement. Came here around 8pm for late night hotspot. Told there was a 30mins minute wait.  We didn't get seated until 9:20!! That's crazy!

19.description: Was quite impressed with this hot pot place. The meat we ordered was very well marbled and nicely prepared. Broths were just spicy and tasty enough to make the experience great (too spicy and things go south!)Highly recommend the grilled lamb rack. Huge but balanced cumin flavor that was delicious. Ordered 1 for a group of 4...not enough! Get 2

28.description: This place was amazing! The staff is really nice and the authentic feel and taste is exquisite. A+ in my book.

45.description: I should first share that I am not a big fan of hot pot.The broth almost always has me feeling nauseous after the meal.With that said, I would say that Little Lamb was one of the better hot pot experiences I've had.We ordered the house special herb broth and the spicy broth and both were delicious with a strong flavor. We ordered beef, pork, seafood platter, shrimp dumplings, enoki mushroom and vegetable platter. The shrimp dumplings had no flavor or texture and I had to ask the server what they were. We were also not too crazy about the seafood platter and would probably just stick to the meat and veggies next time. We also ordered cold noodles as so many reviews recommended it but found it to be a disappointment - the flavors did not blend well and the cilantro was overbearing. There is a $1/pp charge for the sauce bar where you can find recipes for the different sauce you can make. I found it to be quite helpful!

33.description: As a Singaporean Chinese new to Chicago, i didnt harbor high hopes for authentic savory hotpot. But i was pleasantly surprised by the standard of the soup bases here. I ordered spicy herbal broth and mushroom broth. Both were really flavorful and tasty! I felt that i could really taste the mushrooms in the mushroom soup. The spicy herbal soup looks oily and i have to spoon out a really thick layer of oil on top,but it was still really addictive. Ingredients wise,they were quite normal but at least fresh. All in all a pretty good meal. Would be great if it could be slightly cheaper though.

43.description: Having heartburn after ingesting the broth is probably not a good feeling to have. First, you would think that when you walk into a restaurant, you would be greeted by someone immediately. It wasn't like they were busy. After 5 minutes, someone finally sat me down at one of the booths. I noticed that they don't have fume hoods so all the steam will eventually end up in your face. At least my waitress was kind enough to explain the menu to me. Everything is a la carte. If you were new to the hot pot place, her explanation would have left you even more confused. In fact, you may just order way too much stuff. I had the Spicy Mongolian Broth to start off my hot pot as well as some lamb slices and vegetable platter. The broth was not good. It contained too many peppercorns and hot chili oil that ruined the broth.The lamb slices were decent, but I was disappointed in their vegetable platter. Most of the platter was cabbage, and slopped on the plate as though presentation was a fad. The worst was the sauce bar. Half of the labels and sauces were missing from the sauce bar. Also, looking at the sauces would make you lose your appetite.

2.description: We absolutely love it! Good quality meat, fresh veggies and several kinds of mushroom, tofu products, seafood, plus yummy appetizers. There are only two of us, so we ordered supreme beef slices, premium lamb slices, tong ho, Napa cabbage, mushroom platter, and tofu platter. We also ordered Mongolian meat pie and lamb kebab. Everything tastes so good. The Mongolian herbal and spicy herbal broth are good. When you don't feel super thirsty after your meal, you know there's no msg or too much additives. Oh and they charge extra $2 for dipping sauce. The service was good though they were super busy on a Saturday night. We got there around 6 pm and only waited 15 mins to be seated. By the time we left, there were at least 20 people waiting! Definitely go before 6 if you can. We are looking forward to going back already.

18.description: I really like this place. Sometimes I think the communication barrier frustrated the wait staff which can be a little difficult. The food here is everything and affordable. I love the plum juice also. This is great for people who want a romantic date night or want to hang out with friends. I love the fact I can eat different toppings whenever I come.

41.description: Nice service! Hotpot and jelly noodles are sooooo delicious! Definitely come back for food again!

52.description: Had a party of 4 sharing the hot pot. The decision about spiciness of the broth makes a huge difference on how the rest of the meal turns out. For one side of the pot we selected something too spicy for our tastes which effectively "ruined" the foods we selected. The other side of the pot was a more bland flavor and did not do a lot to enhance the food. Something in between would have been much better.We had a combination of meats and vegetables and tofu. The meat was good. We probably should have ordered more varieties. The vegetables included several that seemed conducive to this form of preparation (broccoli, carrots, etc.) but there were also several that were not and the result was a big mess. There were dipping sauces for an extra charge that helped add some flavor and cut some of the spiciness.The staff was extremely accommodating and provided guidance. I had been to several hot pot restaurants in Shanghai so this place was a nice reminder. Would consider returning here but as I said earlier i would be much more careful in selecting the broth.

50.description: Food is good and fresh, it's a fun experience too.  Just plan on being there for a while, the food takes time to make and eat.

4.description: So overrated! It's a modern setup. The bar menu is too simple. Quality, but simple. The service was decent and prompt. They had a variety of broths... I ordered the Mongolian herbal broth and the house special... Meh. The food selection was good too. Anyway, $50 for two females.

6.description: Attended the 2016 Chinese New Year parade in Chinatown & came upon this place wanting to try something new & get out of the cold snowy weather.... It's a hot pot style Restraunt.. Delicious ... You get to choose your broth style along with meats, veggies, seafood, noodles, rice etc (great selection) only qualm was they ran out of rice (I'm Asian so rice is a necessities me)... Very very delicious ... See attached picture for what we had.. Great pricing & very nice server (our server was very accommodating)... Go go try it.. You really can't go wrong in Chinatown!!!! I love ethnic food!!! BON APPETITE!!!

22.description: Hot pot galore, pretty much a staple in my culinary appetite as I usually enjoy this at my friends and family outings. This is my first time going to a restaurant for hot pot. They give you a very extensive menu to choose every item, there is no pictures which is hard for me since I see what I like to eat rather than the word describing the item. Took me a while but I ordered all the items I can remember. I got the not-so-spicy broth (there are more than 5  different broths) and over twenty little dishes came to the table Once the broth boils up and you can start to add cold items into the broth and wait and take it out in these wire mesh baskets to serve to your bowl. I was here for three hours to finish all my dishes. I would definitely come back again. There are plenty of parking and BYOB. The good thing about this is you don't have to do any dishes when you are done.

15.description: I had spicy herbal soup (the second one on the menu). It looks really spicy, but taste not that spicy. The herbs gave combinations of smell, which is not bad at all,  but I'm not used to it. There are varieties of ingredients, which you can used to make cups of sauce yourself. Lack of service a little, but overall is a very good place to eat with friends!

57.description: I went on April 2015 and the menu had slightly changed. They no longer offer the 50% off meat on sunday, but I noticed that the price of the meat reduced by few dollars. This time around, the house special broth (non spicy) was not as good as the first few times I had over the past winter 2014. The flavor wasn't there or could've been better. Once again, the meat presentation was nice and the quality is still there. I tried the Mongolian beef pie and I loved it!!! YUMMY. It's almost like a chicken pot pie, except this is flaky and soft. The interior was stuffed with minced beef and the outer crust had some cheese in it. It was delicious!

20.description: Overall, a very poor experience. We ordered 羊蝎子 (lamb) hotpot but the lamb was not yet done and it was very strong. The 烧饼 (sesame bun) was not freshly made or authentic. Also, typically 羊蝎子 hotpot has a custom made soup but they just used the standard clear soup which did not have much flavor. Additionally, the sesame sauce for the dipping sauce was not pure but was cut with a filler that gave it a very poor taste. It was way too expensive for what we got. There are much better options for hotpot in town.

36.description: Nice hot pot! I like both the flavor and the environment! It is really a nice place to hang out with friends here!

14.description: Arguably the best hotpot in Chicago right now.  Yeah it's right near by Mandarin Kitchen and they have an all-you-can-eat price, but you can get just as much at Little Lamb for the same price.  But really the quality of the meat is a step above at Little Lamb, which is (in my opinion) what gives it the crown.  We sampled quite the spread of meat and veggies, and left more than full.  When ordering start with fewer dishes and order more as you go, rather than loading up initially and then have so much food to try and eat.  There are many different lamb choices on the menu, but get the Supreme Lamb Shoulder. Even though it's twice the cost of the lamb leg and both have the same amount of meat, the shoulder is much more tender while the leg is tough.  Also they make their own fish balls in house with chives, which I absolutely loved but the partner disliked.  For broths, the seasoned house broth is a great choice.  It starts off not that flavorful, but improves as you cook more in it, and is a star by the end of the meal and makes the last noodles taste so yummy.  The tomato base works in the opposite way, starting off great but degrading as more and more water boils off, I can't in good faith recommend this, especially when there are multiple other broth choices.  They also offer some small appetizers, of which the lamb kebabs are dry rubs with cumin on them, pretty tasty.  Lastly you can check in on Yelp to get a free scoop of ice cream.

3.description: Wing Fung Market which recently opened in Chinatown is new and clean.  The entire staff there is very friendly and helpful especially the manager. There are a variety of fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, and fresh seafood to choose from. They also have lots of Asian snack food and all reasonably priced.  It is also a major plus because it has an indoor parking lot and is very accessible.  I will be visiting this store whenever I need any Chinese groceries.  Keep up the great work Wing Fung Market!!!

1.description: We were in the area and my mom was looking for something specific and said to come here. I didn't even know there was another store around here besides HK Market. They do have a covered parking lot, but tight....that's a given. It was FREAKING HOT in there. They had those big fans going, but it was HOT!. I hope they will be turning on the air in the future because this will not do.When I first went in, I was like Wow, pretty big with wide aisles, but then walking around, it felt big, but empty. Not much stuff. They did have a back area that they were stocking.Veggies didn't look fresh. Sad selection too. It was so hot, I bet whoever dared to buy anything with chocolate, it was melted. I think they rushed the opening.....they should have waited til they were all set up first. Not a good first impression. Will probably be back to see how it is later though.

2.description: This market opened a week ago and it is pretty hidden. If you head northeast on archer, then you will easily see the parking garage. The parking garage is small but very efficient; people are heading in and out of this store.The market itself is average but it houses Asian items like the standard shrimp chips, mochi ice cream, and ramune soda. They also have fresh fish that they will kill to order and meat cuts. I bought a lot of Asian snacks and the delicious ramen oaks they had. I'm so glad this market is nearby.

0.description: Shopped on Dec 27th 2015.  This market is going out of business soon.  Most of the items on the shelf are 20% off marked price.  The owner said the market will remain open for three more weeks (til Jan 17th, 2016 or so).Now it is the best time to stock up on dry goods, can goods, jars, sauce, spice, snacks...etc.Most likely the discount will increase from current 20% off, in order to empty out the shelves in the days remaining.

58.description: This is a family style Chinese restaurant with no-nonsense decor and I have been a repeat customer for over 10 years..   If you go thinking you will have a great meal ordering individual dinners, think again- FAMILY STYLE.  Stick to what they do best- regional seasonal specialties and stay away from the Chinese food for US tastes menu (empress chicken, etc).  Talk to the waiters and tell them what you want to eat- seafood?  veggies?  etc...  and they will oblige and bring you what is best and fresh.  For those looknig for fast food- this is not a carry out/delivery sort of place.

56.description: Went there for Father's Day with the family and plan never to go there again!  This restaurant has been in Chinatown for years.  The sad part is, the food is pretty good .... if they ever bring it to you!   Granted it was Father's Day and extremely busy, but there is absolutely no excuse for what we experienced.  First, they just packed people in wherever they could fit them!  It was so crowded that the help couldn't get around the tables, let alone patrons.  In hindsight, we should have left.  If there was a fire, it would have been a very dangerous situation - it was that overcrowded!  Once we were actually able to get the attention of our waiter and started ordering, he said at least 3 of the dishes we ordered were not available.  How aggravating is that? It was only 6:30pm!  We did end up ordering 8 dishes.  We got one dish and some rice and then waited at least 20 mins. before the next dish came out.  Long story short, 2 hours into it we had only gotten 4 dishes!  Finally, we got so frustrated that we asked them to cancel the rest of the order and give us the check.  Even that took 20 mins.  Back to the overcrowding issue ..... the table next to us opened up and it was a round table that usually seats 8-10 people.  This rude woman came in and just had to cram 16-20 people into it!  They banged their chairs into our chairs trying to make us move in.  It was a ridiculous situation.  Worse yet, one of the waitresses was trying to help them accomplish this rather than telling them to stop!  The food is not good enough to put up with this kind of treatment and there are so many other restaurants in Chinatown to chose from.

29.description: If my father, who is a Type 2 diabetic, an antisocial agoraphobic, and an EXTREMELY thrifty consumer, still manages to be a semi-regular customer here after twenty some years, it's probably for pretty good reason. Specifically, it's the giant portions of high quality food at prices even he can't pass on.The crispy skin chicken, steamed fish over Chinese greens, and soft shelled crab are all amazing and consistently delicious. Very high quality in both ingredients and preparation.Who would've thought the last joint on Wentworth would be the best? Really hoping it's somebody's birthday soon, so I can suggest coming here again.

42.description: My favorite Chinese Restaurant in Chicago...So the first time I came here was with an ex.  We didn't know where to go so I asked some locals, "Hey, where do you guys like to eat?" and they told us 2 places, of which I can't remember the other one.I'm like, "Evergreen?  That doesn't sound very Chinese..."  And really, in Chinatown, I'm just kinda curious what possessed the proprietors of this restaurant to come up with the name Evergreen.I mean, that's very christmasy.  I would expect German or Bavarian food or something, but Chinese food would kinda be the last GOOD thing I would expect at a restaurant named Evergreen.But it's fricken Delicious!Ya, so first off the menu is giant.  I think they give you like 2 or 3 menus and honestly I have no idea what most of the stuff is, but I have managed to figure out a staple of deliciousness:Sizzling Rice SoupYang Chow Fried RiceCrispy Skin ChickenThat's pretty much heaven on the table right there.  A great night in the sack with a sexy mama after that and I think I could pretty much die a happy man.  Regardless, the food is top notch, but if you go on a weekend it will be LOADED house and they tend to be understaffed so the service may not be as amazing as some might expect.But if you go on a weekday night or whatever you are good to go.Anyway, check it out and I think you'll be pleased.  Cheers...

23.description: This place is one of my favorites in China town. Friendly service, accommodating. Large portions and great taste. A good place to sit down with friends and share. They have a bar and drinks are pretty inexpensive. Try their stuffed crab legs, they are awesome!

47.description: Ordered from here on a friday night. We ordered online through grubhub.com. It was ready a couple minutes after the scheduled time, don't mind the wait. My boyfriend said that they had the best general tsao's chicken he's ever had. Crab rangoon were good, potstickers were good and the chicken fried rice was great. I will definitely be taking the trip to china town for the amazing food. Go, experience it for yourself!!

8.description: Coming here for years probably one of the best Chinese restaurants in the city of Chicago. Mongolian beef & salt n pepper shrimp my favorite. Very comfortable atmosphere.

31.description: Friendly greeting, attentive service, reasonable prices and ample portions. All and all a good experience. Happy to be able to add it to my list of we can walk here from home places. As you walk in you enter a large room, all tables no booths, no little off to the side areas, just one big brightly lit room, almost like a banquet hall, there is a small bar off to the left. They make a pretty decent Mai Tai by the way. If you're ordering more than one dish, and you want them served together, you must tell them, otherwise they serve one dish at a time, we didn't know this and didn't figure it out since the server asked my husband what he wanted, then she asked me. Seemed straight forward enough.My husband ordered bean curd (tofu) with vegetables which came up first. I ordered General Tso's Chicken and a side order of pan fried noodles, which wasn't on the menu as a side, but they gladly said no problem, not only was it not a problem they gave me a huge plate full. Which will make for great leftovers at breakfast. I love pan fried noodles with a couple of over easy eggs on them. Everything was very good, vegetables cooked to the right stage of crispness, chicken nice and crispy with just the right amount of spice.Why not five stars? A very simple fix, please get rid of the TVs. I kept trying to enjoy my dinner when something on the screen would grab my attention, oh yes that would be Law & Order, granted they did have the sound off and the captioning on, but it still was a distraction.

34.description: Came here for a party last night and it was packer than usual because of Christmas Eve. They had our tables all ready which was nice. The service is good here and everyone is friendly. The food for the most part is okay, nothing really stands out from other places in CT. We had the 10 course meal and everything was okay. The only thing we didn't like was the seafood vermicelli, which was lacking flavor. It looked really bland and tasted that way. The quail looked good, but was a little salty. My personal favorite was the baby pea tip with dry scallop. The baby pea tips was fresh and it was probably the best I had yet. The lobster with ginger and onion was good too.I would come back here in the future because of the friendly service.

16.description: Very cheap and HUGE portions.  Definitely staved off our hunger for the night.  Couldn't decide where to go and this seemed at the top of the list.

13.description: We came here for lunch after a funeral service. There weren't that many people there since it was around 230pm. We were served right away - probably because the order was already placed. The service was very attentive and nice. The food was decent.. Nothing to complain.
