A decent Chinese restaurant in Chinatown!

11.description: I'm torn on this.  The food quality is definitely 5 stars.  The service is probably slightly lower and the decor a bit below that.  Since we usually get take-out or delivery, I'm sticking with 5 stars for this.  I could go there and eat potsticker after potsticker until my tummy burst, but all of their food is really quite good.  We tried they Moy's Special and that is probably a new favorite of mine.  If you go to the actual restaurant for dine-in, it is quite dated and the staff seemed to have no issue with small children playing tag in the dining room, but I guess you're probably not expecting a fine-dining experience heading here.

39.description: Biggest sleeper Chinese restaurant in Chicago. And for all you Evergreen fans out there - let's keep it that way!

37.description: A nice, quiet old-school Chinese restaurant serving up some of the best food I've had down here!Went on a busy Saturday night and it was filled with Chinese families who were celebrating birthdays, family get-togethers, etc.  Great atmosphere.Definitely go for the Planter's Punch before stuffing your face with wonderful BBQ Pork or crispy chicken wings.  They're serious about their drinks here.The beef was of the highest quality and Mongolian Beef is something we always get.  Loved the shrimp in the taro nest (which we got to take back for a friend who couldn't join us - and it kind of disappeared on the way...).  General's Chicken is an old stand-by and they prepare it the way it should be done.Service was friendly and quick.  Pricing was reasonable.Tell your friends.  But not too many!

0.description: A family oriented restaurant.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  Take out or dine in, the food is consistent and good.

38.description: Located all the way at the south end of Chinatown this is my favorite place in the area to go and have great Chinese.  The owner is always at the front counter with a friendly helpful attitude.  We've eaten here a lot and the food is always great and consistent.  Excellent Hong Kong Steak.  If you're in Elmwood Park, their other restaurant is New Star on North Ave.  Fantastic.  Always ask for the waiter Chee.

51.description: geez...why does their Picking Duck taste so GOOD?!?!?! Steamed Oysters.....mmmmMmmmMMMmm. Potstickers is a typical dish, but it's really good. Love coming here with friends and family. With more people comes more dishes. There's great service. I always order the same Chinese stuff, so there are times when I like another person's opinion. The waiters are very helpful. I just ask to suggest something. They'll tell me what was freshly delivered. HOOK it up! I like how it's a sit in nicely put Chinese restaurant. Most Chinatown places are a bit uncomfy and dirty to eat in. But it's chill in here. I like.Thumbs up to this place.

27.description: I've been going to this restaurant for years and years.  Are there places that make this dish or that dish better? Yes, of course.  But for our Peking Duck Pilgramage, there is no better place.  Very good service and a mix of customers makes it an enjoyable afternoon or everning for all.

32.description: My new favorite in Chi-town Chinatown. I'm usually hesitant to go to Chinese restaurants because I don't like greasy food laden with MSG. This time, a group of friends wanted to go there for New Year Eve's dinner and I have no other place to suggest. It turned out to be a wonderful surprise. All the dishes were great. Huge servings. I love the red bean-lotus seed soup as dessert.Good service, especially for a Chinese restaurant.Definitely going back again!

54.description: I frequent Chinatown a lot and I love eating here! The waiters are nice and attentive. There's a bar, although I've don't usually order from there. I love their fried oysters! It was fresh and delish! Will continue to go back as I always have!

48.description: We have been coming here for years and have historically loved it . . . however, lately it seems they have a new chef or have changed something in the kitchen because both the entree that I always order (General Tso) and the entree my wife always orders (Kung Pao) are both now suddenly, and regularly, inedibly hot.  This happened three visits in a row so last time I took to trying to explain it to the person on the phone.  There was a bit of a language barrier, and we both ended up with totally not at all spicy dishes, which was no good either.  We want it spicy, just not inedible.

44.description: We happen to stumble upon this hidden decent restaurant after the Chinatown Parade.   They have a pretty good family size deals and we were able to take home left overs after wards.   Service was typical as any other Asian restaurant, mediocre.   However, since I am not a big fan of Chinese it's not a place I would trek the train to satiate my appetite for this type of cuisine.

24.description: Not bad, worth giving it a try.

7.description: My review of this place hasn't really changed my mind. It is still dated. Stuck on it's hay day. Everything that you can order is basically what you can order at any take out place. Still not impress.

49.description: By far some of the best chinese food that I have tasted in a long time. The food was fresh and hot when it was delivered to my house. And it was delivered on time, which is a plus for me.  The delivery man was so sweet & nice.

40.description: A new favorite place to eat!  I was eating at Cai and Ming Hing for quite a while and realized, man it's a ton of money and the food portions kept shrinking.  So I tried somewhere else.  Evergreen has been around for a decade or two.  So we went for father's day (the week after) and it was about half full, a mixture of american and chinese people, some tables had both!  I ordered chinese food.  The food, I have no complaints about the food!  Wow just well cooked flavorful food, the service is kinda your typical chinese restaurant service, though the owner said she has been trying to get them to improve.  Bottom Line: Food is better here than the other two places, same price, service not as good.  I go for good food over good service/price (I want all 3 though, but until I can find that, this is my new favorite place)Salt and Pepper Short Beef Rib - this is done the way it should be, lightly battered and deep fried and fall off the bone tenderness. Salt and Pepper Shrimp - When you can eat the shell, you know it's good.  You can eat this shell.  It's also not overly spicy like some places.  Salt and Pepper Tofu stuffed w/ shrimp and egg - We had never heard of this and  decided, let's try it. The tofu is that koren or japanese tofu that is in a roll, not that cubed stuff.  It's firmer and they found a way to make it salt and pepper, and stuff it while keeping it all in one piece.  Amazing.  Try it!Baked Tofu stuffed w/ Shrimp and american broccoli - our parents don't always like spicy so they ordered this one, though they did say they liked the salt and pepper one as well haha.  Probably won't be ordering this because the other one is favorable to them, but this was also good.  They put egg drop soup on top of the cubes of tofu stuffed with shrimp.  Odd but it was nice, added some creaminess.Honey Walnut Shrimp - One of my favorite dishes, along with salt and pepper ones as you can tell.  This one is often messed up by restaurants in some way.  This was done in an excellent way, and the best walnuts I have had in a long time.  Often walnuts are stale, these are nice and fresh and the shrimp, oh the firmness gave it great substance.Bird's Nest (Deep Sea in a Basket) - Shrimp, Scallops, and baby bok choy in a taro basket.  The ultimate failure of this in almost all chinese places is they use either non-taro, or they make it once a week and refry them, or they make both mistakes.  Evergreen made neither, it was fresh 100% taro and cooked to perfection.  My brother is a huge fan of this and he said it was excellent!  The nest itself is crunchy and the seafood was cooked perfectly, let the stuff meld a bit and eat the nest and you get such flavor it's droolable (i made that word up).Fish Fillet w/ Chinese Broccoli - a good clean tasting dish with fresh veggies and fish.  Nice and did not fall apart when eating it.Egg Plant Casserole - I don't know why we order this except that our parents like it.  I did enjoy it, it's actually spicy which I did not expect. I'm not an egg plant fan by any means but I did enjoy this due to the spiciness, they didn't realize it was spicy I think.Sew Chow (Lotus Root fried w/ some mushrooms, peapods, and other veggies) oh it also comes with chinese sausage.  This dish is really only good if you can get it to be nice and not overly oily and crispy  That's what they did.  It's a traditional casual type dish that chinese people like.  If you like veggies, try it out.

53.description: If you are in China Town looking for a good place to sit, and dine in this is the place to be. I gave Evergreen 3 stars because I was looking to try something new. I asked our waitress about a particular item and her English wasn't that great so I had to order your typical Mongolian Beef. Ive been to alot of Chinese restaurant and have ordered this dish many times so it takes alot to impress me. Was hoping to try something new in the heart of China Town.

30.description: The foods here are mediocre. I really like the lobster fruit salad and the sweet and sour pork ribs!!!

46.description: I come here and get my peking duck fix, to be honest, I haven't tried alot of their other dishes, usually I just come, get an order of peking duck which I'll get the fried rice/soup/peking duck wraps which will completely fill up the two of us. they use the traditional thin wraps instead of the buns which most of chinatown and Sun Wah in argyle are using. They cut the duck skin with just the right amount of meat and they soup they make with the bones doesn't taste like the typical chinatown msg filled house special soup.Their service is friendly in a kind of way that makes you feel like they all have known you for a long time....but actually not. writing this review makes me want to go eat again...maybe tonight.

1.description: I can't remember the last time I was here. I came here with my family after a funeral. We ordered the typical banquet meal. Some standouts were the roasted pork (did not like the pickled vegetables underneath) and the beef and gai lan. But I did not like the tilapia (oil tasted old/smoky, which imparted a weird aftertaste), sweet and sour pork (not very crispy, just felt like it was slathered in sauce). I thought it was interesting to be served a sweet ginger dessert soup with noodles rather than balls or tapioca. Additionally, when you enter the restaurant, it's like you're transported back to the 80s/90s. However, service was prompt although we were pretty much the only customers in the entire restaurant.

55.description: I need to start by saying in fairness, this review is incomplete, I need to go back with a more experimental crew and try stuff off that green "authentic" menu. I'll also say that based on my experience just the one time, it's probably 4.5 based on what we had. Need to bump up to the full 5 to help the average based on some of the completely idiotic reviews some people have of this place....... My experience, 3 of us got the dinner for 3. This includes; egg drop soup, egg rolls, crab rangoon, 3 bbq ribs, fried shrimp, combination fried rice, Lemon Chicken, Kung Pao Beef, and Shrimp and Scallops in water chestnuts and peapods. As for the starters, the egg rolls were solid, everything else was decent with the exception of the crab rangoons, this wasn't that good. As for entrees, first off, huge portions, in fact, this dinner for 3 easily would of fed 4 people, maybe even 5 or 6. As for the taste, only one mediocre one, the lemon chicken. It wasn't necessarily bad, but the lemon flavor tasted a bit like the inside of a lemon meringue pie, which everyone agreed was a bit too sweet. Then there was the fried rice, and shrimp and scallop dish, both very solid. Maybe a tad short of great, but very solid. The Kung Pao Beef on the other hand was great. A great deal of spicy hot, but not too much to make it difficult to eat (well maybe if you got overly involved with the red peppers and/or seeds). The freshness of this dish also popped, especially with the peanuts. I would not call it an exaggeration to call it far and away the best Kung Pao I've ever had. So all in all we were happy and overly full. We got a good meal at about $22 a person with tax and tip.................................. I want to add 2 things to this review. My girlfriend doesn't like to experiment with food decisions as much as I do. This review is incomplete because they have an entire menu of dishes I did not try one of. I would like to go back there after I research some more traditional Chinese dishes (the seafood ones looked especially interesting), and try them. I will also not order a set item like the dinner for 3 and pick and choose off both menus....................Finally I'd like to address the people who had problems with the service and only gave it one star. This place is quite a bit authentic, and I know we're in America, but there are some cultural differences that I believe play a factor. The rest of the world is not so obnoxious and demanding as Americans, maybe that's why they aren't as attentive. To me they were a bit aloof, but got the job done. I personally have never been to China, but have talked to many who have. Ask them what service is like in a common restaurant (not some high class place business people go to). This place does fine, and saying they have great food but they get one star cause of service is completely shortsighted. So unless you're an asswipe about service, go to Evergreen, cool place!

9.description: If I hadn't gone with people that had been there before I probably would not have stepped into it.  It's not fancy but if you look past the decor, you will not be disappointed. Just think about how you're visiting old Chinatown. :)Went there with a 18 person party, definitely good for family dining.  My favorite dishes were their Peking Duck, Walnut Shrimp, Crispy Duck Stuffed with Taro Root.  The crispy duck stuffed with taro root, looks a little odd and probably sounds odd as well if you've never tried it.  I think this is the dish I would recommend if you're trying to venture out of your norm.  The service wasn't bad, but it did get slow towards the end of our meal because the entire restaurant was packed.  But as long as you're not afraid of asking for things, you'll be fine. If you still have room for dessert, you should get the mango pudding in a shape of a fish. Having the pudding was refreshing at the end of a big meal. And well the fish shape is cute too. :)

26.description: There are not a lot of restaurants in Chicago's Chinatown that is consistent. Evergreen is my family's preferred choice. We always order the dinner for eight or ten, depending on how many family members show up and the dishes are always the same. Crispy chicken, steamed lobster, a whole steamed fish, stir fried calamari, Mongolian beef, beef chow mein, seafood chow fun and a few vegetable stir fry dishes that rotate each visit. Eight out of ten visits, the food is good. Fresh, seasoned well and hot. You will get those times when they are busy (ie., a banquet or a Saturday night in the summer) and the food will be either over or under cooked. My father in law, who I often describe as a grumpy old man who complains about the food at every restaurant complains the least at Evergreen. So, I guess that kind of sums it up. Worth a trip. Best time to visit is for lunch on a Sunday when everyone else is having dim sum elsewhere.

25.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!   Outright discrimination, and excessively poor service.  Our family dined at the Evergreen Restaurant last night.  The restaurant was very crowed, so we waited about 30 - 45 minutes to be seated.  We were finally seated in the back of the restaurant in a small cramped space, arm distance from the constant traffic of the kitchen.  We were so close to the kitchen that the waiters kept bumping into my chair, with no apologies at all.  We never received a waitress.  We were the only African Americans in the restaurant.  A couple of waitresses walked by and asked us if we needed anything.  One waitress took our order for drinks and appetizers, then just disappeared into the crowd. We didn't see her until 45 minutes later.  Another waiter felt sorry for us and took our dinner order.  Because we were close to the kitchen we saw another table that was seated after us, be served their drinks, appetizer, and then even dinner before we were asked our dinner orders.  I did not want to cause a scene, I was so shocked. So I patiently waited, but I didn't look pleased.  There was concern on my face the whole time.  I wanted to see how far they would go.  They usually have excellent food, so I anticipated that it would be worth the wait.  We received a half full dinner plates.  The proportion size was considerably smaller than the other plates leaving the kitchen that went to other tables.  Like they at the last minute put scraps together for us.  THE SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE!!  THE FOOD WAS BELOW PAR.  The food quantity was small.  We asked for extra shrimp - I barely say a shrimp.  We are a quiet family of four that's not use to this type of service.  No ill words were ever said to the wait staff, only because I didn't want to cause a scene, the restaurant was crowded and I didn't want to cause undo criticism to the other wait staff that really felt sorry for us and were genuinely busy with other tables -- It's not all about me -- but I hope the restaurant owner sees this.  I WILL NEVER, EVER RETURN TO THE EVERGREEN RESTAURANT and hope that if any other African Americans go to this restaurant, they are treated better, and get the same high quality service and attention as any other patron.

12.description: It has taken me so much to write this review regarding a dining experience... Traditionally, there is a dinner gathering proceeding a funeral and we unfortunately did not occupy the whole restaurant so it was still set up for business. We occupied approximately 5/7 of one half of the place (sorry no math). The other side was apparently reserved for a wedding. The boss did their part on having two polar events in the same room and had a facade set up. My low review is due to the rude staff who snapped photos to capture the happy event of a wedding with the funeral related dinner... Needless to say, my respect for the staff etiquette diminished and will not wish to come back for any planned dinner events for my immediate family.

59.description: Ask for the green menu(with real Chinese food). Had the Gold Dust Crab. Real crab for once. Was good!

21.description: So sad to go all the way to china town for over priced mediocre food. Even worse I guess we looked like tourists because we were told we had to order from the Dinner menu even though it was lunch time.   Very slow service.  Really disappointed we wasted our time here.

17.description: Horrible experience. Every food we ordered had the same taste. The waitress was rude. My first and last time for sure!!!

10.description: We appreciated knowing when we inquired about MSG. COMPLETE disclosure. Dishes with No MSG and no salt are available on entres only. All appetizer have MSG.

5.description: About a 2-2.5:  My co-workers and I came to Evergreen in Chinatown, as it was stated to be one of their favorite Chinese food.  I was a little weary, as I haven't had such good experiences with the eateries around here :P  We were seated right away, and we tried several dishes: vegetarian egg rolls (which were okay with the sweet and sour sauce); vegetable fried rice (on the bland side); sweet & sour pork (big chunks of chicken in a very sweet sauce; fried tofu (the tofu was fried, but the sauce was a bit watered down); Lo Mein Special (had pieces of chicken, shrimp, and fried noodles - I enjoyed this most out of all); and, Mongolian Beef (I wasn't really a fan of the texture of the beef; it had a spicy kick to it with the jalapeno slices, and it was a bit too salty).  We were also served oolong tea and fortune cookies for dessert.  Service was pretty quick and efficient, and the place was packed during the lunch rush.+Lo Mein Special

3.description: You want to get on a plane and fly to Bejing and order some Peking duck? Maybe you do, but why not go to Chinatown in Chicago and order the best Peking duck offering in Chicago!Good prices, good service and excellent duck.

35.description: We were in Chi-Town for business and craved some down-and-dirty-eat-like-the-local-ethnics-authentic Chinese cooking.We ordered in Chinese and get some off the menu recommendations.My favorite item: Gold Dusted Crab. Hands down. The crab is covered in egg yolk and is oh-so-tasty-finger-licken good.It was pretty good and quite affordable. Pretty good in a pinch when you're in a city that you don't know. A bit of a trek though and this was our second time back and every time we always have trouble finding a cab to get home.

19.description: If my father, who is a Type 2 diabetic, an antisocial agoraphobic, and an EXTREMELY thrifty consumer, still manages to be a semi-regular customer here after twenty some years, it's probably for pretty good reason. Specifically, it's the giant portions of high quality food at prices even he can't pass on.The crispy skin chicken, steamed fish over Chinese greens, and soft shelled crab are all amazing and consistently delicious. Very high quality in both ingredients and preparation.Who would've thought the last joint on Wentworth would be the best? Really hoping it's somebody's birthday soon, so I can suggest coming here again.

28.description: Great lunch specials.  Food is consistent.  I would recommend.  Also good for larger parties.

45.description: i brought my family here to eat because it was my father's birthday and he wanted to try something new. it was a weekday night and the place was kind of dead.. the place seem pretty big and well organized..we ordered salt and pepper shrimp, steamed flounder, sweet and sour pork, and Chinese spinach.. the shrimp was ok,it was lacking a little on the flavor... i don't eat fish but my parents seems to like it... the sweet and sour pork was pretty good and well balanced.. the Chinese spinach taste average like most of the restaurants in Chinatown..the service was a little slow for being the only few customer there.. but i will give this place another try some day!

33.description: In China town. Food huge portions -very good. We chuckled when we found out is sister company a place we frequent regularly. The sizzling soup was very good.

43.description: Some of the best Chinese food in the city. What I love about Evergreen is the food is always good. They have some of the best steamed dumplings I have ever had. HANDS DOWN. Seriously if you are not ordering dumplings, you're doing it wrong. I love their mongolian beef and the kung poa chicken as well. The place fills up pretty quickly during the dinner time rush. I love seeing all the families coming for dinner and the owner is really nice. Seriously go to Evergreen if you have never been.

2.description: We had yet another wonderful Chinese banquet family meal here, and I just noted to myself that it's been over 3 years since I provided my last updated review.  Current owner Bing and Evergreen staff have always been reliable and consistent in providing a great, big and traditional Cantonese meal at very reasonable prices.  We've had a lot of meals here over the years. Daughter also had her delightful and satisfying rehearsal dinner here last year that was a particular hit for our out-of-town guests and I did not even bother to review as it was par for the course for us here.  Tonight's dinner for 10 consisted of (in no particular order):- pork broth starter soup- cold pork / jelly fish / egg roll appetizer plate- seafood in taro nest- whole steamed flounder- Chinese fried chicken- beef tenderloin- rice vermicelli and veggies- pork in Peking sauce- sauteed jalapeno shrimp- double lobster- fried rice- egg noodles- black bean dessert soup- complimentary fish-shaped mango jello with creamIt was pretty busy tonight and Father's Day weekend dinners likely contributed.  I'm sure we'll be back again sometime.

18.description: Friendly greeting, attentive service, reasonable prices and ample portions. All and all a good experience. Happy to be able to add it to my list of we can walk here from home places. As you walk in you enter a large room, all tables no booths, no little off to the side areas, just one big brightly lit room, almost like a banquet hall, there is a small bar off to the left. They make a pretty decent Mai Tai by the way. If you're ordering more than one dish, and you want them served together, you must tell them, otherwise they serve one dish at a time, we didn't know this and didn't figure it out since the server asked my husband what he wanted, then she asked me. Seemed straight forward enough.My husband ordered bean curd (tofu) with vegetables which came up first. I ordered General Tso's Chicken and a side order of pan fried noodles, which wasn't on the menu as a side, but they gladly said no problem, not only was it not a problem they gave me a huge plate full. Which will make for great leftovers at breakfast. I love pan fried noodles with a couple of over easy eggs on them. Everything was very good, vegetables cooked to the right stage of crispness, chicken nice and crispy with just the right amount of spice.Why not five stars? A very simple fix, please get rid of the TVs. I kept trying to enjoy my dinner when something on the screen would grab my attention, oh yes that would be Law & Order, granted they did have the sound off and the captioning on, but it still was a distraction.

41.description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in Chicago and I have been allot of places. We go there once a month and on special occasions. Always friendly service, allof of fresh good tasting food at reasonable prices. Never been disappointed and always leave with a smile and a very full tummy.....order off the Chinese menu for the best dishes, if you can read the wait staff will translate...bon appetite!

52.description: Pleasantly surprised. Great food and huge portions and not too expensive. Drinks are strong and the decor actually makes you feel like you are in Chinatown. First Chinese joint that I've ever seen use jalapenos in a dish making them a little more eccentric.

50.description: I have been coming here for years since I live in bridgeport and they make a few exceptional dishes that other restaurants in the area cannot match.  Most of the younger people opt to go to chinatown square for more casual meals but this place is the place I go for authentic chinese food with the family.  They are also very consistent with the quality of beef and freshness of the seafood, which I cannot say about many restaurants in the area.The peking duck is a standout dish.  The duck is always crispy and succulent and it combines so well with the wrap, oyster sauce, and scallions.  The egg rolls here are by far the best I've tried.  They are robust and do not skimp on the pork.  They are consistently crispy and have just the right amount of saltiness.  Many egg rolls in chinatown are small and have too much cabbage but this one passes the test.  Another favorite of mine is the NY T-Bone Steak.  The meat is charred on the outside leaving the interior juicy.  The meat is topped off with soy sauce and surrounded by chinese vegetables.  It is better than some steak houses I've been to.For those who have an american taste, Evergreen will also satisfy your needs.  The sesame chicken is crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.  This is much harder to do that it sounds as I have been sorely dissapointed with some other restaurants that serve this dish.  The beef at Evergreen is usually of very high quality.  Therefore, the spicy mongolian beef is another great dish to have here.  The seafood here is equally amazing.  I usually get the seafood basket with scallops and shrimp.  The best part is the fried taro basket.  You will have to try it if you haven't.  Bring your family if you want great chinese cuisine.  The chefs here are legit and know how to pay attention to taste and meat quality.  Take it from a real chinese person who has been around the entire chinatown.  You will not be let down.

4.description: Mediocre at best. Most of their food is very bland.

6.description: We've eaten since before my parents passed away. We keep coming back. The food is always fresh an that includes the meats too. It's noisy but a good noise. The service is excellent. Two thumbs up.

22.description: So I've been going to Evergreen for a few years now, and I guess it's a decent restaurant.  The best thing there I would have to say is probably the lobster coated with the salty egg.  Now one thing i hate that is rampant in most chinese restaurants is the fact that they have two different menus, a western and eastern menu.  Being chinese I would always get the eastern menu which includes a larger variety of more authentic foods including the lobster coated in the salty egg.  Besides the lobster not much else is really worth mentioning.  The restaurant itself is a pretty decent size and is pretty comfortable.  The service is decent and the overall ambiance is ok.  Now another thing I didn't enjoy on my last visit (it was mothers day) was the fact that the place was definitely overcrowded and undermanned.  The service was worse than usual and twice my mother had to get up from the meal to make room for other customers to get out, not very good planning.  But overall it's a decently priced restaurant with pretty decent portions.

15.description: First time eating here with friends today. Ordered the special set menu that included lobster, salt & pepper prawns, veggies with fish fillet, rice and side order of peking duck. The wait staff was very attentive and like the old school posh waiters with their waistcoats. I was pleasantly surprised the the quality of food and service. Will return.

57.description: Awesome service and great food.The best Chinese Food in AmericaMust go and eat here

20.description: I have not had Evergreen in a while. It's crazy to say that I really loved their food because sometimes Chinese food is all the same to me. I had the best egg rolls in town here. The crab rangoon was tasty. I had a spicy shrimp plate that was not too overwhelming so it wasn't killing you to eat it even though I enjoy spicy foods. We tried the emein noodles which were soooo great!  It's something that I will probably crave. The only thing I did not like at all were there fried shrimp. The batter was way too thick and it looked & tasted like it was sitting for a while, almost pre-made. Their tea is freshly made with tea leaves and not tea bags like some other joints.

36.description: Solid Chinese restaurant. So far everything I have eaten here over the years is tasty. However the restaurant changes chefs pretty often. Most of the time they chefs are pretty well picked and can prepare good main dishes. I usually get seafood dishes such as lobster, scallop, steamed fish, etc.

14.description: My family and I really like this establishment. Waiters and waitresses are friendly. Owners are really nice and the food is delicious. We love the salt and pepper smelts and orange chicken. No one else in Chinatown can prepare it as good as Evergreen!

1.description: How hard is it to run a credit card? After fumbling with the machine for a couple minutes, they double charged me for what turned out to be bland, tasteless food.

0.description: This is one of the booths in Chinatown's subterranean food court. I tried it a few days ago and was favorably impressed. I got a big plate of vegetable fried rice for $3.99. Not a fancy dish or anything, but it was nicely prepared and tasty. I'd go there again.

58.description: I love this place I go on some Sundays, Its a friendly place its just small with a lot of tables. the food is very good. its a nice place to hang out with friends and family.

56.description: Took forever at addressing us or getting our order done quickly. Others made their orders after us and picked it up quicker. The manager ignored us when we wanted to inquire about our order.Food wasn't great either.

29.description: Great place for carry out. This place is small but the food is good. Most of the time it's best to call in your order because parking is a bit crazy in this area. It you like pot stickers this place is a winner and the house made hot sauce. And if you like veggies then check out the veggie fried rice with eggs.

42.description: Good fried rice. Nice stir fried vegetable but standard egg roll and spring roll. Authentic chinese restaurant atmosphere.

23.description: The food is OK .. Sometimes the rice is old , and they don't seem to like Black people. I have witnessed on more than one occasion when the cashier would be rude to an African American guest ...

47.description: Quality chinese restaurant, I admit in chinatown they kinda all taste the same to me, but it was still good nonetheless, we had shrimp toast, crab rangoon, general tsaos chicken, seafood, rice, beans, beef chop suey, i dont remember the exact names but anything with those ingredients in it should be an ok choice

8.description: This was my favorite Chinese restaurant growing up. Ate here almost once a month for almost 20 years. It's still one of my favorites for dim sum or a dinner in the city. Always enjoy the pan fried noodles or their shrimp fried rice.

31.description: They open late so we came here to eat at 3 am after looking around for asian food in china town.Normally, when you're in china town, you don't have to worry about the usual Americanized Chinese food but this place has all that oily dishes. their menu doesn't sound like the restaurant locates in china town.  I can't explain it but if you travel to some small abandoned  towns, you'll most likely find some Chinese restaurants like this one.  They almost have the same names for all the fast food dishes and they almost taste the same.  I think of these restaurants as Chinese fast foods and they serve frozen food marinated in some serious MSG. Everything was soak and glazed with MSG so badly that we couldn't finish our dish.  The food was overly sweet in a very synthetic way.  It feels like mothballs was one of the ingredients or something chemically strange like that.  Will never come back and hopefully nobody has to have mothball food experience like us.

34.description: I've come here for dim sum a few times and as the rating suggests, food is A-OK. Price is reasonable...nothing special, but nothing terrible, in my experiences at least.Chicago, in my opinion, has great Chinese food though, so why just get "OK" Chinese food?

16.description: I like it. They give you big servings for the price and they are very good every time we get to dine with them. I wish the place was a little bigger and the decor, but we came here to eat and not to be fancy. They are open until 3AM, which is always good for the late bird that I am. Check them out when you get a chance.

13.description: Great place to go to late at night after the bars/clubs. Not the cleanest Chinese restaurant but food is good! Ordered egg drop soup, fried rice, Chinese broccoli, and a whole duck. This was too much food for 4 people, we over ordered, but luckily it's cheap. Staff wasn't very attentive but a lot of Chinese restaurants are like that.

11.description: Hadn't been to Chinatown in years, but remember this and King Wah as being a good feed.  King Wahs sign is still there, but the restaurant is not.  It's some clothing store, or such.   Look into that, new business owner.   Off to Three Happiness.   Yes, it's small, a bit worn, and could use a good cleaning, but the food is as good as I remember.  Our out of town guests were impressed as well, and one is a very picky eater.  Everything was made-to-order and very fresh. (As opposed to vats of cooked food sitting under warming lamps)I don't know if it was the Wentworth road construction, but all of Chinatown seemed a little dirty and worn.  Lots of black panhandling bums lurking about, which I never remember as being a problem in the past, but gave the streetscape a slight sketchy feel.  Forewarned is forearmed.

39.description: I made it a goal to make it to Chinatown in Chicago and stopped by Three Happiness with friends because of the mostly positive reviews. When I came in, I wasn't excited by the ambiance of this restaurant as it had chairs and tables of your average Subway restaurant. On the other hand, their menu items were very inexpensive. I tried the eggrolls as an appetizer and was very pleased. Also had the chicken curry and I got a huge dinner portion for under $10. Even though I left on a full stomach, I wasn't very wowed by the food quality. Also, the servers were inattentive and had to wave them over when I ordered an appetizer, dinner and to clear the plates. For the money, this place is a real bargain and even the beer prices inexpensive to the average Chicago bar, (only $3). However, I wouldn't visit this place to get a great Chinatown experience, only would come here on an empty stomach to eat cheap.

37.description: I've come here a few times now that I think I can submit a review. I usually come here at hours past 11pm. I've come here drunk and sober so I can assure you that I wasn't just drunk and loved the food. Place: a little bit cramped, scary looking bathrooms, depending on the night the service could be slow to moderate. On the bathroom note, everymen I've needed to use the bathroom and look up to see it, it makes me not want to go anymore. In not sure of this is a bad thing or good thing. But it may also be magic. Anyways, bathrooms look really small and o honestly think there is just a hole behind the doors you do your business in. So I'm not sure about bathroom except that it's small. Food: the food is okay. I've had better and I've had worse. Overall I leave content and smiling. The food has taste but at times it's not too great. Seems like they may be rushing it and not allowing enough time to soak the taste up. The shrimp dishes with egg and fried rice are good. Matter of fact, you can't go wrong with any of their rice dishes. I do know my cousin tried the curry once and I tasted it and thought it was awful. I'd stick to the cheap rice plates they have and you should be content with you're selection.

0.description: This was a very good experience. I've been coming to Chinatown for years but never had a true favorite until now. Three Happiness Original (make sure you go to the one on the south side of Cermak!) had great service and very good food. My favorites were the beef w. pan rice noodles, shrimp balls, shrimp dumplings, and pork buns. Shrimp is a specialty here. I prefer the shrimp balls over the shrimp toast as it's basically the same thing, just no slice of fried toast underneath. I also enjoy the sticky rice in grape leaves. Overall this is a great place and easy to get to given the nearby train station. Please visit if you can.

38.description: In terms of the quality of food, I'm giving this place 3 stars, because you could go a few blocks north to Chinatown and get much better quality Chinese food.  But for the service and the bang for your buck, this is an amazing deal!You can literally walk into this restaurant and within 30 minutes be seated, have a multiple course lunch, and be on your merry way.  They are extremely fast and appeal to those that are working in the area during the week.  The prices are cheap too!  I usually get a lunch special with a main dish (Kung Pao chicken, fried rice, eggroll, & soup all for $6).  Extremely cheap and you will have a TON of leftovers, at least one meal.  The servers here have always been incredibly nice as well, especially for those of us who don't speak Chinese... ahem.

51.description: I've been going to this restaurant for years now and I still love it! Try the sauteed oyster with ginger- I drive almost 40 min just to eat this dish here! It is flavorful and delicious. And the fishball soup is amazing too. It's light and hearty.

27.description: Waited 30 min for a table only to have them give the open table to someone else because they had more people. I here the food is good but never got to try it...and never will attempt to again

32.description: The Three Happiness Original restaurant (not to be confused with the New Three Happiness restaurant across the street on the north side of Cermak Ave.) is a hole-in-the-wall storefront operation in the heart of Chinatown.  The dining area is small and unembellished.On a recent weekday our group of four lunched there.  We all shared the shrimp with black bean sauce, the satay beef, the chicken with cashews, and the pork fried rice.  When the food arrived, we initially thought that we had ordered too much as the portions were quite ample.  However, the food was so good that hardly a scrap was left over.  All the dishes were well prepared and tasty, but I especially liked the shrimp because of its very flavorful sauce.  The service was efficient and courteous.Pay-to-park lots and metered street parking are available.  Weekends in Chinatown are usually very crowded so plan accordingly.The Three Happiness is recommended for the good quality of the food and its moderate prices, but go elsewhere if you are looking for a classy atmosphere.

54.description: The dining area is small but the food is great and it comes in larger portions than most nearby Chinese places. They open very late so if you crave Chinese at night this is definitely  the place to go. Paid street parking, free after 10pm

48.description: Disgusting food. Bad service. Dirty restaurant. Everyone in my party hated what they ordered.All of the restrooms were out of order and I saw a lady that works at the restaurant go into the bathroom with a bucket of water to flush the toilet. Same lady that brought us our food. Gross.AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

44.description: I have been here a few more times and it's two stars for the Three Happiness. I had the General Tso chicken for lunch. Now I am not sure if it was on the lunch menu as it was quite lengthy and a bit dirty. I grabbed the regular menu, but I wasn't in the mood for a dinner portion. They brought out the tea, lickity split. The chicken came shortly there after. It looked as though it was made in house. Almost like a heavy dumpling coating the bird. The sauce was dark and very heavy. Spicy, but the uncoated parts tasted very bland. Not a lot of flavor. The rice was not the sticky kind I like. I think it was Uncle Bonzi. I am not a fan of broccoli, but I will eat the veggies if they are crisp. These numbers were way past go. Not a great experience. I think I will poke around next time and see what else CT has to offer. I'm thinking they lost a loyal customer.

24.description: All I am going to say is that the waiter cleaned our table with the previous customers leftover tea. While we were sitting there he actually took the used tea cup, dumped it on the table, and proceeded to wipe the table with it.   I suppose we should have left but we were hungry. The food was fine, pretty authentic, service was fast hence the 2 stars.  But I really hope someone reads this and gets a clue about how to clean a table.

7.description: Food isn't bad. Service okMan sleeping at table next to us, they were cleaning vegetables at another table and then a grass hopper joined me while I was in the bathroom.....very EW!!! I wouldn't even give one star but u gave to lol

49.description: Me and my brother and sister have been coming here forever and love the food and the service has always been awesome till tonight a younger gentlemen was at the register and was very rude we made a order to go and he told us it would be twenty minutes so we said we would wait figure me and my lil sis and bro can chat he said well why don't you just eat here and seem to get mad afterwards he finished the transaction and tossed the receipt at the counter I like this place it has great food and this was my first bad experience here and hope its the last also when the food was done he walked up to the table set the food down and just stormed off in a bad mood very rude and me and my family have decided that if he is there we will eat somewhere else.

40.description: This review is more of when I use to come here. The service was always good, I believe I would always order the same thing, which was orange chicken, then one time I changed the order up and confused services as they were use to me ordering the same thing always.Last time I was there October 2006, but not due to service, just was dating someone back then, and we are no longer together. I just have not found time to go back to some spots in Chicago, IL due to different events in life.I have read the reviews of some negativity on the place, but in honest opinion all businesses have their ups and downs, I liked the food when I went there, it was good and I kept going back.Just give them try, don't just go based on bias opinions of many. I believe in this, many put negative feedback because of one small mistake or an issue, but one can not judge one unless they have tried it.

53.description: OOPs! wong west-want.. the other 3 happiness across the street...After years of downhill quality, my last visit (Dec 2013) was the best ever. I have been coming here for more than 20 years and always stop in when I go grocery shopping for the good stuff I cannot find in Indiana. Well, this visit was great and I can't wait for a Sunday with clear weather to slog up there. The price has gone up with the quality and one needs about $25/person .. but its worth it.Now here are some tips if you are a Dim Sum Commando:1) Get there early (10:30 latest) for best selection and service .. and for the best cuts of BBQ Pork if you go grocery shopping afterwards.2) Get a table close to the kitchen door, forgo the ambiance for the better selection and quicker service/hotter plates.3) Group of 8-10 is optimum for lazy susan table (be early for good table)     Group of two offers comfortable room at the table/more selection.     Group of 6+ is crowded and little elbow room at regular table.

30.description: I've been coming here Since high school,so a little over ten years. They know me. But that still doesn't matter to them, they have no customer service. I almost got used to it, but as I'm older now I just won't tolerate being treated like I'm invisible. Besides being rude throughout our dinner, when we were ready to leave they only came for our check and didn't bother to wrap our food! We literally waited fifteen to twenty minutes after they took our payment for them to come and wrap our food! With a ten month old baby, that seemed like eternity. I will never come back to this place, which sucks because that's always my go to. But i pay money, so I expect a little courtesy.

46.description: This is our late night spot. Everything we get here is excellent. Love the egg rolls and pot stickers. The sweet soy sauce and sweet and sour sauce are spot on.

1.description: In the mood for Chinese food, I asked some coworkers where to go that was close to our building.  Without hesitation, they recommended Three Happiness.  And I'm eating the Orange Chicken and Shrimp Toast I scored from there as I'm typing this review.It's.That.Good.The chicken in the dish are fried to light, pillowy delicious balls of heaven.  The breading isn't too heavy, the chicken isn't stringy or tough at all, and the sauce is a light, delicious orange flavor with slices of fresh orange in it.  Perfect.The shrimp toast is ok - a little too greasy for my liking...but great flavor. whomp whomp.Overall, this place puts my boyfriend and I's favorite Chinese place closer to where we live TO SHAME.   And for the price and the incredibly sweet women who work there, I don't think I'll go anywhere else for Chinese food when I'm at work.

55.description: came here for late night grub, service was fast food was a little bland. Not as good as I wished it was.

9.description: Great place for carry out. This place is small but the food is good. Most of the time it's best to call in your order because parking is a bit crazy in this area. It you like pot stickers this place is a winner and the house made hot sauce. And if you like veggies then check out the veggie fried rice with eggs.

26.description: The food was horrible,  I could understand the food being  bad in the hood but in China Town. in the words of  Mike Tyson that's just ludakiss. The cook needs to be sent back to the homeland to learn how to fry rice I will not be going back. ..

25.description: Again, Chinese restaurants to me should not be judged on service! I don't think it is part of their culture. The food was not bad, if I have the late night munchies for Chinese and they are the only ones open, I would actually drive all the way to Chinatown for it from Lakeview. I wish the Orange Chicken was tastier though...

12.description: I'm here only during late at night.  They're food and service is exceptional.  If you're craving chinese and it's late, stop by here and you will not regret it.

59.description: This is the best Chinese food in any Chinatown I've ever been to (including San Fran and Vancouver)!!! Pan fried noodles and chicken with corn soup are a MUST. Sriracha and Lan Chi chili paste are on every table!

21.description: First time here and the food was subpar at best. It honestly tasted more like a slightly better Panda Express which surprised me because this is in the heart of Chinatown. While i know it's known for being open late and after-club patrons come in- the atmosphere wasn't the best at least this time around. Waiting 20 minutes for our bill and service in general was a bit daunting but it's understandable when there are other patrons in the establishment as well. I would recommend them hiring an additional server or of equivalent to keep this place a bit more efficient. PS: anyone calling chicago, "Chiraq" is an utter moron. Check your pants, seriously. That is all.

17.description: I've come here for dim sum a few times and as the rating suggests, food is A-OK. Price is reasonable...nothing special, but nothing terrible, in my experiences at least.Chicago, in my opinion, has great Chinese food though, so why just get "OK" Chinese food?

10.description: Went there again last night about 2am , because there was nothing else open.The father is really nice.and oleasant, but the son has terrible customer service. The food was not good and the son and one of the workers went to sleep at one of the tables. I wish some other Chinese restaurant would open late in China Town because this place is a Hazzard. Everything is the place was just DIRTY from the rest rooms to the credit card  holder. I'm calling the City of Chicago inspectors, they should be closed, don't eat here unless you want food bacteria in your stomach..... Geezzzz

5.description: My family has been going here for over 30 years. Even though Ive moved to San Francisco, I havent found a place as good as this. Their wonton noodle soup, lobster, snails in black bean sauce and dim sum are all spectacular. Plus I used to go so much, they would treat me like family. Its not super fancy inside, except for the chandelier but Ive never had to wait or otherwise its quick and I always leave feeling better because I ate there.

3.description: The service is a bit rude, not rude in a sense of that the server said rude things, rather said nothing at all. He never asked how everything was. He actually seemed to be filing his taxes next to us. However, the food was rather good, so 3 stars seems fitting.

35.description: Dirty plates and spoons. Food is greasy and loaded with MSG. We ordered salt and pepper squid and scallops and could see tons of msg particles around the food.  The flat Noodles stirred fry was drenched in heavy greasy sauce.  The egg omelet was soaked in watery undercooked egg materials (I can't even describe it as food. .. It's just like some gooey thing congealed together)There was so much MSG I'm the food, out throats got swollen after we left.  There was only 1 server there and he's really fast but there was only 1 person doing all the jobs so I don't blame him for not doing all his jobs.  Also this is a place for you if you want cheap, greasy, dirty, stinky, low quality Chinese food that tastes like a Chinese place in the middle of nowhere (when you drive thru every small town during your road trip, you could find a Chinese restaurant even is in the middle of no where) right in the middle of China town area.  So ironic that I found this place in the middle of China town because you would assume authentic food here.

19.description: Great food with a low cost! My friends and I come here once a month it has become a tradition for us all to meet and have dinner together. It's our fav. place. I recommend this place to anyone and have already. Great!

28.description: I acknowledge that I am totally biased because this is where my family came for Chinese food when I was a kid.  I've been going here since I first had teeth.  I always order the Singapore Fried Rice Noodles and they are good, although I think the quality has declined over the years.  There is a good mix of veggies, pork and shrimp, although they're getting a little skimpier on those, and putting more noodles into the mix.  This restaurant is very casual, almost divey, but always has good service and great takeout.  They're open late, so it's a great place to grab a midnight snack.  Overall, still one of my favorite places in Chinatown.

45.description: I'm not sure what has happened to my little place.  First time I went it was delicious!! I keep going back hoping it will get better but unfortunately it's not. I have ordered off the regular menu, the lunch menu, the dim sum menu, and I am just not pleased. Their egg rolls are still Amazing!! I love the chicken wings too. The potstickers aren't bad either, but everything else is either just marginal or has just been plain bad.

33.description: The service here is very good. This restaurant has the best chicken corn soup in chicago. I have been here many times. The chicken friedrice spicy is also the best over here

43.description: My fiancé and I went here late at night and ordered sesame chicken and orange chicken. We took it to go and realized in the car that they did not even give us a fork or anything to eat with. That was pretty odd. The orange chicken is alright but they put way too much sauce and there are actually orange peels in the bottom of the container. The sesame chicken really did not have much flavor.

2.description: open Late like well after 4am. Consider it a rarity if you get in the restaurant with out some hustlers hitting you up, "I just got out of Cook County, are you gonna help me out' while his friend stands there next to him pacing. Once Got in from the cold, The food was great. The Spicy Egg drop soup did me proper. they split bills. The Table we wanted the mail worker yelled at us we couldn't have, twice. I told the Lady in our group, let me go talk to the 2 ladies that work here, lets see if I can get you the table you want. I got the table I wanted from the ladies with a pleasant smile.

18.description: 2 of my recent past experiences include: 1.  dining in the restaurant and 2. for a to go order.  the in restaurant experience had really good food and marginal service.  when i asked for the remaining food (which was a lot as we were a party of 4 and ordered a lot of food) to be packed up to take home, we found when we got home that the restaurant kept much of the food and only packed small containers like a sampling of our food, when in reality there had been twice as much food left on the serving plates.  we were very disappointed as we were splitting the left overs between 2 couples and then that could not be done.  really creepy!  on our most recent to go order, the egg rolls were way over cooked and very hard to bite and chew.  the friend rice was very dry.  i normally do not use soy sauce at all, but with this fried rice being so dry, for just my one small portion for myself i had to use 2 packets of soy sauce just to give it some moisture so i could swallow it.  i will say that going back a year, this place was top notch in all aspects.  now we will be skipping a trip to chinatown and sticking closer to home.

41.description: Still one of my favorite place to go in Chinatown!  Ever since we went here in college, oh my gosh, I've never really like any other ones.  They have the best pork dumplings!!! Oh and talk about the sauce, super food!  Can't get enough of it.  My only hesitation for not giving the five stars is the bathroom issues ( small ).  I can't stand small compartments.

52.description: Ooof avoid. After going for Chinese New Year a while back, we all felt a little sick after eating here. Probably partly because all of the food we ordered came literally within 5 minutes of having our menus collected. Now granted there weren't many people in the place, but still, come on, thats not natural. I'd pick another place in Chinatown.

50.description: Not bad at all! Food's great, lots of choices that will, more often than not, pleasantly surprise you. The view from the top floors is stunning as well. Overall, a great experience in a great part of Chicago.

4.description: I should have ordered dim sum.  I should have ordered dim sum. I soooo should have ordered anything other than what I did.  It was cold and rainy outside and I was greeted with a warm pot of tea, a great start.  I looked at the dim sum menu and a regular menu and decided on the latter as I had high hopes for the pork with green peppers.  It turned out to be one of the worst Chinese dishes I've ordered in a while.  The pork ribs was okay, but the clumpy rice tasted a bit old and the sauce for the dish was like slime.  Entirely too much corn starch or something because it was literally stuck on my spoon.  Like goop it was.  It wasn't even good tasting goop.  Just bland,  slimy, gooey, goop.  I tried to salvage it with the suspicious looking jar of hot sauce at the end of the table.  There was fried rice stuck on the jar's lid so no thanks.  I couldn't even finish my meal.  I went somewhere else to eat for my second lunch.  By the way, I asked for a to go box for my goop and ribs and when I got home I looked inside it to discover that the waitress had packed the already eaten pork bones I had spit out on the side of my plate.  I mean, why did...How is that...Why would you even...?  If a place is known for their dim sum, maybe I should stick with that next time.

6.description: Best Chinese restaurant in Chicago, my boyfriend and I come here constantly. Great service and the food is always hot and delicious. They're cheap, they always get the order right and it gets out to you quickly. Best place in Chicago.

22.description: Great place to go to late at night after the bars/clubs. Not the cleanest Chinese restaurant but food is good! Ordered egg drop soup, fried rice, Chinese broccoli, and a whole duck. This was too much food for 4 people, we over ordered, but luckily it's cheap. Staff wasn't very attentive but a lot of Chinese restaurants are like that.

15.description: The only place I order Chinese food from. It's always fresh and affordable.

57.description: This is my go-to Chinese place if I'm in a hurry and just want take-out. Almost always decent-- never great, but solid. Probably would have gotten 4 stars from me, in fact, except that my last 2 meals were pretty bad. Still, I will be back many, many more times.

20.description: I like it. They give you big servings for the price and they are very good every time we get to dine with them. I wish the place was a little bigger and the decor, but we came here to eat and not to be fancy. They are open until 3AM, which is always good for the late bird that I am. Check them out when you get a chance.

36.description: Dropped by this place for dinner and was very disappointed with the food, especially given lots of good reviews.  We ordered beef pepper, eggplant casserole, egg rolls and egg drop soup -  all very bland.   Service was slow and atmosphere was old and  dingy but I didn't mind it.  Food is deal-breaker tho so I won't be returning.

14.description: We've been coming here since they opened in the 70's!  It is great Chinese food!  We love the Beef with Chinese Broccoli and thin noodle, Salt and Pepper Scallops or Shrimp,  and dim sun menu.  I get a smile just thinking of visiting!

58.description: I was brought here by a friend who is from the Chicago area. This is one of his family's favorite restaurant and they visit it once a week. Don't be deceived by its run down appearance. We ordered soup dumpling, which is their specialty, oxtail noodle soup, and mapo tofu. The  pork soup dumplings was served first with a black vinegar and ginger. The dough was a little heavy on top of dumpling but the I love the natural  sweetness of pork. The oxtail noodle soup was delicious as well. The noodles were chewy and the meat on oxtail pieces was falling off the bone. I wish the oxtails were cooked longer in the soup since the broth can be a little more umami. I didn't care much for the napa cabbage in the soup since it was bland. I usually do not get mapo tofu when I eat out, but I was pleasantly surprised by this dish at this restaurant. The tofu was so silky and smooth that I could not even pick it up with my chopsticks. The sauce was really flavorful and went really well with white rice.

56.description: Came here with my team during lunch during the weekday. Arrived around 1pm and they weren't extremely packed. Food: I ordered the beef cubes in black pepper sauce entree, shrimp fried rice, spicy tuna roll and miso soup. The beef cubes are PHENOMENAL...and this is no exaggeration. Extremely tender, great flavor, and you can definitely taste the pepper throughout every bite, this dish is not extremely sweet which I love about it. This will consistently be my go-to entree any time I come here. The shrimp fried rice was really good as well, decent size shrimp and they weren't stingy on the amount of shrimp they give you. The sushi roll I had was standard, no complaints there. I did not like the miso soup which was a dissapointment b/c I love miso soup. Overall my dish was great.Service:The service was great at first, but then it seemed like we never had a consistent waiter/waitress. Luckily we were able to ask anyone for whatever we needed, but it would have been nice to have one individual who would check on us. But hey that's the only reason I knocked them down 1 star. Overall, I would recommend coming here to eat for lunch!

29.description: This place has been opened for quite some time now and I'm ashamed that I never gave it a try.  I had friends that said it as good but forty whatever reason,  I was not interested.  Today,  my husband and I decided to give it a try since I was craving soup dumplings and it's supposed to be really good here.  And yes they are. Lots of soup inside and the skin was nice and thin.   I loved it.  Delicious. The handmade noodles were good and fresh.  The squid app we ordered were huge and it was good too. Nicely grilled and great texture. The shrimp, pork and chive dumplings were very flavorful. The handmade pan fried bread was really crunchy but a bit too much oil. But overall,  I loved everything we ordered.I definitely recommend this placeBetter than Din Tai Fung in my opinion.

42.description: My favorite go to place in Chinatown for Xiaolongbaos and Noodle soup dishes, which are second to none! Their noodles are hand pulled and dumpling peels are hand made, and one of the treats is being able to see their chef in the process of applying his techniques to finely weave strands of noodles!Edit: After having gone there more recently, I'm going to have to revise my review. I've received very poor to nonexistent service from the waiters/waitresses. I understand this is a Chinese establishment and service is (generally speaking) lacking (not trying to be racist here, just the way I feel about Chinese restaurants, even the somewhat nicer ones; I am a Chinese myself), but lately I've been there a few times where the waiters/waitresses wouldn't even seat me, and furthermore I wasn't asked to order and I had to hail one of the waiters to take my order.

23.description: I always love the noodle bowls and dumplings at this place. Good deals, good flavor, and big size. For the noodle bowl, I like the braised beef one the most. The Szechuan spicy dumpling is the dumpling I like.

47.description: All you can eat hot pot for $18/person.  Food was fresh, beef, shrimp, watercress, etc.  Nothing like eating to your hearts content and still feeling good after.  I love hot pot and it's done well here.

8.description: Have you ever had Chinese food that makes you happy?? It warms you on the inside, reminds you of home and that life is good??? Yah, well this place made me sad.   The soup dumpling (xiao long bao) are handmade.... I watched the lady make them. But when they came to my table, they were overcooked, sticky and they all broke.  I didn't get to slurp any soup from the dumplings....they all broke and leaked to the plate below.   And the egg rolls didn't taste good either.... Crunchy but bland.   Yuck.  So now I'm sad and need to find another food to make me happy.... I didn't come to Chinatown to eat sad food.... Wtf!

31.description: The food here is really delicious but I have never once received everything I ordered when I order for delivery. They are constantly forgetting the broth for the soup or the bean sprouts, etc. for the pho. Make sure to check your order before the delivery guy leaves. You're bound to be missing something.

34.description: So good! So many choices, their menu is as thick as Nicki Minaj's booty lol. Service can be a bit off but I never leave this place unsatisfied.

16.description: Hing Kee is a pretty small restaurant, so it may be challenging to get a table on the weekend during prime dinner hours. It's definitely worth it to try this place at least once, as I was very satisfied with the food!We ordered the Shanghai xiao long bao (soup dumplings), which was my favorite dish - the soup was hot and flavorful, and the pork was tender - as well as the sizzling teriyaki beef, tofu with bok choy, and fish fillet with Chinese broccoli. We were satisfied with all of the dishes, as they all had great flavor and weren't overly salty, as many Chinese restaurants tend to be. However, don't expect 5 star service - most of the servers were not very attentive, and we had to repeat some of our requests multiple times.

13.description: I came here for the all you can eat hotpot last Saturday with five other people. Before I start I must say that I was very impressed with their service. Originally they had us seated at a normal sized circular table but then brought out a larger table for us because we were having hotpot. The original table would have been fine but it was certainly a nice gesture by them.The food itself was very good as well. I was skeptical at first about the variety of food that they would serve but it was a good mix of vegetables, meat, and seafood. Also, the owner/staff were very accommodating with what we wanted refilled. This is definitely a place that I will return to. After spending the summer in Taiwan and eating a ton of hot pot I'm happy to say that I found a hotpot restaurant that does it just as well if not better than the ones in Taiwan.

11.description: Growing up i never really ventured into Chinatown. Something about the novel-like menus and fried ducks hanging from windows just didn't make the neighborhood too attractive to me. Now as an adult, thanks to my good friend Aapple (who is born/raised in China/Taiwan), I have been recently introduced to the yummy goodness Chicago's Chinese corridor has to offer.  Hing Kee is the closest thing to traditional Chinese food in our city limits, says Aapple. Last time I went with her we tried the soup dumplings and Korean style short ribs. I truly have never eaten anything like the soup dumplings.  They are soft, pick them up carefully or they'll break and you'll ruin the magic, place it in ur spoon - bite off the top, slowly drink the soup inside (CAUTION: SOUP IS SUPER HOT) then let some steam out and eat the remaining piece of dumpling. The inside is a chunk of crab meat and the handmade dumplings basically melt in your mouth. Everything i've tried here is straight fire and it's extremely reasonably priced. The price for four heads was roughly $55   {^_^}

39.description: You never go wrong with smoothie here. I am so obsessed with their smoothie that whenever I visit Chicago, Hingkee is my first stop. They make smoothie from REAL FRUIT. Boba is sweet and yummy. I have tried different places around but this is the BEST PLACE to go for smoothie.

37.description: Let me first say that I was born in Chicago and I grew up around the Chinatown area. I have ate at almost every restaurant multiple times. When I first went to Hing Kee, I thought it was the best place at the moment. Decent prices, decent food. Now in my most recent visit, I received the WORST customer service in any restaurant that I have been. I went there on a Saturday afternoon with my family as a belated birthday lunch for my uncle. I ordered a plate of sushi and it was decent. My uncle and grandfather both ordered shrimp wonton noodles. When I was done with my sushi plate, their food still has not arrived, and it has been 30 minutes. The other table came after us got their food. What did the other table order? Shrimp wonton noodles. So I asked the waitress. They said that they forgot to put in the order. That's fine. People make mistakes. So we had to wait another 30 minutes to receive our first bowl of shrimp wonton noodles. Guess what? THE SHRIMP WONTON IS RAW! Unbelievable. So they took it back and 20 minutes later came back with another bowl of shrimp wonton noodles. Guess what? IT WAS ALSO RAW! I cannot believe it! They were serving us raw food. Words can NOT explain how embarrassed I was taking my grandfather and uncle out to this restaurant. So what now? We decided to just change our order to beef noodle soup. Everyone else finished eating except my grandfather and uncle. So after another 15 minutes, they came back with 1 bowl. We waited another 20 minutes and the other bowl has not arrived yet. So we asked the waitress. They forgot it again! Unbelievable.. I never experienced such horrible customer service. The only thing quick they done was give us the check. I definitely will NOT be coming back here or recommending anyone.

0.description: First time trying the restaurant and was thoroughly impressed with the food. Went for the Xiao Long Bao, which were amazing but also ordered the Dandan noodles. The Dandan noodle soup was a bit on the spicy side but totally tolerable. The noodles were ridiculously long but manageable. The food was fantastic to say the least and the servers were friendly and efficient but did have to flag someone down every so often for a drink refill or utensils; I suck with chopsticks. The restaurant is small but was able to get a table around 5pm on a Saturday. I will definitely go back, actually craving some Chinese food right now.

38.description: This is our favorite Chinatown haunt. It's authentic, unpretentious and the food is cheap and delicious. The smoothies are absolutely gigantic and the beef stew is divine. It's across the street from the more popular Joy Yee but if you're looking to avoid long queues and high prices then just pop across the way for seriously delicious food. One tip, make sure you are clear on your order as many of the waitresses speak only a little bit of English. I highly recommend the beef stew, potstickers, onion pancakes and avocado smoothie!

51.description: I give the soup dumplings here 3.5 out of 5 here. For the service, I would give it a negative 3 out of 5. It is horrendous. The staff makes you feel inferior to them as if they were doing you a favor coming to their restaurant. I've been going here for a year now and last time was the cherry on top. I suggest to anyone who has a short temper not to come to this venue. If you feel like being treated a cheap hooker, you're most welcome!

27.description: I always come here for the hand made noodle soup and soup dumplings. I thought the restaurant downstairs in the Richland building had the best soup dumplings but I was wrong. Hing Kee has the best. Hands down. Highly recommend.

32.description: They have very good food. Specially noodle soups. The service is  horrible. The Waitresses are always rushing you to order and if you have any questions they are so short and always have an attitude. If it wasn't for the bad service they would get 4 stars. Hopefully one day the owners realized how bad the service is and get new employees. Two different tables next to us we as well complaining how bad the service is. We have been there a couple times and every time the service has been bad.

54.description: The xiao long bao here is worth coming for. There's a nice amount of soup inside; the skin is chewy; there's a good amount of filling. Everything else was hit or miss. I came here less than 2 weeks ago and I already forgot what I had eaten. Honestly there aren't that many occasions where poor service affects my opinion of a restaurant. I tend to side with the waiter/waitress. Hing Kee wasn't a terrible experience...it's just unreliable service doesn't add much to incredibly forgettable food. After we were seated, two different waitresses took turns coming to our table for our order...literally giving us 2/3 minutes before each visit. Then after we were given our food, they promptly both disappeared and we had to flag other waiters down throughout the meal. The check took literal ages to get. On top of that, our shao mai filling was undercooked. Not just medium rare pork, portions of the meat were actually still raw. The waiter who handled it gave us a new order, explaining that there was a new cook, but it took way too long just to get someone's attention. Its unfortunate when you remember the service more than you remember the food.

48.description: I ordered yesterday. I had mango chicken and shrimp. It was ok not complaints not amazing. I also order shrimp spring rolls, I didn't like them but that's not the restaurant fault. It was my 1st time trying them. My order arrived soon then expected  I will be ordering again.

44.description: One of these days I'm going to eat at every Chinatown joint - about half way there!! In comparison to other places I've tried there this is pretty good--  more a 3.5 then a 3. Solid authentic Chinese food,  but not necessarily outstanding. Service and atmosphere is fine - what you'd expect from a Chinese restaurant.  Relatively clean-ish. :)Let's talk about the xiao long baos: pretty large in size, really flavorful and juicy/soupy, but sort of mushy in texture. The skin was thick and actually really sticky which was strange. Definitely not the best xlb's compared to Din Tai Fung etc.The dan dan mien was not the traditional version that my hubby and I are used to- it was basically in soup form rather than dry. Was pretty good overall but definitely different. Table next to us seemed to be really enjoying their hot pot which had a lot of pretty good looking variety of veggies and noodles but can't comment on the taste. Overall woukd go back and try a few other things on the menu. An authentic place with ok/good Chinese food with decent portions and prices but nothing special.

24.description: My go-to in Chinatown for soup dumplings. Although on my most recent visit, the skin was soggy and almost all of them stuck to the bottom of the steamer, so none of the lovely meat juice made it into my mouth :(Their noodles are good too, but no matter what you order, the soup it comes with is from the same pot and very salty. Another favorite is the pork flapjack rolls. We order this on every visit and it's always crispy & flavorful. Strayed from the wheat-heavy menu once and got the stir-fried rice noodles, which was a big mistake as it was greasy & tasteless. We've learned our lesson and been happy ever since.

7.description: Hing Kee is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants. I love the handmade noodles for various soups especially spicy lamb meat noodle soup. And the smelt fish with pepper!  Service is good and their menu has photos for non-Chinese speakers.

49.description: Meh Xiao long bao soup is too sweet artificially. The short rib not tastyI really think Chicago Chinese food way too sweet for my preference. I don't know why but it happens in Joy yee noodle as well

40.description: Came here late night during the week the place was empty. We ordered the fried rice and mango chicken came out before anything else the service was horrible the lady kept forgetting things and wouldn't even check up for refills on drinks. The food was good but with bad service it didn't help the situation out. It's probably better to order take out instead of dinning inside.

53.description: DO NOT CALL IN TAKE OUT ORDERS!! The price is different online than when you call in. The cost on the printed menu is what they charge on call in orders. When you place orders online it costs less!!

30.description: I've made it a habit to scout whatever city I'm in for good soup dumplings (Xiao Long Bao). Having grown up in NYC, my standards were set by Joe's Shanghai (10/10), who arguably have the best soup dumplings east of the Pacific (some LA folk may be grumbling). After a number of years in Boston, where the best soup dumplings I could find were a 7/10 at best, I was thrilled to find Hing Kee.What can I tell you about this place? It's a bit divey; the green laminate tables are sometimes sticky. The servers may or may not ignore. So why 4 stars? Because it's also friendly, casual, and has damn good Chinese food. Most importantly, the best soup dumplings I've had since NYC (yes, I am aware there are better in Singapore and Taiwan). I give these soup dumplings an 8.5/10.You probably won't get good service here. You'll probably have to speak up for yourself to get what you want (read: remind the waitstaff of your order). But I'll be damned if I haven't liked everything that's come out of that kitchen so far. Some notables beyond the dumplings: mushroom soup, home style pancake, and taro & sausage fried rice.Also, it's BYOB, so don't be afraid to bring a bottle or six pack with you. You can find a liquor store in Chinatown Square (along with Hing Kee).

46.description: My boyfriend and I had already had pizza before dinner, so we weren't in a great appetite. But the rest of four friends seemed to like this place. The steamed Bao was the best among all we ordered, juicy and fresh. Cumin lamb was Okay, a little bit overcooked though. Spicy chicken was not flavorful enough. Well we ordered four or five dishes more but nothing really impressed me.
