The restaurant was half empty.  The service was horrible and on top of that they automatically charge a 15% gratitude.  The broth wasn't that good.  I had better hotpot.  I don't think I will be returning for mediocre food and lousy service.

8.description: Tried to overcharge us by nearly $100. We had a large group, but it was for food we didn't order and an "included tip" that was mentioned nowhere on the menue. They service was horrible, and the reason we did not want to tip what so ever is because they called the police on us to dispute the overcharge. It wasted a monumental amount of time. CPD came and laughed at them and told them you cannot charge gratuity if it is not posted. They removed that charge but we still had to over pay for food we did not order. The manager was also telling our waiter to charge our card for the full amount in mandarin thinking that we would not understand.

31.description: I enjoyed this place a lot. Be warned like others say they don't speak much English. So it was hard for them to take my order. The waiter didn't even understand bubble tea. I wanted to make sure no seafood was in the broth.They also couldn't really explain how it worked and from the sign outside you can't read that it's all you can eat.It's like fondue, not in that it's thick and cheesy, just in how it works. You order a broth. You can get mild, spicy, or both. It comes in one pot like a yin yang splitting it down the middle if you get both. The price is $18.95 per person, all you can eat. The table has a cooking thing right in it. Heats the broth up to a boil, or whatever is in the pot, but you can touch it and it's not hot.Next they give you a paper and you circle what you want. There's veggies, meat, seafood, and a few items that cost you extra. Some things I had or remember were: beef, pork, lamb, chicken, meatballs, spinach, cauliflower, potato, water chestnut, bok choy, wood ears, shrimp, two kinds of sprouts, rice noodles, udon noodles, house made noodles, scallion pancakes, chive pancakes, etc. There's about 40 or so things to choose from.You put them in the broth to cook. Everything cooks within a few seconds. The bowl is shared between everyone at your table, but you all have individual bowls to eat from.Both of the broths were very tasty. The spicy side was loaded with pepper flakes. It was hot, but not too hot. My nose was running. The other side was kind of white looking and had ginger in it. The scallion pancakes were my favorite. They soaked up the broth nicely.I had a honeydew flavored bubble tea and they understood I didn't want bubbles.If I lived in the area I'd go here often. A LOT! I crave more of the broth. When we were done they thanked us for coming. I just wonder, since it was late could I have parked in the bank next door. I ended up paying for parking across the street.

34.description: The hot pot here is pretty good and the veggies were fresh. The sauce choices could have been better. A fair warning though, you probably won't get all the right items you checked off for the hot pot. If coming here, bring a Chinese speaking friend or else good luck.

16.description: Went in with great expectations, left completely dissatisfied.    Absolutely terrible service - staff bumbled about like idiots and were unresponsive (a 15% mandatory service fee is charged so good luck trying to skip out on your tip), meat was served frozen, soup bases had off flavors and were extremely over salted.   Everything from the greasy tables to the warehouse environment was just off.   Absolutely terrible.

13.description: I was here for all-you-can-at hot pot for dinner and it was so delicious. We ordered the half-and-half "nutritious broth" and spicy broth - not sure what was so nutritious about the broth, but it was delicious. Easily one of the best broths I've had in the states. I didn't have as much of the spicy broth, but it was still really good. For our first order, we had the cuttlefish balls (filled with very flavorful meat), sliced beef (very, very thin slices), napa cabbage (fresh), fried tofu (great texture), watercress (also fresh), and the chive pockets (one of my favorite things that we had, these were absolutely delicious). We also ordered fish fillet, but we never received any. On our second order, we had a bunch of the same things, with the addition of baby bok choy. We still didn't receive fish fillet, and I tried to order more chive pockets, but they ever brought them to us. We ended up feeling pretty full on what we got, so it wasn't a huge problem, but I was still a little disappointed. Overall, the one thing that is barring this place from being a five-star hot pot place is the service. (In case you were thinking it: I did communicate with them in Mandarin, and it did not appear to lead to better service.) It was incredibly difficult to get hold of someone to place additional orders with, order drinks from, or ask for broth refills from.

11.description: Never go there again, the hotpot is just average but the service is SHIT. The owner has no service at all, totally a bitch and also forcing you pay the tip without noticing in advance. 女老板娘服务态度太差，跟谁欠了她钱似的，摆着个臭脸。还强迫付18%小费，只有呵呵了

39.description: I use to live this place but my experience here today was terrible. I came in with my boyfriend and ordered some food. We chose the list and waited. We have waited for 10 mins and there was no service nothing! I have to ask to get a cup of water. So afterward we ordered and when the food came they told us that we have nothing and there is no veggies, we paid 40 something dollars just to have two dishes of beef and one dish of tofu! I will absolutely never go there again

37.description: Servers don't speak much English or Cantonese so communication is hard for me here.I came here probably a little more than 5 times.BYOB and all you can eat hot pot for 20 so ish dollars. Not a bad deal.

0.description: The best Hotpot in Chinatown!This place will receive only 4 stars from me, because of the poor service, but if you don't mind that then you seriously have to come here! The woman at the front speaks English to a sufficient degree and will get you want you need. She did not serve us water until asked and did not give us another sheet to mark down more items until asked. Other than these aspects, the Hotpot broth is amazing! We ordered the regular broth and it was just so flavorful, I could have drank it by itself. All of the items on the list were fresh! I would definitely come back here next time to try the Spicy broth!

38.description: ooooh hot pot....Upon entering this place one can smell the boiling pots of goodness bubbling full of delicious personalized ingredients. It's spectacular.Personally, when I look around and see that I am a minority in an Asian restaurant my excitement arises. When communication with the staff is a little bit of a challenge - awesome. I enjoyed the ordering process. It is similar to how you order sushi, using a sheet of paper to check off ingredients you'd like to enjoy in your broth. When enjoying your soup, if you want to be able to ladle out broth you have to ask for a spoon with no slots/holes. (Or else you will be trying to scoop out broth with your own little spoon.) Actually, you have to ask for everything if you want anything....water, drinking glasses for your alcohol (BYOB), more broth, so service here is a little iffy but it did not ruin my experience. Soup was delicious, mixing the broths and using their 3 sauces to create different variations of the soup with each bowl I ate was enjoyable. Their scallion potato pancake was insanely delicious. The fried dough I dipped in their garlic sauce- awesome.The negative features of this place would be the payment method and the restrooms. They only accept 1 card per table, so keep that in mind. The womens restroom smelled as if there were 20 cats hiding within the walls....so that was discomforting....It's a good thing I went after I ate....or is it??Anyways, I will most likely be back because I enjoyed the food.

51.description: It was awesome.it was so cost effective, all you can eat in 2 hours.amazing authentic Chinese flavor...however car parking is limited.

27.description: I'll be fare, other than too salty, the hot pot itself is okay taste.Veggies: three star, cause some of them aren't that fresh and some just not clean.Meat: two star, first plate they give me looks like it's from last night.  Dry and sticky.Other foods: two star, ordered see cucumber with extra charge, and it came frozen, they are smaller than your pinky toe, ya that's why two star.Service: two star, I saw the server offered ice cream to the customer when they finish.  But not me!!!!!! WHY? Think I don't speak Chinese? Condition: two star, just not that clean.Overall: two star, Won't go back, cause there are too many better places to choose from.

32.description: I was here for all-you-can-at hot pot for dinner and it was so delicious. We ordered the half-and-half "nutritious broth" and spicy broth - not sure what was so nutritious about the broth, but it was delicious. Easily one of the best broths I've had in the states. I didn't have as much of the spicy broth, but it was still really good. For our first order, we had the cuttlefish balls (filled with very flavorful meat), sliced beef (very, very thin slices), napa cabbage (fresh), fried tofu (great texture), watercress (also fresh), and the chive pockets (one of my favorite things that we had, these were absolutely delicious). We also ordered fish fillet, but we never received any. On our second order, we had a bunch of the same things, with the addition of baby bok choy. We still didn't receive fish fillet, and I tried to order more chive pockets, but they ever brought them to us. We ended up feeling pretty full on what we got, so it wasn't a huge problem, but I was still a little disappointed. Overall, the one thing that is barring this place from being a five-star hot pot place is the service. (In case you were thinking it: I did communicate with them in Mandarin, and it did not appear to lead to better service.) It was incredibly difficult to get hold of someone to place additional orders with, order drinks from, or ask for broth refills from.

54.description: I came here with some family members for a birthday dinner. We were the only table when we arrived. Who cares? It's AYCE hot pot for $16? a person. We ordered three rounds of ingredients. Unfortunately, they were out of some ingredients when we arrived. I liked their pancake, but disliked the fact that they didn't clean their vegetables. The spicy broth was actually spicy. I had to scoop a lot of pepper flakes out so I could have a cleaner broth. They didn't bring everything that we marked on the menu, even though we marked and circled it twice.Not much of an environment since it was just us. I don't think they speak Cantonese but we got along just fine. There are other options in Chinatown and I would like to try the others.

48.description: The food was absolutely delicious! But,  the service was horrible. The waitresses give you the death stare or would just be impatient in explaining what certain pots and foods were. They seemed like they didn't want to be there and was in a rush/ in the back laughing. When I didn't tip for the bad service I receieved, they wouldn't let me leave and started yelling. They stare at you when you tip and try to make you pay in cash. Will never return.

44.description: I've never had hot pot before so this was a really fun experience for me. We were extremely confused when we showed up because most of the people we spoke to didn't speak any english. I ended up looking up how to do it online. That's my only complaint is that it's really hard to communicate and understand what's going on. Aside from a huge language barrier the food was really tasty. The lamb pancake was my favorite side for sure. All the ingredients were so fresh I just couldn't get enough. We got beef, lamb, a ton of veggies, and then their homemade noodles. I've NEVER had noodles like that but I was really happily blown away with them. I will definitely go back now that I know what I'm doing.

24.description: Whenever I'm craving hot pot, I have my usual locations but when my friend was in town for the weekend, one of her friends decided to organize a hot pot outing to a place none of us had been before. For starters, we called in advance to reserve space for about 14-16 people (yes, I know, large), yet when they arrived, they were totally surprised by how many people were there. They ended up seating us at two of the tables that were quite large but too small for the number of people there. Luckily we were all either friends or from the same university so we just took it as an opportunity to get close to one another. When it was time to order, the waiters were extremely slow to come to us. It took us about an hour until we had water and food at the tables, and it took about an hour and half (from when we entered) until we had enough cups for tea at the tables. I'm not an expert in languages but I can tell you that the waiters responded only to those at my table who spoke Cantonese or Mandarin. I asked for water in English and they stared at me. The food was typical hot pot food but the broth the food was cooked in wasn't anything special. The spicy was way too mild for my taste and the mild was basically water. I made my food taste amazing with the garlic paste. One thing that truly annoyed us was the fact that even though we called and were told that they have a menu besides hot pot, there actually isn't. This place only does hot pot. Which is great if you want to try hot pot because they make it easy to order options, but if you have vegetarians at the table, it makes it impossible. We were all just so confused why they lied and said they had entrees on the menu when they don't. So just be aware of the fact that this restaurant only does hot pot. The one vegetarian ended up going home 5 minutes after she arrived because there was nothing she could eat.Even though the food wasn't truly exceptional, I found the environment enjoyable and food edible. I was planning to come back until we got the bill. I'm a recent college grad so I'm used to being in large groups with the tip already added onto the bill. Usually it's between 15% and 20% if you're a group larger than 8 so we all planned to pay about $30 bucks including tax and tip. But when we got the check, they charged us 30%. Yes, 30 PERCENT. We asked them about that but never got a straight answer about why such an upcharge. They never told us that in advance.  I don't know at what point do they tack on the 30% but I know I'm not coming back. I would've tipped them more than my 15% I was expecting for dealing with such a large group. But if you don't warn me about the surcharge even though we call in advance, then you've lost me as a customer.

7.description: Bad service, can't even bring our food, I mean, come on.Won't come again, you are a restaurant, just give our the food we ordered!Nobody answer us, they just want us to leave the room.Terrible terrible service.

49.description: The service is so bad. We ordered the beef and wait almost a hour for these two dishes of beef. Finally, they gave us two dishes of meet but it end up the lamb. And I am allergy to lamb!!!!!!!!!!!! Since I am allergy to lamb, I refused to eat it. The waiter there are so rude and not even say sorry about their mistake. I will not come back again ! Such a bad place. They are so many choices in Chinatown I will try some other place.

40.description: I use to like Mandarin Kitchen, but each time they miss up my order. I usually have to ask for the same thing multiple times to get it. Also, they do not except multiple credit cards, which is really annoying. I will not take the initiative to go there unless my friends want to go. However, if you did decide to go, they have different types of buns and pancakes that comes with the hotpot. They also have parking validation.

53.description: Food is good. Service is terrible. Only the first round of food came fast. After that it took so long to get your food, water, sauce or whatever you ask... They rush you to leave by constantly inform you that we have people waiting. They charge you 15% tip even they provide really terrible service.

30.description: Very standard hot pot experience. Service is not the best (you sometimes have to call the waitresses over for more food or drinks), but that's not what's important here. Ordering items is more straightforward than most, as you just write down and indicate quantities on a write-in menu that they give you. The broths are ready to go with the first round of food that comes out. There is so much food and so much variety that it may be hard to decide what to get, but definitely try not to over-order to avoid the excess fee. Everything is good--be sure to get a good mix of meat and vegetables.

46.description: Awesome Chicago spot for hot pot. They apparently raised their price from 15 to $18 all you can eat and just wrote a 8 over the 5 hahaha...but it's okay it's worth it.  They bring unlimited food and the spicy and normal hot pots are great. I love the spicy, with beef, bean curd, dumprings, sweet potato pancakes, etc.  Yum!

1.description: Overall, this is great decent place to get hot pot for a reasonable price. Service could definitely be a little better though.Price: All you can eat hot pot for around $19 plus tax/tip for 2 hours.Food: No complaints. There are 2 broths available, the nutritional and spicy. You can also choose both! What I like about this place is that the spicy broth is not overly spicy. Plates of meat and vegetables are generous. This place also includes some appetizers in its menu including dumplings, scallion pancakes, etc.Service: Not the best, but I suppose it is comparable for Chinatown. The waiter rarely came by our tale to see if we needed more broth or water. We had to wave him down to order more from the menu.

55.description: Ok place to eat at. Owner seems really stingy with their food. When you advertise as an all you can eat, let the customer eat, and not short their order. Not worth the $16 per person. With the amount of food they actually give you, it's like a 200% profit margin.

9.description: Let me start off by saying that this was my first hot pot experience. I was extremely excited to try it because I have heard such great things. I have heard its similar to Korean barbecue but also different. I've heard my friends say that it's better to make it on our own at home then to go to out forIt. I really did not know what to expect. Even after their brought out the broth boiling.. I asked my friends.. "Okay so do I scoop my bowl in the broth?" They both laughed obviously. Anyway. We order the plain broth. It looked very appetizing. Tons of fresh strange ingredients already in it before the food even came out. Then came the menus. My friends did all the ordering. We got pork and beef for meats. I enjoyed the watercress, bok Choy, And the cilantro the best for veggies. My friends told me the meat quality wasn't that good heard but it tasted great to me. So we throw everything into the bowl and let it cook. And then you just start scarffingggg down. It's all you can eat so come hungry. It's also BYOB so come thirsty. And repeat.  It ended up being about $25 a person including tip. Great experience. Don't go after 945 as they start flipping the chairs over super early (they close at 11). Also. The three sauces they have there... Wow. Mix all three together and welcome in the meat. Prepare for take off to tastyyyyy town! Haha. Put a small amount of the garlic in their. But equal portions of the other two sauces. I will definitely be going back.

26.description: Amazing, super authentic place. I spend half the year in Beijing, and this is as close as you can find to real Szechuan hot pot. Atmosphere is also authentic (not super nice), but who cares when the food is this good?

25.description: Let me start off by saying that this was my first hot pot experience. I was extremely excited to try it because I have heard such great things. I have heard its similar to Korean barbecue but also different. I've heard my friends say that it's better to make it on our own at home then to go to out forIt. I really did not know what to expect. Even after their brought out the broth boiling.. I asked my friends.. "Okay so do I scoop my bowl in the broth?" They both laughed obviously. Anyway. We order the plain broth. It looked very appetizing. Tons of fresh strange ingredients already in it before the food even came out. Then came the menus. My friends did all the ordering. We got pork and beef for meats. I enjoyed the watercress, bok Choy, And the cilantro the best for veggies. My friends told me the meat quality wasn't that good heard but it tasted great to me. So we throw everything into the bowl and let it cook. And then you just start scarffingggg down. It's all you can eat so come hungry. It's also BYOB so come thirsty. And repeat.  It ended up being about $25 a person including tip. Great experience. Don't go after 945 as they start flipping the chairs over super early (they close at 11). Also. The three sauces they have there... Wow. Mix all three together and welcome in the meat. Prepare for take off to tastyyyyy town! Haha. Put a small amount of the garlic in their. But equal portions of the other two sauces. I will definitely be going back.
